3.description: One of the cleanest and most organized Walgreens I've ever been to! I was at a baby shower nearby and needed to buy diapers to complete my gift, well I lost half an hour looking at everything! I wish my Walgreens was this nice. They even have a clearance section in the back that's well organized where you're not wasting time trying to figure out the price.

1.description: They have some interesting products in clearance and products are not too expensive but nothing unusual about this Walgreens store over the other stores I've been.

2.description: I like this place. Sure, standard products and medication and stuff. But, by far the most good-looking pharmacy techs. Makes that medicine go down that much easier.

5.description: I have been to this Walgreens twice in the last two weeks to get some pictures developed. I was very pleased with the photo specialist that helped me both times-Maria. She is very friendly, efficient, and thoughtful. I had some red eye in my photos and was having a hard time getting it out. She went through 100 of my pictures and helped me to remove the red eye. In my opinion, she is a good employee and went above and beyond to help me. I truly appreciate great service.

6.description: Dropped off a scrip in less than 2 minutes, ran some errands, came back less than one hour later.  Scrip was ready  and pharmacist remembered my name!  Goodbye Nagle ave Walgreens!

7.description: I'm not really sure what Charlotte was smoking when her and her friends stopped to visit this Walgreens. Jefferson Park is actually a very decent part of Chicago. Like anywhere in Chicago you always see interesting people no matter how nice the area is or not. Lets not forget there is a Chicago Area Police Station right across the street. How firgin bad could the area be? I would take anything anyone said from the burbs with a grain of salt. As far as the face lift goes, I would disagree with that totally. It's in just fine shape. Maybe not if you are comparing with a Walgreens in Naperville.

8.description: were on our way back to the western suburbs after visiting the baha'i temple and took some local roads as the traffic was getting pretty bad (afternoon rush hour)... a few people in the car were having bathroom urgencies so we stopped at this walgreens in a rather 'interesting' part of town... bladders were relieved and a few snacks were bought for the road ahead to naperville...thank you walgreens!  in return i'd like to nominate this location for a face-lift and interior renovation

9.description: While I don't have any amazing life-changing Walgreens shopping experiences to share, this store is consistently good in regards to the front registers and the pharmacy.  They're quick to open a second register if more than a few people are in line, and the pharmacy staff has a good grasp of the alphabet (unlike the CVS at Lawrence/Central, where the letter "Q" was often filed under "O" and I basically had to find my medication myself).  The manager of this store is an awesome little man who looks like he walked out of a 90s TGIF sitcom.

0.description: Not sure what one of the reviewers is suggesting by saying this walgreens is in an "interesting part of town" nor why we need to know she was on her way to Naperville? I live in Jefferson Park and have lived in the city since I was born. This is a great area to live in and the walgreens is near the blue line among other cool spots along Milwaukee Ave. This walgreens is always a clean and friendly. So I guess the reviewer named Charlotte needs to stay in her suburb and leave Chicago for explorers!

4.description: One of my favorite  Walgreens  always stocked they just built a bigger parking lot much better now staff always friendly  outgoing  and know there stuff

3.description: This is a great neighborhood bar!  Every time I go in there, I run into someone from the neighborhood.  Good for hanging out with a few friends or big groups.  Fun place to watch sports.  Love this place!

1.description: Neighborhood bar... no doubt, but I wish that when I lived in the city I had a neighborhood bar like this one!  Showed up to meet up with some friends on a Saturday night, KARAOKE BABY!  Got there a little after 10 and it was moderately full, but seemed like someone dropped off a busload of locals about 11 or so because the door kept opening and it got packed really quick!Weird though, I've been to many packed bars in my time and was surprised that it was SO packed around the bar when there was plenty of room to spread out better, seems the locals only like being a few steps from the actualy bar to belly up faster or something... that was more of an annoyance than anything because the bathrooms are at the back, just passed the bar, and we had to walk around the dense group to get there... whatever.Bartender service... well, because of the fact that the crowd drinks and socializes right in front of the bar itself, it was a bit difficult to get up to the bar to get the drink order and the drinks.Yes, I'll pop in again... Jonny Fah, my friend and great karaoke host, does a show here and as long as I can karaoke, I'm there!

2.description: Total duchebag hangout. The place was crowded with dudes many of who were well under 21. Females might or might not like the sex ratio at this place.  They did not appreciate strangers to their bar and all had their hat on backwards it seemed like. The place was dirty and not real special. They have three old classic arcade games that either are broken or never plugged in the socket. The one bartender was off talking to a friend most of the night and this really seemed like a bad bar. Maybe on other nights it might be a better place but the time I went it was all wrong.

5.description: Came here with some friends who pretty much demanded we check the place out. Wednesday seems to be the day to go because it's relatively dead, they open the door windows during the summer, and bud/miller beers are $1 each. It's a pretty awesome deal if you're into cheap beer. I also had a sip of this one guys cider which turned out to be REALLY tasty even though it was more expensive than a dollar. I think he said it was $3 or $4. The bartender is a chill guy. Not chill in the way that you'd want to carry on a conversation with the guy. In fact he's pretty quiet. But pours your beer to the brim. A whiskey sour was in a tall glass, not a lot of whiskey in it though. Four dollars for that. I'll probably come again to join my buds for the chill atmosphere and cheep beer.

6.description: For a neighborhood joint - this place can't be beat.  Compared to what it used to be the owners have really done a stellar job.  Love the big windows that open to the street.  Tons of TVs and sports, sports, sports.  Only downside is no food - but you can order take out from Pier 5736 next door.  And that food is good, or order a pizza.  Linda, the bartender/owner is GREAT at hosting parties at the bar.  Good prices, cold beer, sports on all TV's, nice crowd - gotta check it out!

7.description: Great drinks and service.  Cash only  fyi.

8.description: great neighborhood bar - you get a mixture of the oldies and the newly 21's...but thats ok.Major upgrades gives this place more room, more space to move and sit...the large windows are pretty cool, plus there's enough fancy flat screens all over to watch just about any and every game you need. the bartenders and the same awesome ladies from years past, including the owner..plus who doesnt love a guy in a hawaiian shirt??? great place to meet out and hang for a night, exceptional drink prices...they dont offer food but you can order food from next door - and they'll even call you a cab if need be (its your best option, cabs dont come rolling by often). Starting to have The Kingfish there more often (a great local band playing no an "off-night" for them) which only makes the night better. how can you beat a great atmosphere and good cheap drinks???

0.description: This sports bar is nice to go for a weekday wind down or a weekend wind up.  It's well-lit and has lots of TVs.  Groups come here, but also couples can enjoy hanging out at the bar or one of the high tables.  There is also a nice outdoor patio area in the summer.  The other day we went by and they had a band playing.  This place is pretty inexpensive and simple.  There is not a bar menu, BUT if you go for a Bears game, they do a free buffet to feed hungry fans.  Some neighborhood bars have no or small windows.  One thing I like about the Nil is that it has big floor to ceiling windows on the street side which give it a friendly atmosphere.  Check it out!Bus: CTA 85, 85A, Pace 225/226

4.description: Great local bar walking distance from my house.  Good spot to watch sports and drink cheaply.

3.description: I was a fan of this place as the people that work here are so sweet and it's super inexpensive. I take my younger cousins here for first pedicures all of the time and they love it! But the last time I was in I saw a few roaches crawling on the wall behind the lady doing my nails. It completely freaked me out so I hurried and paid and ran out promptly causing me to mess up my nails. Total bummer!

1.description: If there was a way I can give this place a negative star I would. I have been in there a total of three times and all three times was a terrible experience .the management is atrocious. the first time the lady told me she couldn't do my nails the way I wanted them done because the nails have to come pre made that way which was a flat out lie. the second time she cut off half of my eyebrows and told me that I told her that was okay ,and the third time was today I went in and asked if I could get my nails cut down and she told me know because she doesn't know how to do that how are you a nail salon and you can't cut down nails!?

2.description: I went to Dream nails Yesterday, When I say I'm Disappointed I am highly disappointed. I don't Recommend anyone to even try to go here I got an Full set, & Eyebrows .My nails look like an 5 Year old did them . They're  bulky , Not coated right & Eye brows are okay but not what expected ,

5.description: Disclaimer: It's just my own personal pet peeve when i'm in a business of any kind (except maybe a restaurant) and the employees hold full conversations in a language other than english. Sorry, it just annoys the bejeezus out of me!On that note, I lived in this neighborhood for approximately 10 years and never really noticed this place until I found myself several cars behind at the oil change place and waiting with nothing to do. This review is based on the manicure I received only, and well, the saying you get what you pay for is extremely true in this instance. The manicure was only $10. That's right, $10.I'd probably say this was more of a 2 1/2 stars place, but the hand massage was ridiculously relaxing so we'll round up. The salon itself was clean, well-lit, and had a larger selection of colors to choose from than i'm used to. There was only one other customer in aside from myself, and my technician was a guy which was a nice change from the norm, or it could've been had he said more than 5 sentences to me.  I wasn't feeling that chatty anyway Mr. Man. Things were pretty standard as far as a manicure goes, shape, file, buff, etc...only I noticed after I left that one of my nails wasn't shaped the same. Also, when the tech was putting on the clear coat, there was a little fuzzy bit trapped in the brush which promptly screwed up the polish on one nail. He tried to repair it, but it still doesn't look uniform. Maybe i'm just too anal-retentive?On the upside, I did some heavy duty cleaning yesterday and no chipping so Yay! That alone earned that extra half star from me.

0.description: Please raise your beautifully manicured hand if you like Dream Nails! *raises hand*. I go to Kathy for my nails. She is extremely down to earth and friendly. I am a fan of the no-chip manicure and she really takes her time paying attention to detail. The store itself is very clean and when you walk in, even when they are busy, they greet you. They give you a roundabouts time when they can get to you so you aren't sitting there without a clue. I really respect upfrontedness (not a word, I know) and I know they do hold conversations in Vietnamese, but for the quality of their work, its worth it.I have been to several places for pedicures. I like to keep my toes on point so I know when I get a good pedicure. They don't cut corners and rush it, again...attention to detail. I am a very happy customer and I would recommend this place to others. i really wished their prices would go down a bit, cmon is Jefferson Park, not the Gold coast! Ask for Kathy, but they are all great people with amazing skill.Til next mani/pedi!!!!

4.description: This place is under new management and has new employees and I think that is exactly what it needed. They also did some light remodeling.  I went in on a Saturday afternoon with an hour to get a manicure and pedicure and they were of so accommodating! They ladies all helped me out and did a wonderful job.  And at $30 for both it was a steal of a deal.  I will for sure be back!

3.description: In and out quick courteous service in the area was very clean and very professional.  Sometimes it gets pretty busy in the mornings but it's an orderly crowd no monkey business. When I'm in this area I usually stop by here and no regrets although the bathroom being locked threw me for a loop. Sometimes when you gotta go, you gotta go. The bathroom itself is also very clean.

1.description: I really wanted to like this location as it is in walking distance from where I live, but after 3 poor experiences in a row I will not be returning. The first poor experience I had I ordered 2 lattes. There was a sign that said they were $1.99 for a special. After I paid I noticed I had paid full price, $3.90. When I asked for about it the woman behind the counter seemed confused and didn't know there was a deal. Then I asked for a refund and she said it was not possible since I did not pay with cash. I find that hard to believe that a transaction is not able to be canceled or refunded. There was no attempts to apologize for this, merely a shrug of the shoulders.The second poor experience isn't as bad. I asked for a pound of coffee as it is locked up. She scanned it and began to charge me when I asked if it was whole bean. She looked at the bag and said "Yeah, I think so". I then looked and found it said ground. Not a huge deal, just surprising that an employee at a dunkin donuts wouldn't know the difference between whole bean and ground coffee.The last and most upsetting experience that made me decide that I will never return. I asked for two lattes, again still $1.99 deal. She told me she could only do one at that price, when I said that I was able to get two at that price at many other locations she just looked at me blankly. I asked her to ring it up as two separate transactions, she didn't want to but obliged. I watched her make the lattes. The milk for the latte was not fresh, it was sitting in the container that it gets steamed in. So no clue how long that had been sitting there. Then once she steamed the milk and finished the lattes she found that there was not enough steamed milk for both lattes. So she took one latte and topped it off with fresh milk and just mixed the drink with a spoon. The latte had very poor taste and was lukewarm when it was given to me.There is a dunkin donuts at Foster and Nagle that has much better service. I would highly recommend going to that one.

2.description: When you hear owners talk about spitting in coffee especially the police officers coffee it sickens me.

5.description: They are very friendly here. There's a sweet lady who works behind the counter and she is always so cheerful. I don't come here as often as I would like, but they are perfect for busy commuters who need to get to the bus terminal across the street.

6.description: Not much parking in the lot.  Overall, the people are decent and very clean location.  There is a limit ice cream section on-site.  We visit since it's close by for quick after dinner ice cream.

7.description: I love this place. They know my order and have it ready in a snap. Attaced to gas station which is a bounus.

8.description: Good service great people

0.description: I come here often for  my work breaks they seem to run like a well oiled machine  and they get your orfer and get you in and out quickly  and thats a plus

4.description: Go to any other Dunkin. An employee bragged on facebook about spitting in coffee. When confronted about it, the owner told the complainers to get off his property. How professional

58.description: I've been in here twice before and loved the food and was very pleased with the friendless of both the owner/manager and wait staff.  However, I went in last night with a party of 4 at 715 and was told that they were completely booked for the night and that I couldn't even put my name on the list to wait.  We would have been the only people waiting for a table!  There were several tables open, obviously for their 730 reservations, which I completely get. However, they probably have 30 total  tables and I cant image that every single one of them had a "booked" reservation for the remainder of the evening.  The hostess even told us that she had a table for 2 open if half of my party wanted to eat.  Seriously? Who would recommend that or even take that option?  What restaurant doesn't operate on a wait list or turns away a party of 4 at 715 on a Saturday night? I wish I asked to see the manager while I was there.

56.description: I came with group of 7 friends, and loved my first visit there. What an evening of wonderful dishes, and it was so fun to sample so many different ones. Very attentive service and affordable prices.

29.description: Tried a bunch of their tapas.  The shrimp with crispy noodle was awesome so was the grilled calamari.  The avocado salad was very tasty.  Nice waiter and hostess and its BYOB!!

42.description: We have been there at least 4 times this year and I have to say every time we enjoy it very much. I love tapa style dishes and there dishes are really good.. The chef was serving some of the dishes and checking on us.  We tried everything on the menu ( we had a large group) . You can bring your own wine or beer which saves a lot of money. . The service is great and with a smile. Great for a date night and also  great for bigger family parties and celebrations. Sharing dishes, trying a lot of fresh and grilled  sea food, ( Grilled octopus is outstanding and goat cheese with tomatoes  and  fig rapped with beacon  are my favorite)   Yummy !  I think the place it's great. Especially when not much is around in that area .  We are happy to discover that place.   We will be back.

23.description: Wow! What a wonderful find, we just loved it.Sometimes I find new places by looking on Yelp and other times, my Facebook friends lead me there.A guy I went to HS with who was also a drama nerd and Spanish geek thought I would love this place. My husband and I met his wife and him at this great family restaurant.We got to meet the owner and his super friendly wife. Our friends brought wine as this is a BYOB and we settled down to a magnificent meal.We ordered tortilla which is one of the ways I judge a Spanish restaurant. Delicious, just the right balance of egg and potato with just the right amount of heft. We also tried some veggies, meat and scallop tapas before the Paella Valenciana. Oh yes, my favorite kind made with mussels, clams, chicken, rice, veggies and the wonderful flavor of saffron.We topped it off with a crema catalana and a cortado. That is good eating.Only place that is more authentic is in Spain itself.It's a lot cheaper to come here!

47.description: Cafe Marbella is a gem, one of my favorite restaurants on the North side.I've been there on date nights and with groups of friends, and the staff knows how to treat a party of any size.  Attentive and friendly service.  Beautiful tapas, great specials,  reasonable prices and the fact that it's BYOB is the icing on the cake.After Cafe Marbella, I'm disappointed with the tapas we get at Ba Ba Reeba and their ilk.

8.description: Awesome service and the food was delicious. They had great specials and the food was cooked perfectly. Plus it's BYOB which was nice. I like that the paella was not priced per person like other tapas restaurants. The portions were pretty big as well. The pricing is very reasonable.

31.description: Their specials are always different and who doesn't love byob. I have had a variety of their tapas and every single one has been extremely delicious. The stuffed figs with bacon just melt in your mouth and the sweet sauce is extrordinary. They have stuffed avocados which I have not encountered before and they are exquisite. The avocado,bacon, and cheese salad was perfect, sautéed mushrooms were tasty and I used to not like mushrooms. The mixture of flavors explode in your mouth. Last night I had the Australian baby pork chops with potatoes. The dish could not have been better. The paella is of course a huge success. Loved it and cannot get enough. I also tried the chocolate pudding and unlike everything else it surprised me on how delicious it was. The food is always out super fast and they were pretty busy on a Saturday night and unfortunately they lacked a bit on their service. I have also gone during the week when it's empty and of course the service was better. This chef is definately something else and I love all his dishes.

34.description: Can not fault this place, simple, exquisite food, affordable with a nice cozy ambience.

16.description: Our second time at Marbella. We just returned from 2 weeks in Spain and the tapas are better here. Service was pleasant, well paced and attentive. Even though there were several other tables occupied, it is conversation friendly.  So nice to find a restaurant that is not noisy. Parking is easy right on the street nearby. We had the mushrooms, figs stuffed with bacon, meatballs, garlic potato salad, grilled calamari, grilled shrimp, croquetta's. All were delicious and portions large. We forgot to bring wine and got a very nice Spanish wine across the street at the convenience store. Dessert tart filled with pastry cream and topped with fresh raspberries was delicious and enough for 4 or us to share.

13.description: This place was FABULOUS... It was my first time there and I had no clue what to order .. the cook/owner came to our table and asked us if he should cook for us tonite .. meaning his choice ... we agreed and EVERYTHING was out of this world ... Iwill for sure be returning .... The waitress / owners wife  was super friendly ... Byob was a plus ... Prices are VERY reasonable ... LOVE IT !!!!

11.description: I have to say I was pleasantly impressed with Cafe Marbella. The staff was nice and the food was delicious. We had potatoes, squid, tomato and goat cheese a great avocado salad. The restaurant was a bit tight for me and I felt we were on stage when we entered the restaurant. Despite this, I plan on coming back to Cafe Marbella in the future.

39.description: Lots of different options for tapas. We enjoyed patatas bravas and baked goat cheese and a number of others!

37.description: I love this place.  I've been here at least five times.  It's great food at a great value.  It's also BYOB.  I love the avocado salad, grilled calamari, gambas al ajillo (grilled shrimp in a garlic olive oil), and paella Vallenciana.  I also really like the Sting Ray if you are lucky enough to have it as a special on the day you are there.  I am not a fan of the patatas riojana, but I do like the grilled fish (there's usually at least two on the menu) that have a slightly spicy blackened seasoning on them.    I ordered a side of mayo to bring down the heat a little (it's like having tartar sauce,right? :) ).  I have brought many friends with me, and we all leave happy especially when you take into account the cost.  The portions of the dished are also much larger than what I am used to for tapas.  The service is typically ok.  It's a bit of a teamwork environment so I would just ask anyone if you need anything to ensure you have a good experience.  Hope you love this place too!!

0.description: Cade Marbella is a sleeper from the outside in my opinion. It has more to do with the block it's in I suppose. But this isn't a real estate review, it's a restaurant review and a 5 star one at that. Dining room is warm and cozy and the service is very good. But this place is about the food and the price point. It's BYOB, enough said. The food is spectacular, seafood specials always please and the variety of options are endless. I've had lamb, veal and beef plates and the salads and soup offerings are quite creative. Full menu with daily specials. Desserts are homemade as is the hospitality by this talented chef and his partner/wife. Word.

38.description: This is a simple place to stuff your face. There doesn't seem to be a bad plate on the menu, and my group tried at least two dozen. Being a BYOB - you can actually bring some wine and brandy in advance for a pitcher or two of Sangria - which is dangerously delicious. The service and atmosphere weren't anything special, but this is one of the better restaurants in the area. Seems like an unassuming date-worthy place.

51.description: I'm Not a huge tapas fan but this place surprised me. The food was pretty good. They give you bread and oil when you first get seated which actually has no favor at all. But that was the only thing I didn't like. Other than that our group ordered 8 or so dishes which were very tasty. I recommend the (1) chicken with spinach and some sort of cheese sauce, (2) flatbread with peppers chickens and other veggies, (3) goat cheese/marinara with toast, (4) the filet steak (Delicious!!!), (5) spicy potatoes, and (6) the chicken and salad were all. Portions super small of course which is why I don't like these types of places. We were still hungry afterwards even though we were 6 ppl and ordered 8 dishes.

27.description: SALT prevented a four star dining experience for me and my wife.  We enjoy dining in Tapas restaurants.  At Café Marbella we were impressed with the atmosphere, the menu variety and the super attention from our server. However, we ended up not enjoying, or finishing, our meals because the food was too salty.

32.description: Awesome service and the food was delicious. They had great specials and the food was cooked perfectly. Plus it's BYOB which was nice. I like that the paella was not priced per person like other tapas restaurants. The portions were pretty big as well. The pricing is very reasonable.

54.description: Food was great.  Enjoyed the calamares in olive oil, patatas bravas, goat cheese with marinara and portabella mushrooms.  All the dishes were delish.  We got there at 5:30 without a reservation and the gal looked at us like we were crazy but did seat us.  We could see the reservation list - it was long!  Definitely call for a reservation.  BYOB so bring your wine.  I agree with other folks that the service at the beginning was markedly different than the end of the meal.  I would try to order everything at the beginning and not expect to add to your order.  This place is busy!  I think that they run the restaurant like they would in Spain where they won't bring your check until you ask for it.

48.description: This restaurant is exceptional. I am a long time patron. I was there tonight after a very short hiatus. I had almost forgotten how good the food is. The proprietors are extremely friendly and make you feel totally at home. It is BYOB. We always go for a selection of small dishes which we share with our party - tonight the Calamari, Avocado Salad,  Salmon, Potobello mushrooms were just out of this world. If you have space for deserts, they are exceptional. They change their specials every time we have been there and they never fail to impress. Why go downtown Chicago when there is this excellent restaurant in our Jefferson Park neighborhood. Lots of street parking close by and very reasonable prices.

44.description: I heard great things about Cafe Marbella and I was mad at myself that I didn't realize there was a BYOB tapas restaurant nearby. We came for my mom's birthday and there were already many patrons in the restaurant.  There were 8 of us and our server was very pleasant and told us about the specials. After we ordered the food came out very quickly. We tried the meatballs, patatas bravas, avocado salad, grilled squid (on special), shrimp with crispy spaghetti, goat cheese, pork medallions, and bacon wrapped  figs. I thought everything was good but maybe just a little oily/salty. I wasn't a huge fan of the figs. The reason I didn't give more stars was because towards the end of the meal our server disappeared and we had to wave down someone for more water. We also weren't offered coffee/dessert before our server came with the check and my sis in-law told him we wanted flan.  I saw another server come out with some amazing looking cakes and I was kind of mad we hadn't been told about those. since it was my mom's birthday.  They could probably hire more servers/bussers.

24.description: This was a great BYOB place in our neighborhood that we kept missing because it's in an inconspicuous spot on Milwaukee ave. finally I don't have have to trek down to cafe ba-ba-Reeba for great Spanish Tapas. We went in around 5:45 with reservations on a Friday night. We were the second couple to walk in. By 6:30 the place was nearly packed. You'll see a lot of locals here. The food is really authentic and delicious. One downfall was the bread they served was cold--if it were warm I'd have given this place 5 stars. It's the little things. Food: everything we ordered was great! Not in my pictures: hubby ordered a warm spinach and apple salad that he loved. We didn't order our typical favorite Spanish tapas: the bacon wrapped fig. Which I heard was good too. We will def be back with friends next time! Hubby also ordered the chef special--halibut good but a bit salty for us. We ordered 5 tapas and one diet coke.. Bill was $47 without tip! Most menu tapas were 4.99-7.99. Specials were 10.99-14.99. Paellas ranged from 10-16 bucks. Not bad, right!

7.description: I've been here 3 times in the last 6 months. I've had two decent experiences and one poor one. The food is fine. Nothing is 'out of this world, have to go to this location to have it' delicious, but it's all good. One time I had a chocolate cake for dessert that was particularly remarkable, but that's about it. The downfall of this restaurant is its service. The food gets out of the kitchen quickly, and for that this place cannot be faulted. The restaurant, however, is understaffed with regards to servers. Our server stopped by once to check if everything was okay around ~15 minutes after we had gotten our food. After that, we waited another ~20 minutes so that she could come by to ask her for the check. There seemed to be two servers for the entire restaurant on a Friday night at 7pm.

49.description: We been going with my family at that place  over 2 years , and it's been descent , but today we went for Father's Day , the food was too greasy and way to salty , sometimes happens  and I don't  usually complain , but sometimes when the restaurants get to busy the food quality goes down so I think that is the case , not going back !

40.description: Last night I met some girlfriends for dinner here and when we walked in we were wondering if it was open since it was so quiet. This place is BYOB so we brought a few bottles with us and they opened right away. The staff is friendly and attentive.The food was outstanding. The avocado salad was so good we asked for another. The rissotto, calamari, and scallops were my personal favorite. Dessert was excellent too, the goat cheese cheesecake was worth keeping to myself.I am not a huge fan of family style restaurants but this is one I would come back to. Plus it was very reasonable for the quality and quantity of food.

53.description: Cafe Marbella is a nice addition to Jefferson Park's growing restaurant scene, and it's byob to boot!  The restaurant looks like and old late seventies European restaurant, which I thought made  it feel like I was in an old neighborhood restaurant in Marbella or Malaga...this was a plus in my book.As far as the cuisine is concerned, my girlfriend and I thought it was JUST OK.  Actually, the tapas sort of reminded me of Cafe Iberico's early days.  I think Iberico is now better than ever (a solid 4 stars).  Anyway, we ordered quite a few tapas; Tortilla Espanola, Grilled Squid, Avocado Salad, Piquillo Peppers with Goat Cheese, Queso de Cabra, and the Veggie Paella.  The Tortilla Espanola was too bland and egg-ey, definitely the worst one of all from the various Spanish tapas restaurants around.   It needed more, slowly sautéed onion and potato.  Also, there was a common dressing used on the side greens in many of the dishes that resembled more of a cheap amateurish acidic Italian or Greek dressing.  It had with a lot of oregano.  It was inauthentic and overpowering.  While the grilled squid was my favorite of the bunch, it was way way salty rendering it nearly inedible.  The Paella was far too oily and didn't have the mandatory crunchy bits at the bottom.The recipes need some improvement, so until then, I don't think I'll be back.

30.description: This has become one of our favorite spots to go to. Service is great and they have great tapas options. Must try is the grilled calamari - so delicious! They also always have great specials - recently had a tuna tartare which was to die for. It's byob as well so you can't go wrong with that.

46.description: Excellent food and fun atmosphere. BYOB Spanish tapas, doesn't get any better than that. Atmosphere is inviting, especially on cold winter nights. Stop by the liquor store just down the street for some wine and enjoy a good meal sharing tapas with friends.

1.description: Really wanted to love this place. We live in Jefferson park and there is not much to choose from. We have also traveled to Spain many times and heard of this restaurant in our area. We always have to go downtown or wicker park for tapas. We were seated right away. But it took the waiter come to our table 15 minutes. He then did not greet us, but just asked us if we are ready?. I said "can we have a drink menu?" Waiter said it is byob. Which is great but wish we knew ahead of time. Anyway then he left and returned 15 min after that! We ordered a lot. We were hungry and came with my teenager who is always hungry! Lol food came out right away. It was ok, but we felt so rushed when the waiter explained the specials that we just ordered a lot. But then we wanted more, but again the waiter was MIA. As soon as we saw him we just asked for the check. Didn't even finish our wine which we got across the street. (Liquor store) We were bothered by our waiter so much at first but then noticed he was the ONLY waiter attending the whole restaurant on a Friday night! Shame on the owners!The restaurant was like walking into a restaurant in Spain, but the service killed everything. Food was ok, but go there for the byob. Sad.... Man I wish it was better! So disappointing!

55.description: Great family-run tapas restaurant, really drawing a crowd on Saturday nights. We've been fans of Virgilio' artistry since long ago when he was at Arco on Halsted.  The standards are great: Champinones, Patatas Bravas, Gambas, pork cutlet in cream sherry sauce-- hot, flavorful, and abundant.  The specials last night were terrific: Calimares, the Bronzini fish cooked with paprika; Higos con tocino is a can't miss ending, but last night the chocolate sponge cake with kahlua and espresso cream frosting was killer. And BYOB and free local parking. Attentive service. What's not to love?

9.description: We love Cafe Marbella! Their hand written 'specials menu' changes every week so there's always some new kind of meat, fish and/or vegetable item to explore. I am fortunate to live nearby so my wife and I have eaten here dozens of times, brought family members, brought friends and made new friends. Everyone raves. I have enjoyed dozens of different tapas small plates and found them consistently and deliciously spiced with over salting occurring maybe two or three times as most. In each case I wasn't shy about asking for a replacement and they were wonderful about talking care of me. It's so cool to be able to select from such a wide variety of small plates and share. You get to experience so many different things lots of people bring a red and white wine for pairing. Also nice that it is BYOB with no corkage fee. Makes it much easier on the budget than driving downtown (or flying to Madrid) for comparable quality. PS Great homemade soups.

26.description: The 5 star rating is base on both times I have been here, within the last 4 months.  I went with 5 friends here the first time I had the pleasure of dining at Cafe Marbella, and everything was great.  It is a reasonably priced menu, and the food is high quality.  BYOB is definitely a great selling point too.  I had such a great experience that I decided to have a 10 person surprise dinner party for my husband's 30th birthday there.  They were nothing short of accommodating.  I booked online through opentable, with adding a few notes re: the 'situation' and they accommodated us beautifully.  I would HIGHLY recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys tapas and appreciates BYOB.

25.description: So, the food is really good.  But the service is lacking.  I say lacking only because they are seriously understaffed.  Not only that, they charge a dollar per card fee if you split the check.  Really??

12.description: Amazing food! Awesome service! Cafe Marbella offers a great selection of amazingly flavorful foods. And it's BYOB. What else do u need.

59.description: The food here is good but the service is horrible. The hostess is clueless. The first time I went there I asked her how long the wait was and she said there would be tables available at 9pm... It was 9:10pm. On the second occasion that I went to this restaurant I asked the same girl again how long the wait was. I asked her twice actually and she said she didn't know and simply shrugged her shoulders. I saw her tun several potential customers away. Instead of taking people's names down and giving them a wait time she just sends people off. This girl is definitely causing the restaurant to lose business and potential future customers. She also had really sloppy dirty clothes on. Our waiter the first time was a jerk. It took him 15-20 minutes to come to our table for the first time and when I asked If we could order he said "yea I'm right here". We pretty much didn't see him the rest othe night until he brought our bill which he gave to the table next to us. Good food though.

21.description: Five stars for the mango tart !!! Yummy!  The rest... One star. The bread basket had stale bread...not a good sign from the beginning. The garlic soup was very salty, I could not finish it. I am not sensitive to salt at all either. The flatbread was pretty good, my friend felt it was ingredient heavy and slightly too oily, but I enjoyed it. The vegetarian paella was bland, not worth the price, it was very unappetizing. My friend had a steak who said it was overdone. They had coffee but no cream...too bitter for my taste. I wanted to drink it with my tart...but ended up giving it away. Most of my meal is setting in leftover containers in the fridge right now, as I hate wasting food, but it was pretty inedible, hopefully I will get desperate later. 94 dollar bill at the end...and we only enjoyed 10 of it.

17.description: This was a great BYOB place in our neighborhood that we kept missing because it's in an inconspicuous spot on Milwaukee ave. finally I don't have have to trek down to cafe ba-ba-Reeba for great Spanish Tapas. We went in around 5:45 with reservations on a Friday night. We were the second couple to walk in. By 6:30 the place was nearly packed. You'll see a lot of locals here. The food is really authentic and delicious. One downfall was the bread they served was cold--if it were warm I'd have given this place 5 stars. It's the little things. Food: everything we ordered was great! Not in my pictures: hubby ordered a warm spinach and apple salad that he loved. We didn't order our typical favorite Spanish tapas: the bacon wrapped fig. Which I heard was good too. We will def be back with friends next time! Hubby also ordered the chef special--halibut good but a bit salty for us. We ordered 5 tapas and one diet coke.. Bill was $47 without tip! Most menu tapas were 4.99-7.99. Specials were 10.99-14.99. Paellas ranged from 10-16 bucks. Not bad, right!

10.description: Very good food! Friendly staff! They have lots  of Spanish cousins dishes.If you are planning a romantic dinner, or a night out with friends...Definitely this is the perfect spot! Also, is BYOB!

5.description: It has been a few months since I have eaten at Marbella -- where has the time gone --?  The food was fresh and creative. Service seemed a little slow at first, perhaps because we hadn't made a reservation, but when we inquired we were told it was because all the dishes we had ordered were made only after our order was placed. So the wait was rewarded with a tasty meal.  Thanks for a delicious experience.

3.description: Food is just okay, but the service is BRUTALLY slow. If the waiter comes up and asks if you're ready or if you need a few minutes, you better be ready, because he won't come back for a half hour.

35.description: Had Valentine's dinner with my husband there. Food was very good and tasty. We didn' t bring our own wine. But that wasn't the problem. The liquor store is across the street.

19.description: My family previously went here in April and it was fantastic but something has changed.  We were just there recently and they must have changed chefs or something because the food was not as good.

28.description: This is my favorite place in the neighborhood. We love to go there for early dinner during weekends with our toddler when we don't feel like driving downtown.Awesome place for night out with bigger groups to celebrate special occasion like B-day especially it's BYOB!Food is tasty, fresh, big selection of seafood and fish. I feel like tapas portions are more generous comparing to other places I've been in Chicago land area.You have to try it!Special features:neighborhood gem,good for groups,great for brunch,great for lunch,kid-friendly

45.description: People in chicago are Completely Clueless, I think if you served them deep fried leather they would be raving about it for months.This restaurant if you want to call it that, was hands down and easily one of the worst restaurant's I had the misfortune of eating at, the food was terrible and tasteless and some dishes were overcooked, when I was there it was a ghost town that should of been a huge red flag and the place never does any business,shut the dump down already!!!!!!!

33.description: Wonderful Place!! My girlfriend and I visited this place for Valentine's Day. We had excellent service and the food was excellent.    We had the mussels (excellent), mushrooms (to die for), shrimp w/ garlic (incredible), etc. I would recommend this place to anyone with a sense of adventure, and definitely return soon. Thanks guys!!

43.description: My real rating is outstanding to average. Inconsistent quality drives this. Some dishes are exceptionally outstanding and some simply good.This is Spanish food. Real Spanish food. Good or even average; the real deal. This is hard to find in Chicago. I commend there hard work.Marbella has some phenomenal dishes: potato wedges with thin beef slices, grilled octopus and greens, broiled goat cheese, gazpacho and the cauliflower soup. Many delicious specials. They are known for their fish. Most of the deserts are also homemade. All restaurants as all people have opportunities for improvement. This restaurant will only grow into a better and better place. Go and enjoy.

2.description: One of my husband's friends recommends us to go there and gladly we did! We had soup of the day (lentils and spinach), Patatas Bravas, Champinones Al Ajillo, Calamares Al Ajillo and Paella Marinera. We like the little portion of tapas because you can try a variety of food and you don't feel awfully stuffed. Friendly staff, exotic decor with good Spanish music and AWESOME food. We will definitely go back for sure! :)

18.description: Sad to say this place only gets one star... I was excited to try a BYOB tapas place close to home.The atmosphere is kind of dull but wouldn't be noticeable if the food had been good. The service was slow, but it was just one woman serving the whole restaurant which was fairly busy, so I was understanding about that, being a waitress myself. Could have possibly used two servers.Ordered lots of dishes, manchengo cheese, Spanish olives, and calamari to start. The calamari was rubbery and overcooked, for me overdone seafood is a huge let down and completely unenjoyable. The olives and cheese were fine, can't really mess those up.Then we had a tilapia entree which was very dry, and a fish and seafood paella. The rice on that was good but again, all the seafood was overcooked and rubbery and flavorless. We also had dates stuffed with bacon and cheese, I really disliked this dish it was sweet and syrupy. We felt optimistic when they mentioned desert, had lots of options. We had some sort of raspberry tart that was decent, but then I had creme brûlée, which is a favorite of mine, but it managed to disappoint and was cold, not heated all the way through. My friend had flan and it was absolutely nasty, he said worst he's had.Overall, I think I most enjoyed the bottle of wine I brought myself :(.

41.description: Yum!  We've been here twice now and both times, the food was excellent, and inexpensive. Our last trip, four people ate their fill on a fifty dollar tab!  And it's byob, with no corking fees. The menu is mostly seafood options- I don't think there's any beef or pork at all.  Even though I tend not to like seafood, this place won me over. Every shrimp dish was delicious.  The paella covers just about very type of seafood you can imagine, and my family ate every bit of it. The seasoning can be a bit spicy, but the flavors are great. The patatas bravas and the cheese platter is highly recommended as well. For great (cheap!) tapas, look no further than Cafe Marbella!

52.description: Wifey and I still frequent here.  The food is consistent and excellent.  The service is always on point, always has that "at home" feel.  I have an appreciation for Chef Virgilio's techniques and flavors.  His love for the food and culture comes through with every bite.  They are very welcoming and we always enjoy being there.

50.description: A good tapas restaurant located in Jefferson Park.  I enjoy the restaurant because it isn't the bustling, loud sort of restaurant like Iberico or Babareeba.  The food overall is good comparatively to other tapas places on the northside.  Waitstaff is attentive.  It is BYOB, which is an added benefit.  Desserts could you use some creativity but good overall.

4.description: Wow! What a wonderful find, we just loved it.Sometimes I find new places by looking on Yelp and other times, my Facebook friends lead me there.A guy I went to HS with who was also a drama nerd and Spanish geek thought I would love this place. My husband and I met his wife and him at this great family restaurant.We got to meet the owner and his super friendly wife. Our friends brought wine as this is a BYOB and we settled down to a magnificent meal.We ordered tortilla which is one of the ways I judge a Spanish restaurant. Delicious, just the right balance of egg and potato with just the right amount of heft. We also tried some veggies, meat and scallop tapas before the Paella Valenciana. Oh yes, my favorite kind made with mussels, clams, chicken, rice, veggies and the wonderful flavor of saffron.We topped it off with a crema catalana and a cortado. That is good eating.Only place that is more authentic is in Spain itself.It's a lot cheaper to come here!

6.description: This place was recommended to me from a friend. It's byob and we love our cocktails so anything that allows us to spend more on food is worth a shot in our book. Long story short, food was 5 stars!The staff was friendly, bathrooms clean, and our bill was $87 for four to walk out full and satisfied as can be. I will definitely be back.

22.description: We decided to check out this neighborhood tapas place and I'm glad we did. The food is phenomenal! My favorite is the grilled calamari but all the other dishes were great, too. I like the ambience. It is BYOB. And our waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable. He recommended the grilled calamari. Yummy!

15.description: It's always a pleasure coming to this place. Fresh food,  nice environment and friendly people. Sometimes, the owner who is also the chef will even come to your table and speak to you to make sure you're enjoying your meal.

57.description: I feel bad  that  some people had bad experience as so far we've been there twice and second time we had even better experience. Not crazy about their desert choices and our only complain was overly salted, other than that its on my fave list right next to Iberico. Even through all the salt the flavors were great. My fave was their muscles....

20.description: I cannot say enough on how great my daughter's bridal shower was last Sunday.  Great alternative to the traditional shower event.  The top crowd pleasures was the goat cheese with tomato sauce and garlic crustini, shrimp, grilled chicken with baby greens and dressing, mushrooms, etc.  Maria, her husband the Chef Virgil and son, Oscar run a family owned business.  It is BOB and I told my gal at Jefferson Park Medical and she said her and her husband like Cafe Babareeba which is downtown.  So nice to have a tapas place in the neighborhood.  Sally Blume-Kelly

36.description: We love Cafe Marbella! Their hand written 'specials menu' changes every week so there's always some new kind of meat, fish and/or vegetable item to explore. I am fortunate to live nearby so my wife and I have eaten here dozens of times, brought family members, brought friends and made new friends. Everyone raves. I have enjoyed dozens of different tapas small plates and found them consistently and deliciously spiced with over salting occurring maybe two or three times as most. In each case I wasn't shy about asking for a replacement and they were wonderful about talking care of me. It's so cool to be able to select from such a wide variety of small plates and share. You get to experience so many different things lots of people bring a red and white wine for pairing. Also nice that it is BYOB with no corkage fee. Makes it much easier on the budget than driving downtown (or flying to Madrid) for comparable quality. PS Great homemade soups.

14.description: I have been to this place many times usually with a large group. They are always so accomadating to our group. The food has been excellent every time we go there. The BYOB is an excellent touch, since you can have a great meal for a decent price. They do not rush you out of their restaurant. Maria and her husband (chef) come out to great us and have a glass of wine every time. We frequent this place and hope the service/food continues to be top notch! Must try!

29.description: Excellent cookies, will defiantly be back!!

42.description: BEST FLAN EVER.My co-worker brought it to a party and everyone raved about it. The texture is firm yet creamy and the caramel has a slight burnt sugar/coffee taste to it. You can purchase the flan cakes at Tony's Finer Foods as well as the bakery. They're only $10-15 depending on the size, however the $10 one is large enough to feed 10-15 people.

23.description: Sweet connections did my baby shower cake and it turned out beautiful! It was a sheet cake and on top of that a 3D baby's bottom in a diaper with its feet going into the cake that looked like the blanket. The feet had creases!! It looked so real! The cake designer is amazing, the cake also tasted really good too! The cake was definitely the talk of the baby shower, great job by sweet connections bakery!

47.description: WOW..!!! YUM-YUM. This bakery is explosive... and I mean it, you could easily over induldge in this place and pack on a few extra pound.... The german chocolate cake is amazing, almond cresants. pecan rolls and those brownies.. The only plus for me on this spot is its completely out of my way home. So its not often I can make it there, But when I do it is so worth the trip. They do great birthday cakes too. an special events as well.  Highly recommend the assortment cake trays for any office gathering it is loaded with bite size cakes. And you co-workers will love you for them

8.description: First timer. Good sweets! Was a little overwhelmed by how many yummy treats there were to choose from! :)

31.description: Delicious bakery! I frequent this establishment a lot! I love their greek cookies.  I have purchased several yummy treats from this bakery and have always been happy. The only reason I did not give 5 stars was  the rude service I received on more than 1 occasion from a woman whom I shall not name, but has short white hair and is there in the afternoons. Very cranky and terrible customer service.  Avoid her, especially for any speciality cake orders.  Ask to see someone one else. Like this lovely young girl named Michelle. She is absolutely wonderful. In fact I try to go when she is working because I appreciate her kind and helpful professionalism.  She was very  knowledgeable and patient with me when I was picking out a cake for my in-laws. The other workers have been pleasant too but this girl just stood out. Get rid of that other lady!

34.description: Recently moved into the area and we love this bakery.  Their food is top quality.  We especially love the Apple Fritters and Donuts!  Yum Yum!  The only downside is that their staff members are hit or miss with attitude.  If you are looking for an old school Chicago bakery they have it all.  Their prices are also very reasonable.

16.description: What a surprising gem to find! I've lived so close to this bakery for years and have never gone until now. They have tres leches cake!!!!!!! And not just regular, but caramel, and mocha tres leches too! It's not 100% traditional, but it is still really good! Rather than completely sopping with milk head to toe, it's layered with a dry layer for the bottom to keep everything in. Bringing it to coworkers, the only complaint some had was that it was a little too sweet. But i'm a sugar junkie, so I really didn't think it was overly sweet at all -- (icing is usually too sugary for me).But they also have flan, which is on my list of things to try from here. I really do enjoy that these guys are just so affordable! The 10" tres leches,, whether regular or mocha or whatever is only $24.  And it's a great value for it's size.I'm sure to come back for more. and more. and more. Only con? service is a bit slow. Even though many cakes and things are already premade, the workers move like snails whether it's to write a message on your cake or just put ribbons on a box. =) i'm spoiled by speedy service.

13.description: Co worker brought some donuts on a cold day and they were delicious. Fluffy, big, and warm. Everything dunkin doughnuts usually aren't. Ive personally never tried anything else but the chocolate frosted doughnuts were great. My other go to place is oven fresh but sweet connection beats it out by a hair.

11.description: I am indulging myself with their Three Milk Cake for the last 8 years, but i start buying from the source only a few months ago. My two recent discoveries, The Chiffon Cake and Du Monde Cake are pure heaven..moist, creamy, flavorful. The ladies working there are just as sweet as the cakes, very helpful and knowledgeable.                                                                                      Efharisto para poli!

39.description: Love this place!   For every birthday or special occasion this is the place to go.  We got a beautifully decorated german chocolate birthday cake, a huge box of sweet rolls, cookies, spinach pies, and a couple other things and the total was like $25.  WHAT?  At any other place just the cake alone would have been over $25.  Their prices cannot be beat.  I've always encountered super friendly employees and we always wind up talking and laughing the whole time we are in there.  Just an awesome bakery with a huge selection and everything is delicious.

37.description: Well, I've been back and guess who waited on me?  That's right, same woman.  But this time, she was nice as can be.  Even went so far as to call me "sweatheart" a couple of times.  I was like "Wha??"  The line and figuring out who was next still seemed to be totally unorganized.  There was a woman ahead of me, but they asked me if I was next, and again, like in my last visit, I said "No, I think she was next." and it was totally fine.  I don't know what the best tactic is here, it seems like being aggressive with a touch of being laid back is what works.  Make sure you know when you are up, but don't cut in front of anyone.  Seriously, I can NOT recommend the cheesecake more - it is SO good.  The bf thinks their tiramisu is awesome and also loves their german chocolate cake.  This is going to be my go-to bakery.  I think I'll try to go at a non-peak time and see how the line goes then.

0.description: UPDATE:  I spoke to the manager (Joanna) and explained what had happened with the birthday cake.  She apologized and stated that she would look into it right away, and also asked if I could email her pictures of the actual cake (which I did).  In the midst of the tail end of Fat Tuesday/Paczki Day craziness, the took the time to listen to everything I had to say and promised to get back to me by the end of the day or first thing in the morning.  When we spoke, the bakery was closing in twenty minutes so I knew she wouldn't be calling me back the same evening.Sure enough, she called within ten minutes of the time she said she would.  Upon speaking with the staff, she confirmed that it was a miscommunication with the bakery and offered to refund my money or a store credit.  Since I had already ordered a cake for my mom, I asked that I just be able to use the credit towards my mom's cake.  I really do have to applaud her understanding and diligence in handling this matter._____________________________________________________________________I ordered a cake for my son's birthday and asked them to make it look like a football field...no goal posts, players, nothing fancy, but asked that they put a football in the center.  I found a picture on my phone and the lady at the counter took it in the back to show the baker.  The cake in the photo had a huge half football cake in the center.  She said the cake was going to cost $60, but the football would be an additional $30 since they had to bake a separate bowl cake for the football.  Since it was my son's birthday, I agreed to it. I also asked if I should email a photo of a sample of the cake we wanted, and they gave me the email address.  Promptly upon returning home, I emailed a different photo of a football field cake.  It wasn't much different than the original picture, with the exception of the football in the center (the photo in the email had a smaller football).When we went to pick up the cake, there was no football.  I told them that it was no big deal, but asked that they refund the $30 for the missing football.  The lady went in the back and came back with a stack of plastic half-football decorations, and said she could put it on the cake.  I said that was fine, but then asked again about the $30.  She stated the $30 charge was for the icing/frosting, fondant (the cake was not covered in fondant...only the football field itself was fondant, which did not cover the entire top of the cake, only the center), and decoration.   I thought that was strange, because why would you charge extra for icing/frosting?  I didn't want to argue because we had to leave for the party.Fortunately the cake tasted great and everyone loved it.  My parents loved it so much that they asked if I could order a much smaller one for them, which I did.  Upon placing my second order, I asked how much it was going to cost and was given a price.  I then asked how much it would cost if I wanted it covered in fondant and have decorations, and she said it was the same cost.This morning I called the bakery back and I was told they were swamped (which I completely understand, since it's Fat Tuesday). They took down my information and was asked if I could either call back tomorrow, which I fully intend to.I don't mind paying extra for a cake, but I find it ridiculous that they're trying to tell me that the cake cost $60, and decorations that were strictly limited to frosting and a sheet of fondant costs half as much as the cake!

38.description: What a surprising gem to find! I've lived so close to this bakery for years and have never gone until now. They have tres leches cake!!!!!!! And not just regular, but caramel, and mocha tres leches too! It's not 100% traditional, but it is still really good! Rather than completely sopping with milk head to toe, it's layered with a dry layer for the bottom to keep everything in. Bringing it to coworkers, the only complaint some had was that it was a little too sweet. But i'm a sugar junkie, so I really didn't think it was overly sweet at all -- (icing is usually too sugary for me).But they also have flan, which is on my list of things to try from here. I really do enjoy that these guys are just so affordable! The 10" tres leches,, whether regular or mocha or whatever is only $24.  And it's a great value for it's size.I'm sure to come back for more. and more. and more. Only con? service is a bit slow. Even though many cakes and things are already premade, the workers move like snails whether it's to write a message on your cake or just put ribbons on a box. =) i'm spoiled by speedy service.

51.description: I go here to get some  pastries and fresh breads from time to time. They have a couple of tables inside if you would like to have your snack there. They also sell some strong coffee. Not much to do right around here; mostly industrial, so stop at the bakery and be on your way.

27.description: My God this place is huge.  Like warehouse huge.  They had 8 trucks parked outside so this is definitely a machine.  The place had a large assortment of cakes and small pretty desserts.  Breads and coffee cakes as well.  I tried the opera cake, which was a chocolate with chocolate mousse.  It was average.  I would not go back for it nor anything else.  This is the place that sells it's goods to many restaurants and grocery stores.  I am sure there are better things than what I had, but not my cup of tea- it's an old school bakery...

32.description: This place is AWESOME! ALWAYS FRESH! Plus they sell day old coffee cake at discount. There great also!!

48.description: This is my "mistress" bakery.It's not my favorite bakery (Swedish Bakery is) but it is my second fav, the best quality, "gets the job done" bakery, closest to my house.Many a birthday cake, hostess gift, and sweet-tooth treat, have been purchased here.My favorites are the "Tres Leche" (3 milk) cake. Actually, for this not being a Mexican bakery, they make a very good one.And their Paczkis (pronounced  poonch-key) the Polish fruit filled sweet roll made on "Paczki Day" otherwise known as Fat Tuesday. The fresh strawberry ones are amazing.Seeing as I am neither Polish, or Mexican, and do prefer authenticity,  I've been told from people who are, that both these items, are pretty darn good.I did order my wedding cake here, it was absolutely beautiful, tasty, and affordable. I wanted to save some money, which I did, because I was also ordering an "art-piece" of a groom's cake from the "Cake Girls".

44.description: This is the best bakery I have ever been to in Chicago. i have tried several different cakes and pasteries but the Chocolate dipped butter cookies are the bomb. If those are the only cookies I ever eat again it wouldnt dissapoint me.

24.description: Unbelievable treats at unbelievable prices...we have done this for holidays and birthdays and the amazing chocolate treats, cakes and delights are moderately priced but at the quality you would expect from a high end restaurant!

7.description: ROACH!!!!Did I grab your attention yet?  A roach grabbed my attention there today when I went to go pick up a cake and cupcakes today. I was standing at the counter and a roach crawled out of the counter...I called out to several employees to come and look here and they scrambled to kill the roach.  Remember what they say....you see one and there should be hundreds/thousands more. I was utterly grossed out and will tell everyone I know including the City of Chicago Health Dept.  come one now.....you can't tell me no employee has not seen a roach and somehow a customer sees one today?  I was just picking up the goods today as they were already paid for by my uncle, but I informed mu uncle of what I saw and he will be calling there and never buying a single thing from there again.ALSO- The cake that I picked up feeds 55 people so needless to say it was pretty big.  They put the cake in a CARD BOARD BOX!!! no cover and excuse was it would break the center piece.  How ghetto is that??!!I am a loyal customer of OAK MILL BAKERY and every cake I ever picked up big or small had a complete cover for the cake.Please be warned of what I saw.I only wish I had taken a pic, but I left my phone in my car because I knew I was picking up a big cake and was wearing a dress with no pockets.

49.description: Just wanted to let everyone know that the Tres Leches cake at Sweet Connection is fabulous! My parents, who are very Mexican, love it so you know it's got to be good. The best part is that it's reasonably priced for the size of the cake, make sure you have it for your next Mexican fiesta.

40.description: A coworker of mine had told me about this place for the past few years and had even gotten a few almond croissants for me in the past.  But I never put two and two together until AFTER I told her I had gone here myself that this was the place she was talking about.  The store is located in a kind of industrial area in Jefferson Park.  Parking is pretty accessible on the street because of this factor and it's not far from the highway either. I purchased a carrot cake and after some debate between a powdered one and a chocolate one, the chocolate napoleon won.  The napoleon wasn't very good.  The layers were so hard to break into and it didn't have a nice custard.  After one bite, I wasn't really pleased with it, so I just gave up and threw it away.  Any dessert that's that difficult to eat isn't worth eating.  I had the carrot cake the next day, and wow, totally different story.  After my first bite of that cake, I was convinced that this was my Go To dessert for them.  The carrot cake was spiced and jazzed up more than I'm use to of other carrot cakes.  In fact, there were actual shreds of carrot in them.  Icing wasn't too sweet and the cake itself was moist and pretty dense.  Total for both desserts was around $3.50.  What a steal! After glancing at their large array of pastries and breads, this place is deemed very affordable! Nice to see that bakeries are not a dying breed among all the other things being cut in our economy

30.description: The desserts are so very delicious.My favorite is the Strawberry Shortcake (and mind you I usually go for chocolate). The strawberries are fresh and flavorful, the frosting is so so light (with shaved almonds!), and they both complement the moist and delicious cake. This is what a cake should taste like. I've ordered it multiple times for various events, and my guests are always raving about it.Always beautifully decorated and on time.

46.description: My daughter got married Saturday,1/2/2010. We ordered an assortment of mini dessets for the wedding reception's sweets table. We were very satified with the quality, presentation, and taste. The bakery staff was very friendly and helpful. The cost was very reasonable, too. And they delivered from the northwest side of Chicago to Lemont for only $25.

1.description: HAIR IN THE CAKES!!!!!! Do NOT waste your timer money!!! REFUSED to refund money!2 cakes we purchased for a 6 year-old little boy for his Birthday, had HUMAN HAIR in them - 1 long black hair and 2 dark brown short hairs.   During the Birthday Party, in front of friends and family we cut into the cakes and they had 2 HAIRS - I was so grossed out - I wanted to throw up!!! GROSS!!!!!!!  We were upset and embarrassed in front of all the friends and family.  Not to mention, how do you explain to a 6-year-old little boy on his birthday who just blew the candles off his birthday cake that he cannot eat his cake?  HEARTBREAKING!!!!  He has been asking his family to get him a Tres Leches cake for MONTHS - and he gets cakes full of hair!  NASTY!!!I contacted the facility to file a complaint with them and requested a FULL refund for the purchase and demanded for proof of the sanitary conditions the cakes were prepared, which they did not comply with either...  They said - You have to return it to received a full refund.  So let me get this right - You MESS UP and I have to take the time and make myself available for you to get the HAIRY cakes back?  They were tossed in the GARBAGE!!!  That's where they belong!!! I am disgusted and appalled with this whole experience.  They lied to me on several occasions: that the owner was going to call me and speak to me and then, we will process a full refund to you!  I just found out today that there were reports of the roaches in that place.  GROSS!!! When I escalated the issue, they promised a full refund - almost a week later - NOTHING!  They took down the credit card number and once again lied!LIAR!!  GROSS and SICK LIARS!!!  I will make it my mission to have them pay for it.  It would cost them less to have processed my full refund, than the fines they are facing! I have filed an official complaint with the Better Business Bureau and Chicago Health Department and Chicago Consumer. All they had to do was to process a FULL REFUND for the nasty cakes w hair!  GOOD LUCK NOW!!!!

9.description: The people here are great and very accommodating. However, I've been ordering birthday cakes for the last several years and the last 2 times was really disappointed. I ordered chocolate cake with fresh strawberries and there were hardly any strawberries. In addition, the cake tasted pretty stale and the frosting, which I am usually a big fan of, was also non-too-fresh. I will continue to go there for other bakery items but won't order cakes from here anymore.

26.description: I live on the far south side of Chicago and I get all of my cakes from here.   They are the freshest, best tasting cakes my family has ever had.  The customer service is also very good - polite and fast.  The prices are very reasonable so I have no complaints.  If you haven't already tried this place stop in - you won't be disappointed!!

25.description: Forget the baked goods. They have really good caramel apples, way better looking than the Affy Apples at the grocery store even though they're an Illinois product too. I recently found that they can be found at Whole Foods.. yay for that because this is a tad of a trek for me coming from downtown.

12.description: have only had a few things and they were ok, but not awesome.made on-site and good pricing.i'm sure we'll be trying other things though.

21.description: A friend suggested this bakery to me and I'm so glad! This place is like an old school bakery.  They have cakes, cookies, bread, etc....something for everyone. The lady that helped me was so nice. I bought dessert for a dinner party, red velvet cake, Carmelo cake, dark forest and tiramisu!  Omg...they were delicious!!! Will definitely be back and the prices are very reasonable!!

17.description: I have been going there for years now it is hard to make a decision and don't go there if you are even a little bit hungry!  My personal favorite is the three milk cake and even though I am not a big fan of cheesecake theirs is really good. I  have been ordering a cake there for my daughter's birthday the last six years and the possibilities are endless. My recommendation is the chocolate mousse filling.  Sooo good! The only suggestion for cakes is not to order a layer of just chocolate.  For a year or two I would order a layer of yellow then the filling then a chocolate layer.   In a word the chocolate sucks.  It's very dry not at all moist just terrible. When I spoke to a girl there last month she assured me that I was not wrong and  that indeed the chocolate sucked!  Not all the chocolate, just in the cake mix when you order the cakes for pick up. Her recommendation was to have the marbled cake where the chocolate is swirled a little through the yellow batter.  That was much better I just wish they would toss out that crappy chocolate cake recipe and get a better one.  The people are very nice there and the possibilities of what you can bring home are endless!

10.description: I have been a customer of Chicago Sweet Connection for numerous years and have never been disappointed with their baked goods. On May 5th, 2015 I called to see if they could duplicate the flavors of my daughter and son-in-law's wedding cake in a shower cake. They had a destination wedding in California, so obviously I couldn't use that baker. I wanted a white cake with raspberry Bavarian cream filling and buttercream frosting. I spoke to Sylvia who informed me they didn't do raspberry Bavarian cream,but did raspberry mousse. I  asked her what the difference was, and she informed me she didn't know but would check with the baker. She came back on the phone and much to my surprise, said the baker knew how to make the raspberry Bavarian cream and agreed to make a white cake with that filling and buttercream frosting. On May 18th, I went in to the bakery and ordered and paid for the cake. Milagros ( counter girl) even went back and spoke to the baker and hand wrote ( Roberto knows) on my printed receipt "White cake, Raspberry Bavarian cream filling and Vanilla Buttercream frosting."The picture from the shower invite was too small, so I was given a card with their email address to send a picture of what we wanted on the cake. I sent an email reiterating the type of cake, filling and frosting along with the picture I wanted transferred to the cake. I received no response, so sent another email with my original email asking for an email confirmation or a phone call. When I still received no response, I went into the bakery with the picture to be transferred to the cake. At this time, I again went over the type of cake, filling and frosting. I even stated I didn't want layer of Bavarian cream with raspberries on top, wanted it mixed. The counter girl went back and the baker assured her he knew how to make raspberry Bavarian cream and it would be blended.I was also told they never received my email.On June 7th, I picked up the cake and four pounds of cookies I had ordered. Imagine my dismay, when the cake was cut and it was YELLOW cake. There was also a layer of cream with raspberries on top of it, not blended at all.Seeing that the cake and cookies were our only dessert, we served it. On June 9th, I called the bakery to express my disappointment with the cake. Pam who answered the phone said the "Owner isn't in. I could call back the next day." I called the next day and relayed what had happened with the cake. The woman on the phone relayed my message to the owner who said "I shouldn't have served it and brought it back for a refund." Really? Their mistake and we are suppose to tell our guests, sorry no cake for you. Eat the cookies? Needless to say, I was less than pleased with this flippant response. I went in to the bakery and spoke to Joanna the manager. She also told me we should have returned the cake and not served it. She then proceeded to tell me they don't even make white cake. She asked if I had a picture of the cake, and how did she know it was the wrong type? I told her I had some of the cake at home and would be happy to return it so she could see it was wrong. I also added, if you don't make white cake why wouldn't anyone tell me that and why are you questioning it was yellow? Why would it be printed on my receipt? "She offered me a $10.00 refund. I told her that was not satisfactory and I planned on Yelping a review of my experience. She then asked, "Are you threatening me?" My response, "Absolutely not, I am just telling you that if this is not resolved to my satisfaction, I will relay my experience." I also mentioned the two emails I sent and had my iPad to show her the emails. She went in the back for 10 minutes and came back out and told me they ended up in Spam and they never check their Spam. Keep that in mind brides ;( Not very reassuring. Joanna finally after 45 minutes of arguing with me refunded the price of the cake minus the $10.00 for the transfer, "because nothing was wrong with that." I will NEVER patronize this bakery again due to their terrible customer service. All this aggravation over a $38.00 cake. The woman who held the shower loved the cake and was planning on having them make the cake for her wedding,(450 + guests. ) Another guest was going to use the bakery for two bridal showers she is hosting. After hearing of my disastrous experience, both have wisely chosen to go elsewhere.While the customer is NOT always right, I believe Chicago Sweet connection really dropped the ball and lost hundreds of dollars in business over a $38.00 cake. The cake was good, but not what I ordered. In this case, the customer was right.

5.description: I am so disappointed. My daughter picked up two cakes for my 50th bday on Saturday Oct. 18th. One was Strawberry filled, the other was Strawberry and banana. The cakes we lovely to look at but the taste was not good. They were not fresh fruit, it was a glaze or some sort of disgusting  goo. I believe this cake was not fresh. I have ordered fabulous cakes from them in the past, but these two were so bad, I feel like a horrible mother because I could not hold in my emotions when I took a bite of the cake. I know the others at my home felt it was an okay cake, but for the price, not good. I don't know if they are in the practice that other bakers use where they freeze freshly baked cakes and have them on hand for people who order the last minute, but that would be the only thing that explained it. The yellow cake itself tasted grainy. It was not a nice fluffy yellow in taste or appearance. This is why I felt it was an older cake. Me personally, will never order another cake from them. Ruined my 50th. I am the person that mattered as it was my day. Cannot have a redo. Just disappointed. Their baklava is awesome as are their other little pastries but no no no no to cakes.  Just no.
