3.description: I have been getting birthday cakes here since elementary school. Whether it's my birthday, my moms or my dads-we always get it here! My dad's favorite is the tres leches and I have to say I find their tres leches to be better than at traditional Mexican places. The flavor is spectacular. I personally love the atomic, it has a layer of cheesecake in there :) They carry my favorite Greek cookies (melamakarona) here as well which is a real treat considering they take a lot of ingredients and time to make at home.

35.description: My mom got their  tres leches cake from another grocery store and it was absolutely delicious and moist without being soggy in a bad way. (I actually live a really short drive away from this place.)The reason this review is getting 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the following.I try to avoid hydrogenated oil (trans fats) like the plague. Sometimes it hides behind the name of margarine or shortening. On the ingredient list for the cake one of the ingredients was "cake shortening". I called up the bakery to ask more specifically what it was.My question seemed complicated to the lady I was speaking to. I asked what it was, she put me on hold to ask a baker, she said it was vegetable oil, I asked if it was hydrogenated oil, she put me on hold again to ask someone else, then came back and told me that it was just vegetable oil. It almost sounded as if she had never heard of hydrogenated oil, so I asked if that specific oil was solid or in liquid form. (hydrogenated being solid) and without putting me on hold to ask someone she answered right away that it was liquid vegetable oil.I'm not sure if her quick answer was because she was becoming impatient with my questions and assumed all vegetable oil came in liquid form (it does not) or if she really knew what she was talking about.A problem I have with it being "just vegetable oil" is what makes it so special that it has to be listed as "cake shortening"?The next time I get something from them, I'm going straight to their location to ask a baker myself what ingredients they use.

19.description: Any bakery with a line outside the door before it opens has to be good! This place just has some awesome treats, and I'm not even a sweets person. But I would sell my first born for one of their chocolate donuts. They are so good that if you don't get there early enough on a weekend they run out, and early too! It's crazy! But everything they make is pretty damn good, and worth the wait in line. You'll thank me.

28.description: We had friends visiting from out of town, and we were celebrating her birthday in Chicago so her Fiance asked us if we can get a cake. I researched a few places online, called two...and then decided to place the order with Chicago Sweet Connection. Website is informative, lots of detail of options available.We ordered a Strawberry Shortcake..when we went to pick up the cake...we didn't realize they also have a fairly large bakery. Prices are exceptionally reasonable, def good value for your money. They have freshly baked breads, buns, and pastries, and of course lots of cakes and desserts. The cake was one of the best Strawberry shortcake I've had. Service was pretty good. And prices are reasonable!I have saved and bookmarked their information and will def be going back for future birthdays!! I wish they were closer to us and I would probably be there once a week, at least!

45.description: This place is OK.  Nothing exceptional about it.  Doughnuts and other pastries are nice, but again, nothing really special.  I don't like to special order cakes from here because they always seem to be dry and overly sweet (although they are beautiful to look at).  Help is nice and parking is usually not a problem.So, in short, there are lots of better choices.  But if you're in a hurry and are nearby, this place is OK.

33.description: I just wanted to offer my thanks to the staff at Chicago Sweet Connection for the amazing job they did on a special order a few weeks back.  Not only did the cake come out beautifully, but the cake was done to my exact specifications.  They couldn't have been more helpful-  they worked fast and the cake was done on time, considering that it ended up being a last-minute order on my part.  They were also very obliging in working with me to get the custom artwork that was to be put atop the cake.  I spoke to Veronica and she informed me I was able to email the picture file to them, saving me a trip to their location.  The cake was, besides being absolutely delicious, a huge hit and I owe Veronica and the rest of the staff at Chicago Sweet Connection a big thank you.  I will be sure to not only take my future orders there again, but also to spread the word the friends and colleagues of my 100% satisfaction.  Thanks again!

43.description: The strawberry shortcake is amazing! I recently celebrated my birthday with friends and family, and the cake was purchased from Sweet Connection. I've never had anything from this place before. I LOVED the cake from here. It was moist, and the strawberries were fresh, and the frosting was amazing! Oh yeah, and it was decorated BEAUTIFULLY!!!I will definitely go back for more!!!

2.description: Though the prices are reasonable, the costumer service is terrible. I will not go back here. They are rude and made me feel like a bother. On top of that, the floors and tables where dirty and the bathroom was as well. I do not recommend this place for anyone.

18.description: The best red velvet cake and the nicest people!  And they make special cakes for special occasions !!  I'm always very happy when I leave sweet connections!!!!

41.description: We stop here for coffee and a roll on occasion and things are usually ok but one time I had a piece of cake with a strawberry. I ckd under the chocolate the fruit was rotten w green mold so it is not your imagination. Check your food, from previous post, not Costco's fault.

50.description: I went for Easter Dinner at a friends house and we had a cake from Sweet Connections. The cake was white with custard filling and white icing. It was tasty. Everyone enjoyed it. The cake could have been better but the custard and icing were awesome. Apparently the company always puts the writing in quotation marks--- I think they do it to make it seem like someone is speaking to you but it strikes me as funny.

4.description: The Super Atomic cake is delicious. Layers of chocolate cake, yellow cake and cheese cake with strawberries and whipped cream.  Yum!  I've served it at birthday parties for years, and everyone always loves it.  Their service can be disorganized.  But the Atomic cake is worth it.  Free parking in front.

6.description: Great bakery. We had our wedding cake custom made here. We also had a plethora of delicious Greek and American pastries that our guests loved. Great service!

22.description: The customer service is very poor.  They use to have really good customer service when there were older ladies working, but the young girls they have hired are rude and clearly have no clue how to treat customers.  Their cakes are overpriced and you can get the same thing at Jewel for a lot cheaper.  I would have given them 4 to 5 stars about 2 years ago, but not now.  Save your money and go to Mariano's on Elston.

15.description: This place is one of Chicagos best kept secrets...Ok then why am I telling you right? Lol! Well I like to share my secrets. And this is to yummy not to share. Chicagos Sweet Connection has amazing cakes, pies and cookies! As well as Greek sweets you don't find at your local grocery store.What I like most is if your like me you may not need a whole Tres Leches or Cheesecake, which are HUGE. They sell slices of many of them for a couple of dollars.. And this place is their price is cheap! A few years back I wanted a 10in Custom Bday cake. I called around and the prices were about $75 and most bakeries wouldn't even make the design I wanted. It was a record shaped cake just so you don't think anything dirty. Lol! I got an amazing cake from Sweet Connection for $40. Almost 50% less. Plus the cake we bought was better then I had pictured.

20.description: Any bakery with a line outside the door before it opens has to be good! This place just has some awesome treats, and I'm not even a sweets person. But I would sell my first born for one of their chocolate donuts. They are so good that if you don't get there early enough on a weekend they run out, and early too! It's crazy! But everything they make is pretty damn good, and worth the wait in line. You'll thank me.

36.description: I've been passing this place for many a year. So I decided to stop and take a look see. This is the outlet for the commercial bakery. They need to be good as their customers are probably restaurants, small deli's, and Wedliny's.I saw they had rye bread. I hoped it was fresh. I haven't had good rye bread since Augusta Rye went out of business. Couldn't wait to try it. In the car I rushed to get a slice (they do slice a loaf for free) and I was in heaven. Just GREAT. I also bought 2 of my fav apple fritters. Cost: $0.80.I thought, a little high for an outlet. I didn't realize how humongous they were until I got home! HUGE is an understatement. Very fresh and loaded with apple of course. They have a good selection of product. I just looked as there is only 1 of me and how much sweets can I handle? If I lived closer and had a party or celebration I would order from Chgo Sweet.I am partial to Jarosche in Elk Grove as it is closer to home. But Chgo Sweet Connection gives them a run for their money.

14.description: Sweet connections did my baby shower cake and it turned out beautiful! It was a sheet cake and on top of that a 3D baby's bottom in a diaper with its feet going into the cake that looked like the blanket. The feet had creases!! It looked so real! The cake designer is amazing, the cake also tasted really good too! The cake was definitely the talk of the baby shower, great job by sweet connections bakery!

1.description: I've been procrastinating in changing my battery on a watch. Two became 3. Then 3 became 5. So I guess it was time to batt swap. Searched Yelp! for help and found these guys. Costs much less than the mall to change watch batteries. I had a few oversized watches and my set wasn't capable of changing those. I'm very OCD and meticulous in handling my possessions and these guys handled my watches with care without even telling them to. All in all, I will definitely come back here for all future battery related business. Good dudes here!  Oh and by the way, bring any of your Mag light flashlights here to get serviced!  It's covered by warranty and they'll take care of everything. They can even upgrade your existing bulb to an led.  You're welcome :)

9.description: Dave was incredibly helpful and over the top courteous in helping me with my car troubles.  He was able to assess, diagnose, and replace my battery in less than twenty minutes- five star service!

12.description: I needed an extra battery for my Samsung Galaxy phone, and thanks to Dave Meyer, not only did I obtain the battery, but I also received a very helpful education on cell phone battery use. They have a very sizeable array of options for charging and extending battery life, some which just recently became available (so they're very current and knowledgeable on the technology). I also appreciated the very "low-key" and patient sales approach, which allowed me to feel very comfortable throughout my visit, with reasonable pricing as well. I strongly recommend Battery Giant and Dave Meyer.

21.description: One of those pleasant fall afternoons in the 'hood, my watch needed a new battery.  I stopped in, was greeted pleasantly, and explained what I needed.  Then added "and I really don't know how to set this watch when it is running."  I settled in a chair while the nice young woman put in the new battery, cleaned summer gunk off my watch and asked if I'd like a printout of instructions on how to set the various bells and whistles.  The walls are lined with batteries of all kinds and sizes.  Dave proudly told me they also have batteries for large equipment.  If I had grandkids I'd stop in here for a holiday supply of batteries for toys and electronic whatzits.  In less than 10 minutes I was good to go.  Yes, there's a small fee for installing the new battery - well worth it as far as I'm concerned.

16.description: One of those pleasant fall afternoons in the 'hood, my watch needed a new battery.  I stopped in, was greeted pleasantly, and explained what I needed.  Then added "and I really don't know how to set this watch when it is running."  I settled in a chair while the nice young woman put in the new battery, cleaned summer gunk off my watch and asked if I'd like a printout of instructions on how to set the various bells and whistles.  The walls are lined with batteries of all kinds and sizes.  Dave proudly told me they also have batteries for large equipment.  If I had grandkids I'd stop in here for a holiday supply of batteries for toys and electronic whatzits.  In less than 10 minutes I was good to go.  Yes, there's a small fee for installing the new battery - well worth it as far as I'm concerned.

17.description: At 1st I thought I had been ripped off once again,As on my year old 2013 Roketa YY250T scooter shipped to me  from (Superier Power Sports 0 stars rip off note don't get the p.d.I. as U pay over $300.00 for services not done and bike or other vehicle ships from Taiwan to them to you without them doing anything) Any way back to Giant after 6 months the batt. was cashed probably old stoke from Superier but 2auto store put it on tester and told me it was no good ( auto zone/advance auto) & it wasn't just as the fuses,mirrors,crankcase & rear end oil, and W.Washer fluid in place of A.Freeze and more the S.P.S. Were to swap out for American fluids and parts for the  P.D.I. Over $300.00) and Since other battery places as Illinois batt. we're no longer in business and didn't want to pay $125.00 for a tiny scooter batt. I went there) And got a pre filled one for under $55.00 and next day bike wouldn't start and the 2 auto places said above said it also was no good and tried selling me a batt. 4 $125.00 bucks I went back to Battery Giant with printout from both auto stores and bitched up a storm. The guy there put on his machine and it check out good and said to leave it for a few hours and let him charge it as auto store say they did and told him.The battery was fully charged when I came back in 5 hours and put in scoot and haven't had a problem since ( you REALLY need to trust your batt. As the scot don't have back up kick start and you would be dead in the road if battery failed) The real test will be if it still works over the Chicago winter I brought inside as always and trickle chage though winter to be sure it will work in spring and put in stable with full tank (21/2 gal of gas) as you do B4 you store something gas powered for over winter.But guy I believe was owner was very Nice and Calm Evan with my meltdown he acted in a manner of true professional,They have or will get you in matter of a day ANY battery you may need and for a reasonable buck.I will alway go back there as the auto pro's were trying to Fu@/ Me out of about triple and acted liked they deserved me to buy cause the charged and checked my batt. Which is to be free, Bot places did this act and I am sure many people fall foll it as it prints out a piece of paper from charger saying 2/3 or more is wrong with your battery and try and push the highest priced battery on you as you feel obligated as they " Did all this troubleshooting for you" And add more guilt with we will put it in free for you.Beside the scooter battery I have bought car battery's from Giant Battery and were again about 1/3 of cost of main 3/4 auto parts stoes you can figure it out without naming them. Thanks Dave and others at B.G. For standing behind their products and NOT treating you like a moron plus dealing with assho$&'@ as I that came in ranting and raving. Sorry for long story,But I always think I am going to write a few words and turns into this.  PEACE GUY'S   A very satisfied customer Sincerll, Dylan Caamano

10.description: When I first laid my eyes upon Battery Giant, the first thing that popped into my head was The Simpsons. Ned Flanders store in the Springfield Mall, The Leftorium, the store for left handed people. Then I thought of King of the Hill. You know Strickland Propane, where Hank Hill sells "propane and propane accessories". Well Battery Giant has a similar concept of batteries and battery accessories. From the smallest watch batteries to the largest car batteries and anything in between. It's either stocked at the store or easily ordered. I wish more retailers were as friendly as Dave. It's as if he actually came out of Andy Griffith's Mayberry!! I've had my car remote battery replaced, my watch, and my cell phone. The cell phone battery, Dave had to order. He called when it was delivered. I was surprised that the battery had a full charge on delivery. One more thing. Very important. Battery Giant is an authorized disposal for old batteries.

5.description: Best price for a car battery, learned they are American made industrial strength (at least this is what I interpreted what he [Dave] said) 3 year warranty- in my research most only covered for 1 year. Best part was I know I was pushing it coming near closing on a Friday but he was willing to change the battery for me anyways the guy is hella nice! Never been even though it's been in the neighborhood for 2yrs now, glad I came and now I know where to take my used up batteries .

11.description: Found Battery Giant on the Internet spoke to Dave Meyer about getting a new Battery for my Infiniti.  He told me to come up and see them and I did, and I was glad I did. His tech tom put the new Battery in my car in no time. Very impressed with there work and knowledge. Very efficient and knowledgeable also let me not forget very friendly. I will come back again if anybody needs batteries for anything look david up at Battery Giant.

3.description: WHAT AN AMAZING CUSTOMER CARE!!!  I am impressed beyond belief.  I have rarely (RARELY) come across such superb care.  This is what make a business a great business.  This is something that all store and business owners should strive to achieve.  How wonderful and immense pleasure to know that you are treated with respect, promptitude and provided with excellent (and honest!) technical support!I have serviced a powerwasher at Dave's B/G.  I then needed a part which was later found by Dave.  Overall - prompt, knew-what-he-was-doing, and truly caring about his customers.  Bravo to Dave and his team!  I applaud this business and wish them continued success!

0.description: Great experience. He changed three watch batteries in les than 10 minutes. It was very cheap. Ill definitely go there again to change my car key remote

20.description: Great place. Got my watch batteries replaced. Quick and friendly.

19.description: Excellent customer service. Found online, called store, spoke with owners. Great price, knowledgeable, expedient. Overall daily chore turned into pleasurable experience. Tip: parking lot a little tricky, either avoid by parking on Milwaukee or a lot for extra couple minutes.

2.description: Went there on a Sunday and had all the batteries of my four watches replaced in front of me! It was quick and price was reasonable! The guy who worked on it (forgot his name) was also very friendly! It was a pleasant experience! I'll definitely come back here!

18.description: I generally don't spend a lot of time thinking about batteries, but recently, when my cordless office phone died mid-client call, the importance of batteries became crystal clear to me. And if you need batteries, you can't do any better than Battery Giant. Whether you need new battery packs for your cordless phone, or power for your car, your drill or your home alarm system, go see Dave. His prices and his service are unparalleled. He will have you juiced up and running in no time!

13.description: I came here to get batteries for two watches. The gentleman who assisted me was fast and courteous. This is an all purpose one-stop electronic shopping store. Chargers/batteries for a wide selection of phones, vacuum repair, car batteries, and electronic repairs are just some of the services they offer.

4.description: Really enjoyed Dave and his team! I went in to his business for a Chamber networking event; I asked him a few questions about my current car battery problem and he was not only friendly but also informative.

6.description: I had an old dead watch just sitting in my purse for months. I was holding onto it, waiting until I stumbled upon someone that could change the battery for me. One Friday on my way home from work I popped into Battery Giant. They are in a strip mall with easy parking. I walked in, got the battery changed, and was back in my car leaving the parking lot within four minutes.  The total bill was about $8. The guys in there were, quick, friendly and kinda funny/chatty. I would definitely recommend.

15.description: Great place. Got my watch batteries replaced. Quick and friendly.

7.description: Did not need any batteries and was surprised that they can repair small tools there. Had a Homelite leaf blower leaking gas and they refurbished it. Older ones are better built and worth the investment.Dave was courteous, helpful (got me a instruction manual) and very professional.Very difficult to find someone to repair small tools today.First impression was an exceptionally clean store, which confirmed my decision to go from Mt. Prospect to Chicago for my service needs.A++++++

8.description: This man was great help to me and my uncle. We were looking for a battery for our handicap vehicle, as my uncle is paraplegic. David, the owner of the store stayed over an hour after closing time and he even helped us look at the install of the battery in our car  (out in the cold Chicago weather). This man was wonderful. I would rate our experience here 8.9/10

14.description: I needed two watch batteries and was happy to find this gem in my neighborhood. Dave was very courteous and changed my batteries on the spot! Great customer service and reasonably priced...keep up the good work. If you need a battery this is your place, they have batteries of all types!

3.description: Called in and asked for some general info... Person on the phone was very professional and advised me to bring in my DVD player. I am missing the power chord. Low and behold... They have it! Employees are very nice and extremely helpful. No complaints here.

1.description: I bought a new router and have been having issues since. Had both my internet provider and geeksquad try to fix. both state that it is my router. Took the router back within the time frame allowed for returns but was unable to even exchange the equipment because I didn't have the paper receipt. I am in the computer with my credit card I used to purchase the router but still wasn't allowed to return.The young kid working kept making other excuses why the router was not working even though these don't stand up to common sense since there were no problems before this purchase and all other parties state that it was the routerI have shopped here many times to buy hard to find batteries and such, but will no longer shop there. They all should had gone bankrupt. Sad that customer service is the reason that otherwise decent businesses go out of business

2.description: This review is for the sprint dealer inside radio shack: I am writing this review on behalf of my mother who visited the store on 8/13 to get a replacement sprint phone. Francis and her boss went above and beyond to help her find a replacement phone that fit her needs and didn't try and pressure her into an iphone like other sprint locations. She was very happy with the service at this location and we will be returning in the future.

0.description: The location of the store was nice and easy to go there.Their phone collection was perfect for the customer got many kinds of phone.Their product quality very fast not over priced.Thanks for their responsible service and will go back for the next time.

4.description: I'm one of those mean people who usually writes reviews for bad experiences. This is an exception. I bought my first smartphone from this store and the two women working that Friday evening were great. Unfortunately once I got the phone home the camera was not working so I took it back. The staff was happy to help me, tried to troubleshoot it, and ultimately ended up giving me a new phone. All the time like they were happy to be there helping a customer. That, in my experience, is very rare.

29.description: For a northside Chinese restaurant I really liked this place.  It's like old school Chinese food.  The only thing, whenever we order out, they never give us fortune cookies!  I need my fortune!!  lol  The chop suey is very good and so is the fried rice.  Would recommend.

42.description: I love this place!! In particular their egg rolls are amazing, and I just love their beef&broccoli. I''ve never had to wait for a table, and you get free oolong tea all you can drink with your meal.  It's very quiet and quaint. They are also one of the only places I know of that you can buy bags of oolong tea.I recommend that everyone in the area give this place a shot. I've had nothing but good experiences in the 10+ times I've been here.

23.description: I've been eating here for about 20 years and the food is always freshly prepared, hot,  and tasty.  They have the very best eggrolls that I've tried on the NW Side.   I've tried numerous dishes on their menu and all were good, made with the freshest  high quality ingredients.  Sometimes when dining in during the early afternoon, I've seen Moy, his wife and staff preparing various vegetables for their dishes.  They will honor no MSG requests as well, just ask.The interior decor is a bit dated, but the restaurant has wide comfortable booths.  The waitstaff is the best, very prompt, professional and courteous.  When dining in I've always enjoyed the complimentary tea with dinner.  If you like sweet dishes, the Moo Shoo Chicken and Pork are out of this world good.When you have company coming over and you want to order Chinese, this is the place that you call for carryout or delivery.

8.description: Great dine in restaurant. Not that many good Chinese restaurants around the Jefferson Park area. It is a bit dark inside, but I guess it adds to the ambience. Also the food comes quick and the staff is extremely friendly!

31.description: My family raved about this place and took me there one afternoon and it was HORRIBLE! first off...when we walked in the whole restaurant smelled like rotten decaying something...fish maybe? My cousin suggested they might have cleaned the fish tank that particular day? Anyway, if that wasn't appetite destroying enough, I ordered vegetable chow mein and it was literally a glob of noodles with some brown rancid tasting gravy and onions and bean sprouts. There were a couple pea pods but 3 at the most. Just terrible. I will never go back, nor do I recommend this place. Yuk!

34.description: I used to love this place, but in my opinion, the quality of the food has deteriorated in the past year for some reason, which is very disappointing. I suggest trying Saigon Grill on Elston Avenue instead.

16.description: Great eggrolls!! The food is very good and very fresh..you can really taste the difference between restaurant quality food and take-out..prices are actually not too different from the smaller places in the area..we found our new chinese place!!

13.description: Moy lee has some great Chinese food, except for the potstickers which are just okay. The chicken soup, egg rolls, and chicken with broccoli are very good! Not too salty either. The waitstaff is really friendly and attentive and it is a nice family owned place. I har only at in the restaurant, but the phone is always ringing off the hook for take out orders. You must try this place if you are looking for good food in the area!

11.description: Good healthy food.  No MSG.  It tastes so fresh.  You actually taste the ingredients, not salt like most Chinese places.  I just wish they had a non-shellfish option for the egg rolls for allergy reason.  Otherwise wonderful!

39.description: Disappointed.....we tried it for the first time last night.  Ordered Mongolian beef, veggie fried rice and egg rolls.  I couldn't even eat it.  The Mongolian beef was swimming in some thick sauce that tasted like BBQ sauce and the egg rolls were very fishy tasting and had that bright colored mystery meat in it.  My husband said that veggie fried rice had very little taste.  I didn't even bother. Yes, the portions were great, but to appreciate that I need to LIKE the food. I don't think I will try this place again

37.description: We refer to this place as "Oily Moy Lee", and even though it isn't exactly oily, it isn't worth a second trip.  It is average at best, but to me it's merely mediocre.  To those who don't venture outside of Jeff Park for Asian food, I can understand the connection.  But I have eaten a lot of Chinese food, and to me, this place doesn't hold a candle to others I've been to.

0.description: Fave Neighborhood Chinese Restaurant!

38.description: My favorite chinese food.  Egg Rolls are the bomb.  Fried rice is great.

27.description: So my buddy had heard that Moy Lee has superb pot stickers and MAN WAS HE RIGHT!!!  These were some of the best pot stickers I had ever had.  The problem?  The rest of the food was TASTLESS.  Look at my past reviews.  I don't roll this way, but a review like this is very well deserved.  In short, all three meals were so bland that once we had all finished the half of our meals that had just gotten us to the point of sustanance, we were forced to throw the rest away.  And Chinese reheats well!  We didn't want to take the chance.  It was so bad that It is October and I am commenting on a meal in August.  I looked up my American Express card, just to be sure I had the name right.  In my opinion the food was warm... that was good.  there were no bugs or outright baddness that I could see... just your standard tasteless waste of money.  My advice... they need to fire their cook... inless the cook only makes pot stickers.  Because damn those pot stickers were really good.

32.description: Hot and sour soup - Very Good. Egg Roll was large and tasty. Hong Shu Chicken was good but had too much gravy. Tea was hot and full bodied. Service was excellent.

44.description: i am re writing this, atfer my last experience i eill never eat here againi found a chicken tallan in my sweet and sour chicken, and i called to ask them whats up? and they said sorry and next time i cll i get free sweet and sour chicken...ehh no more chinesse for me espically here, well here is my review before this happened..............i do like moy lee, it is hard to find a good chinesse retaurant around the chicago area because there are so many, the food can be greasy espically the sweet and sour chicken but its good, and you can order a PACK of their fortune cookies which i love, yes it is a little expensive i must sAY BUT FOR CHINESSE around this neighborhood stick here.

24.description: I don't know why this place doesn't have better ratings. Their bbq beef is the best. Mix that with their special fried rice. *drool* they make by far the best egg rolls with their special sweet and sour sauce. If anyone knows of a better place with egg rolls let me know. I don't even live in the area and I buy their food.

7.description: This is literally the worst Chinese food that I have ever eaten. Not one thing that I ordered (and I have ordered many different things) had any SMIDGEON of flavor. You'd have to drench the food in some kind of sauce to draw up ANY flavor. It's completely bland, but no healthier, so there goes the problem.The only items that have any semblance of flavor are the egg rolls. Even still, I am unsure of the ingredients and it made me feel uneasy while eating it. Overall I would never recommend the restaurant to anyone. I'd only eat here again if I was forced to.

40.description: YUK...my first visit, and I was hoping from the other great reviews that I had finally I found a new place since my beloved take out place closed. I am looking for a good orange chicken, and I will settle for decent...but this stuff was nasty. Tasted like weak sweet and sour sauce, looked kind of cloudy and pale, not really a glaze, looked to be thickened with corn starch, no spicy heat to it what so ever, soggy breading and last but not least, what are those red things ???...yes folks,,,maraschino cherries ?!?!?!? D- on the orange chicken. (some of the meat pieces were questionable too). On to the Vegetable Fried rice, I'll give it a C+. Not greasy, a good thing...vegetables ?? well, the most predominant veggie was the chopped up snow peas, then a few bean sprouts with a couple mushroom pieces thrown in. I did see what I think was a small piece of green pepper. That was it, oh, a little egg of course. So few vegetables could almost call it plain fried rice. It did have decent flavor, but I have had much better. Now the eggrolls..B- and that's being generous just because they were nice and fat, but have had better as well, nothing special about them. Strange meat, I think bbq pork from the red color, a little shock to bite into it and see a good bit of dark pink/red meat.  That said, I may try them again, but still going to keep looking. Oh, portion size ....A+ a ton of entree food, it's in in a flat plastic container, not a take out carton.  But no fortune cookies...should be only one star for that alone !  Takeout service ok,  no smiles from anyone. Looked bored.

30.description: I have eaten here twice with my Grandpa and I ate good food. It wasn't extraordinary, but it was good. The sesame chicken was really different. The waiter alerted me as I ordered that it is different than most. When it came it I discovered that the breading was more like a tempura, which I liked. The chicken was a little tough, though. All in all, I like the creativity considering it's a small, nondescript Chinese restaurant, but it could be a bit better. Still, Gramps loves it.

1.description: This Chinese restaurant is near where I live and it is the first time I came to this place. My parents came to this place a long time ago when they first moved to this neighborhood. The egg rolls were good but not as big as the now closed Kow Kow restaurant in Cicero Ave., Lincolnwood, IL. They also served sweet and sour shrimp like in Kow Kow which I also liked but the portions are a bit smaller than the one they served in Kow Kow during lunch time. I did not care for bar-b-q ribs. It's smothered in barbecue sauce. It's not similar to Chinese smoked sweet and sour bar-b-q ribs served in other Chinese carry-outs and Chinese restaurants like the closed Kow Kow.Our server was nice and friendly but I thought he was pushy. My elderly mom asked for egg foo young but the waiter kept insisting on getting the combination (egg roll, shrimp, barbecue ribs, and fried rice). He said the egg foo young would be "too much". If it was too much, we would have taken it home with us in a doggie bag. Two stars for the customer service. How I wish Kow Kow was still opened!

9.description: Been going to Moy Lees since I was a little girl and honestly no other place has chinese food as good in my opinion. The only other place where I get food that tastes similar is when I go directly to china town and even then there are foods I try in China town that I prefer more at moy lees. Keep up the great work Moy Less you have me as a life long customer.

26.description: I have been coming here since 1993 and this is hands down THE BEST Chinese restaurant in town.The atmosphere is more classy than your average Chinese joint. You get everything on clean, fresh plates that are not chipped or mismatched like at other Chinese restaurants.For dinner they break out with elegant linen napkins.The servers have been the same for ages and are very professional and actually speak great English so you don't have to repeat your order 5 times and you know they won't mess it up.As for the food, OMG! You won't find anything like Moy Lee's elsewhere. First, they make their own sweet n sour sauce. Not of this processed, hot pink-colored sticky sauce. Theirs is just the right amount of sweet (I think they put oranges in there) and just the right amount of sour (apples I think) and it's this warm orange color that makes it appetizing. They steam their rice to perfection. I like to eat it on the side bc it's just so good plain. For years I couldn't break of of my Sweet n Sour Delight cycle. If you like sweet n sour you'll love this dish! Chicken, pork and huge shrimp in crispy deep-fried batter with that delicious sauce! Oh my goodness, to die for!!!The egg rolls are huge, about the size of my head and filled to the brim with Chinese cabbage, bbq pork and assorted veggies. Fried to perfection it's the perfect appetizer. The rangoons are also worth getting as you can actually see and tasts the crabmeat inside. Last night I has the Sai Woo duck. I've only had it once before while dining here with a party of 8 and we had to share all our dishes so I didn't get enough of this delicious dish. Finally, I had it all to myself. It was so good I ended up saving the other half of it to eat for lunch the next day.If you haven't tried Moy Lee's out yet, then what are you waiting for? Your tastebuds will thank you!

25.description: Went her for lunch and I want to address some of the other reviews that say the food is bland - is is not bland, it is subtle. This is not a Chines fast food joint it is a restaurant and the food tastes like restaurant food - also the staff and owner are amazing - the owner making out Christmas cards when i was there...

12.description: I have been going to this place since it was take-out only.  30 years of being a customer and I love the place.  Owner is friendly.  Always engages his customers.  Food is great.  An old school Cantonese place that reminds me of all the Chinese restaurants of my Chicago NW side  youth, but they also offer other Chinese varieties.  I really miss the friendly waiter, Dan, who left about 5 years ago.  There was nothing better than a lunch when your waiter would regale you with his Cub Fan nonsense in his Chinese accent.This is a NEIGHBORHOOD PLACE.  It serves a loyal customer base.  Nothing fancy about the decor.  You go there to eat, not wine and dine.

21.description: I have been going to this place since it was take-out only.  30 years of being a customer and I love the place.  Owner is friendly.  Always engages his customers.  Food is great.  An old school Cantonese place that reminds me of all the Chinese restaurants of my Chicago NW side  youth, but they also offer other Chinese varieties.  I really miss the friendly waiter, Dan, who left about 5 years ago.  There was nothing better than a lunch when your waiter would regale you with his Cub Fan nonsense in his Chinese accent.This is a NEIGHBORHOOD PLACE.  It serves a loyal customer base.  Nothing fancy about the decor.  You go there to eat, not wine and dine.

17.description: I've been eating here for about 20 years and the food is always freshly prepared, hot,  and tasty.  They have the very best eggrolls that I've tried on the NW Side.   I've tried numerous dishes on their menu and all were good, made with the freshest  high quality ingredients.  Sometimes when dining in during the early afternoon, I've seen Moy, his wife and staff preparing various vegetables for their dishes.  They will honor no MSG requests as well, just ask.The interior decor is a bit dated, but the restaurant has wide comfortable booths.  The waitstaff is the best, very prompt, professional and courteous.  When dining in I've always enjoyed the complimentary tea with dinner.  If you like sweet dishes, the Moo Shoo Chicken and Pork are out of this world good.When you have company coming over and you want to order Chinese, this is the place that you call for carryout or delivery.

10.description: Not good! What happen? Soup cold and food just not up to par....The place next to 7-11 is way better now.Hope you can get it together again.Heard owner talking that he was tired and no family members wants it maybe they just gave up.Sorry!!!

5.description: So another Chinese restaurant so close to another one I reviewed. This one has ambiance. If you want to dine in it looks nice inside. I have only ever gotten carryout but I liked how it looked and staff seemed professional at a glance. Their egg rolls are really good and so is their fried rice. Their orange chicken could use a little more spice, but I forgot to order it spicy. They put sweet and sour and soy in the bag unlike their neighbors too. Good experiences only downside is its about $5 pricier for the meal i get. $25 vs $20 down the block. Worth it though, just feels nicer inside.

3.description: The Service was good. I would not come back for the food. The sesame chicken was dry. The sauce was way to salty. The only thing like is the egg rolls. I never going back again

35.description: This place is really good.I think it's possibly the best place on the Northside.Really family orientated,They were actually eating dinner at the Big table.The whole family! I thought that was pretty cool.The Fried Rice is excellent.The Mongolian Beef is FLAME!!! Great Eggrolls, And the Egg Foo Young is Awesome!  One of my favorites.Check it out!

19.description: I have eaten here twice with my Grandpa and I ate good food. It wasn't extraordinary, but it was good. The sesame chicken was really different. The waiter alerted me as I ordered that it is different than most. When it came it I discovered that the breading was more like a tempura, which I liked. The chicken was a little tough, though. All in all, I like the creativity considering it's a small, nondescript Chinese restaurant, but it could be a bit better. Still, Gramps loves it.

28.description: I love this place! It remains the same some 15 years later. The staff are pretty much the same, and they a nice bunch of people. This is the best Chinese restaurant in Jefferson Park. There are always people inside dining in, and there are also plenty of takeout and delivery orders as well.The hot and sour soup is just "souper-duper" and the eggrolls are divine. I get an order to go sometimes, just because they're so yummy and good. The eggrolls are a mix of the different meats and the "mystery" pink meat that was mentioned in a previous review is actually their barbeque pork.The entrees are very good: you can never go wrong with the chicken birds nest; the beef pepperada; the beef lo mein; or any of the sweet and sour meats. The sweet and sour sauce is not heavy and has a very fresh, citrus taste that some may have to acquire. The ultimate thing to get, though, is Moy's Special, which is a mixuture of the different meats in a savory sauce that comes with pan fried noodles. Above else, all ingredients are fresh, and there is a great cocktail menu. Any place that has a Harvey Wallbanger on their menu is awesome!

45.description: A good sit-down chinese restaurant...very quiet and quaint. However, they use MSG in all their cooking! They say they can cook without the MSG upon request...but that's why I honestly prefer Chinese Kitchen: I never have to request or worry about a mistake!!! The only real plus about this place is that there are plenty of seats...the food is pretty good - as long as it doesn't give you a huge headache afterwards!!

33.description: 25 years ago this place was great and we ate here constantly.  But now...Yuck!My mom wanted Chinese on Mother's Day so we got a whole bunch of different dishes and everybody had a little of each.  We ordered the food with no MSG and it was absolutely atrocious.  (I understand MSG gives it flavor, but I order no MSG from other places and the food is delicious.)  It was so bland with NO flavor at all.  The chicken was so overcooked it was tough and hard and almost crunched when you bit into it.  Broccoli was light green and total mush.  The fried rice was dripping grease and tasted old.  The egg rolls were absolutely inedible.  I don't know how you can screw up an egg roll but they tasted like crap.All in all the entire meal was a disaster and completely overpriced.  We had a group of 6 serious eaters who love Chinese food and all of us agreed it was just terrible and we would never eat here again.

43.description: I can honestly say that this is hands down the BEST Chinese food I have ever eaten. I love it so much I have dreams about ordering from Moy Lee. I am very particular when it comes to Chinese...the fried rice has to be perfect and the egg rolls can make or break your meal. Moy Lee's food is just fantastic. Everything here is delicious! I've recommended this place to many friends and they all agree. They even deliver to Edison Park (where I live), which is key.

2.description: Moy Lee is a fairly typical little neighborhood Chinese joint of the old school:  laminated menus with a ton of options and low prices, traditional American-centered Mandarin/Cantonese items, and best of all, my favorite of all neighborhood Chinese options in Chicago, the secret tiki bar.  It's a tiny space, and the service can be a bit sketchy when they have a lot of delivery/take-out orders, but they're always super friendly. The food is...uh...well, the food is reliable and consistent.  It's not going to be the most memorable or tasty food you've ever had, but it's got a buffet-line familiarity that is appealing in a way.  So there you go!  Moy Lee!

18.description: I'll admit, I do not dive deep into the menu, but for my favorites this place 'em does right. All I need to satisfy my twice-a-month Chinese food cravings is Fried Rice done right, egg rolls and sweet-n-sour chicken. I moved to Jefferson Park 4 years ago, and it took me about a year to find Moy Lee's. Other places in the area could do Rice or Eggs rolls well, but NOT both. I cannot vouch for anything else on the menu (Crab Rangoon is semi-decent), but if you keep it simple like me and Fried Rice/Egg Roll combo is the most important thing; you'd be hard pressed to find better in the area. P.S. to ownership: Add Smoothies!

41.description: Best chinese restaurant I have left the neighborhood and occasionally go back just to eat.  I love the Egg Rolls, Mongolian Beef, Fried Rice, Orange Chicken. They do use MSG, but the food is excellent. It is no Opera, but is still an awesome restaurant.

4.description: I ordered 2 dinner specials they sent the mrat with white rice only i valled she said that was the dinner special retarded if she would have told me i would of ordered fried rice smh so 35 dollars for two meats and white rice i will never order here again

6.description: Brought my Mom here for Mothers day and it was closed by the Health Department.  Really put a damper on our holiday.

22.description: They have the best egg rolls ever!! I love them!!

15.description: This place is the reason I travel all the way to Chinatown, or Argyle for a good meal. Been here 5 times since I moved here and the only edible good I've encountered are the potstickers and beef broccoli. The potsticker filling is delicious, if only they would stop microwaving them. Nothing else I've had there is even remotely edible. This is the place we went to when we had no idea what Chinese food should be. The food is trapped back in the 70's and it's a shame. So I'll hop on the 92 & go to Argyle until I find something closer.

20.description: I have been eating here for 15 years.  The food is always fresh, the people are always friendly.  The inside could be more modern, but its not unpleasant.  We have to travel a little farther to eat here, but we won't go anyplace else for Chinese.  LOVE IT!!

36.description: For the first time I tried Moy Lee last night .  The food was horrible and that is putting it nicely.  I tried it primarily because there were a lot of good reviews.  I ordered sesame chicken.  It was awful had a sour flavor, most sesame chickens have a bit of honey in the sause so it is slightly sweet, not at all here.  My husband ordered mongolian beef his was slightly better but oily and still not good.  The food was not worth it at all.  I want my money back!!

14.description: I have been coming here since 1993 and this is hands down THE BEST Chinese restaurant in town.The atmosphere is more classy than your average Chinese joint. You get everything on clean, fresh plates that are not chipped or mismatched like at other Chinese restaurants.For dinner they break out with elegant linen napkins.The servers have been the same for ages and are very professional and actually speak great English so you don't have to repeat your order 5 times and you know they won't mess it up.As for the food, OMG! You won't find anything like Moy Lee's elsewhere. First, they make their own sweet n sour sauce. Not of this processed, hot pink-colored sticky sauce. Theirs is just the right amount of sweet (I think they put oranges in there) and just the right amount of sour (apples I think) and it's this warm orange color that makes it appetizing. They steam their rice to perfection. I like to eat it on the side bc it's just so good plain. For years I couldn't break of of my Sweet n Sour Delight cycle. If you like sweet n sour you'll love this dish! Chicken, pork and huge shrimp in crispy deep-fried batter with that delicious sauce! Oh my goodness, to die for!!!The egg rolls are huge, about the size of my head and filled to the brim with Chinese cabbage, bbq pork and assorted veggies. Fried to perfection it's the perfect appetizer. The rangoons are also worth getting as you can actually see and tasts the crabmeat inside. Last night I has the Sai Woo duck. I've only had it once before while dining here with a party of 8 and we had to share all our dishes so I didn't get enough of this delicious dish. Finally, I had it all to myself. It was so good I ended up saving the other half of it to eat for lunch the next day.If you haven't tried Moy Lee's out yet, then what are you waiting for? Your tastebuds will thank you!

3.description: This is a true hometown bar!! Only reason I gave it 4 stars was because they didn't talk me out of doing a shot of Jeppson's Malort!!!! WHY?????

1.description: My new favorite bar. It's cozy yet spacious, clean but also with the charm of your grandfather's basement. Free pool, jukebox, great patio in back and awesome drink prices. Cristina the bartender is so warm and welcoming. Will definitely be back!

2.description: This place should be closed down with immediate effect for false advertising.Hamms does NOT grow on trees.Please be more truthful and rename your bar to Tree Inn.

5.description: Stopped in to attend a surprise 40th party for a friend.  It's a neighborhood bar, like many in Chicago, with a great beer garden in the back.  The bartender on Saturday night was great, friendly, attentive... what I think makes a great bar-keep!  Rather than the normal narrow Chicago bar, there were plenty of bar-height tables to sit at, along with the bar seating.  Couple of dart boards for a little steel-tip throwing.Generally a nice little neighborhood place that I could pop into again, anytime.

6.description: As far as neighborhood dive bars go... this place is awesome.  I can't wait to sit in the big beer garden out back.  Kristina, the bartender is from Krakow and is a very sharp bartendress.Plenty of stools, nice seating, darts, pool tables, etc...Nice cast of characters I might add... very friendly and welcoming folks too.  Some had marbles in their mouth, but we met an inspiring veteran that shared some great stories.

7.description: A good neighborhood dive with drunk people that are not threatening. I liked this little bar with a pool table and the smallest beer garden known to man. This is a bar with a variety of sized televisions and of good drinking bottled beer. The decor is average, yet somehow I like the layout and look of this place.

8.description: The best bar on the northwest side of Chicago.  The bartenders are great and the prices are reasonable. What else can you ask for...

0.description: This is my favorite bar in Jefferson Park, hands down.Every year we throw our Christmas party here. The owners are very sweet, and even cooked for our party one year, free of charge! Some of the regulars are weird, but in a "ha-ha" way, not an "Uh-oh" way. The beer garden in back helps out if there are smokers in your group. Free pool table and dart boards, 7 HDTV's, and a SWEET ass jukebox.

4.description: This is a great place for regular people. I never have had a bad experience here in the almost two decades of going here.

3.description: Nice job by the team. On time and put a purple felt on my table - and made sure everything was level! Nice guys, that I think actually put my table in 8 years ago (from a dealer that went out of business).

1.description: Dennis, Frank and their staff run a top notch operation. They were very accommodating. I made an appointment to see tables even on a day when their showroom was technically closed. And even though it's the busy holiday season they delivered and installed the next day! Love their service. They did a great job. Thanks!

0.description: They just delivered and set up our pool table.  It may be used, but it looks brand new!!  Couldn't be happier with this company.  They obviously take pride in their work.  Prices are extremely fair, and they delivered and set up our table within a week of our purchase.  They have exceeded my expectations and I would highly recommend them to anyone!

2.description: Frank and his uncle, Dennis, were outstanding. I visited the store and explained what i was looking for and they kept me in touch with their inventory. The delivery process and set-up was perfect and the table looks fantastic. Frank provided a ton of input throughout about issues such as room sizing, types of cue, what to happen if our kids affected the felt etc etc. A very professional operation that made the entire process easy and efficient. You will be very happy  you went to visit them

5.description: Dennis' team just left my office after moving my pool table from one room to another.  They did a great job and finished in under two hours!  I am very happy with the results and will definitely recommend them to anyone looking for a pool table mover.  Dennis is very friendly as was his team.

6.description: We've moved our table 3 times in the past 8 years, and used 3 different movers .  largely because I lost the name of our previous movers.  i found Jaburek online.  I was very impressed with them.  They were on time, polite, and efficient.  They were happy to answer any questions.  They were the best and most economical of all that I have used.

7.description: These guys just moved a table for me.   They were on time, took great care disassembling, let me know that my cushins were dry rotted and needed to be replaced (sure enough they were when the felt was pulled off), and they did an excellent job reassembling the table.  It was pretty wild watching them put it all together and I was probably pretty annoying watching them so closely and asking so many questions, but they really did a good job.  My table plays really really good now with the new bumbers and new felt.If you are very picky about having everything perfect like me, you can trust these guys to handle it.Thanks Frank & Dennis!

8.description: I bought a used pool table from these guys a couple years ago.  The setup was great and the table is top notch.  It's got a lot play and many compliments from players stopping by to shoot a game.

9.description: Found Dennis on craiglist.. i'm far from his shop.  I didnt have the time to make the trip there. Instead Dennis spent few hours on phone with me, and emailing and texting me various photos and helped pick out a table.  We spoke Wed and Sat morning his guys were here to install.  Table looked better than expected!  Dennis was great to work with, he looked for ways to stay in my budget.  His workers were great too, friendly and helped me understand how everything is put together incase  I ever had to move it.   A+++Overall Great company to deal with.  Thanks again.

10.description: I am so impressed with this company. I called to order a repair and the owner, Dennis Jaburek, walked me through how I could fix it on my own. He could have sent someone out, billed me and I wouldn't have known the difference. The fact that he took the high road is an impressive thing, especially in this economy. When I looked back on my organization's records, this company also did our pool table set-up. I remember them doing an excellent and efficient job then, as well. D. Jaburek Billiards definitely has my future business.

4.description: They were great - flexible with their scheduling, on-time, professional, and honored the costs they provided upfront. We had them disassemble, transport, and re-assemble a 3 piece slate 8ft. Brunswick table. They were successful in reusing the existing felt (had lots of folks who said that they would have to replace it) and replaced one bad bumper for only $20. Also, out of the six places I received quotes, they were one of the least expensive. When we decide to replace the felt and remaining bumpers, we will definitely call D. Jaburek Billiards and Pool Tables!!

3.description: Had my sons ps3 and ps4 fixed here. Great guy and service. Haven't had no problems with either system since. Forget Gamestop here's where we get our games ever since. Can't wait to get my original Nintendo fixed to bring back old memories.  Strongly recommend

1.description: Needed my Xbox One wireless controller repaired, brought it in and had it fixed in less than 20 mins. Lifelong customer acquired!

2.description: Had my friends ps3 repaired and works great! Life long customer already aquired! He's the best in every way. Like I said he is highly recommended for all of your videogame repair needs.

5.description: On the eve of my Birthday my PS4 died and all hope was lost.  As I considered  buying a new system I came across and Ad for North West Video games and decided to give them a shot. While I was very skeptical I kept an open mind in speaking to the owner not only did he tell me repair was possible but that I would have my system back in 2 day. As I ran to my car like the Bat mobile I hear the owner say we will pick it up I said OMG that's awesome and in less that 30 min someone was at my door to pick up my broken friend. While I have to say they were very friendly and informative and kept me in the loop of the progress of the repair. While I was still skeptical on day 2 I get the call that the system we repaired and would be dropped off. During the drop off I was allow to test out the system before payment without asking and that was very important to me honestly they had just saved me $300.... Thanks for all of you help you are truly a 5+ star A+++ operation

0.description: This place is awesome and saved me a lot of money. I took my son's wii u game pad in last week because it wouldn't turn on my son fried it out. I called them after i saw a fb post. I took it in same day. Left it overnight and the next day they called me and said it was ready for pickup. This place is very friendly and inexpensive. Definitely recommend them.

4.description: Great place to get your gaming systems fixed. They did a complete and very detailed clean-up to my system on top of the repairs. Staff here go to the extent of putting fresh thermal paste to keep the system going for a few years. Services and prices are great. Highly recommend. A+++.

3.description: Not impressed at all.  There color selection stinks.  The nail Polish is old.  :(  My feet and hands look like a 5 year old did them.I wanted to find a 'go to' place in the neighborhood - this is not it.

1.description: First trip to Illinois Nails, and it was just fine. I'd give it a 2.5 if I could. Nothing spectacular, but nothing terrible. Not a high quality selection of polishes, but I found a pretty Essie lilac for my toes. Went on a Saturday at 4, waited a half hour because there were only 3 women working (On a Saturday!?!) Got a decent pedicure, but while drying toes realized that one was smudged and one had a dried chunk of top-coat in it. Amy, who was in charge, fixed both upon my request (along with a few others she clearly didn't approve of!) If I came back it would only be for her.

0.description: I stopped in to get my gel nails taken off from my wedding and I felt welcome from the moment I stepped inside.  Very friendly and always make sure your nails are perfect before you leave.Will definitely go back soon!

2.description: I used a groupon at this place for a manicure and pedicure with parrafin. The leg massage was non-existent and to get the paraffin, I had to wait a while after the manicure- pedicure was done. The paraffin didn't seem like a sanitary procedure as I had to stick my hands and feet into the hearing element/one pot they had to heat the mixture. If you're looking for a cheaper mani-pedi,come here but don't expect great service.

5.description: Absolutely love love love this place. I've been coming here for several months now and every time I come I get great service! Amy is amazing at what she does! The prices are fair and the ladies are all so very welcoming. An undiscovered slice of heaven in Jefferson Park. I simply can't praise this place enough.. Def recommend others come check it out.. you won't be disappointed!

6.description: FYI...this place is closed.  And the phone number is no longer in service.  A new proprietor has taken over the location.  Haven't tried it since changeover.

7.description: The longest and BEST foot massage with a pedicure I've ever had in my life! They took the time to always address me by name as well as my 3 year old who I brought with for her first mani/pedi! They were so patient with her because she kept smearing her nails! I can't wait to go back!

8.description: After a hard day of work, I decided on a pedicure to treat myself. Illinois Nails was the only place open past 7pm on a Saturday night (SCORE), and they were happy to take me at a last minute notice. I was warmly greeted and my nail tech, whose name I regret not catching, was very sweet. She was meticulous and took her time with my pedicure, paying attention to every detail. I'm pleased with the result- my feet are soft and my toes look perfectly polished. I look forward to returning here next time for a mani+pedi!

9.description: Have gone twice, but plan on making my regular place for nails! Friendly staff, great service, great job on my pedicures. Clean, comfortable, a relaxing place to get your nails done.

10.description: Definately returning. Indeed they are very friendly. They work hard and do a great job. Prices are moderate, the best part they work in the evening so it's easy to get it. I highly recommend!

4.description: I like this place. It's no-frills, but the proprietor remembers you in a second and what you like. ALSO, this is the ONLY nail salon I have ever been to that is not afraid to pull out my in-grown toenails. I get them really bad and they hurt. It's a little uncomfortable, but they do it quick and fast and it's well worth it.

3.description: This produce store/deli features American and Polish cuisine.  They are stocked with fresh fruits & vegetables sold at great prices.  This little grocery store packs a solid punch.  Excellent walk in collers filled with beer on one side and dairy items on the other make this stop a must while in Jefferson Park

1.description: This little gem is a little out of my way but I would stop by whenever I'm in the area. Great tasting and always fresh prepared foods, good selection of European beer and decent choice of produce. Love the cakes and fresh bread, too. Well worth trying if you like Polish food.

2.description: If you're the kind of person who loves Polish delis for what they offer, ignore this review.  We recently moved in the neighborhood and I had walked past this place a few times without knowing exactly what they had to offer.  If fact, I didn't even know it was a Polish deli until I walked in.  The first sign is the smell, it smells like every other Polish deli.  As soon as you walk in you are at a wall of Polish juices.  I was especially curious about their produce section since I am a big produce fan, and for the size of the store, the produce section wasn't too bad.  They carry the typical common fruits and vegetables, and it all looked fairly fresh.  The prices weren't bad.  I was disappointed that they didn't carry more in the way of produce, but again, for the overall size of the place, not bad.Aside from the produce, there really wasn't anything at all I was interested in.  i don't drink Polish liquor, I don't like Polish food and therefore don't like the smell of Polish delis.  There were some Polish girls working there who were kind of ditsy.  I bought some lettuce and strawberries and the girl at the register had some trouble with my debit card.  She transformed the simple procedure of swiping a card into a battle.  She totally ignored me when I offered my advice.  When the transaction was complete, I smiled and said thank you to her, and she was just staring into space the other way across the store like someone had just asked her to recite the Preamble to the Constitution.  Kinda creepy.Anyway, yeah, I might stop here for emergency vegetables, but likely, that won't ever happen.

0.description: This store is great. They carry a huge juice collection, a fresh lunch meat and cheese deli, and they offer ready to eat food at great prices. Their chicken breast with cheese and chives is amazing. Their Krokiety are soooo good and their dumplings to die for. I most of all love how inexpensive everything is. They also offer basic items like sugar, flour, pasta, soda, breads, alcohol and they have a produce section. They also offer some raw meats, but not a huge selection. This place is great for a quick trip to pick up a few items.

3.description: Okay...no longer "one of my favorite neighborhood dive bars"I am removing "strong drinks" from the check list.Went there last night, and I actually think they are "watered down." So did the rest of the people we were with.It seems a little dirtier...or maybe it's just I was a little more sober-er. Still cheap drinks.Still love the pool table.Still very close...now just okay.

1.description: Great place to hang out! Wonderful atmosphere! Great bartenders! The drinks are amazing!!!

2.description: What I want to know is why any white sux fan in their right mind is going to expect a bar to be overly friendly to sux fans on the far Northwest side of Chicago.A Cub fan on the southside in a bar raising a stink about stupid crap like mentioned in another review would get their ass kicked.I have seen plenty worse bars than this on the southside and *gasp* Elmhurst.Anyway, this place is good to watch a Bears game or shoot some pool and drink beers.You could get a lot worse.

5.description: If life turns out to be just one long game of tag, Gladstone is my glue.

0.description: Great local bar! Cheap drinks, that aren't watered down, and they always have daily beer specials. It's hard pressed to find a better local bar in the area. Would strongly recommend coming in on a Friday or Saturday to have a good time.Just don't mind the music, we get a little carried away.

4.description: This bar was pretty lame. The bartender only talked with one group of people for the night and the beer on tap tasted awful. The place is small and not really worth a time of visit and they have a total bias for Cubs over the other baseball team in town. The television sets were so tiny and from some other era

29.description: Look past the fact that this place is a bit of a dump...ok, it's a real dump and if you go in you'll likely see a buch of dudes with mullets hangin' out there BUT listen up...the food is really, really yummy.The Italian Beef sandwiches are absolutely delish.  Fine cut beef engulfed in what tastes like homeade gravy...that's right no Vienna Beef factory italian beef here...Duke's does their own baby!! They give you a more than ample portion and you even get some homemade hot gardiniere if you ask.  Each time I've visited they make up a fresh batch of fries when you order and they come out piping hot.  Don't miss Fridays...the Italian Beef special with fries is a good deal.  The chocolate shakes are awfully tasty too.  Staff is helpful and friendly.Give this joint a try...you won't be sorry.

42.description: My absolute favorite Italian beef sandwich on the north side.  It's shaved super thin, and it practically melts in your mouth.  The winning combination for me is dipped with mozzarella and sweet peppers.  Also, I'm a huge fan of their fries.  I don't know what the secret is, but they're delicious, even though they're frozen.The hot dog special is great, although the hot dogs are pretty standard.  The lack of a poppy seed bun really hurts.

23.description: This place is the other hot dog spot that i would go eat.. The price of the hot dogs are the best with fries included and a drink... and you can get cheese on the side to dip your fries in... After 10 years coming back to Chicago, this is one of the must go to places for a hot dog.. and will be a must go place when i come back in the winter... Yeah the place looks old but the taste has no reflection on how the place looks like..

8.description: The one star is because of the cheese fries.  The gyro's are horrible.  If you need to cook the gyros after you've cut them off the spit, its usually not a good sign.Sorry, but you've lost me.

31.description: Went to duke's today based on reviews I found on yelp and might I say I'm glad I did.It's a hole in the wall dive hot dog spot, but their hot dogs were on point.  And their fries although not freshly cut were still delicious!The chili they use on their chili dogs was spicy and had kick which was a welcomed surprise!  I will definitely be heading back to Dukes whenever I get that chili dog crave =)Their italian beef was nothing to scoff at either, the guys at Dukes really really hooked it up with the beef!  YUMMY!

34.description: Forget hotdogs... delicious as they are, you know what's best at Dukes?The double file fish sandwich... oooh. No one mentioned but it's awesome; crisp, cheap, always fresh (as in freshly fried flash-frozen little brick that turns to heaven once golden brown) and giant. Prepare for a sore jaw trying to eat that thing. Well worth my 10 minute drive. Another thing we love there, is Italian beef and beef combo, as well as grilled chicken with cheese.Fries are good too, not too salty. Pop by if it's on your way; yes, it's a little grease spoon but the food rocks.Nice service too. The lady at the checkout laughs at me as I pace around, waiting for my fish sandwich and the joy I display once the order arrives. Nothing more to wish for when it comes to fast food.

16.description: The beef is just plain horrible here.  Hot dogs, well, it's pretty hard to do that wrong.  Maybe the beefs were better in the past but today it was horrible.  Beef was stringy and tasteless. Grab a hot dog, stay away from the beef.

13.description: Had a beef there for the first time in a long while.  I hate to say it, but something has changed.  It just ain't the same.  Not terrible, but not great either.  Too bad... :o(

11.description: Is it healthy? There are options to get sliced tomatoes and diced onions with your hotdog, but otherwise, no. Does it ooze sophistication? There are working burners and a cash register, but otherwise, no.Is it eco friendly? I do not know nor do I care.Are their hotdogs made from pigs that were killed humanely? Who gives a f_ck. cause I sure don't.It's blue-collar; it's greasy. The only fashion displayed is on weekends where hot rods & muscle cars hangout before cruising the streets. The food is comforting. The ladies at the order counter are nice. When the weather permits, you can sit outside enjoying your food, with cars parked around you. It's the atmosphere. It's Americana, and that's why it is good.

39.description: I live just a few blocks from this place, and the burgers are huge and tasty and they are by far the best french fries I have had in the city of Chicago.If you want healthy, avoid it, but if want tasty....grab it!

37.description: THE BEST FRENCH FRIES, MILK SHAKES, AND ITALIAN BEEFS EVER!!!!!!!Me and my family have been going hear for years and its a hit. Very fast on their service. Its gotten a little high on their pricing but totally worth it.YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPOINTED IF YOUR LOOK FOR SOME GREAT FAST FOOD!!!!P.S. THIS RESTURANT SHOULD BE OPEN LATE, HOPE IT HAPPENS IN THE FUTURE

0.description: My favorite part was how they are always nice and i have always gone there since I was  three.By the way people who give them bellow three stars are idiots do not listen to those people try it I  promise it will be a good expirence.

38.description: Double dogs are the shiz! Make sure you stop by here when going to the Edgebrook Golf Course.Tell the guys behind the counter Justin sent ya!** - you will get a dirty look, and they will charge you extra for your fries

27.description: Great place for a Beef if you are up in this area. I have been going to Duke's for 10 years or so. I try and limit my Beef sammich intake, but when the mood hits Duke's hits the spot.

32.description: I don't know why this place gets good reviews at all. I went there twice and the food was bad both times. I thought I could give it another shot after the first time I went there. I ordered a rib sandwich. The patty was dry and not heated all the way and the fries were terrible. I don't know if it was just me but they were TERRIBLE and rock hard. Second time I went there I ordered a sandwich. It was still BAD!  Don't think I'd ever go there again.

44.description: Another 3 star dog stand (and that's ok).  2 dogs and a fry for 2.99. You cannot do better unless you hit Frank n' Fries on Golf, but who wants to drive all that way.  Only complaint as a hot dog purist is the bun. No poppy seed.  Beyond that I love this place, good service, good food. Fries are bagged not hand cut, but for a local place, I would probably pick this over toot's if it was during the day.  Outstanding value.

24.description: Great food for cheap price! You can not go wrong with the 3.99 hot dog special that comes with 2 dogs and an order of fries.  Beefs are great, double cheeseburger is amazing and the philly cheesesteak is pretty good too.

7.description: Had the looks of those divy hot dog stand secret gems (Gene & Judes etc) but the food did not deliver. The beef sandwiche was like dog food. I mean it was more like a paste or bottom of the pan sludge. I could not pick off a piece that resembled a shred of anything for the life of me.The 2 hot dog special with fries was better. Fixins were all there and the fries were plentiful and crispy.Place was kinda dead and the girl at the counter could have been more upbeat.

40.description: I grew up only a few blocks from Duke's. It is one of those quintessential Chicago hole in the wall dives. Nothing beats an Italian beef sandwich with peppers and a bag of fries (the kind that soak the bag). Also, half the fun of going is just walking in, standing there, and smelling those delicious sandwiches cooking. You can't beat the prices either. Everything is pretty cheap and you get a lot of food for your buck.

30.description: Some of the best Italian beef around.  The size of the sandwich is enormous!!  The Italian Sausage is superb.  The place could use a major makeover though.  Then it would be so crowded we'd never get in!!  Fastest fast food place on the planet.  Unless you ordered a burger.  Good job Duke's.

1.description: my friend and I went there last night. It was his first time back there in 15 years.  I go there maybe once every couple months.We both worked there in early eighties during high school. It was called Gia's back then. Food was ok I had beef they give you good amount .he had hot dogs we ate there and reminiscing about the good old days of working there, stories about Ted the owner, john the night mgr, Guz ,rob. .. One thing we noticed it  wasn't clean.. Ceiling tiles and some of the floor tiles looked like the same ones that were there when we worked there

9.description: For a hometown girl who lives a land devoid of beef sandwiches this trip home meant a culinary tour my my childhood comfort foods. For the first time in a decade I had a proper dog, pizza with good it. sausage & cut correctly for once, Dunkin Donuts and a beef. I was a Roma's devotee...sad to find it closed down. So I drove over here and I was not disappointed! The fries tasted perfectly salted and crisped, the beef was just as I imagined it would. I felt actual joy eating this thing. (I have never been into peppers on my dipped beef but by the next morning I felt compelled to polish off the leftover half of my southern-husband's pepper-filled beef sandwich because the craving in me was so great.) The perfect blend of Chgo. style fast food deliciousness.

26.description: My friend has lived near by here for a long time and I have never been. The other day my sister stated that she would like a hamburger and since it was nearby I popped in to grab us some lunch. Eating with my eyes first I ordered two cheese burgers a hot dog (with everything, no ketcup) and two small orders of fries. Fries were good need more salt but were my favorite part of the meal. The hot dog was ok. My sister polished off her burger and when I started to eat mine it just had the funkiest taste. I couldn't figure it out and just had to stop eating it. Maybe it was something they cooked on the grill before or one of the veggies went bad but what ever it was it was gross. Since I don't eat that much fast food I'm going to pass on this place from now on. The people behind the counter were very nice and patient since I had to stare at the menu for 5 minutes before I ordered exactly what I knew I wanted before I came in. Still I think I'll check out one of the other local joints.  Oh and there out door seating is right next to their dumpsters so I would think twice about there outdoor seating.

25.description: Boy, is this place a dive. A dive with really good Italian Beef sandwiches. Fries are good, too. But it looks like a dump from the outside, and the inside looks like an old, neglected 1960's rec basement rec room.  But I have to say, the Eye-talian beef with sweet peppers was tender, juicy and full of flavor, I made pretty fast work of that. While they have hot dog and cheeseburger combo's with fries and drink for $4.99, the Italian Beef combo runs closer to $9.00. And that's really the reason for the three stars. Just doesn't LOOK like a place to pay that much. So if they put even a little more effort into the appearance of the place, I'd be at 4 o 4.5, 'cause the food is so good. And can't beat the funny-talking, friendly counter guys. They were a treat. Head on down to Duke's for Eye-sore Eye-talian.
