12.description: What can I say it's a good dive-y type spot, it ain't no fancy place I tell you that but the food was okay.  The guys working a bit on the "hood-take-no-attitude-but-sweet-tyep of men". I complained that my meal didn't come with a pop and well let's say my charming ways got me a free drink lol :) ha Overall too many locals constantly running in and out makes it for a lil less than pleasant dining experience but the food made up for it. Next time I may just order to- go ! lol

21.description: The place is dirty.  my beef sandwich just didn't smell and taste right.  and my stomach bothered me after I ate.  I won't eat here again.

17.description: I lived 2 blocks away from here and seldom ever went here unless I was desperate for food, did not want to cook and did not want to drive someplace.  The beef is ok - nothing special. Fries were usualkly decent. Hot dogs - skinny, small tasteless. HOWEVER prices are very reasonable anf the staff was always friendly. Never tried the shakes or anything else.  I have since moved but am back in the neighborhood a couple times a month but I would never make it a stop for food now.

10.description: Duke's is still pretty dumpy looking, but the Italian Beef and fries are still good. Christopher tried the gyros and was underwhelmed. He said it was way too greasy. When he picked the sandwich up, stuff just ran off it. Gross. Stick with the beef sandwiches and the hot dogs and you will do alright.

5.description: This used to be the place to get a great beef sandwich. It's been a few months since we got one from here so we decided to get a beef today. For $8.25 I got a beef sandwich and cheese fries.... I got home and was VERY UNHAPPY.The sandwich shrunk and was NASTY. I usually save half for later but this sandwich is so small now theres no saving for later. I guess after remodeling they raised the prices and shrunk the portions. I WILL NOT GO BACK EVER

35.description: DROOOOOOOOL!The hot dogs are perfectly Chicago, the fries crispy and light, and the gardiniera fresh (the owners make it themselves!!!!  AWESOME) We got a spread of food since there were so many of us and everything I ate was DELISH.  My fave parts of Duke's were the sides:  I couldn't stop eating the cheese fries with gardiniera on top, fried mushrooms, and the best corn dogs I've ever had (mini corn dogs are considered a side when you're inhaling a huge italian beef!)  The cornmeal on the mini corn dogs are mildly sweet and cooked to perfection, pairing so well with that steamy hot dog in the middle.  Who knew I could say so much about a corn dog?!?!This place has great food at such a great value.  I love you, Duke's

19.description: I recommend you try the beef.  Yeah you, I'm talking to you!  The sausage had too much of something in it and ruined it.  The girl working the counter had a very bad attitude. Maybe she was having a bad day.  I can't stand people with bad attitudes.  I still gave this place 4 stars because I rate on the quality and flavor of the food.    Some of my reviews on yelp are harsh, but that's only because if I ran a restaurant, it would be done right.  I also can't stand dealing with businesses that are in the service business, but don't provide quality service to their customers.  I want you to buy my product, my strategy is to piss you off.My Top 5 Italian Beef Sandwiches:1.  Mr. Beef & Pizza (Harlem and Irving)2.  Mr. Beef (Orleans Street in downtown Chicago, not related to Mr. Beef & Pizza from my knowledge.) 3.  Johnnie's (Elmwood park, Arlington Heights)  4.  Portillo's (Great flavor, but I don't like the aftertaste, something about it, has slowly been making it's way down my list)5.  Al's Beef (It keeps growing on me every time I have it.  I did not like it the first time because it was different.)Consolation Prizes:  These places all have above average beef sandwiches in my mind.  I will list as many as I can remember.  Duke's Beef, Coach's Corner, Bub's Subs, Chickie's, Joe Boston's, Frannie's, Pop's Italian Beef and Sausage, Tony's Deli, Nana's, Nottoli's, Tommy's, Buona, Capt'n Nemo's, Joseph's Elegante, Augustino's, Rammy's, Teddy Fabs, Gina's, Mr. A's.  There are definitely places I have missed and places I have not been to yet.  My list always changes, depending on if these places and my taste buds are having good days or bad days.

28.description: Small place.  Really basic layout.  But the food here rocks.Have eaten a skirt steak sandwhich here (my fav) and italian beef and a couple of hot dogs (not all in one sitting obviously).  The employess are friendly and the owner (i believe) remembers me and starts on my order, which is nice. :))  But she is professional to everyone that comes in.Easy access as it is on the corner with a decent sized lot.  The place is small though, but you know wh at they say about those small places.. :)I notice one of the pics shows outdoor seating...but I have never seen it.  (shrug)  However they are open until 10 if you have this urge for a quasi late night binge.

3.description: As old and beat up looking as this place is... I like it, the food is good and the service is good as well. This definitely is the neighborhood dive but it's a good dive and worth checking out. Limited seating, burgers, hotdogs, gyros, Italian beef, pizza puffs... Basically all the food you'd expect at your neighborhood fast food place!

33.description: The place is the dive of all dives. I felt downright dirty as soon as I entered the dungeon-like atmosphere. The hot dog wasn't bad but the fries were bland. I don't get wy this place gets good reviews.

43.description: Duke's is a typical Chicago neighborhood hot dog joint. They do, however, have EXCELLENT beef sandwiches. I think the fries are so-so, but my brother-in-law swears they are the best even though they are not fresh-cut. The decor is nothing special, but the employees are friendly. It's a great value for what you get and worth checking out for sure.

2.description: I came to this place looking for a new lunch place as it is near my house. When I was ordering, the lady taking my order was so serious, I felt that I was doing something wrong. She seemed completely unfriendly and it made me never want to go back again as I felt so unwelcome. The food is nothing special. The fries seem like they were frozen. The burger I ordered was not even tasty. Never coming here again. Food is bland and service (from that lady) was terrible. A smile would be nice.

18.description: The place is dirty.  my beef sandwich just didn't smell and taste right.  and my stomach bothered me after I ate.  I won't eat here again.

41.description: This place is so random. They have this huge parking lot but then you walk in and it has like 4 tables to sit. I went during lunch and it was a little crowded... seems like a lot of locals come here for lunch break. The food is typical of a Chicago burger/hot dog joint. They have a great deal... I think it was 2 hot dogs and fries for 4 bucks. One item on their menu that seems to be overlooked is their cheesy italian beef. They load you up with lots of beef, peppers, and the cheese.... oh the cheese. I've had my share of italian beef in chicago and this is up there. I'd probably come here more often if it was closer.

4.description: I enjoyed the burger, fries and gyro...I tried the Italian beef but I don't see what all the fuss is about. Polish sausage and dogs are alright. I can see myself going back here

6.description: Gone here many times the food is always good and consistent love the italian  beefs good price too

22.description: I recommend you try the beef.  Yeah you, I'm talking to you!  The sausage had too much of something in it and ruined it.  The girl working the counter had a very bad attitude. Maybe she was having a bad day.  I can't stand people with bad attitudes.  I still gave this place 4 stars because I rate on the quality and flavor of the food.    Some of my reviews on yelp are harsh, but that's only because if I ran a restaurant, it would be done right.  I also can't stand dealing with businesses that are in the service business, but don't provide quality service to their customers.  I want you to buy my product, my strategy is to piss you off.My Top 5 Italian Beef Sandwiches:1.  Mr. Beef & Pizza (Harlem and Irving)2.  Mr. Beef (Orleans Street in downtown Chicago, not related to Mr. Beef & Pizza from my knowledge.) 3.  Johnnie's (Elmwood park, Arlington Heights)  4.  Portillo's (Great flavor, but I don't like the aftertaste, something about it, has slowly been making it's way down my list)5.  Al's Beef (It keeps growing on me every time I have it.  I did not like it the first time because it was different.)Consolation Prizes:  These places all have above average beef sandwiches in my mind.  I will list as many as I can remember.  Duke's Beef, Coach's Corner, Bub's Subs, Chickie's, Joe Boston's, Frannie's, Pop's Italian Beef and Sausage, Tony's Deli, Nana's, Nottoli's, Tommy's, Buona, Capt'n Nemo's, Joseph's Elegante, Augustino's, Rammy's, Teddy Fabs, Gina's, Mr. A's.  There are definitely places I have missed and places I have not been to yet.  My list always changes, depending on if these places and my taste buds are having good days or bad days.

15.description: I would give this place zero stars if I could, how do you mess up a Vienna beef hot dog, not that hard well guess this place figured it out. How do you serve a cold hot dog on a stale bun. I have also never been served a hot dog for $2.50 and not get any fries. Let's not even talk about the cheeseburger it was inedible and I ended up throwing it away, I wouldn't even feed it to my dogs.I would rather someone tell me the place is closed than to serve me what they served me.

20.description: What can I say it's a good dive-y type spot, it ain't no fancy place I tell you that but the food was okay.  The guys working a bit on the "hood-take-no-attitude-but-sweet-tyep of men". I complained that my meal didn't come with a pop and well let's say my charming ways got me a free drink lol :) ha Overall too many locals constantly running in and out makes it for a lil less than pleasant dining experience but the food made up for it. Next time I may just order to- go ! lol

36.description: I moved to Jefferson Park about 13 years ago. The day I moved into my house, my cousin Ellyn asked me if there was some good hot dog places around here. In a desperate attempt to look cool I almost instantaneously said yes. So we set forth on our journey not knowing where the hell I was going. I was a smart kid, I knew I was bound to hit something. There it was, Dukes, in all its glory. Much to my demise, my cousin did not have any money but that didn't stop us from having a feast. That's when I fell in love with Dukes. The decor of the place isn't what makes it good. Its the fantastic, perfectly cooked, made to order food. The 2 hot dog with french fries special is my advice for you to try. They sell all sorts of awesome things too. To name a few: Italian beef (dry for me), Italian sausage's and flavorful), The combo (beef and sausage...get it dry), Milkshakes, Chicken pita, fried mushrooms, and polish sausages. So since we have established about the food. The service is awesome. Cathy (Chick at the counter) has watched us all grow up and is super friendly. Every time I go without my dad, they almost never forget to send me with a "hello from Dukes". The food is cooked fast and with all the fixings you want. They have a parking lot, accessible from public transport(85a, or 85 going towards the terminal). Located right on the corner on Central and Elston, how convenient! I agree with the others... I wish Dukes was open later. Its worth going a little earlier for though. I am a life long customer. I tip my hat to you Dukes.

14.description: The woman at the register is a straight up bitch. She is very rude and ignorant. I don't ever want to go back because of the way I was treated the last couple times I was there. F this place.

3.description: The 2 clerks were more interested in talking about another co-worker loudly, more than tending to me as I stood at the register..once I finally got the attention of one of them she moved slowly back to the register and chomped/snapped on her gum while she rung me up..she didnt say sorry for ignoring me or actually anything at all..avoid if possible

1.description: Since they franchised this store they brought in the most rude, and unknowledgeable people that doesn't know how to operate cash registers. They don't like accepting manufacturers coupons and oh whatever you do please watch when they ring up promotional items because they apparently don't input the promos in the till and when you point that out to them they put up a big argument with you. Also one time I wanted to use two different debit cards to make a purchase so I asked them to charge one card 12 dollars and the remaining balance on the other and the guy did not know how to do that. They have a young lady who is very rude to customers. She tried scanning this customer's cigarette coupon and it wouldn't scan so she rudely says to her this is not coupon and walks away. I knew it was a coupon because I used to get cigarette coupons in the mail when I smoked. So if your not in the mood to get into a guaranteed argument don't go here. I've filed 2 complaints to their corporate offices.

2.description: Just heard they are going to franchise the store!!!!!! :-( all the great people that worked here will be gone :-(

0.description: My rating is taking into account what 7-11 is, it's a convenience grocery store. Yes the prices are higher than the big guys but it's the convenience of having a store close by to pick up things here and there. If you have a lot of shopping to do go to the big grocery stores, if you want a drink or lottery ticket stop by here. The store is open all night, parking at peak times is scarce and the staff had always been polite with me. Sure the staff talk to each other but they don't ignore you.

56.description: Good beer selections, and a decent plate of Bangers & Mash (just try it, go ahead). Some of the other customers seemed a little snooty, taking away from the "neighborhood bar" vibe, but overall a good experience.

29.description: Ok so this was our second time here and in my previous review, I loved this place.  So because of this I raved about this place to some friends and suggested to come here on another Friday night...this time was a big mistake! There was six of us. The place wasn't busy at all and it was around 5:30pm. We all placed our dinner orders. Two of us ordered fish and chips while the others ordered a variety of things.  Needless to say, about 20 minutes had passed and one order of fish and chips came out to one of my friends and that was it! He had finished his whole meal and the rest of us had still not be served!! It was terrible. I was so embarassed!  I recommended this place and the service this time around was terrible!  Another twenty minutes went by, we finally received our food except one of my friends, she was still waiting on a burger!!! Seriously?!?!  Anyways, not sure if I'll be back now. I think I'm suppose to be getting a free giftcard for my bday, if I get it, I'll return, if not oh well!

42.description: Thanks to YELP, this was a great find! Nice looking Irish pub with and authentic Irish bartender. This place is a must on Thursday nights! 35 cent wings and 1.75$ Miller Lite pints make for and unbelievably small tab and these wings will not disappoint! Food takes quite a while to get out, but it's completely worth the wait. Friendly service, great prices, and awesome wings; what more could you want of a pub?

23.description: I have not had a bad time here. It provides a great atmosphere where you can still hear and talk to the people you are with while enjoying food and drink. I am not giving four stars for a personal, moody ready, but a legit one.

47.description: AWESOME! The wings here are great! They are a really good size and on Thursdays they are only .25 cents! The bartenders are always friendly and the atmosphere is very laid back. Definitely a traditional pub that you might find in Ireland. The people who own this place also have a few other bars around Chicago which I have yet to try. But, this location is definitely worth trying!

8.description: Didn't expect the food to be so good for a bar, but was pleasantly surprised! They have a fun and lively bar scene too. Can get pretty rowdy some nights with the lads.

31.description: One of my favorite Irish Pubs in the area. The ladies there are super friendly and pretty laid back. They love to suggest beers and specials if they see you browsing the menu. They do have pretty decent specials on the weeknight. (25 cent wings, 1.50 mini burgers). Only downside is that they dont rotate much; its pretty much the same specials for the past 3 years. If you sign up for their birthday club, they send you a gift certificate every year on your special day!All in all, worth checking out! They have a really good St Pattys Day celebration every year around this time!

34.description: Ate 20 wings here one night because they were on special, but it effed my stomach up big time. Take that for what It's worth...

16.description: Been here with coworkers  on several  occasions  for lunch  the atmosphere  is very friendly  and cozy the food is so delicious  a real laid back pub feel with really damn good food  great fresh cut potato  chips mmmmm

13.description: Friendly atmosphere and good food. Ordered one of the food specials for Thursday: $.50 wings. Drink special is also $2 Miller and Coors light Wings were a good size and the BBQ had a good taste. Its worth checking out for the wing special. The waitress was also working the bar but she never forgot about us and always made her rounds to fill drinks and check on our table.

11.description: This is the go-to when the boyf and I are hungry and can't decide where to go, lunch or dinner. Staff is always nice. And I love how they put a splash of Guinness and Magners in their Bloody Mary. Gotta try it :)

39.description: This is a good pub.  It's the kind of place where you won't just see guys sitting at the bar.  You will see families eating here with their children.  I always think that is a good sign.I like this place for the wings.  Monday's are half price appetizer day and that's when I try to good because the sampler plate is only about $10.  And $10 for a huge plate of wings, cheese sticks, onion rings and fried mushrooms is a good deal on a normal day so when it's half price it's a crazy deal.  This place isn't a dump like the other reviewer said it was.  If think is pretty clean when you look at other places.  The steak sandwich is good and so are most things.  I just had a buffalo burger that was a little overcooked.  I asked for medium rare knowing that buffalo can be a little tough.  But that was one time and usually the food is real good.  The beer selection is very good too.

37.description: Anne's da woman-- always friendly and cheerful.Cheap wings.

0.description: A friend recommended the Friday night AYCE fish and chips a few months ago. It became a relevant recommendation this past Friday when fish and chips was all I could think about. We arrived at 6:50pm and there were 2 big parties ahead of our party of 5. I was getting nervous we wouldn't get a table for a while. Turns out, we were sat within about 15 minutes. We cane with our 5 and 2 year old boys. I was kinda nervous about taking my kids to, you know, a bar. But it's surprisingly family friendly and they have a kids menu. The staff is super friendly and fast! Our waitress even complimented our kids on their behavior and handed out suckers. So nice! We had cheese curds to start and they were amazing. My kids had a cup of cheddar broccoli soup and a plate of bangers and fries. They loved everything. My husband and I had the fish and chips and it was amazing. The fish pieces are a nice size and fried well. Our friend had a burger and said it was very good. We might end up Friday night regulars!

38.description: Great pub. Never had anything on the menu I didn't like. I will devour the Santa Fe burger in a matter of minutes and can eat many, many mini-cheeseburgers.Servers are always nice. Always have good monthly beer specials, too (except when it was Stella). And you gotta love it on a warm evening when that front window is open. Love Vaughan's!

51.description: Went here couple times for the wings special when they have it. 25 cents a wing, you really can't beat that for how big they are and tastey. They have around 5 flavors. All good! The draft beer selection they had was also good. The service was great and the bartender lady was really nice. I'm definitely a fan of this place and will be coming back .

27.description: On Fridays they have all you can eat Fish and chips and the portions are big. Went there with a friend and we had 2 pitchers of sangria meh not the best but i guess that is why it was 10 dollars. It has a dive bar feel to it, it seems only locals go here.

32.description: We love to go to Vaughn's, it is a favorite of ours.  The food has never disappointed  whether it's burgers,fish, chicken or salads, it's always great and consistent   Friendly wait staff and owner......just always a good experience!

54.description: I went there and had a pub burger.  I thought the burger was very good and the fries were the large (steak cut) fries I like.  I didn't care for the coleslaw it didn't seem sweet enough.

48.description: I really liked this place. The atmosphere is beautiful, with TONS of natural woodwork. They have a good selection of beer, and it is reasonably priced. In addition to the beautiful atmosphere, and great beer, we had teriyaki chicken wings that were great. They were a little greasy, but what are wings without a little grease? By the way, I should mention that we ordered them after 11:30PM. So, that's also a plus, that you can order that late.They have a jukebox so you can play your favorite tunes, and great music was played there that night.Thanks Vaughan's Pub & Grill!

44.description: I like Vaughn's. I can walk there from my house, which is good. They have food and drink specials every night of the week, my husband and I can eat and drink a few beers for around $30 bucks for both of us. It's rather cute inside and the staff is nice. For the complainers I ask "have you been to some of the other bars in this neighborhood? Old man bars with six inces of cigarette butts to walk through to get in the door, then you walk in and are greated by a handfull of old drunks whose butts have fused to the stools they have been sitting in for the past 20 years! There's about 5 bars i this area that I would actually go to and Vaughn's is one of them. It's not fancy, but cute, the service is good, the mini cheeseburgers are yummy, and it's reasonably priced.

24.description: 4 dollar bombs!!! Awwwwwwwesome and the nachos were loaded and delicious :))) and the bartender was great...I'd def go back!

7.description: It's a lively neighborhood bar with good food, good drink and 60 cent jumbo wings on Thursdays.  The staff are courteous, friendly and professional. Definitely a good bar to put on your list. Did I mention there's lots of parking?!

49.description: Great place that reminded me of some of the pubs I visited in small towns in Ireland. It's very European in that the bartender typically waits on all the tables too, so if you're looking to binge drink, this may not be the place for you if you're planning to consume lotsa adult beverages in a small amount of time. It's well off the beaten path, unless the beaten path is Northwest Highway, in which case you've lucked out because it's right there. Lots of street parking, though you should not attempt to drive home after enjoying a bit of the craic, and the transit access isn't so hot.If time is not of the essence, and you're looking for a cozy, comfortable place to relax with good friends that also offers some might fine specials, well, you have arrived.

40.description: HOLY FRIED CHICKEN! you would think all fried chicken is some what the same right? well holy shit balls.. this chicken is GREAT.. Crispy, juicy and NOT greasy, There Salmon Appitizer is pretty awesome also.. Guiness on Tap and cool looking old irish pup.   the boths are a little tight, but oh well.. Lose some weight. blah blah blah try the FRIED chicken... Enjoy bitches

53.description: Driven by Vaughan's Pub for years and finally had a chance to stop in. I was really surprised at how comfortable it was inside. The decor is just great with some great Irish details. The bartenders were great and talkative and, wow, I love the accent! I haven't had a chance to get through the whole menu yet but the food I've had so far has been very good.  Nice place to sit back,  enjoy a beer and have a nice meal.

30.description: Great burger! All you can eat fish and chips on Friday night are delicious! Real Irish staff! Real soccer!  Beer selection contains craft beer choices, although they aren't frequently rotated.

46.description: F#@* me...what a dump.Should have turned around when I walked in and my shoes stuck to the floor.  However, with deep regret, I did not.We ordered appetizers and after a quick 40 minutes, they arrived.  Nothing was clean.  I still can't believe I actually ate there.Not again.

1.description: When moving to a new apartment you need three things within walking distance: a grocer, a liquor store, and a good bar. Simply put: Vaughan's is one of the best neighborhood bars on the NW side. Super friendly staff, good food, great atmosphere.I've come here for weekend lunches with kids and solo to watch the Cubs lose. In both cases it fits the bill. And unlike a lot of trendier "neighborhood bars" this one isn't overpriced.Important tip: Get the rewards card and fill out the online surveys whenever you can.

55.description: Great pub burgers and a nice selection (although I wish they had fewer imports and more American micros).  On Tuesday the pub burger is half off.  Great atmosphere and friendly staff.

9.description: Great little bar with an awesome beer selection to go with it.Easy street parking, which is so rare these days (at least in the city).And lastly, I can't say enough about the bar food.  Yum!  We will definitely be back.

26.description: I love this place the Magners is always fresh and crisp, and there is always a bit of craic going on with the regulars.

25.description: I love this place! This is my neighborhood bar. Never disappoints. The staff, food, and drink specials are great!

12.description: Finally started coming back to Vaughan's after a few years - not for any particular reason, just not as close as other options, and was only here for drinks once.  But this will no doubt become a clutch place to visit!Perfect variety of beer on tap.  Awesome food.  Fabulous staff. What more do you need?Wish we hadn't waited so long to come back!

21.description: The Best Neighbor Bar and Restaurant in the neighborhood. The prices are fair and the portions are large. Anna is always friendly. The other waitresses are also good. I have told all of the people that I see to come and have a drink and eat some food. They have never been disappointed.

17.description: All you can eat Fish Fry for 10 bucks is what brought us to Vaughn's.  HUGE pieces of fish that came with fries and peas.  Very delicious.We also ordered the mac & cheese which was unique and tasty.  They used Merck's or something because it was great.The only reason we are giving them 4 instead of 5 stars is because of the length of time we were there.  The place was very crowded, we sat right away, but waited for for an extensively long time once we ordered.  Granted, it seemed as if there was only one server on the floor and she was hustling, so maybe someone called off?

10.description: Best chicken wings ever!!!!! Curry, Teriyaki, Buffalo, BBQ flavors are all awesome! Love Anne and Diane who work there!

5.description: Best fish fry I've had in awhile! I broke get my 7 year old, she ordered off the kids menu and we got the all you can eat fish fry. Food was quick and service was fantastic! Very attentive! We will definitely be regulars on Fridays now!

3.description: I am really disappointed in the service I received today when I came in for lunch with my son. Food was good, was a little slow but hot, and tasty. The girl waiting on us though was horrible. She had 3 tables including our and 2 gentleman at the bar, and it took her forever to check on us, then it took 15 to 20 minutes to get our check. I could have understood if she was busy but she just chatted with the 2 gentleman at the bar the entire time we were there or she was on her phone. Won't be back on Fridays anymore.

35.description: We had a nice all-ages family meal at Vaughan's.  We were lucky to get the front booth at the open window on a beautiful spring evening.  The food was solid pub fare with decent veggie options.  I really enjoyed the traditional pub decor as well - beautiful dark varnished wood, subway tile and tiffany-style lamps.  It was just so cozy, which made for a feel good, relaxed time.  Nice, attentive waitstaff as well.  I particularly liked that it seemed very open.  You know how in some pubs you feel awkward when you come in the door if you are not a regular?  I did not get that vibe at all.Easy street parking, accessible by CTA bus 68 or Metra Gladstone Park.

19.description: Old peoples home from what I could tell between the crowd and the lights on so high, no ambiance at all not helped by the sound from college games on that no one was watching...I am.sports fan but there are times when the jukebox is clearly the better option. Also don't like how they crowd you in at the bar to get an extra tables in the place, even if they got rid of one of them you could back and forth to the bathroom with having to squeeze by a pole.

28.description: Love the fifty cent wings on thursday. Wash them down with a Guiness and you will be set. Great family atmosphere early in the day.

45.description: The Stanger, in all his mightiness was drag racin' the Stange down NW Hwy lookin' for some strange last Thursday when something caught my eye.  $1.75 Miller Lite pints!!!!!!!!!!!!  The Stanger did a quick doughnut in the middle of the street to show all the babes watching how the Stanger rolls, and did a completely bad ass maneuver into a parking spot.  There was no time to waste on the simple things, the Stanger needed one of those cheap Miller Lites quick.Q:  Stanger, how did it go?  Was it cool?  Stanger, bro, you haven't said anything about the bar?A:  Hold on dorks, Stanger is slammin' a cold one.Stanger got his brew from the frumpy lass behind the bar.  She could have been quicker about it, but she was busy yelling at the kitchen staff.  Stanger loves the drama.  Stanger thought about watchin a little tv while enjoying his brew, but Stanger forgot his glasses and could barely see the picture on the 19" tvs.  Not sure if they got a deal on computer monitors but why they have such small TVs is beyond the Stangers realm of comprehension, but then again, so is basic math.  As Stanger has eluded to in the past, Stanger is a meat eatin' son of a gun, had some wings and a steak sandwich...both of which were prepared to perfection by the incompetents in the kitchen.  Steak fries were solid.  This place would be a solid 5 star if there was more talent, the Stanger is still hunting for some strange.  Also, there was an Irish newspaper on the bar, The Stanger only reads and drives American!!!!!!!! Then Again....$1.75 Miller Lites on Thursday.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Grrrrrrrrrrrrr!!!!!!!!!!!!

33.description: They have the best hot chicken wings!! They're on special on Thursday there 50 cents each!!

43.description: I really, really, really like Vaughn's. I work nearby but it is still far enough that if i go, nobody will know me there. Sometimes you want that. Many times at lunch, my buddy and I would go in and grab a seat at the bar. The Irish bartender, which i believe is the owner maybe, tells us tales of her childhood and then proceeds to watch sports and talk shit. It's great. Vaughn's has a dive-bar feel but with a great pub environment. You feel like you are in a pub in Ireland and everyone is down to earth, laid back and cool to talk to and be around. They also have great specials, a great menu and great beers on tap. So why 4 stars instead of 5? Well, they used to serve "Matilda" on tap and they removed it recently. It's hard to find Matilda anywhere so it was a huge plus for me. They still have great things to substitute but Matilda from the bottle just isn't the same.

2.description: I like this place. I'll probably be a regular. It is a little small and some things are better than others on the menu, but the staff is great. There is a great and warm ambiance that is appreciated.

18.description: Great burger! All you can eat fish and chips on Friday night are delicious! Real Irish staff! Real soccer!  Beer selection contains craft beer choices, although they aren't frequently rotated.

41.description: Great place for steak sandwich.

52.description: Nice neighborhood bar, good selection of beer. Small but fun.

50.description: Consistent fish n chips here. It's what I get pretty much every time I go here now that I don't eat chicken or meat and they're always good. I don't appreciate other Irish pubs saying fish and chips and then serving rock hard fish with shoestring fries. Chips are what we Americans know as steak fries...not shoestring!They set the bar pretty high here in regards to their Irish fare, I've yet to try a place that comes close.They also have great specials throughout the week, weekends too. Take the NW metra line and get off at Gladstone Park or Norwood Park for a wee taste of Ireland!

4.description: What a cute little neighborhood bar! It's definitely an Irish bar. I had the luck of going there for the first time the weekend before St. Patty's day for their Friday All you Can Eat Fish and Chips special. It was a Friday during Lent, and I was on a search for a fish fry in Illinois. I settled on fish and chips.With the St. Patrick's Day festivities going on, it was difficult to determine if the lack of a seat at 7pm on a Friday was due to the popularity of the bar, or the fact that many people were out celebrating the holiday early. In any case, we took the one open table they had upstairs (yes, there's an upstairs), ordered up a couple beers immediately, and put in for our fish and chips.It was loud. Really, really loud. Again, I think it was part of the festivities related to St. Patrick's Day weekend, but Irish music was blaring through the speakers, one of which was located directly above us. Plus, pretty frequently during the evening, there were two lovely Irish dancers dancing up and down the aisles of the restaurant. It was fun to watch, but I think that Irish dancers wouldn't be an everyday occurrence.Due to the place being packed, service was a bit slow, but nothing that was unexpected given the amount of people there. We weren't checked on very frequently, but we were asked if we wanted another round of both beer an fish. I declined, but my husband enjoyed more.As for the food itself, it was good, especially given how much food they must have been preparing. The fish was cooked well in that it was nice and crispy on the outside, but not overdone on the inside. The fries were OK, I mean I ate them all, so that says something.I'll be trying this place again soon. Hey, dinner out for 2 (all you can eat) for a total of $26 before tax and tip? I'm there!

6.description: We've been here before, but this may be the last.  Wife and I came here for dinner and there were maybe 5-6 tables of customers.  One waitress and one bartender took care of the floor.  Bartender came over and took our drink order which arrived very fast.  Afterwards.....ZZZZZ. Ten minutes after we got our drinks, I had to flag her down to place our order.  I ordered the fish fry and wife got mac & cheese.  45 minutes later, our food came.  I think the thing that aggravated me most was a few of the tables who ordered the fish fry special came out at the same time.  It was like the kitchen waited for more orders of the fish fry before they started to cook it.  Fish was good, but not worth a 45 minute wait.  Wife's mac & cheese was very basic and she said the broccoli was not fresh but frozen.  We also had the impression that if you weren't a regular, the staff didn't take the time to take care of you.

22.description: This place just does things right.  Great beer selection, good food and competent staffers.  Leave your ego at the door when you come here.  Patrons tend to chat with each other at Vaughan's.

15.description: Nice place to hang out with friends.  Food is good and week day specials are even better.

20.description: Great little bar with an awesome beer selection to go with it.Easy street parking, which is so rare these days (at least in the city).And lastly, I can't say enough about the bar food.  Yum!  We will definitely be back.

36.description: Always good. Love their chips. Love the decor. A definite family spot that will not disappoint.

14.description: This place must be blessed by leprechauns, because when you walk in, the stress melts away and, with a sigh and a pint, all if your troubles are behind you.The bar is very comfortable, and the crowd is legit, good folks out with family or friends for a bite to eat and some refreshment.  I have been here a few  times and have the same strange observation - no tools and no "wo-ho" girls.  Somehow the chest bumpin sloppy drunk 20somethings dont' drink here - thank heaven.  The food is way above average pub-grub.  They serve Irish Breakfast around the clock.  The specials are great- especially the bacon & cabbage on Mondays, but come early on Mondays because the seem to run out a lot.

3.description: I absolutely love this free museum.  I had never heard of Ed Paschke until seeing a clip on WTTW's Chicago Tonight when the museum opened in 2014.  It is in a renovated storefront at the intersection of Milwaukee and Higgins which in a former life was the home of a stationary store.The museum is bright and airy and staffed by a friendly young lady who will answer all of your questions about Ed.  They have a number of his works on display and are currently displaying many photos from Steve Schapiro.  Steve Schapiro is the photographer who took hundreds of photos of rockers from the 1960's & 1970's. Assembled here are iconic photos of Lou Reed and the Velvet Underground, Nico, Andy Warhol and David Bowie.For me the main attraction is Mr. Paschke's art.  His use of color and dimension literally brings a smile to my face.  For those suffering from seasonal affective disorder, a trip to the Ed Paschke Art Center would be a great form of therapy.  They have painstakingly recreated his Howard Ave studio and my wife and I enjoyed pouring over all of the interesting notes and tidbits.  It gave us some insight into the man.  If you visit, be sure to allow time to view the half hour documentary on Ed to gain even greater insight to his art.  It runs on an endless loop and you don't have to worry about walking in during the middle.  It's compiled in such a way that you won't lose context if you don't start at the very beginning.  It really is a must see.I'm really glad that we made the trip to visit this museum.  It really is a treasure in the Jefferson Park neighborhood.  Although it's free, please consider helping them out by making a donation.

1.description: I miss Ed.  He was...IS...a wonderful artist and a great person.  A wonderful, kind man who always gave 110% to Chicago's art community and helped people.  Luckily, you can visit here and enjoy his work.  The Center holds events, talks and other artist exhibitions.

2.description: Lovely little FREE museum dedicated to Chicago artist Paschke.  Nice way to spend an hour.

9.description: So excited to have this gorgeous addition to Jefferson Park. As Ed Paschke said, "They either love it or hate it, but rarely are they indifferent to it." Personally, I love it!!! They are currently starting their email list so that they will be able to let those interested know about their future programming. Call them if you don't have time to visit so they add your name to what will surely be an amazing place in Jefferson Park!

10.description: #1 best thing about the Ed Paschke Art Center is it's free and near public transportation (like the DePaul Art Museum on Fullerton). Alas, I attended DePaul not Northwestern, so I missed out on getting to "help" Paschke paint. (He sometimes allowed students to paint on his works-in-progress in his studio, explaining it would keep him from falling back on his trademark "gestures.") Been a fan since the '80s and always hoped to own one of his paintings. Well, because the Center allows non-flash photography, I can check that off my bucket list. The lower level area featuring other artists' shows is small but then, so is the building. #2 best thing: it's quiet and you can stand in front of your favorite painting forever without being disturbed. Metered parking on west side of Higgins, neighborhood parking is tight. If you use the bike racks at the Jefferson Park Field House, use a U-lock or your bike may be stolen.

4.description: The museum is on an inconspicuous location just off Milwaukee Avenue. Large picture windows open up the space filled with out of the ordinary artwork. Actually, I wouldn't know how to define his style of work. Regardless, the number of works may not be large. But, they are impressive and are memorable.I understand the museum has art classes as well, with some of the student works on the lower level. His studio is worth a peek to see part of the creative process of this artist.I'm told they have revolving works of art that change every few months. A new photography exhibit from a local artist is to be displayed in the coming weeks or months. That will be interesting.A much-needed cultural improvement to the area. Stop by and take a look.

6.description: Coming from the Portage Park area and a student of art, I had some idea of Ed Paschke. After coming to the center I feel like I personally knew the man, this place is great. If you're looking for something interesting and free to do check out the art center and be amazed by the man's work!

12.description: Great to have some fine art in Jeff Park.  This is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood.  The museum has many of Paschke's works on exhibit and offers a recreation of his studio to view.  The admission is free and his work is interesting, check it out.

5.description: I highly recommend spending time in this gallery.  I came her today with a meet-up and was  impressed from start to finish.  I wasn't familiar with Ed Paschke but the gallery tour was guided by a knowledgeable staff person.  I really came to admire the artist, his work, and his imprint on art in Chicago and beyond.   His art is bold, brave and colorful.  If you need a jolt during our gray Chicago winter, this is a good place to spend some time.  There was also an exhibit of Steve Schapiro's photography.  On display were some iconic photos of Lou Reed, David Bowie, Andy Warhol, Nico, and The Velvet Underground.  We also saw a video of Paschke which gave insight into his creative process, his personality and his sense of humor.  His art studio was located in Rogers Park and if you know the area you'll recognize the intersection near the Howard Red Line stop in the film.  His recreated studio is also on display in the gallery.  The gallery's location might be a little out of the way, but if you're heading out west via Lawrence you'll also get to see a couple colorful murals honoring Paschke in the viaduct under the train tracks.  A great jolt of color on a gray day, indeed.

13.description: He is one of my favorite artist and was sad when he died.  I attended the Art Center opening weekend and enjoyed seeing all the artwork in one location!!  Looking forward to going back to see the mural on the side of the building (it was covered opening weekend by a tent.)

11.description: If you love art this is a must see.  The center is a hidden gem of Jefferson Park.  There is a great Paschke mural on both sides of the Lawrence Avenue underpass.  The re-creation of Paschke's 2004 art studio is amazing ... almost every piece is original.  A small screening room is designed for viewing an informative video.  It's definitely a place to revisit for upcoming events.

8.description: What a gem!  Right on public transit for downtown folks. An easy drive for west siders. Ed Paschkes art is beautifully displayed in this modest sized gallery. Just right for kids with limited art patience, visitors wanting something uniquely Chicago...  The recreation of his studio is fascinating. And it's FREE!  But please donate. You get a cool pin!

0.description: This is a must stop on any art tour of Chicago. The small museum is dedicated to the work of Ed Paschke. Here you will find his art in many media, his studio recreated from Howard St. (neat!), and videos about him, plus a small gallery given over to another artist for a temporary show. I liked my time here, first because the space is sharp and clean, the art is well-presented, and admission is free--and second, because the exhibit raises more questions about Paschke's work than it answers. There is very little in the way of wall texts to explain his art or give it context, and the half-hour video presentation is raw footage, not a full-fledged finely honed exploration of its subject. Ed does say in the video that he didn't enjoy his classes at the Art Institute in the 1960's; he preferred the Pop Art appearing in New York at the time. Still, I was left to wonder what artists influenced or inspired him, what stages his career passed through, where his wild use of color stems from, why bullets and guns are so prominent a motif in his work, and many other things. In the video there were images of black and white posters for his shows that looked terrific; I would have enjoyed seeing a selection of posters in the gallery. You will need 30 minutes for the exhibit and another 30 mins. if you watch the video. Engaging with this important Chicago artist is worthwhile on every level.

7.description: Wonderful art. Adds creative soul to the neighborhood. Kind staff and curators. Well-lit and inviting. Accessible to the public and curious passers-by.  Rotating exhibit. Great hours, too.

3.description: I Spoke to a very nice lady on the phone this morning about ordering a funeral spray for a wake that was from 4-9 in the evening. She made a few suggestions & wrote something pretty in the card too. I've never sent flowers to a wake so I was pretty oblivious to the process. She asked me what color flowers I liked &  I let her do her magic . The arrangement was big & beautiful & the price was good too. I'm so thankful because the family loved it. Great job!!!!!

1.description: I live just around the corner from Wall's and really wanted to be able to support this local small business when I purchased my wedding flowers.  I was disappointed by what I encountered.  The woman there tried to help and was nice enough, but told me that the flowers I wanted didn't exist (Mango Calla Lilies that were actually orange and not brown).  I wouldn't have minded if she told me their store didn't have access to what I wanted, but she told me the flowers I described didn't exist and weren't available anywhere in the fall.  I almost ended up getting flowers I didn't really like based on her advice.  Luckily, my now husband convinced me to go elsewhere, where we found exactly what we had been looking for.But the real reason I'm leaving such a low rating is this: I specifically made my husband walk away so I could show her the picture of my dress on my phone (she wanted to see the style so she could match the flowers to it).  A few minutes after he came back she said, "So, I think these roses would look nice with your champagne strapless dress."  Who does that???  We sort of laughed it off, but it really bothered me that she had ruined part of the surprise of the dress.  If weddings are a big part of your business, you should know better.

0.description: Wedding, bridal shower, funeral, baby shower. They have done everything for me and always go above and beyond. Everything is always perfect

2.description: Been here a few times. Pleasant staff that help customers with whatever they need. Wonderful flower shop!

5.description: Very cute shop inside, hence the second star. I ordered a medium sized corsage for my sisters baby shower. It cost $16.50 plus tax. When I picked it up, it was made from 5 of the tiniest sweetheart roses and a wee bit of baby's breath. I felt like I got ripped off.  If that's the medium, how small is the small? I won't be back.

6.description: I was amazed at how much the arrangement looked like the picture on the website.  They did an awesome job.

7.description: I had to call in a last minute sympathy arrangement for a Sunday wake. The ladies at Wall's went out of their way to take care of me. Thank you very much!

8.description: They have beeen around for many years in Jefferson Park.  They have a beautiful window display that is changed fairly often.  They deliver throughout the city and suburbs and service weddings, funerals and special events.

9.description: This place is great and has been a staple for my friends through all the prom and homecoming seasons. The staff is very creative and the prices are cheaper than most other flower shops.

10.description: I have had very good luck with this florist in the past.  I wanted to do something special for a special person and had no idea how to get started.  I went in, told them my budget, who it was for, and what message I was trying to send.  30 minutes later I had an overly impressive bouquet for my money.  High value place.  I did not feel overcharged.  Not sure where they fair on weddings etc etc but for my one off it was just perfect.

4.description: I used Wall's Flowers for my wedding.  It was a double-edged sword.  I was under the impression that the florist is supposed to make sure that you were happy with the flowers before taking off.  They came to the church, placed my unity candle on the altar and left the rest of the flowers in the back pew and took off.  No Phone Call, no note. Just dumped them there for me to find.  Then I discovered that my flower girl's petals were not there, 12 minutes before the ceremony.  They promptly delivered them but I was still angry.  Booking them for a wedding  is an ok idea but make sure you be clear to them that they should wait for your approval before they leave.,  Also, watch out how many locations they deliver to.  Each stop is $25, that's why I had them delivered all to the church.

0.description: Just bought my new glasses from them and am very pleased with the product and service.  Knowledgeable personnel and a good selection of frames.

3.description: Great diner food and soups - the kids love it., always served hot, great coffee and friendly service!!

1.description: Went there once and wasn't impressed.  Prices are high for such a low end type place.  Might be a neighborhood place but there are much better places in the neighborhood. A real letdown.

2.description: Yet another disappointing "1 star" in my list of reviews. This place is no longer called Kenny's Grill, but is called something else. However, I did check this place out before the name change...err...management change possibly? Although I didn't have any high expectations coming into this place, I just didn't realize that the restaurant can sink any lower than necessary on the food pole.There was a roach crawling on my seat. The last time I saw a roach was when I was a kid. Capital G R O S S.I wish Yelp had the option of giving negative stars.

5.description: Well this place used to be Kennys but was sold,They did improve the interior with a slight remodel and a couple of TVs but other than that the food and prices are not the same.I think they are trying to hard,they have too much on the menu everything from burritos to pizza.I also hear they plan on having outdoor dining this summer,great for people who want to eat next to a grease dumpster.I would avoid this place,I have and its 2 blocks from my house.

0.description: Good place for a sandwich and the outdoor seating is nice.  Also free wifi and open 24/7!

4.description: What a hole. Do you have any idea how hard one has to try to fuck up scrambled eggs and bacon?Really greasy grimy restaurant, and that has nothing to do with the food. I'm fairly positive that the tables and servers are greasier than anything on the menu. Too bad the waitresses personalities aren't half as slick. Look, I know you're a waitress at a shitty 24 hours diner, but either start affect positive change in your own life or wipe that scowl off your face.The only thing saving this place from a one-star rating is the occasional brilliance of the steak and egg combo.

28.description: I purchase the Groupon. I was really surprise when I walk in very small place no items in a case like I was thinking with cakes cupcakes to purchase. There was 1 case there but had models of cakes & pictures. Very strange set up for business that offer Groupon. Groupon business are on there to drive up there business you go in there with groupon then end up with "add ons" purchases. And hopefully find a treasure of place.Although the lady working there was very nice & cupcakes were ok. There no way I pay more than 1 for 1.I will give this 3 as average since the cupcakes were average. I guess I'm really surprise this place was on Groupon for how it is.

1.description: Moved to portage park a couple years ago and finally found this gem of a baker/artist.I placed an order for a pink marvel avengers cake for 17 year old teen daughter.This cake was moist and flavorful.My teen loved the fondant Captain America,Thor,Iron Man faces that had been created for the occasion and they really looked 3D.There were edible stars as well.We were delighted with its playful quality and great raspberry filling taste.We will be ordering again very soon.

9.description: Picked up cupcakes yesterday and shared them with friends. I really wanted to love these cupcakes because service was just excellent! And we had a groupon for a great deal on these already cheap little guys.They lack the frills and fancifulness that some of the other cupcake places have but who cares when the cupcakes are tasty, right? Well I had one okay cupcake... The Turtle cupcake with nuts in the cake batter, yum.  My friends and I tried the Cookies & Cream, Red Velvet, the Chocolate, the Sundae and a Yellow Cake with Chocolate frosting that had a few Reese's on top. My friends definitely liked the red velvet because that was the only one that was devoured. All the rest were not even finished so they were just not a big hit with my friends. I concur. They were okay cupcakes but nothing great tasting, no amazing flavor combinations, nothing fantastic about these little guys. They were all basically the same with small differences like Reese's Pieces on top or just chocolate frosting on top.It pains me to say it, too, because the price is awesome on these! I think they are normally like $2.25 each or something. And the lady working there was just so friendly and nice. But sadly, the cupcakes just were not that great. :(

29.description: I've ordered several cakes from Beautiful Cakes and there have been nothing but raves about how great the cakes look and how yummy they are.  I buy birthday cakes for my sons (we've had Winnie the Pooh, Tigger, Lightning McQueen, and dinosaurs... my sons LOVED them all... this year we are going to with a Transformers theme) and I've also ordered for my husband's birthdays, anniversaries, etc... We've NEVER been disappointed with either the quality of the cakes nor with the service.  And to the other reviewer who commented about the store front... yes, it is not a fancy place. They did not spend much on the interior design of the store, but their cakes are probably just as good if not better than those from the high end stores.  Besides, what matters most?... how the store looks or the quality of their product?  Clearly they are spending most of their thought, time and money on their cakes.  So I'd recommend you give them a chance.

23.description: I bought 3 Groupons for Beautiful Cakes because they were in the neighborhood and I believe in supporting local businesses. I was unsure when I walked in since it's just a storefront that doesn't have a bakery feel. I'm disappointed in the cupcakes (I've tried each flavor). They are dense, small and not creative. I'm an advanced home-baker and have made more creative and more delicious cupcakes than what Beautiful Cakes offered. There is not much flavor to their cupcakes at all. When biting into one of the Red Velvet cupcakes, my husband found two chunks of eggshell. I will use my remaining Groupons just because I don't want them up go to waste. Hopefully this bakery will improve.

5.description: This is a great little bakery. I order a cake every year from this place. The same cake that was the top tier at our wedding years ago. It's still the same recipe and is still just as delicious as we remember!  (Carrot cake with cream cheese frosting filling in case you're all wondering!). Just remember they need 2 weeks lead time to accommodate requests like this.

31.description: Beautiful Cake-tasted great. Posted a pic on facebook of it and people asked where I got it they liked it so much

25.description: I ate three cupcakes in one week! My friends used their groupon and bought some over. Cupcakes were some the best I've ever had.

12.description: The staff was so rude. Either they are over worked or just seemed too good for new customers. She wasn't willing to answer any of my questions and once I made an appointment I never got the week before call to confirm. They obviously don't need any more revenue.

21.description: I discovered through Groupon that I had a cupcake place in my very own back yard!!  No need to travel to Lincoln Park anymore... woohoo!  I'll admit that I haven't tried anything other than the cupcakes so far, but they were soooooooo gooooooood.  They're a little smaller than the average Lincoln Park cupcake, but so tasty.  The cake is perfectly moist and the cake to frosting ratio is perfect.  I've been dying to go back, but am trying to have some restraint.

16.description: Nice little bakery. We found this place in the neighborhood about a year ago, and have been pleasantly surprised. We wanted cupcakes instead of a cake for a party, and ordered from here. They were pretty good, and the variety was decent too. The only complaint we had was the cupcakes were a bit small, but we priced them at others places and the larger ones are also more expensive. Because we enjoyed the cupcakes, we ended up getting my  oldest's birthday cake from there too. The cake was huge and tasty, and was very reasonably priced compared to other bakeries. We will be getting all the kids cakes from here from now on. Just love to give the small local shops shops the business too.

17.description: Because of the previous reviews about the carrot cake, I decided to order one for my friend's baby shower from here.It was probably one of the best carrot cakes I have ever had. I don't really like raisins in my carrot cake and they don't put any in theirs. It was extremely moist and the cream cheese frosting was perfect. The decorations were really cute as well. Everyone asked where I got the cake from. I really need to find an excuse to order the carrot cake again.When I went into order the carrot cake, I also picked up a few of the cupcakes which were extremely reasonably priced - $1.25 each. I tried the marble, vanilla, and turtle. The turtle cupcake is REALLY TASTY! The caramel drizzled on the top just makes the cupcake. I have another event coming up and I am definitely ordering cupcakes from here.

10.description: $2 cupcakes, yes please!  These babies are on the smaller side, and it's a no frills location, but there are plenty of choices, the woman is friendly, and c'mon, it's cupcakes!There isn't really much to look at because the cupcakes are kept in a refrigerator.  I tried the red velvet, sundae, pina colada, yellow, and oreo, and all were fresh and moist.  The flavors were there, but not overpowering.  Sundae was the funnest: it had strawberry, vanilla, and chocolate flavors, with whipped cream and a cherry on top.I'll be paying a visit to Jefferson Park again soon.  Thanks for the intro, Groupon!

11.description: WOW!  This little gem is such a great addition to our neighborhood!  I saw them on groupon and bought the deal without even realizing they were so close to me.  I bought a beautiful cake from them, lemon moose inside for the filing and lemon cake flavor with vanilla icing.  It was such a fancy cake and so BEAUTIFUL.  However what suprised me the most was the subtle yet delicious taste.  It was AMAZING!  The perfect cake taste and so elegantly decorated!  I highly reccomend this place.  We are in Jefferson Park Chicago and it is so close to us too.LOVE!

26.description: Figured I'd stop here for some cupcakes, since I bought a Groupon on an impulse buy.  I got an assortment of most of the flavors, the best probably being the red velvet (I'm glad I got 2 of those).  Other than that, the cupcakes were just okay.  I was hoping they would be awesome, but sadly not.  Oh well, but on the plus side the service was excellent and very friendly.  Plus the prices aren't too bad either.  Apart from the cupcakes, they also make custom decorated cakes.  Sadly I probably won't be back, well at least not for the cupcakes.

27.description: Picked up cupcakes yesterday and shared them with friends. I really wanted to love these cupcakes because service was just excellent! And we had a groupon for a great deal on these already cheap little guys.They lack the frills and fancifulness that some of the other cupcake places have but who cares when the cupcakes are tasty, right? Well I had one okay cupcake... The Turtle cupcake with nuts in the cake batter, yum.  My friends and I tried the Cookies & Cream, Red Velvet, the Chocolate, the Sundae and a Yellow Cake with Chocolate frosting that had a few Reese's on top. My friends definitely liked the red velvet because that was the only one that was devoured. All the rest were not even finished so they were just not a big hit with my friends. I concur. They were okay cupcakes but nothing great tasting, no amazing flavor combinations, nothing fantastic about these little guys. They were all basically the same with small differences like Reese's Pieces on top or just chocolate frosting on top.It pains me to say it, too, because the price is awesome on these! I think they are normally like $2.25 each or something. And the lady working there was just so friendly and nice. But sadly, the cupcakes just were not that great. :(

35.description: This place has good cakes... lots to choose from.. they have many books to look through.  The taste of the cake is good... I can't say that it's the best cake I've ever tasted.. but it's fairly good.  I guess it depends on what type of filling you have.  The strawberry with whip-cream filling is great, but we had the Jamaican rum and it was just okay..  They do awesome decorating though. I don't know if it's just me.. but I didn't get a good vibe from the owner.. she seemed pleasant, but kinda fake... Not my first place to go to when I have to buy cake.

8.description: I gave these guys another shot. I don't know what others are seeing, because i've had so much better. not flavorful, hardly unique, and nothing special. and they're open only 7 hrs a day. pfft. As before, the moment I walked in, the lady who worked there demanded how many i'm getting before i even made a single choice. pushy pushy. obviously doesn't want to increase sales. she'll pull a box out right away, like she just wants you gone. (P.S. the box is cheap.) will not hold cupcakes securely, and has scotch tape to keep it shut. - no pretty packaging- no name, so I wouldn't even recommend it as a birthday gift kind of token.I asked, "which is the best cupcake you can offer?"  Her response was, "well, let's see what we actually have."  Apparently, they don't bake all varieties every day. I'm still really opposed to the way you order. You don't see what you get. they're all kept in a refrigerator out of sight. You select off of a laminated list (I'm a germ-a-phobe. DIRTY!!!!!!), which again, is worse than an ice cream truck. No picture to entice, no idea what you're getting. and, she tapes it up in the box  on a hidden table before you can even see it. uhm. really?Result? I got a red velvet and a turtle. The cake is moderately moist, and semi-sweet. Good for those who can't tolerate over sweet. The cream cheese icing was like chomping on sugar (ick). And the turtle reminded me of little debbie brownies turned into a cupcake. kinda weird. check out my pics.i took a bite of each, and that was all it was worth. had my bf finish the rest. won't bother again.  i have updated pics

0.description: I've been so impressed with Irma's work and was completely blown away by my daughter's 2nd birthday cake.  It was beautiful and was the highlight of the party. All the parents were asking where we got the cake. This was the second time we used Beautiful Cakes and I'll be calling again soon for a friend's baby shower. The best part is that not only do the cakes look amazing but they taste fantastic as well!

20.description: I had a Groupon to Beautiful Cakes but had never been. The store front is actually pretty cute..similar to what others said, the fresh product was not sitting out so it did have sort of an out of business type of feel. However, the woman whom I presume to be the owner was very nice!They handed me a menu and I was able to pick 12 cupcakes (they didnt have a few that I wanted so i had to get doubles of some). She pulled the cupcakes out of a refrigerator which was a little odd, but they looked beautiful and she had a great carry-out container for them (see picture 9).We were having them for a birthday and they really did serve the purpose well. However, I do have to admit that I agree with other posters saying that they tasted like they were made from a box mix. For all of the delicious sounding flavors these were supposed to be, ultimately they just tasted like yellow cake with generic frosting and little decorations. Further, some of the cupcakes had whipped cream, which I did not care for.If you are in the neighborhood and don't have time to bake, these will do the trick. Living further downtown with lots of cupcake shops around, I will go elsewhere.

19.description: I purchase the Groupon. I was really surprise when I walk in very small place no items in a case like I was thinking with cakes cupcakes to purchase. There was 1 case there but had models of cakes & pictures. Very strange set up for business that offer Groupon. Groupon business are on there to drive up there business you go in there with groupon then end up with "add ons" purchases. And hopefully find a treasure of place.Although the lady working there was very nice & cupcakes were ok. There no way I pay more than 1 for 1.I will give this 3 as average since the cupcakes were average. I guess I'm really surprise this place was on Groupon for how it is.

33.description: The carrot cake was awesome! I bought a cake for my mother's birthday party. Yes, I could get one from Costco for less, but I wanted to impress her and her friends - and I did! The owner helped me design a really lovely cake and everyone oohed and aahed all evening about it. It was well worth the few extra dollars. I'm not a huge fan of carrot cake, but this one was so good. No nuts and raisins, just dense carrot specked goodness. Very moist and flavorful. My husband thought it was one of the best carrot cakes ever. I can't believe I haven't tried this place sooner!

2.description: How to rate.  Working with staff over the phone to scoop up a tray of cupcakes was easy.  Told them the styles I wanted and the quantity and they gave me a date to pick them up.  Their cupcakes are no frills and in comparison to any cupcake bakery they are as good as a product you might bake at home.  Check out pictures online of their cupcakes, they look great but taste is subjective.  Both the cake and the frosting are just components that seldom worked together.  There wasn't any harmony with flavor.  I would suggest these for an older crowd, for those watching their figure or trying to lose weight or those watching their sugar intake.  Like their name suggests, they are beautiful cakes but what about flavor or even.. um, sugar?

34.description: I just joined Yelp to write a review for Beautiful Cakes!  Please patronize this great neighborhood bakery. The person who answered the phone (owner?) was really nice and helpful. Remembered my exact cake order when my husband came to pick it up.  I used this bakery for my wedding cake 10 years ago, have ordered a couple of other cakes, and most recently got my birthday cake there. Although the ownership changed hands, the cakes are just as delicious as I remember.  The prices are very good considering the high quality of the cake ($31 for an 8" cake). I can't wait to order one for my 10th anniversary in April.

32.description: I have used Irma for several occasions, including my son's 1st birthday cake.  I took her a napkin and she was able to replicate exactly the monkey that was our theme.  Amazing!  AND the cake was delicious!  My older son took Oreo cupcakes to school to celebrate his birthday and I had parents calling me to inquire as to where I bougfht them. She is creative and cares about her clients.  Irma is very pleasant and will work with you to insure you get what you want.  I highly recommend Beautiful Cakes!!!

18.description: Really bare boned store in the middle of no where. I used the groupon for 1 dozen cupcakes, and they are just ok.

13.description: I had a Groupon to Beautiful Cakes but had never been. The store front is actually pretty cute..similar to what others said, the fresh product was not sitting out so it did have sort of an out of business type of feel. However, the woman whom I presume to be the owner was very nice!They handed me a menu and I was able to pick 12 cupcakes (they didnt have a few that I wanted so i had to get doubles of some). She pulled the cupcakes out of a refrigerator which was a little odd, but they looked beautiful and she had a great carry-out container for them (see picture 9).We were having them for a birthday and they really did serve the purpose well. However, I do have to admit that I agree with other posters saying that they tasted like they were made from a box mix. For all of the delicious sounding flavors these were supposed to be, ultimately they just tasted like yellow cake with generic frosting and little decorations. Further, some of the cupcakes had whipped cream, which I did not care for.If you are in the neighborhood and don't have time to bake, these will do the trick. Living further downtown with lots of cupcake shops around, I will go elsewhere.

4.description: Love Beautiful Cakes. I have been going to Irma for almost 4 years now. She has done my daughters cakes since her 1st birthday and I will be back this month for her 4th birthday party cake!  She also did my husbands 30th birthday cake as well!The cakes are very reasonably priced, I have never paid over $100 bucks for one of her cakes, they are huge, very easily have cake left over and plenty to give away at the end of the party!

24.description: I am in search of the best butter cream ever.....it wasn't here.  I test a bakery on standard flavors...vanilla cake with vanilla frosting and vanilla  cake with chocolate frosting. Since cakes are by special order only I got their cupcakes.  They looked great!  They had nice thick swirled frosting with little sprinkles but their taste was just standard.  The cake did not taste of butter and neither did the vanilla butter cream.  They reminded me of Jewel cupcakes.  The chocolate frosting was more fudge-like and not really good.  I don"t know if their actual cakes are better but cupcake wise I wont be back.

6.description: DELICIOUS! We recently got our daughters Quinceanera cake from here and it was DELICIOUS! It had the perfect flavor balance, and it was also beautiful! We were very happy with Beautiful cakes!

22.description: I used my Groupon and the cupcakes were great tasting but I might have a little trouble paying $2 a piece for them. However, there certainly are places charging more for cupcakes. As other reviews mentioned, they don't have a display case so make sure you call in your order ahead of time. I had a turtle and an oreo and both were excellent.

15.description: Eh..  The cupcakes are just  "OK". Their special order cakes look amazing. I ordered the variety cupcakes which were not bad but not awesome like I was expecting them to be. I've had some really good cupcakes and these were just a little blah for me. The ladies who work there are very nice and cordial. The cupcakes need some more work though.

7.description: Amazing. Irma worked fast magic with my last minute order. Cookies were so good the kids were fighting over the extras. What a perfect treat for our out of town hockey tournament.  I will not go anywhere else

36.description: This was the best wedding cake I've ever tasted and my sister was very pleased with the service.  It had amazing flavor, as though my grandmother lovingly made it from scratch in her kitchen.  What can I say....gorgeous to behold, Alexandra P. just about did a headstand waiting to get her little fingers on some of that thick frosting.This is the first time I've looked forward to having a slice from the top of the cake in a year.  Do we really have to wait for the one-year anniversary?  I think it should be one week.

30.description: Because of the previous reviews about the carrot cake, I decided to order one for my friend's baby shower from here.It was probably one of the best carrot cakes I have ever had. I don't really like raisins in my carrot cake and they don't put any in theirs. It was extremely moist and the cream cheese frosting was perfect. The decorations were really cute as well. Everyone asked where I got the cake from. I really need to find an excuse to order the carrot cake again.When I went into order the carrot cake, I also picked up a few of the cupcakes which were extremely reasonably priced - $1.25 each. I tried the marble, vanilla, and turtle. The turtle cupcake is REALLY TASTY! The caramel drizzled on the top just makes the cupcake. I have another event coming up and I am definitely ordering cupcakes from here.

3.description: We ordered a beautiful birch tree wedding cake from Beautiful Cakes for our January wedding in Chicago. The experience was awesome from start to finish! We had so much fun at the tasting, and the cakes and frostings were delicious. The cake itself was really unique and we got a lot of compliments. It tasted great, as well. We can't wait to eat our top layer for our first anniversary!

14.description: WOW!! Beautiful cakes has done it again! Initially I purchased a cake for my daughter's first birthday in March of this year for her Minnie Mouse party. I brought a Groupon for the cake and thought that the cake would just be mediocre, but I was pleasantly surprised at how good the cake was. Since tasting the cake in March, my mom has been asking for a birthday cake for herself. So this month, I brought her 50th birthday cake and the results were the same. Another great cake! As long as this bakery stays open, I will order every cake from them. Very happy customer!!!

0.description: walked in. asked if they can cut my hair. says "u? no"while they only had one customer sitting and other stuff was there.the place did not look like they should be choosing customers.bad business attitude.

58.description: This place has been around for years - even before I was born. The pizza is pretty good but the Italian subs are something else! It's a full-blown bar too with TVs and all. It's a nice spot to sit back and have a few beers with some friends. Noisy as hell though! There's also a convenience store too right next door - Foremost Liquor Center - every kind of alcohol you'd ever want...along with some munchies in the fridges!

56.description: Want a fancy dining area? Go someplace else. Want great pizza at a good price in a real blue collar setting? This is the right place for you. I've had the thin crust with sausage every time I've come and I left full afterwards. Great place for a big get-together with friends or co-workers since you have a large open dining area. Order a pitcher of Coke or whatever you like and have at it! This is what a Jefferson Park eatery should look like.

29.description: Been picking up pizzas from here for nearly 20 years. When the one pizza chef that has been there for ever works the pizza was really great. There is a new cook now, and when he is working the pizza is awful! The last 2 times we ordered it has been bad the last time we actually threw it out because it was nasty and  inedible. It was a pasty, really, really salty mess.When I called to order the pizza , the cook that answered the phone repeated back to me that I wanted it "pie cut" as  I was rather emphatic that I wanted the pizza "pie cut" as we really don't like a round pizza cut into squares. Simple request one would think that a pizza pie could be pie cut. See that  was me being emphatic!The pizza did not have the ingredients that I  ordered and was unbelievably NOT PIE CUT!  Based on recent quality issues I gave them back the pizza and asked for my money back which they did. They never apologized and lead me to believe that they really could care less.Sorry to say goodbye after all these years, will have to find a new pizza restaurant I guess.

42.description: Great homemade Italian fare is the reason that I go to Paterno's.  The "incredibles" are a gluttonous treat (beef, sausage, meatball or combo on garlic bread).  The pasta dishes are always "al-dente" and come with garlic bread.  The marinara and meat sauces are excellent.  The decor is dated, but the quality of the food makes up for it.

23.description: There is a dining room, but I've rarely seen anyone in there.Food is average 1970's take-out fare. Grease city. Characters galore after 10 pm. As in automatically harassing you at the jukebox. There could be 3 people in there, and two of them will have no qualms coming up to you if you dare put in $2 to override Deep Purple.If you're ok with cheap beer, people passed out on the bar at 12 am, and getting harassed by socially-awkward, bored regulars, then you may be comfortable here.

47.description: Paternos.. You get 2 stars for an EXCELLENT "Incredible Beef" Sandwich. Its one of the best Ive had.BUT...If it wasnt for that beef sandwich you would have ZERO stars. Everything else pretty much sucks. The pizza is semi OK.. but I would never go there for it.THE BIGGEST PROBLEM...The smoking law says that people have to be 15 feet away from the door.
