Well the smokers at Paternos, (and there are many seeing is tho its typically an old man hangout), they stand right IN FRONT of the door. When I see this.. I just drive away. I shouldnt have to walk through that. Someone needs to fix it.

8.description: Great old school place, with an awesome liquor store next door.  Get The Incredible Beef!  It's, um, incredible...

31.description: Have been here a few times (new in the area).  They have great pizza - my husband loves it as well.  I also had the chicken parm sandwich which was amazing, too.  The only downfall to Paterno's is... they don't deliver.

34.description: I tried some of their Pizza and it was very good! I will definitely be back with the family.

16.description: Delicious soups, decent sandwiches, plenty of choices. They also make their own pizza but I haven't tried it yet. They bake their own bread, too. Very nice people work here, and apparently there are lots of regulars. There's a large dimly lit bar area as well as another adjacent, better-lit but dingy dining area. (I think the food and the prices make up for it.) Lots of TV screens in both areas to keep from getting too bored with your tablemates, although it's mostly if not always sports events. I like the place but it's not the kind of place that will impress anyone for its ambiance. I think the soups are probably the most impressive. They had a sign outside (maybe it's still there) touting 14 soups... but that really means they have 14 recipes which they rotate. Usually there are 2-4 varieties on a given day. That being said, I've never had a soup there that wasn't fabulous.

13.description: There is a dining room, but I've rarely seen anyone in there.Food is average 1970's take-out fare. Grease city. Characters galore after 10 pm. As in automatically harassing you at the jukebox. There could be 3 people in there, and two of them will have no qualms coming up to you if you dare put in $2 to override Deep Purple.If you're ok with cheap beer, people passed out on the bar at 12 am, and getting harassed by socially-awkward, bored regulars, then you may be comfortable here.

11.description: Best beef stroganoff y'all eat in the city great bartenders Jojo is awesome. Lots of tvs.

39.description: Yep, was back here again with my man-friend last night and was pleased again. The bartender was a surprisingly young, good-natured guy and chili was quite tasty. Man-friend had the patty melt and while it slid down our throats with the grease, it was delicious and inexpensive. I do dream of this place having a better beer selection (6 taps with your standard domestics and not much else).  Also, there was this crazy-like "regular" guy at the end of the bar who spent a lot of time shouting and jesting with the other "regular" patrons. He wasn't too awful, just a lot of uninvited shouting across the bar.  Luckily, someone put money in the jukebox to drown him out, but he was kind of annoying, but I can't blame the bar. Also, 3 girls walked in and were whistled/catcalled at when they walked in, but they waved at the catcallers in a familiar way, so I suspect this was a routine thing between the catcallers and the catcalled.It is not perfect, it has flaws and character issues that need to be accepted, but I'm glad to have a place like this closeby.

37.description: I'm from Rogers Park. I just moved to northwest side even the I have family living there don't have a regular pizza place, but now I do. Paterno's is excellent great crust quality ingredients and cooked to perfection a little well done. Finally my northwest pizza place they have great sandwiches also

0.description: Really like Paterno's. They have a nice full menu. I recommend any of the sandwiches such as Eggplant etc. that they add cheese to, they call them Incredibles and are they good.    Anyway it is for the most part an old man's bar during the day and strange guys bar  later on in the night. Kurt the bartender is a total Jag no doubt about that so don't expect any coddling here just order your drink and don't worry about it! His son is no treat either if u see another younger, tatted up version of The old man complete with shitty attitude.  We go there on occasion and sit there quietly watching everyone and making fun of them it's almost like a freak show.  Like I said we enjoy the menu so you just have to be in the mood for this place.

38.description: Very chill place to pop tops in the Jeff Park area.  Also home to my 2nd favorite bartender in the Chi.  Nothing fancy, but the beers are cold, the prices are right, the food exceeds expectations, service is top-notch, and music is juke box.  If you're there and Bri is working, tip the man well and he'll take care of you right.Doesn't get the full five-star blessing because the regulars are whack-jobs and the P to V ratio is usually absurd.

51.description: I went to Paterno's for lunch yesterday, for the first time in years, and the food was much, much tastier than I had remembered it to be (score!). This is a great lunch spot, though given the age of the crowd (older) and set up (nice for groups but not exactly cozy... it looks like a good place for retired Dads to go) makes me unlikely to go there in the evening for drinks.(I had the eggplant sandwich and fries... yum!!! The bread was super soft and fresh.)

27.description: I'm kind of torn...On the one hand: they have a huge menu (I love love love variety), great pizza, ah-mazing Italian beef, and for the most part all around good food! Most of the people there are really nice, the food is out fast and you get to watch a bit of tv while waiting.But on the other: They don't deliver which can be a bummer and it seems every time I order over the phone my food gets screwed up. They will honor and try to fix the screw up but I don't want to have to drive back and forth after working all day. (and one time I heard one of the (cooks?) talking S#!T in the back ground when I called.So I'm starting to wonder if the good food out weighs the crappy service.....

32.description: CAme for lunch with a group.  We ordered a pizza which i think had the works on it.  And a salad.  Pretty good, pretty good.

54.description: The guys that answer the phone are often rude.  I've ordered from them several times and three of the four times I ordered the pizza was a little too burnt. I didn't notice until I got home and saw that they put cheese over the burnt parts so that it would be more difficult to notice. The last time I ordered pizza, there was an aftertaste that reminded me of fresh vomit. Never going again. You've been warned.

48.description: Finally Found A Pizza Place I Will Stick WithGreat pizza, and fried dough!!!

44.description: A definite on the neighborhood joint list.  I'd say to me this place has a special niche because as far as bars go.  This place has the best food in the area. It's neighborhood bar meets good neighborhood Italian restaurant.  Good pizza, good pasta dishes,  daily specials, soups, salads and more.  My favorites are the "incredible " sandwiches.  an "incredible"  includes garlic bread ,red sauce & mozzarella chesse baked in the pizza oven....yum...I love the incredible combo, beef and sausage.  Combine the good food with a solid neighborhood bar standing and you have a very good combination.. I like Paterno's a lot.

24.description: Three words: Incredible Beef Sandwich. Soooooo good. I live nowhere close to this place but will make the trip specifically for this sandwich. Juicy italian beef with melted mozzarella cheese crammed between two pieces of garlic bread. Top it with some hot giardiniera and well... I don't think I need to say anymore. You won't be disappointed.

7.description: When I walked in I felt like Eddie Murphy when he walked into the red-neck bar in the movie 48hrs. A bunch of good old boys were sitting at the bar and couldn't have made me feel less welcome.  I ordered a burger and it was dry and chewy. They use those cheap, frozen shoe string fries that I detest.  I also ordered a slice of sausage pizza and it was so salty that I couldn't finish it.  This place sucks @ss!!

49.description: went in and had the eggplant parmigian and two fish tacos.   Everything tasted fresh and there are tables to eat there.  very neighborhoodish but in a god way.

40.description: so the place is good, it has cheap beers and drinks, a good jukebox that you usually can just rock with whatever you want, though sometimes middle aged people are in there in the late afternoon wasted playing the hits of their teenage years, this is part of the entertainment of paterno's, also since it's right off the highway and at the really busy intersection of milwaukee/central/foster, a ton of weirdos wander in at random, this is good for laughs and sometimes fear but still awesome, there's a bunch of tvs for watching games and stuff, it can get busy and if you can't get a seat at the bar that's annoying but it's rarely an issue, and if it's busy it dies down by like 10 since the majority of patrons are older and need to get to bed, this one chill bro i know bartends here also, they sponsored our softball team i think, there are some regulars that may intimidate you such as a guy who has sworn off sleeves of any kind regardless of weather, i say check it out people it's cool

53.description: Just not all that good.  Doesn't have to be.  Most people come in this place to drink.  That's the priority.  Too many good places in the area to even bother with this place.

30.description: If you're from the NW side of Chicago and you've never seen or heard of Paterno's, then, well...then I guess you haven't heard seen or heard of Paterno's.  This prominent restaurant/bar at the intersection of Milwaukee and Central has been doing it for many many many years.  The usual crowd consists of neighborhood people - a lot of sports people, motorcycle people, older people smoking outside the front door, loud people, all that good stuff.  Italian beef is ok, the pizza is better.  Pizza in the neighbohood is abundant, and this is not my #1 place, but it is good.  They do not deliver.  I mean, they deliver in the sense that they provide good food, but they will not drive to your house and give it to you. Paterno's?  Pater-YES!

46.description: No Frills REAL Chicago atmosphere.  Amazing food.  Product is SOO good that it's addictive.

1.description: It's bar pizza, not a big fan of the thick crust style that they offer. The sauce and cheese were delicious though. I likely will stick to other local pizzerias but this place is defiantly worth a try if you want to go out and drink, THEN eat.Update:Dang it, I just read a review that they have extra thin crust. Okay I take it back. Maybe just maybe I'll try it again but this time it will be with beer!

55.description: Got a beef here, it was pretty good ( not chewy, the cheese worked, the garlic bread good but not very garlicky).However, I doubt I'm going back again since the person I was with just ran in quick and got a menu. Instantly, they were reeking of cigarette smoke smell. If I want that, in the process of getting something to eat-I prefer Korean BBQ smoke.Seems like your average neighborhood place.

9.description: Would be a lot better if there was not always the same creepy old drunk men hanging around inside and outside the place. Kinda ruins it for me.

26.description: beef was GREAT! pizza was pretty good, service fair

25.description: I catered an order for my block party. The beef and the sausage were good, the mostaccioli and the fried and baked chicken were just ok. I haven't had their pizza yet. When I placed the order over the phone I mentioned i had a 10% off coupon from their website. I forgot to bring the coupon and they wouldn't give me the discount, even though it was straight off their website, not a special coupon.

12.description: Used to go here at least once a week with my coworkers  but after realizing  that they charged  for every little thing like extra sauce  or extra salad dressing etc we stopped  going and there not really that reasonable  priced at all mixed in with the workers additudes we just avoid it now

21.description: I hate to have to drop a star, almost two.Let me explain the updated review. I went here for dinner and ordered the Incredible Beef with fries. I'll say the beef was great. The problem is Paterno's changed their fries.Oh Paterno's, why did you change the fries? The new fries are the crispy coated fries, which I can't stand. I don't like them enough, that I will limit my orders and go elsewhere.I really like the other food I've had here at Paterno's. I will not be ordering something with fries, which is unfortunate, I really like the Incredible Beef!

17.description: Great family dining, their menu has a variety of selections. I would recommend trying out their Italian beef with extra juice and the pizza is fantastic. For catering definitely the lasagna. Great customer service. The people are very friendly and welcoming.

10.description: Nice inside, the cashier was ok alittle spirited when I was inquisitive about pricing and portion sizes.  A little too pricey, but this place is usually bustling with customers.  I came here on a recommendation from a friend.  Looks like a nice place to hang out.  Pool tables inside as well.  Private parking shared with Foremost liquors.  They are doing construction so be wary about getting into the lot.

5.description: Best pizza on the NW side! Ask for the extra thin crust. They have great apps, salads and sandwiches too. The bar is a little like that scene from Mos Eisley Cantina in Star Wars....but carry out is the way to go!

3.description: Our new favorite "night in" is to go to Paterno's and hang out in their frequently empty dining area off the bar. We can go and play cards or games or watch something on TV with plenty of room to stretch our legs. The food's solid and the drinks don't cost too much.

35.description: Great incredible beef! Good pizza, but very pricey!

19.description: I'm kind of torn...On the one hand: they have a huge menu (I love love love variety), great pizza, ah-mazing Italian beef, and for the most part all around good food! Most of the people there are really nice, the food is out fast and you get to watch a bit of tv while waiting.But on the other: They don't deliver which can be a bummer and it seems every time I order over the phone my food gets screwed up. They will honor and try to fix the screw up but I don't want to have to drive back and forth after working all day. (and one time I heard one of the (cooks?) talking S#!T in the back ground when I called.So I'm starting to wonder if the good food out weighs the crappy service.....

28.description: Place is real divey but the pizza is AWESSSSSOOOOMEEE!granted it was a bit higher than what we usually pay for pizza but it was worth every penny. Only down side is i dont think they deliver. Maybe thats good or Id be 500lbs

45.description: If we're eating thin crust in Jefferson Park area, this is where we get our pizza from.  They use fresh ingredients and they have figured out how to cook a good pie.  Their other food is also pretty tasty.  I'm a big fan of the Steak Italiano and the wife loves to get the veggie sandwich.  I'd definitely recommend this place and the only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because they don't deliver.

33.description: Paterno's will surprise you.  You walk in and figure just another neighborhood bar.  But wait, what's this extensive menu I see??  All these sandwiches with "Incredible" as a preface?  Yup, the sandwiches really ARE that good.  The Incredibel Beef has been my standby for as long as I can remember.  Juicy beef on garlic Italian bread with mozzarella cheese...Mmmmmm.  Last night I broke from tradition and saw Portabella Cheeseburger on the dry-erase board.  Sounded interesting so I gave it a try thinking I would get a mushroom with a slice of American or cheddar cheese.  Oh no bucko!  This baby came out with sauteed spinach, blue cheese on an onion roll.  I've had burgers at restaurants for twice the price that couldn't touch this Vegetarian Bad Boy.  Added a basket of fries and a couple of Stiegl drafts and I was feeling good.If you go, always check the dry-erase board for the specials as they are always changing.  The pizza is very solid as well.The vibe is always friendly and they have a few good beers on tap like Sam Adams, Guiness, Stiegl (a rare find), and a couple of Leinie's options.

43.description: I have NEVER encountered such a rude person as the OLD MAN at the bar.  I guess he was bothered by my basic questions, What do you have on draft?  Do sandwiches include fries?  What type of fries do you have? After he gave me a SMART MOUTH reply - He realized I was upset; he then  offered to comp the beer.  I said NO THANKS and walked out.   Sad, because I just moved in the neighborhood.  Earlier in the week I had ordered carry-out and I thought their  pizza was extremely salty.  NEVER again will I give such an establishment my $$$.

2.description: Eggplant parm sandwich is heaven. Kurt the bartender (owners son-in-law) needs counseling. May not return because of him.

18.description: I hate to have to drop a star, almost two.Let me explain the updated review. I went here for dinner and ordered the Incredible Beef with fries. I'll say the beef was great. The problem is Paterno's changed their fries.Oh Paterno's, why did you change the fries? The new fries are the crispy coated fries, which I can't stand. I don't like them enough, that I will limit my orders and go elsewhere.I really like the other food I've had here at Paterno's. I will not be ordering something with fries, which is unfortunate, I really like the Incredible Beef!

41.description: 5 Star for sure on the pizza best in the neighborhood and I have tried them all.  Great crust do not skimp on the ingredients never had a bad pizza there in my life.  I have only had the pizza and wings both are very good and well priced.  Wish I still lived in the neighborhood but dont be fooled by the outside of the place the cook some good stuff in the kitchen.

52.description: Ok I am not the typical eat in diner at Paterno's but I don't care and neither do most of the old men sitting around the bar watching what ever sports game is on.  I came here with a friend and seeing how I always need to eat I gave the menu a go.  The food here is pretty dam good!  I was shocked everything taste fresh and homemade.  The spaghetti and meatballs are delisious as are most of the pasta dishes and the pizza is pretty good to.  My friend typically enjoys the sandwhiches.Overall the food is great and I never feel like I'm getting a weird stare most of them are so friendly they are happy to start a conversation with you.  The decor is so very old, so you'll need to either get over that or get your food to go.Also they give out a free slice of pizza during half time when you come in to see the Bears games!

50.description: Great dive bar spaghetti and pizza. They have the absolute freshest BUD on draft and prices are pretty reasonable. These guys have been cooking thin crust pizza for ever and season with lots of cheese and spices! Def a local favorite! Parking in the lot can be a little pain in the ass though. Better parking across the street.

4.description: My buddy recommended Paterno's for their Italian beef, explaining how they use garlic bread and melt cheese on top (called an incredible on the menu). I usually request provolone on my beef anyway, so this made ordering easier.They did not disappoint. I got about 8 of 'em for around $55, which is a good price. Everyone was very pleased. I can't speak on the pizza, but if you're looking for a different take on a traditional Italian beef sandwich, definitely come here. I recommend the Incredible Beef, with hot peppers on it, and au jus on the side for dipping.

6.description: Been going here for years. The food is quality, fresh,tasty and made to order. From the Tuna salad to the pizza and everything in between.We love our pizza cracker thin,and slighty well done. The pizza chef Romero nails it everytime. The other guy Salso does now too. We do order it that way tho. Otherwise it would be thicker. Not bad, just not our preference. Angela,the young lady whom tends to be the one at the window taking order, is consistently friendly and very efficient. When we have forgotten our coupon ( you can find the coupon in the TV Facts guide,I pick mine up at the wallgreens there on Milwaukee ave) steps up and providing we met the minimum requirements she applies it for us. I truly appreciate that ,for it is good business and helps keep us coming back! you can have the best food with the worst service and we will not spend any money with you.This is not the case here.There is a woman JoJo whom is one of the family members,she makes all the specialties like the green pepper and egg sandwich on Sundays and the meatloaf and even chop suey! She is a fantastic cook. She also bar tends with her husband. They are both wonderful, welcoming, and very friendly. Always greets you with pleasantries. We have also hung out a bit there to have a few night caps. It is a older crowd with many regulars. most are very friendly and accepting .It tends to be a sports bar and therefore the jukebox is on a limited schedule. Also they will not allow for it to be turned on until 7pm to accomadaite some of the regulars whom do not like the jukebox on. I have mixed reviews on that pratice. But it isn't a deal breaker for us. This isn't your cookie cutter place. It is family owned and has been around for generations.It is a safe place with seemingly very little drama. No high spirited ,misbehaving, unruly patron's. We truly enjoy that fact.There is a pool table and a large back room with tables. A nice spot to have a beer and a family dinner (early hours 3-8). Gets packed on weekends!We have been there while families with children are doing just that. It can get a bit annoying when the parents are not monitoring their children, and the children are attempting to play pool and run into the bar area.Lets face it, this is not Chuckie Cheese! Control your kids people, not everyone thinks they are as cute as you do! All in all a great place for food, song (after 7 of course) take out and a good meeting spot. Would recommend it for homecooked food,fun &camaraderie.

22.description: last night I had paterno's cheese burger  thinking with the variety of great  Italian food that they serve I was curious about how they treat an American Icon of food . It was delicious .It 's amazing all their meals are very tasty. It's truly a family restaurant bring your kids.

15.description: Nothing I have tried has let me down here, ppl are really nice, most local gents after a work day come here. Everyone seems to know one another, the fries are good the BLT is my fav ( light on the lettuce) the pizza is the best!  Cold beers on tap, a pool table, room for darts and lots of room for groups with TV's.Mostly see folks @ the bar stools but there is plenty of table seating. It's really affordable so make this your chill spot to decompress after work... ;-)

57.description: Some really good food.  The sub sandwiches are fabulous, and they have a great selection anything from American to Italian ( I suggest the salami and provolone.)  The pasta entrees are great as well, all the sauces are homemade, and the spaghetti aglio olio is my absolute favorite.  And for some reason, I am really excited over the fact that they offer jalapeno poppers with either cream cheese, or cheddar cheese fillings.  But all in all, the place is really great, just remember, when you go in there for carry out, do not make a comment about the guy taking your order and his LA Dodger's hat.  Trust me on this one.

20.description: Paterno's is like good booty call... fast, discreet, tasty, and on occasion, regrettableI just call and say "hey meatball sandwich.. cheese and hot peppers, "   15 minutes later i'm chowing down. Thats the extent of our relationship and I don't want to take it to the next level.

36.description: When I am in the mood for an Italian Beef, in old Chicago style, I head to Paterno's Pizza, an old, family-owned and operated restaurant and bar in Jefferson Park. They do it right!Their Italian beef is served on a toasted garlic hoagie roll, stuffed with thin slice Italian beef with melted provolone (or mozzarella, your choice) cheese on the top. I like to ask for the au jus sauce on the side because then my bread doesn't get soggy as I eat. I treat it as a French dip and dip my sandwich in the sauce as I eat. Yum!Anyways, this place is always filled with the regulars. A bunch of crusty, funny, old guys, just sitting around shooting the sh*t. Always good for a laugh. Really, this place has character!The pizza is pretty good, too. But that Italian beef just calls my name!

14.description: i used to think the homogenization of america would succeed. after all, how could one place be different from another in a land populated by identical stores in identical strip malls? but over time, i realized there was no worry about that. for what makes one place different from the next is something intrinsically deeper, something that bubbles up from the soil, and will remain despite all attempts to eradicate geographical differences.what does this have to do with anything? well, as i sat waiting for my sandwich on the NW side of chicago, this was my revelation. no matter how trendy, hip, gentrified and generic a city or neighborhood may become, you can find little gems from times past sprouting up like weeds through the crack.paternos is just that place. in business since the late '30' it is what it is, it is not trying to be anything else. the horseshoe bar one sees upon entering is usually full of older neighborhood folks, nursing their cheap lagers, watching sports and making small talk. with the cop station down the road, i imagine officer friendly has a chaser after work at paternos. no tattooed hipsters here.the food?  their eggplant parmesan sandwich was quite delicious, their pizza nothing spectacular but no skimping on portions here. this is not the place for local, organic dishes. but you will get alot of food at a decent price, for this is not wicker park. they have revolution IPA on tap along with the same macrobrews you would find at any local watering hole.in an era of trendiness taken to the nth degree, in an era where food and alcohol have to be themed and entertaining, its nice to see places like paternos around, culinary archeological sites evoking earlier, simpler times. i like it

58.description: Love this place for cheap Mexican. Good quality. Steak tacos are delicious and the delivery is very speedy.

56.description: The food is consistently good but not great.  Prices seem to be a little higher every time I visit (and I'm in there about 2 times a month since it's right around the corner from home) - $11 and change for a burrito and beans seems steep for the area.  The horchata is some of the best in the area, but there's always some kind of confusion when I order the "big" size off the menu.  The waitress will then hold up a small cup and a bigger cup, and I'll point to the bigger cup.  She will then ask if that's the one I want, and I'll say "yes."  Inevitably, someone else will fill the drink order and we'll go through the same dance.  I recently starting pointing out the "big" horchata on the menu while stating that I want "the big one - the biggest size there is."

29.description: Just moved to the neighborhood and decided to get the Groupon. We got a chimichanga, fajitas, and a pork tamale. Good, solid Mexican food. I think it will be our new go to place.

42.description: MEH

23.description: Great guacamole.  Steak tacos are excellent, too. Fast service for dine in and carry out.

47.description: Great daily specials that are $5 , had steak taco dinner today and when ordering make sure onions & cilantro if not they will tomatoes and lettuce. The corn tortillas tastes so fresh like made in house.Nice staff as well, also they do take credit cards now but not Discover.

8.description: This is a family run, no frills, but cozy little place and there are good cheap eats here.  Also  BYOB.  It's the sort of place where you go right by the cooking station on the way to the little restroom at the back.  Good food here though and a homey feel.  Wife and I had a two taco lunch, and a steak torta ($5.99) and lengua torta ($6.25).  There were a lot of takeout orders also.  Will be back one day and maybe snack at the bar, and may also try the son's Hermanos Too location on Touhy one day.

31.description: I really wanted to like this place when I moved nearby. I gave it 3 chances. The staff has absolutely no personality whatsoever, even to what seem to be "regulars" that came in. All three times I asked for water with in addition to my other beverage and I had to ask again. I can live with that but the food is boring and in some cases terrible. It's just bland, these people lost the spice rack. And my poor 5 year old daughter! She was subjected to burnt chicken fingers and rubbery pancakes. Skip this place, there are plenty of other options.

34.description: After seeing the reviews, I decided to give this place another try.  I wasn't  too impressed with them when I visited a few years ago.  I had a burrito which promptly fell apart.  It was served along side the beans which made it messy to eat.  The beans were runny but the rice was okay.  The horchata wasn't very flavorful.  I lost my appetite after a large fly landed on my plate.  I left nearly half the meal.  The server only gave me one of the two hot sauces available and the red one was flavorless.  I won't be going back again as there are better choices in the area.

16.description: MEH

13.description: Its one of the only Mexican restaurants in the area..the service is very fast but the food is just ok..Ive been to many Mexican Restaurants in Chicago and this isnt the worst but pretty close to it..the place is dirty and small..avoid it and take a drive a bit further for a better experience

11.description: This is a great little neighborhood place.  Nothing fancy, but good Mexican food for a good value.  The service is friendly and attentive -- go back just a few times and they recognize who you are and what you like to order.  The salsas are delicious.  Pro tip:  Can't figure out what you want?  Mix it up every visit with the special of the day.  It's all good, and you'll get to sample the best of their best.  Avoid the American food, as it's so-so.  Then again, why go to a Mexican restaurant for American food???  Décor is dated, but to me it's really part of this place's charm.

39.description: I eat here whenever I make a trip to the American Science and Surplus store across the street.  The food is indecently cheap, authentic and the cup of horchata is the size of your head.  They also serve American fare, such as hamburgers and fries.  I always order 5 tongue tacos.  The tortillas are little but doubled up so that the meat and juice don't cause it to fall apart.  My soft shell tacos also come with a heaping helping of cilantro and lime wedges.  I don't think the tacos are as good as the ones I get at Maxwell Street, but there's not many places that sell tongue tacos in the neighborhoods I frequent.  The interior of the restaurant is what you think of when you think of hole-in-the-wall.  Oh, a lot of cops with their bullet proof vests, holster and guns eat here.

37.description: Eh. Let's start off on a good note-- the horchata is some of the best I've ever had. Yay!I made the mistake of buying the deal before reading the reviews. As I waited for my order to be prepared I started to read the reviews... I got a little nervous and thanked the heavens that I didn't order the chicken burrito like I had originally planned.The food wasn't bad, it wasn't great. My boyfriend got some sort of meat burrito (pork?) and I got the veggie burrito. As a former long time vegetarian, I always appreciated the inclusion of vegetarian options. Still, if you can't do it right than don't do it at all. The veggie burrito was weird. It wasn't awful, it was just confusing. My taste buds had no idea what was going on, yet I kept on eating anyway because it was cheap, it was cinco de mayo, and I was a few minutes away from starvation. I washed it down with horchata which almost made it all better.In the end... if it is convenient and you've got the Yelp deal, then go for it. I would not suggest going

0.description: We order from here all the time. No their food is not fancy or the best you've ever had, but We've probably ordered 50 times for delivery or carry out and never once have received the wrong order or bad food. We've tried other places in the area when these guys are closed and none of them are even half as good. They also have fast and reasonably priced delivery. My one complaint, they don't have piña jarritos :(

38.description: The worst chicken and steak torta I ve eaten on a Sunday morning.

51.description: Basically, Los 4 Hermanos is your typical Mexican restaurant. They serve tacos, burritos, tortas, and everything else you'd expect with good portions at excellent prices. The biggest problem I have? They don't accept anything but cash. Come on, this is 2011! Get with the program!Other than that, their stuff is fantastic and I recommend it to anyone in the area.Also, I'm not a horchata fan, but their horchata is delicious.

27.description: This was my first time eating from this place since I started this job. The food was good but I honestly think they can add more chicken instead of all the condiments. I order a orchata with my lunch and they gave me a large when they should have asked me what size did I want with my lunch. Over all it was fast delivery .

32.description: This was a great find..would definitely visit again. The guacamole was awesome!

54.description: My little neighborhood is a little area of desperation. I love any place that tastes good and delivers.  But oh, the horror.... cash only.  I've both had delivery and dined in. Very outdated decor with a few Mexican tidbits here and there. I just.... I dunno. I feel like more can be done.  The chips they serve on the table get stale.  The food is just "okay." It's done how you expect them to be, but nothing new or exciting.  It's a good place when you want to just "get to the point," have your meal, and bounce. Definitely not a place you'd sit around in after your meal to have a nice chat. Get in. Get the food in. Then get out. lolI do wish this place were a bit better. I love family businesses and supporting lil shops. But this place needs to get up with the times to become more than just forgettable for me.

48.description: Outside of Pisen this is one of the best authentic Mexican restaurants I've been to.  The inside looks more like a truck-stop diner and the outside appearance of the restaurant can be deceptive but the food is anything but. Staff is very warm and welcoming. First time coming I came at the recommendation of a friend and I've been hooked ever since. One thing I learned is that when ordering the tacos one needs to be specific about only wanting onions and cilantro on the tacos otherwise they "Americanize" it by putting lettuce, cheese and tomatos on it. The steak tacos are juicy and flavorful and priced reasonably. Keep up the good work guys.

44.description: 2 stars for daily deals and price. corn tortillas tasted like they were stale and old.It appeared as if they used only the dark meat and the icky pieces of the chicken for the fajitas. not good.

24.description: Love this place! Food is always delivered quick and hot. There ranchero sauce is sooo good!

7.description: Second time here and my food was very tasty, my tacos came out hot and were very good. Recommend to anyone who is driving by.

49.description: Good solid Mexican food at super-low prices.  Staff very warm and friendly.  Only thing was, it was really hot out and they had the doors open - so it was even hotter inside with the grill going.  But I guess it made the place feel like the real Mexico.  We'll go back again, definitely.

40.description: Good burittos! Eat here often.

53.description: 1st time there and probably wont return. Its close by so i figured id give it a try. Ordered enchiladas and they just didn't taste right. Two bites in and i felt something SLIMY.  I have never seen such a big piece of fat in my life. Didn't even bother trying to find out if there might be more.

30.description: Very interesting.  Old school diner but its a mexican resturant.  Thought I give it a try since I was craving some tacos as of late anyways.  I ordered 2 steak and a beef with onion, cilantro, and cheese....you know what pretty tasty.  I also had the horchata to drink...not too bad either.  Its definatly not fancy but its a nice cheap fix if your in the area.

46.description: Really, really great fresh mexican food!  Tried this place out because I got a groupon.  It was really delicious and CRAZY affordable for mexican.  Everything was tasty and made fresh to order.  Will definitely be adding this place to my regular restaurants.

1.description: Solid neighborhood joint.  Consistent, tasty, satisfies.  5 stars for never missing the beat.  Always ready, hot, and delicious.  Never disappoints

55.description: Took my brother here one time and he loved it - just like I did. Inside is pretty simple - kind of a 50s diner feel to it. A little run down - but I guess that gives it some character.We ordered tacos. You can tell about a Mexican restaurant based on their tacos. Man oh man, was it good. They gave us so many things to put inside the taco - surprisingly - avocado!  I never have been to a restaurant that did this. My ex girlfriend's family did this and I just couldn't find a restaurant that would do this.Sour cream, lime, lettuce, tomatoes, AVOCADO, etc.The waitress was pretty cute too. All the men were gawking at her. Experience was good - food was excellent. My pockets were happy too.

9.description: My wife and I love this place. We have been going there since they opened.It is outdated, although the ambiance is still enjoyable and the staff and chefs are just wonderful.Good food and decent prices, with a clean restaurant.

26.description: I ordered the chicken Suizo under Big Burritos and  Nothing was over cooked and I received a lot of food for my money. Also the food was made quickly but not fast food quickly so I know it wasn't already made and heated in a microwave. There was tons of flavor first bite to last, seasoning was perfect and the sides were delicious.

25.description: This is a family run, no frills, but cozy little place and there are good cheap eats here.  Also  BYOB.  It's the sort of place where you go right by the cooking station on the way to the little restroom at the back.  Good food here though and a homey feel.  Wife and I had a two taco lunch, and a steak torta ($5.99) and lengua torta ($6.25).  There were a lot of takeout orders also.  Will be back one day and maybe snack at the bar, and may also try the son's Hermanos Too location on Touhy one day.

12.description: Well I am a BIG fan of the chesse burger and frys I know a mexican restraint but its that old dinner feel, I have tried some of there spanish specials and they where good and at reasonable price.

59.description: Fast, economical, authentic, mexican food for pick up or eat in.  I always get the chicken flautas, my husband the pork tacos.  Just delicious.  I would recommend swinging by Los 4 Hermanos and checking it out, it's good food fast and easy.

21.description: Horrible service! Horrible breakfast! The huevos mexicanos seem to have had the sauce straight from a can. Water tasted like tap water WITHOUT a filter.. just bad experience overall... Thankfully didn't spend much because of the groupon

17.description: Prompt and friendly carry out for Mexican food.  Reasonable prices for the portions.  Their nachos can feed 2.

10.description: One of my favorite  Mexican  places been going here since they opened they even have deliverey all the staff are friendly  and outgoing  even the delivery  guy is so nice try it out you will be glad you did

5.description: This place is awesome. I get tacos here all the time. (steak is my favoite, But I have ordered chicken, chorizo, seasoned pork as well multiple times). I get quesadillas with meat often. I love their burritos. Cans of soda and quick courteous delivery. I have also ordered carryout both in store and called in. Usually give you enough red and green sauce. If you feel like a Horchata it can really hit the spot with this meal. I think its the best mexican food in the neighborhood. Good rice too!

3.description: They have awesome daily specials. I ordered on a Thursday which was 2 enchiladas and a taco with rice and beans for $5.95. Awesome price, friendly staff, and best meat in the neighborhood! I will be returning because they also serve breakfast.

35.description: I would never have tried this place if it wasn't  for a coupon in my Entertainment book.  Now my family goes there all the time.  You can't beat their tacos which are super fresh and under 2 bucks each.  Make sure you order them with cilantro and onions.  The pork one is best.  I agree with other reviewers that this is not a fancy place but it's a typical mom and pop style Mexican place... with really good tacos.

19.description: Horrible service! Horrible breakfast! The huevos mexicanos seem to have had the sauce straight from a can. Water tasted like tap water WITHOUT a filter.. just bad experience overall... Thankfully didn't spend much because of the groupon

28.description: I love this place especially since it is BYOB. I think it has some of the best Mexican food in the city at a very reasonable price.  Most times I go for the burrito suizo, usually lengua which has been absolutely great every time I ordered it.  The salsa is also great to get as a side if you are ordering your food to go.

45.description: Decent little taco joint for all your decent little taco needs.The steaks were flavorful, not exciting. The rice was good, the beans typical. Good horchata. It does have a truck stop vibe, which works for me. I used a daily Groupon for this visit. That made the food taste even better!!!

33.description: I'll never go back..... I just moved into the neighborhood. Never was in this restaurant in my life. Wanted to order a Taco Dinner, and asked them if they would give me flour tortilla instead of corn, and they wanted to charge me a dollar more for flour...Well for one thing, I'm pretty sure that corn is more expensive then flour. And also in all the years I've been going to mexican Restaurant, never ever has anyone charged me more for flour tortilla.I'm Italian and we load the food on your plate. So it just hit me the wrong way. It's not a way to treat a new customer. So I won't be going back!

43.description: This is a tiny Mexican place that looks like an old school diner in a way and could use some asthetic help.I tried the Seasoned Pork Torta and Guacamole and chips.The torta was huge and had good flavor, could be split with someone else if not very hungry.The Guac needed salt but once added it was very good.Service was fast and friendly.Avoid the hot sauce though, it is death dealing!

2.description: Great food ! Awesome customer service ! Love this place.Lunch time server is the best. She looks pretty young but, a awesome server. The night server is a little special. She's a little bit slower and less attentive. The restroom is in the back behind the kitchen.

18.description: Decent little taco joint for all your decent little taco needs.The steaks were flavorful, not exciting. The rice was good, the beans typical. Good horchata. It does have a truck stop vibe, which works for me. I used a daily Groupon for this visit. That made the food taste even better!!!

41.description: This place is solid. While the booths aren't terribly comfortable and the ambiance is lacking, well, ambiance, the food is cheap and tasty, it seems acceptably clean and the staff is really nice. The $5 specials are likely to be a huge part of my sustenance!

52.description: I Loooooooooooovvvvvvvvvvve Dirty Mexican food.  I've only had the tacos here but I really liked em.  I had the steak tacos and slathered them in hot sauce.  Fast service, clean restaurant, and I love the old fashioned diner/Mexican decor.  A nice alternative to TBK.

50.description: The food is always hot, service is great and the staff is so friendly And the specials are great.  Cant say enough good things about 4 Hermanos!

4.description: 4 Hermanos is a small neighborhood place that delivers.  I've ordered there several times and they haven't disappointed yet. I really like there selection of salsas and fresh food. My wife really enjoys their vegetarian options and portion size.  The delivery was a bit slow but I know they can get busy often.  I really enjoyed their sopes and tacos.  Whatever you're craving " carne asada, al pastor, chorizo, etc...they have it and it's delicious.

6.description: Never again. I was craving a burrito suizo hardcore last night, and came across 4 Hermanos as we don't have many Mexican places that deliver where we live. Ordered delivery through Grubhub and once it arrived we immediately regretted our decision. It was the worst Mexican food we have ever had. I'm surprised we didn't get sick... Never again....

22.description: awful food , left the restaurant with the meal half eaten , just real poor quality .

15.description: My boyfriend called get a delivery and the person was so rude over the phone and was very annoyed so he didn't end up ordering anything from them. We've tried it before but the food is good , but pretty high priced for something I can easily make at home.

57.description: Typical Mexican take-out. I have become a fan mainly because of its close proximity to my day job. Their daily $5 Specials make this place so much more appealing. I strongly suggest stopping by on a Sunday for a Grande' Chicken Quesadilla special, and a refreshing glass of Horchata.Their banana milkshakes are bomb-ass too! i am fairly certain that they use the Horchata to make them instead of milk. but, i could just be hoping. The best part about this restaurant is that they will cook just about anything to your specifications, as far as ingredients and flavors.

20.description: Filled me up!  Wasn't spectacular, but I enjoyed it nonetheless

36.description: Good, friendly service, peaceful ambiance, great food. Don't know what else to say. I had the Big Chicken Quesadilla and it was delicious. The portion sizes are big for what you pay, which is cheaper than most places. No complaints. :)

14.description: Hands down the best Al Pastor Gorditas in the north side. Their Horchata is just as amazing. The service is great; friendly, fast and efficient. Whether you are dinning in or take out the food will be delicious! There have been a handful of new businesses that keep coming and going around the area, but this place is still going strong. This place is DELICIOSO!!!

3.description: This was my first mattress purchase and overall was not a pleasant experience.  I came to the store after seeing that they were offering free delivery and special price for a mattress different from the online price.  It is detailed for first time mattress buyers like me. My apologies.Positives:The sheep are cute. They did price match my mattress cover with Amazon's price, but if saving a few pennies is important you would still save on Amazon since city tax isn't included.  It wasn't to me so I left it that way.  Store set-up was explained and is pretty straight forward. Mattress arranged by mattress line from cheapest to most expensive.Pricing: The mattress was cheaper than the online price and the first salesman did lower it a little for me.  He was eager to sell. I suggest checking the sales ads on the website first.   Other Thoughts: The salesman may have been too eager. He gave me one pitch after another even disparaging their competitor which is not good practice. I didn't feel comfortable trying out the mattresses there. The one liner sales pitches and my gut should have been enough to tell me to shop around a little more.Refund Policy:They do not offer refunds. I am used to Costco who gives refunds even on mattresses from what friends have told me.  I know it is standard practice now, but they should mention that to the customer anyways, especially if it is mentioned it is their first purchase.  I made the mistake of not asking out of ignorance. I found out looking at the receipt.  I was told it was "standard practice" not to get a refund when I returned a second time. I checked their competitors website that are "Experts" and they will refund your money but you have to wait for the check to be sent.  I believe I saw it in FAQ. Sales pitches I was given you should be careful of....Delivery: The salesman said, "For YOU I will waive the delivery charge." It was free delivery period.  It was on the website at the time."We guarantee the price for 60 days!"  They don't tell you is that it is not really possible to find the same mattress.  I am not sure if the names are changed and/or the styles are altered slightly at competitors. Not sure what it is.  The site says it needs to be the same style, size and color.  "You don't need to shop anywhere else! Everything you need is right here!".  They only sell Serta mattresses.  If you are looking to compare different brands that are similar this is not the place. (Update: I was told by the manager at another store (Diversey) that they have the widest selection of Tempurpedic).It must be my "perception" so the manager said when I returned to exchange.My mattress didn't seem as firm as the store one.  I went back to the store this time when the manager was there.  The store one felt better.  I am not sure why.  Maybe the temperature difference.  I didn't get an intelligent answer from the manager except that it must be my perception.  (Update: I found out the the type of top it had shouldn't be affected by the temperature even though it had foam from the manager at a different store so who knows.)"Maybe you should come back for her at 6:45 before the store closes after she takes a nap." I decided to take more time in deciding on a mattress in the same line before exchanging because you are allowed to change once.  The chiropractor told me that salesman at a store will not think you are weird for trying out a mattress for 10 minutes.  The manager made comments that made me feel just that while laying on a mattress for more than a 5 minutes at time on each of the two mattresses I was deciding on. I left he store after that.I learned a lot from my first mattress buying experience and I dread the next one.  Hope you have a better one and this review helps. Cheers.

1.description: WOW!! Just have to share with everyone how happy I am with American Mattress but mainly with the store manager Jim. We came in to the store to ask about the warranty on our mattress that we had bought about a year ago and was greeted by Jim the store manager he was so nice and professional, courteous very knowledgeable he informed us about everything and right away set up an apt for them to come and take a look at our old mattress well thankfully we were approved for a brand new mattress of our choice of Jim helped through the whole process I felt he was so trustworthy and he knew the ups and downs of all kinds of mattresses. Well to finalize this I'm so grateful for employees like Jim he is the best kudos for American Mattress on Milwaukee and Higgins.

2.description: Apparently this place knows who to hire. My boyfriend and I purchased a bed on Sunday (to be delivered tomorrow) and were more than impressed with Anthony. He was no pressure and very informative. We pretty much had the place to ourselves - so quiet and nice. We fell in love with a bed, got free pillows ($400 savings due to President's Day) and he discounted the delivery charge because we live so close to the store. We also bought a mattress protector that he gave us a big discount on as well. The pillows were not scheduled to be delivered, and he noticed on the invoice. He assured me that he would make sure they got delivered as well and if not, he would bring them by personally. I know these guys don't work on commission, but I really felt like he wanted our business. Overall the best shopping experience I've had anywhere in a long time.

5.description: A relatively small store but the lone employee was nice as my girlfriend and I goofed around as we "tested" the beds. I mention the size of the silent store because as we discussed out bedding needs the salsman couldn't help but listen to our akward, whispered business. The selection and pricing were what I expected based on a little pre-vist interwebbing. The company website charges for delivery so the slight price break you'll find on-line is exactly offset by the free delivery for an in store purchase. After tax the prices were identical. We bounced around on a few beds. There was very little pressure to buy and no up selling on the part of the sales person- not Louis but good none the less. Our questions were answered, paper work was completed and delivery was scheduled. The correct bed arrived on time several days later. The delivery guys were quick and pleasant. They delivered and set up the new bed, removed the old bed and were out the door in under five minutes. Side note... I never seem to realize how ragged I've let my old mattress get until I have strangers carrying it out to the street. Yuck! I was actually sleeping on that crushed, flacid thing? Anyway, easy peasy. It would have been a five star review if their bathroom hadn't been out of service and I didn't have to wait in line for 10 minutes and buy a soda at Subway to use theirs. Grrrrr. I hate that.

6.description: We recently bought our mattress at American Mattress at JP.  We couldn't be happier with it.  More importantly, the customer service was great.  Shawn listened to what we needed and wanted as well as accommodated our price range.  We'd recommend this store to everyone.

7.description: This is really a review of the salesman. His name is Louis and he is AWESOME!!! Came here with my girlfriend to get a mattress for her new condo. Louis was so knowledgeable he made me wish I needed a mattress! He wasn't pushy or sleazy in anyway. He was a genuinely nice guy. The mattress selection was great. The prices were reasonable. We found one we liked and bought it. What's even better is you get 30 days to try it out. If you don't like it you can bring it in for a trade.So I'm spreading the word...Anyone who is in need of a mattress look no further! Please, please, please visit Louis. No I'm not a  spokeswoman. Just a very impressed and satisfied girlfriend of an equally impressed and satisfied customer!

8.description: Hi, this review is in regards to Sean. He really is a nice guy, I went to do a warranty on my mattress and long story short ran into problems and I was besides myself and Sean was so nice and accommodating I was very impressed, he was patient with me and I was at that store 4-5 times and each time he had a smile on his face and he really did everything that he could to work with me and make things run smooth. I am very Thankful that American Mattress has nice caring people working for them. Koodos to Sean!

9.description: great store, shawn was a huge help. He was able to answer all my questions and gave me a great deal. I recommend him to anyone looking for a new bed.

0.description: I don't even have the bed yet and had to express that we're really satisfied with the customer service Jim provided.  Fiance and I were informed on the bed selection and payment options thoroughly and with no pressure.  EXTREMELY happy that we decided to return once again and purchase a new bed from this place. Our goal was tempurpedic, but we had to be realistic.  We shopped with a different home/appliance store that had similar beds and were not satisfied with the prices.  Jim guided us through the a different selection of memory beds that were just as great.To keep things short, we are definitely looking forward to our icomfort cool foam-something bed.  Finally, some comfort for the hard working couple!  Thanks so much for everything, your patience and for such a pleasant welcome, Jim!

4.description: Shawn is a very good salesman. Me and my wife had a lot of questions and he was so patient and so nice to make us understand everything we needed to.

12.description: How refreshing is it to be told NOT to spend money? That was my experience at For Eyes. It has been about a year and a half since I last got my eyes checked and I couldn't bring myself to pay a ton of money for contact lenses and glasses for my horrible prescription. The doctor not only gave me a sample of two different brands to test for a few days before placing my order, but also gave me eye drops and contact solution. What impressed me the most about my exam was that he explained what he was doing and why he was doing it. I was really impressed by the time and care he took to make sure I left satisfied with my visit. He even told me...now brace yourself....that my prescription didn't change enough to warrant new glasses I should keep the ones I had and just get new contacts. The place I used to go would have told me that plastic frames need to be replaced frequently and I should get a new pair. The staff is very friendly and helpful. My dad bought glasses at the same time and they were very patient in tweaking them until they were the perfect fit. I never felt pressured to buy more than I needed or rushed out the door when the store became busy. They even tightened the screws on the glasses I didn't purchase at For Eyes and gave me a new glass case for them!

7.description: I was surprised some of the reviews had four stars. I purchased glasses three years ago. I went back several times for adjustments, and still it was never corrected. I couldn't see, it was difficult reading and walking. I would get head aches often.  I just recently purchased a new pair at Pearle Vision the other day, and I can see again, and no more head aches, and my prescription was the same, no changes to it. Why couldn't Four Eyes get it right the first time ?

3.description: Didn't call when my glasses came in had to just show up. Doctor is alright but secretaries are rude and sales people overly insistent. Would help amend my contact prescription to have two brands.

1.description: Service is ok, but guys please check the store- the floor is so dirty and worn out. Huge balls dust bunnies under display cabinets, ewww! Do they even have cleaning/housekeeping contract?

2.description: If you're buying your glasses on a budget, honestly their selection they offer didn't fit my taste at all or made me feel or look good with the glasses I kept trying on. Used to be my go to, but I've outgrown it.

9.description: I've been going to this For Eyes location for over ten years. I've always had good experiences there until my last visit. I got my eyes checked and went out to the floor to look for frames. About ten minutes later no one had approached me to ask if I needed help picking out a frame or anything. Their frame selection seems to have taken a nose dive. I can always find something I like there, but nothing seemed really stylish or current unless they we're more expensive than what I was willing to pay. Another customer came out on the floor and was helped right am away. I don't know how much help the associate could have been, she looked like she just rolled out of bed or something. Not someone I would ask for fashion advice. I left the store and went home to look at glasses online as a friend suggested to me. Also wrote an email to let for eyes know what had happened in the store. Found a great pair I decided to purchase, and called for eyes to make sure I knew how to read my prescription right to place my online order. I guess they knew I'd sent the email already, because they left me on hold forever and then the assistant manager came on the line to talk to me about what happened. Apparently she was the one who came onto the floor looking like she'd just rolled out of bed and helped the other person on the floor and left me standing there. She said it was busy and she was sorry but she did talk to me. Sure ,I asked her where the 2 for 99 glasses were. She showed me and said nothing else to me. Not we're busy, I'm going to help this person and come back, and she didn't get anyone else to help me. Someone could have said something to me in the store and I'd have gladly waited. But, the online glasses turned out great! 65 bucks for frames and polycarbonate lenses with UV and antiglare, a nice hard shell case, and a shammy cloth. Didn't wait much longer for them to come than I wait for for eye glasses.  My advice? Make sure you know what customers are on the floor, when they got there, and who's still left after someone else has been helped.  I've been in one capacity or another of customer service for 20 years. With all the competition these days from the internet, they need to work on their people skills.

18.description: Right now I am on a glasses kick.  So these people came up in my memory bank of optical companies. I didn't get the eye exam here so I can't comment on that. However, they do have optometrists there for one. I went to this company in 09/2006, and have popped every so often for adjustments. ----I did get a really inexpensive pair of glasses from them (since they are reading/ far sighted lens).  They do have free adjustments( thank goodness cause I am forever dropping and stepping on mine). Nice selections and they do accept flexible spending accounts. I loved my pair of  Cynthia Rowley glasses. Its the last bit of funk I have out here in the burbs.

10.description: After my first review I was immediately contacted by someone from For Eyes via Yelp and was told they would try to make my situation better which I truly appreciate. About 20 mins from the first messege the store manager Jané, who helped me the first time I had an issue with my glasses and contacted corporate after my first encounter, she's very nice and genuienly wanted to resolve my problem to the best she could. She Offered me to pick up a pair of contacts that same day and told me she would order me a complete new pair of glasses and we would in return send the defective pair back. It took about a week and I got my new glasses yesterday and I am happy to say there are NO specs. Feels good to finally have a good pair of glasses on and I appreciate all the effort they took into correct my situation.

13.description: Staff are exceptional.  I have been to several other eye places (i.e. Target Optical, Pearl Vision, etc.), and they do not compare to For Eyes.  Dr. Randazzo is reason enough to go here.  I personally would purchase eyeglasses online (i.e. zenni.com), after receiving a prescription from the eye Dr., as that saves major mula. If you are dedicated to the store's cause, they do have more reasonable options than other places.

16.description: By far the best optical store I have ever been to.  The service was outstanding and the Dr. spent so much time with me and I got the feeling he genuinely loved what he does.  He took time to explain what he was doing and why and gave me options that fit my budget (which is basically nothing).  I cannot recommend them enough!

17.description: For Eyes at Harlem and Irving is without a doubt the best mainly due to Dr. Randazzo, who is wonderful.He will not push you to spend more money on more expensive lenses and takes the time to explain what he is doing.  He is very sincere, friendly, professional, and thorough.  My husband and I have been seeing Dr. Randazzo for quite a while now, despite moving quite a distance from this location, two years ago.In general, For Eyes is relatively inexpensive and often have frames for 2/$99.  Their staff has also been thorough and friendly.

15.description: I came to the For Eyes earlier this year for an eye exam and two pair of glasses (one regular, one tinted). The eye exam was very thorough and never too annoying. The overall customer service was very good. I like simple frames, and I was never pushed too hard into looking at the more expensive designer-brand frames. An elderly woman tripped outside along the strip mall, and even though she was not a customer she received a good amount of attention and compassion from the For Eyes saleswoman.

0.description: I took a whole week traveling to several eyeglass places before I found For Eyes. I was on the verge of buying my high prescription glasses online when I found frames I liked. I'm very picky. And cheap.What makes me give For Eyes a 5-star review is their customer service. Tina has been there almost a decade and knows a lot. She was very helpful in finding frames that accentuated my features. She took a lot of time and was very patient. She was never pushy or disingenuous. She was supportive in my quest to find affordable glasses, too, and gave me some fantastic advice to save a lot of money.The eyeglasses came in 4 days early. I was ecstatic! I rushed over there and Tina was there - on Mother's Day! She took a lot of time to make sure my nosepads and lenses were properly adjusted for me. This is something no other optical technician has ever done in my 40 years of wearing glasses without my asking. And this is something no online technician can do.

5.description: I've been coming here for the past couple of years to get my eyes examined and have had the best experience.  Dr Maitino is friendly and makes sure that you receive the right prescription for your eyes by taking her time with you. Now I'm a contact kind of girl so I can only comment on that. The sales associate was pleasant to deal with and when I was curious to try color contacts she offered to let me try it without pressuring me. They explained my benefits and even suggested ways to save on my order.  As I was on my last pair of contacts,  they let me keep the pair I was testing and even told me to take a few days to test them before I even placed my order.  Needless to say, I have recommended them to my family and they've also been satisfied with the service and the glasses selection.

11.description: How refreshing to go to a "discount" eye place that actually has good doctors and excellent customer service.  I use discount in quotes because even though I usually have a pretty cheap experience money-wise, it doesn't feel that way service-wise.  I've seen Dr. Maitino and Dr. Randazzo and both are great.  My glasses are always ready to go early at a  decent price and my first experience with contacts was top notch.  They gave me a pair to try for a week and then asked me to come back for a complimentary follow-up exam before getting my Rx and ordering my new contacts.Top notch!

8.description: I went back to this For Eyes location in Norridge, after several years going to the local optical store.  It was a busy Saturday, however the receptionist and assistant were very friendly and didn't rush me. Dr. Alla Malishkevich was the optometrist. She was very calm, precise and re-did some tests over, until she was satisfied. Alice matched me with 3 fabulous glasses immediately! And, I'm VERY picky. Janay, the manager explained everything in detail and made sure I was satisfied and asked if I had any questions.  I was happy to see that Laura was still there, who always took care of me years before, when my glasses and lenses were ready. I was so surprised that I can now see crystal clear with my glasses and my multifocal contact lenses are unbelievable. I can read a menu, my laptop, smartphone and instructions on medicine boxes without using reading glasses! I will always come back to this For Eyes, even tho it takes me 40 min and will only have Dr. Malishkevich perform my eye exam. I highly recommend this store and especially the optometrist; everyone else were great.

4.description: Sorry to say that although optometrist was lovely, diagnosed my child as nearsighted, farsighted, with an astigmatism; of course requiring glasses. Obviously concerned, we went for a second opinion to a seasoned ophthalmologist, who instead diagnosed her with 20/25 vision. We never suspected vision issues as our child seems to see/read from up close & far away very well, to us at least to us. The ophthalmologist did not want to incriminate optometrist, as he said he could not vouch for what she saw/diagnosed. Otherwise, staff was very friendly. Great selection of children's frames for amazing prices...back to school special 29$ frames + lenses.

14.description: The people are great and always helpful. I bring my glasses in all the time for an adjustment.

6.description: I used a groupon for new glasses the other day-- The people working here are always so pleasant and helpful and don't mind when you can't decide between 5 pairs and need some help! The only thing I have noticed is that the frame selection seems to be decreasing-- they used to have a ton of different "nerdy" style glasses with different colors, and now it seems there are only a few styles left. Other than that, nice clean place with good service.

3.description: I would never let another person touch my hair!  She gives me the greatest haircuts (and I am constantly changing my style).  I receive compliments daily on the cut and how flattering it is for me.  I am often in the mood for a change with no specific ideas or constraints.  She knows her job so well that I give her free reign to suggest and do what she feels will flatter me, and I have never been disappointed.

1.description: This place is great! Made a last minute keratin appointment, and was able to get in. The owner, and the sole stylist, is amazing. Super sweet and did a great job! Definitely worth checking out.

2.description: If I could give Thisoma 10 stars I would. I've been going to her for YEARS! Once you find a great hair stylist that looks at their work as art you need to stick with them. Thisoma tells it how it is, she doesn't sugar coat what you need done. She doesn't mind putting in extra work if something doesn't look quite right. She is very precise and I am so happy with my results. Usually I get an all around blonder look with a tiny bit darker undertones to match my roots which is a dirty blonde. I've let my hair grow out for about a year because I love the Khloe kardashian Ombre look. So I KNEW it was time to come in and get it all blended. It looks beautiful. It's not TOO much of a difference from my previous hair, but it's exactly what I was looking for!!! I am so thankful to have such a great hair stylist and I would never go anywhere else!!! Thanks Thisoma!!!!!!

5.description: I don't know if i should give her a 1 or a 2. I would give her a 2 for being honest with me about her expertise. I called T'soma hair salon to make an appointment for the Keratin. She requested that I don't go through Groupon and go through her. That's fine with me. I ask her if she has done Black women's hair before and would be comfortable doing it. For some reason, I had a feeling that she wouldn't be able to do it because I usually don't ask. She claims she has done Black hair before and to come on in. I made my appointment. It takes me a little over an hour to get there. I took two busses and arrived there as the salon opened. I go in and she takes a look at my hair. She all but insults it. Stating she did do black hair before but it was finer and the curls weren't as loose. She then asked if I ever received Keratin before and were other stylists ok with working on my hair. Not something you should say to a client. She tells me she is not comfortable with working with my hair. I didn't want someone who had reservations about doing my hair to touch it so I got up and left. She apologized but I am hesitant to accept it. I think she didn't want to dedicate the time to do the Keratin for $99. I think she might have dedicated the time if I was paying full price. Two, if you are a hairdresser then you should know how to work on different hair textures. All my Keratins that I received before was done by Caucasian women and they didn't have a problem doing it. Three, it's not a good idea to insult your client's hair. Though I was slightly annoyed that I made a two hour trip to this salon and back, I found a fantastic hairdresser who took me the same day at Evolution Hair Salon. She did the job in under two hours and styled it without charging me extra. Definitely recommend that salon over this one. Plus, it's a lot closer and train/bus friendly unlike T'soma's location which is really far.

0.description: T'soma is a professional colorist, stylist and business owner. She took me as a walk-in and gave me a beautiful new look for fall. Well done, T!! I will be back! Best wishes for a lifetime of success!

4.description: I've had great experiences with Thisoma! I have very thick, course hair and she always makes it look fantastic. I've had my best keratin & haircuts done by her. She's very accommodating and efficient. Totally recommend her services:)

12.description: Wanted to love this place because of its convenience.   Unfortunately, the service was sub par.  This place doesn't have any of the perks you would expect for the price of the service.  Also, I was very unhappy with the way the manicure looks.  I have polish above and beyond my cutical and the color was polished in a way where I have streaks going in two different directions.  Unfortunately, I didn't have have time to stick around for them to put another coat of polish on, in an attempt to fix the streaking.   Even if I did, I wouldn't agree to that b/c the amount of polish was already too thick.

3.description: I've been here plenty of times before today but by far, THIS IS THE WORST PEDICURE I HAVE EVER HAD!  The woman rushed and my feet are rough.  I won't be back!  Save your money.

1.description: I decided to stop in for a nail repair and asked if they could take me in. She said to select a color and so I selected the color and waited and than was told after 30 minutes of waiting that it was a two hour wait. What a waste of my time.

2.description: Preliminary:I really, really wanted to like this place. The convenience is matched by none, considering I take the Blue line into the Jefferson Park Transit center (this place is literally across the street in Veterans Square). I went in around 11 a.m. on a Tuesday, hoping to get a reverse French no-chip. Let me start off by saying, I was immediately seated at a nail desk and an employee began removing my old no-chip. She was friendly, but extremely harsh with taking off the polish (not allowing them to soak long enough in the acetone foil strips). My nails felt extremely weak once she got my previous no-chip off. No-chip application:After my previous no-chip was removed, a different girl came out to do my nails. Normally, this is no problem and she was just as friendly as the last. I showed her a picture of the reverse French that I wanted, and she said she understand exactly what I wanted. She has a stylus for touch screens that she allowed me to borrow, so I could continue to use my phone, as she worked my nails. That part was awesome. When she was cleaning up my cuticles, she was too aggressive, and made three of my fingers bleed. By the third finger, I let out an "Ow!" to get her attention. I understand cuticles occasionally bleed, especially when it's dry out. Three fingers, though, wasn't acceptable to me. Rather than applying the solution to stop the bleeding, she wiped away the blood and proceeded to move on to painting...the only problem - my cuticles were still bleeding. She began applying no-chip polish over the blood seeping onto my nail bed, and it stung! I pointed this out to her, and she /then/ whipped out the product to stop the bleeding, but did not re-do the polish that was now drying into a blood mixture. She explained that she had left her stencils at home, but assured me she'd be fine with the reverse French. I've had plenty of nail techs free-hand my French manis without a stencil and done a beautiful job. This, however, was sloppy and uneven. She also applied WAY to much. I had a thick mound of no-chip polish at the base, and a thinner coat above that.Overall:I have only been here once, so perhaps I had a uniquely bad experience, but I'd much rather spend the extra 5 min to drive to another salon that does a more professional job, than spend 2 weeks looking down at my nails and hating them. I will say the price was average and the people were very friendly.

9.description: Do not waste your time! I arrived for my 4pm appointment & was greeted with disorganized bottles of nail polish with goopy lids. I then waited 30+ minutes for anyone to begin my nails. The nail tech (who may be the owner?) had an ear bud in and was on the phone the entire time she worked on my nails. The pedicure chairs are not the nicest, and the facility in general is not kept clean, organized, and inviting.

10.description: I really love this place.  Always a great mani pedi- super nice staff, they are gentle on your feet and hands- and reasonably priced. It's a small strip mall place- nothing fancy-but great staff and great work.

4.description: Amy gives the best pedicure in the city, and maybe even ever. Period.I have been going here for mani & pedis for so long I can't even remember when I started. Probably somewhere in the 10-15 year range.  Of course I have tried numerous places but nothing compares to Amy. She's sweet, attentive, and always does her best to accommodate. I recommend calling ahead, they can get pretty busy.

6.description: HORRIBLE PLACE! NEVER EVER GO HERE.I simply asked the nail lady to try on two colors to see which color looks best on the nail she said "no, choose one"  then I asked her if she was in a bad mood and her reply was "yes, someone else can do your nails" I told her ok and I left. Horrible service.

15.description: AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING. VERY CLEAN. best mani pedi I have ever had, I just keep going back.Nail Experts never lets me down. Don't let looks fool you, the interior decor is not anything special, but if your interested in getting a great mani pedi this is the place. To be honest I am a nail SNOB I have been going to nail salons all around the City for years, paying high prices and always leaving slightly unsatisfied, and just looking for that perfect place that Always does a good job. I found nail experts which has PARKING, and is open 7 days a week. I always get excellent service and my nails look great. Very Affordable, I would honestly pay more for the great job they do !! Get to Nail Experts.

0.description: I have been here 4 times now. Two manicures and two pedicures. All 4 times have been pleasant, but this time was AMAZING!Today I had Haun. She was very detailed and truly spent a long time on my fred flintstone feet! She massaged my feet too and my legs!I feel rejuvenated!Highly recommend. The parking lot can be a bit tricky at busy times of the day. But there is meter parking a,stones throw away.They have a good selection of colors, and the prices are reasonable.
