5.description: The quality and price of a regular mani and pedi is beyond words. I don't want to go too much into the job done because there really is no point unless you come here yourself. Amy is the one who always do my nails, and I have been coming back for her for the past 3 years

13.description: This place is excellent!! Amy is great!! Great prices!!

11.description: Don't go here.  Sure it's convenient but the service is not good.  I came in for a mani-pedi and sat on the pedicure chair for 45 minutes waiting for service.  That wouldn't be so bad if the massage chair was any good or if the pedicure jets were strong.  But both were so weak!  I had a no-chip manicure that had to be removed... It surprised me that the tech placed a small bowl of acetone for me to soak my fingertips in.  I'm used to having my nails wrapped in a cotton ball and foil... It's interesting... The 2 ladies next to me got that treatment but I didn't.  I got the lazy treatment.   The skin on my hands were so irritated after a few minutes of soaking.  I was so upset and asked why my nails weren't wrapped like the other clients.  The tech at the next station said "some clients soak nails".  No... That's the lazy way to do it.  I was so upset that I didn't want her to remove the polish on my other hand.  And I'm so upset I just want to leave this place...

8.description: I like my no chip mani and regular pedi that I did last week . She is so helpful Linda the technician , she did a good job, prices are reasonable, it. Would be good if they do feet massage but they don't do it unfortunately , I went Friday evening was very busy, it really close to my house so I might go there again

14.description: I SO wanted to like this salon, but I just had a very frustrating experience there.This salon is in a strip mall just one block from my job. I had a wonderful pedicure here once, and went back for some facial waxing today. It is clear that while the services are offered, they get less money for waxing (and I tip 20% all the time for any service!), so only treat you as a valued customer if you actualy need a pedicure or manicure. I came here twice today. The first time, there was an available person to do the waxing, but she clearly hesistated, then told me to come back later. I did. When I came in a few hours later, there were 2 women finishing their pedicures, one also had a manicure. When I explained that I wanted facial waxing, I was literally looked at like I had ebola, and was told to sit - "Just a few minutes". 30 minutes later, I walked out after literally being ignored. I truly believed they wanted me to leave! When I stood up, one of the women looked at me sarcastically and said, "You don't wanna wait anymore?", then began speaking to the other worker while staring at me. I may not speak your language, but I know a nasty comment was being made about me. Shame on you! Rude, unprofessional, and frankly, a poorly kept and managed salon. How this place has stayed in business with such disgusting customer service and attitude is beyond me. DO NOT GO HERE!!!

7.description: definitely not experts! they need more workers on weekdays. thought I should give them a second chance after telling me to come back on Friday, but this is ridiculous!

58.description: I can't put my finger on why I minorly prefer the food so far from Blue Angel, but I dunno if it's the nostalgia talking in me, the fact you could smoke there(RIP pre-smoking ban days), or whatever. Anyway, my first visit here wasn't too bad, but the pancake dish I got minorly disappointed me some. It wasn't totally terrible, but I was expecting slightly better.It isn't too bad though, since I did try a few bites of what others got, and they weren't bad, but of course didn't blow me away. Then again it is just a diner, so I'm not expecting the highest standards in the world. I'd really like to try one of the juices, if I do come back here. They have a take out food and juice area in the back(prob for commuters to call in an order to go, and park in the lot and pick it up), and did clean up the interior and bathrooms a little bit from the Blue Angel days, which I did appreciate. I remember liking the German Pancake after I went to the North and Clark Elly's after it opened, so I'm crossing my fingers that my future visits are better here.ETA: IIRC, I think they're only 24/7 on Wednesday or Thursday through Saturday, and close after a certain time(midnight?) from Sunday through Tuesday or Wednesday. Once I'm sure of the hours, I'll do an edit to this yelp review page.

56.description: My wife had the OPA! salad at the Jefferson Park location on January 14th,  and was up all night with food poisoning.  Be careful when ordering a salad. The service was good and the place was clean, but we won't be going back.

29.description: The food here is just so good! The restaurant is clean the servants are nice. I have never had anything that's not delicious here. I love to come here and have a cup of coffee, enjoying my favorite brunch.

42.description: I love this place! I wish they were still open 24/7 but there still delicious and they make the best chicken sandwich!

23.description: I ordered waffles with strawberries and whip cream. The first time I noticed that the strawberries were going bad so I asked to send it back and to possibly get a different package of strawberries with the next order. Server brings it back and AGAIN strawberries taste rancid. I tell the server, the strawberries are still bad, I don't want the plate, sorry. I get the bill and sure enough I see "strawberry waffles with whip" KIDDING ME?!

47.description: I ordered from here on a Sunday morning for our food to be picked up. We got biscuits and gravy, an ole skillet with toast, and an order of soup. The women on the phone told us it would be ready in 10 minutes. So we get there 15 minutes later, we pay and they tell us it will be out in 2 minutes. After standing there for an addition 15 minutes we start getting mad and say something it takes another 5 minutes to get our food. Why tell us it's gonna be 10 minutes and it takes longer then 40? So we get in the car and start driving as I'm checking the bag they didn't give us soup. At this point I'm so annoyed I call to complain and all the women says on the phone is well do you know who you spoke to that said 10 minutes? After 2 minutes of complaining  she finally apologizes. We get home and there is no toast (along with no soup) and the eggs in the skillet aren't even cooked. We have ate here and ordered from here multiple times but this will be the last time! Be warned!

8.description: Two thumbs up today we went in and felt very welcomed customer service is outstanding !! The food is well prepared it makes your mouth water as you see it coming I had a cappuccino drink and people that know caffeine will love the taste of their cappuccino now we know where to go if we are in a hurry we're going to Elly's pancake house!

31.description: Four stars instead of three tocounter the wack faux foodie reviews. Thesis a breakfast place not Alinea.Place is well lit, we'll laid out. There is a nice juice bar in the back that serves fresh wheatgrass and other juices including, there are also bakery goods. The service is excellent, even when they are slammed. The food is standard American breakfast fare, but it is above average in quality, and taste. There is no better breakfast this side of town. This is the reason there is sometimes a 45 minute to one hour wait on the weekends.

34.description: Hungry for a giant pile of egg mush shaped like football? Try an omelette! In all fairness...the daily soups are generally very good and the turkey club is terrific. Service is hit or miss. Our rule: if the wait for a table is longer than 5min, we go across the street to 4 Hermanos instead....they never disappoint.

16.description: One morning, while in Chicago, I ended up at Elly's Pancake House. The restaurant was jammed packed however, because of the size of our party, we were seated immediately. I'm sure that must have left a sour taste in some people's mouths however, I understand the logic because smaller parties have more seating options while larger parties have to take whatever comes their way. Anyway, as busy as the restaurant was, service was surprisingly acceptable. I don't remember her name but she was bustin' her buns. She wasn't lollygagging around; I remember looking at her shoes and thinking to myself, no matter how comfortable they were, she was going to be sore at the end of her shift. And even with how larger her station was, she was still fairly attentive, friendly and patient with us. As for the food, I went with the Special Club # 1. Chilled juice, two pancakes, two eggs, two strips of bacon and sausage link. Everything cooked as requested and the apple juice I ordered made me believe that the glass was chilled in a cooler because it was nice and cold. My overall thoughts - neighborhood place where a lot of people seemed to know one another, including the staff. Decent food with decent prices. Good service with hard working, friendly people. Nothing gourmet, but definitely okay.

13.description: I visited this place years ago when it was Blue Angel,and even though it was good food the service was horrible.Fast forward a few years...my husband and I are purchasing a home nearby and decided to try out some restaurants. Our first time at Elly's was a great experience. The hostess was super friendly and seated us right away. She asked if it was our first time, and went over the menu,explained how they have their own bakery, and how they make their own juices as well. Our waitress came over right away and asked to take our drink orders and offered a nutella latte. Which was awesome! A bit pricey though. Our food was also very good. My husband ordered one of the breakfast specials and I just had a pecan roll from the bakery. I did try his pancakes and they were very good.The second time we stopped by was to get some breakfast sandwiches to go and juice. Now their sandwiches were huge! The sausage patties were so thick, definitely not your Mcdonalds type of sandwich. The third time was just as good, and it just shows you if we came back 3x already that you should check it out also.

11.description: Excellent service and food. Wait staff was friendly despite a busy Sunday morning rush. Food was prepared exactly how we asked for it to be. The restaurant has plenty of seating and has a clean simple atmosphere... Not an outdated, washed out diner anymore. Nice job Elly's!

39.description: Good food and friendly service. It can get crowded, especially on the weekends for breakfast.  My only real criticism is their coffee is hit or miss. Sometimes it is really good and sometimes it is really bad. Elly's is one of my go to places for breakfast.

37.description: I have to admit coming here on a busy Saturday, the staff did a wonderful job. We didn't wait long for our table (and the manager accommodated my request of a booth, yes it's the little things) and we didn't wait long for our food either. I ordered a spartan omelette and my omelette wasn't dry...(awesome job). The staff was kind enough to surprise the birthday girl with her birthday Sunday and along with the staff and manager sang her a happy birthday. What a great way to start her birthday!

0.description: We are so happy that this place opened. Really nice restaurant , great food.Everything is new and updated.We went for breakfast twice,but you can order anything on the menu. Definitely, we will go back soon.

38.description: I love this place! I live in the area and I'm so glad it's here because we don't have too many options for breakfast/brunch. My husband and I come here almost every weekend. Sundays, expect to wait, but I come from Wicker Park and Ravenswood where you wait anywhere for breakfast/lunch on Sundays, so I'm used to it. They try and get people seated as soon as they can. The chorizo breakfast burrito is SO good. My husband orders that all the time and I always get plate envy. I like the chipotle chicken salad(it's always on the special menu). They are generous with the avocado. I get one of their freshly made juice concoctions every time, as well. The apple beet is my favorite. We've always had good service and the servers are very friendly. They are only open until 4pm now. They used to be 24 hours. Their new hours blow, because there's times I'd love to get that salad for dinner, but I'm not geriatric, so I don't eat dinner at 3pm. Sigh.

51.description: Frittata's do not have hash browns in them. I was disappointed to find out that when they forget your order they will cook a skillet meal and say it's a frittata to save on time I only assume this because I didn't receive my meal until everyone else at my table was 1/3 through their meal.  Restaurant was busy and it's great that they have a juice bar which was the silver lining to an unhappy meal.  Will come back and try again

27.description: Great quality food, its a bit packed all the time, but the service is good, but plan to wait ten minutes to be seated.  I have ordered the eggs Benedict, love their sauce, portion sizes are huge.  My wife gets an omelette, always has left overs the next day.  I do with you get a side fruit with other items than just the Benedict dishes.  Pancakes are really good.  Wife liked the coffee. We go once a month, we will go back.

32.description: great food! EXCELLENT SAUSAGE. EXCELLENT. place was clean and well lit. staff mistook me for a men at least 3 times even though I'm a girl with dominant girl features but it's whatever. nice for an early breakfast with your lovers or friends or both

54.description: My wife and I ordered 2 skillets both had undercooked potatoes and undercooked veggies in them.

48.description: Great foodgood waiters and waitresses Bad service (people that bring your food always mix up orders and during Sunday breakfast rush forget about it)Management is a joke at best, they can get their staff on point.Improve your team Ellys

44.description: Went here for lunch ordered a turkeyy club it was good waitress for got to bring my soup by the time i got her attention  i had to go back to work and i had to wait 20 more minutes  to just get my check smh

24.description: The best brunch place on Milwaukee, so far. The place is clean, spacious and timely. The food is good (a bit salty eggs) but they serve large portions. Burgers look thick and each special has a unique flare to it. It can be a bit pricy for per plate ($10ish) but the portions and quality of the food make up for it. Their regular coffee is not very good but they offer gourmet coffee (recommended). I would def come back again just for the pancakes, best in area; 2nd best on my pancake list.Pros:-large portions (worth the $$)-spacious atmosphere/no crowd (noon, Wednesday)-very friendly staff-good food selection (pineapple omelet, gourmet burgers)-clean, clean, clean :)Cons:-regular coffee is bad (better off with espresso, or juice)- a little pricey-eggs can be a little too salty

7.description: Hubby's work fleet was in need of an oil change at the nearby Firestone, so I threw in an idea of having a breakfast together.  I've seen Elly's Pancake House on Milwaukee Ave. within the Gladstone Corner.  I visited an Elly's location on Cumberland in the O'Hare neighborhood last year.  I remember there was a plenty of vegetarian options for my husband who refrains from consuming meat and meat by-products.  Perfect!  Let's head over there!  There wasn't too much going on on a snowy Monday morning in late March.  The server, Giovanni, quickly introduced himself and commented on the Mother Nature, "What a beautiful weather we are having today!"  Now that Chicagoans have "sampled" the spring season in the early March this year.  Unfortunately, that sample hasn't yet turned into an "entree" format.  I guess we can't have a full-bite of Spring...at least not at this moment.  Anyways, having a hearty breakfast has nothing to do with the condition outside.  We were offered coffee immediately (one of the checklists initialed).  Hence, it was time for us to decided what we wanted.  I had the stuffed French Toast with blueberries, and hubby went with the Southwestern Fritata with pancakes on the side.  I usually an omelet or skillet kind of person, but I changed it up for something new, like how I dress on my days off!  Omelets and skillets are typically rendered in generous portions at Elly's.  Thus, if you're hungry, I recommend you make your selections from one of these categories so that you're content with what you have in your stomaches.  My French stuffed toasts were rather savory than sweet, which was what I preferred.  They did douse an ample amount of blueberries on top.  Overall, we were satisfied with the tastes of the food and the service we received from Mr. Giovanni.  This location has one of the cleanest restrooms I've seen in any restaurant recently (yes, you need gamble on using public facilities in the city of Chicago when you're dining in).  So thank you and keep up the good work.  I know their yelp rating isn't high enough to stand out in the crowd, but based on my experience this morning, I would say it's safe to try it out.

49.description: Bummed about their new hours. I would frequently order out for dinner and now I can't. New hrs are 6am - 4pm. It's still worth coming here for breakfast for their huge portions. 3 stars for the hours.

40.description: Never going back! The omlet was runny but the real turn off was the waitress. Had a bill of $12 and some change. I paid with a $50, waitress opened the book at the table saw it and walked away. Waited over 10 minutes before I saw her walk by, tried to flag her down and she ignored me and disappeared in back. After another 5 minutes I grabbed the hostess and explained I was waiting for my change. Again I waited, finally 2-3 people said it would be right here. Now as she stands off to the side she has a waiter bring it over and couldn't look my way. It's now obvious she was hoping I would forget and just walk out.

53.description: Jefferson Park needs a nice brunch spot, and unfortunately Elly's didn't hit the spot for me.  I was excited that they offered fresh juices but the food was really greasy so I wouldn't go back.  As far as ambiance, the lighting is quite bright and harsh and the decor is pretty minimal.  This place is in a prime spot so hopefully they do well but if you are not a fan of heavy greasy food then this place isn't for you.

30.description: Cozy place, delicious food, nice service! I come here almost every week, and I'll order their pancake every time. My must-order suggestion is the country fired steak. It is not to dry and not to MEATY. With a side dish of fruit (if you are a healthy person) or simply hash browns, you will find the most simple happiness here. Anyways, I love this place and I'll be here every week.

46.description: Mmmmm.... Another food trip with the best in and let me say Ellys Pancake House did not disappoint. We had the create your own skillet. Corn beef hash,ham,bacon, and American cheese with over easy eggs on top. Let me say "OMG" orgasmic  in my mouth. It's very hard to find great places with good breakfast. Customer service was good even though it was busy.

1.description: Been here a couple of times. Food is just mediocre to me. It's not bad, but it's not great either. Today I ordered the February Special: Love Cakes. It was disappointing; half the plate was still untouched when I realized I was over it. Side note: "Topped with strawberries" means a strawberry or two thinly sliced and scattered around the plate more so for presentation rather than consumption. They have wifi and will let you use it if you ask for the password, but it's incredibly slow almost to the point where it's unusable unless you have the patience and time to wait a few minutes after each click.The place is very clean. I've had mixed experiences with staff. Some times they're friendly and greet you well. Other times they seem indifferent or annoyed.Overall it's never been a terrible experience, but like I said, it's just not great or ever really my first option.

55.description: I am updating my review because many thought it was unfair that I base it entirely on one server. The food at Elly's is always good and there are lots of options to suit whatever diet you may or may not be on. I love the fries here. I love the different soups and there are always large portions of everything. Sundays get a little bit busy, but there is lots of seating so you will not be waiting long. All in all, this has been probably the best addition to the neighborhood as far as restaurants go. Not to mention, its better than Blue Angel was! As far as food goes, I am always satisfied with Elly's whether its breakfast or lunch. One of my favorite things to order is the stuffed French toast!

9.description: Love this place. The front is the restaurant and there is a bakery in the back.  They have great to go coffee and pastry specials.The breakfast is tasty and they have very interesting smoothies and juices. Love getting together with friends and family at this spot. Service is excellent every time.

26.description: The food was good service was OK our waitress forgot to bring our apple juice we left the restaurant without drinking The juice we pay for but other than that the pancakes were really good

25.description: came here with a big group of friends.. we were seated right away.. service was good.. food came out a little slow... i ordered a "create your own omelette" .. added basically every meat option they had and some mushrooms.. i thought the food was quite bland.. had to use a lot of hot sauce haha..we all also shared a few orders of biscuit with gravy.. i never had it before and i thought it was pretty good.. i dont know... elly's feels and seem to be like a Dennys or a normal diner except it closes earlier to me ...

12.description: I have lived in this neighborhood for 33 years and it is sad when u have local spots provide horrible service.  My wife and I just ordered breakfast and there is barely anyone here - the food comes out incorrect and cold.  We tell the server he fixes the order but still our whole meal is cold.  I tell them I cannot eat my meal and instead of removing the item from the bill they only deduct a portion.This is not about the money - the bill was only 20 something.  Does a few dollars mean more than a happy customer? A comp of the whole meal would have shown me that they cared I had a horrible experience.  I hope you enjoyed this 19$ it will be the last time we ever eat here.Our server Giovanni was awesome btw.

59.description: I was a patron of the old Blue Angel and they really turned this place around. Brightened it up a bit. I really like what they have done with the place! I grew up in the area and enjoy breakfast foods of all kind. The portions are pretty big and not all of it is bad. I do have to mention that it was busy in there and the service seemed lackluster. The servers looked like they didn't want to be there and mistook my order. Also, the pancakes weren't anything special. I mean for having the word "Pancake" in the name of the business you would think that the pancakes would be out of this world, right? Think again. Everything else was good, kind of hard to mess up breakfast foods.

21.description: A good restaurant, decent staff, and the place is busy, so they are doing it right.  The food is good and the coffee is tasty.

17.description: Previously frequented the Arlington Heights location, we were glad to see an expanded location in Jefferson Park this March.  The service was excellent, from hostess to runners to two waitresses.  All were very friendly and accommodating.  Loita and Tanya were especially sweet, attentive and professional.   The venue is very large and able to accommodate immediately at 10am on a Sunday morning, though it was quite busy.   The place is very clean.   We had the Spartan Omelette and Eggs Benedict.  Both were very good and large portions.  Lots of left overs!   Very impressed with the operation.  We will be back!

10.description: Yum yum yummy yummiest. Went with my big brother yesterday for breakfast. I had the pumpkin waffles with warm maple syrup and amazing sausage links that were not greasy and flavor packed.My brother had banana pancakes and bacon.He ate every bite. My hot chocolate came with whipped cream and chocolate sprinkles.Our server was attentive and smiled a lot. There is even a bakery where you can get fresh French bread and French pastry. This place smells like good coffee .i am in love.In the same parking lot is American Science and Surplus store where you can get many cool cool gifts and science supplies.

5.description: When I was pregnant with my son I had terrible morning sickness and the only thing I could eat was waffles from here. The waffles are really good.

3.description: I really like this place! It's cute. It's clean. It's breakfast. What's not to like? Parking is plentiful in the shared lot so getting in is a breeze. A hostess stand greets you at each of the two entrances. Even on busy weekend mornings they seem to be able to turn tables over quickly. I don't often get too fancy with breakfast, and if I do, it needs to be something more than fruit jam on pancakes. Elly's has Dutch babies and creative omelette options. This is the only place I know that puts bites of avocado directly into the omelette. Different and fun! Surprisingly, the little cup of salsa for your tex mex options is REALLY good. A little watery, but very tasty. Although, maybe it's not a surprise considering you can't find a restaurant in Chicago that doesn't have Mexican cooks. Love the coffee here. It's smooth and balanced, perfect for breakfast. While I like to dine in, the parking lot entrance takes you through the cafe. There you can order pastries, coffee and breakfast to go. They offer a handful of sandwich options that come with a cup o cafe.

35.description: I had an awful experience at this restaurant. This was my first visit to this establishment. The wait staff was friendly but our waiter didn't pay attention to my order. I ordered a cheese burger without onions. I have a severe allergy to this. My burger came with  red onion all over the pretzel top pretzel bun. I asked for a new top bun. He came back with a top sesame bun. I said whatever I'm starving didn't want to complain. I took a bite of the burger and it was filled with onion. I had to immediately spit it out. My husband had to run to walgreens across the street to get me some benedryl. I went into the bathroom to rinse my mouth and try to stop coughing. I had already taken my usual allergy meds in the morning. I finally came out of the bathroom. I explained to the waiter the situation my allergy and why I did not want another burger since the meat contain onion. The manager never came over. She wasn't concerned with my well being in her restaurant at all. The server asked if he could get me something else. I ordered a waffle and drank my husbands coffee to help me breath and took the benedryl. I could hardly eat anything after that incident. The manager was still unconcerned. The waiter took off the burger from my bill and apologized again. My husband took the bill up the manager and explained to her what had happened. She was not concerned and said she'd see what she do. She later came to the table and offered us half off the waffle and of course no charge on the burger. She continued that if I had explained to the waiter that I had an allergy this wouldn't of happened. I told her I had explained it several times that I could not have any onion. I'm speaking with her and still gasping for breath just to have a conversation. She didn't ask if I needed medical attention. She wasn't concerned at all. She said if I had ordered the turkey burger or chicken burger those didn't contain onion and I would be fine. Then she asked if i was satisfied with what I ordered. I said no. I wanted a burger without onion. I was not expecting to die that day. She was very unconcerned. I did not like how she handle things. We paid out bill and left. My whole day was ruined. I had to later get a shot to calm down the reaction. I would just like to warn other customers if you have food allergies please be careful at this restaurant some people in customer service jobs do not care about their guest or repeat guest.

19.description: I can't put my finger on why I minorly prefer the food so far from Blue Angel, but I dunno if it's the nostalgia talking in me, the fact you could smoke there(RIP pre-smoking ban days), or whatever. Anyway, my first visit here wasn't too bad, but the pancake dish I got minorly disappointed me some. It wasn't totally terrible, but I was expecting slightly better.It isn't too bad though, since I did try a few bites of what others got, and they weren't bad, but of course didn't blow me away. Then again it is just a diner, so I'm not expecting the highest standards in the world. I'd really like to try one of the juices, if I do come back here. They have a take out food and juice area in the back(prob for commuters to call in an order to go, and park in the lot and pick it up), and did clean up the interior and bathrooms a little bit from the Blue Angel days, which I did appreciate. I remember liking the German Pancake after I went to the North and Clark Elly's after it opened, so I'm crossing my fingers that my future visits are better here.ETA: IIRC, I think they're only 24/7 on Wednesday or Thursday through Saturday, and close after a certain time(midnight?) from Sunday through Tuesday or Wednesday. Once I'm sure of the hours, I'll do an edit to this yelp review page.

28.description: Good atmosphere, just average food.  Service was ok.  Breakfast shouldn't take as long as this establishment takes to make it.  At least they are trying.

45.description: Hubby's work fleet was in need of an oil change at the nearby Firestone, so I threw in an idea of having a breakfast together.  I've seen Elly's Pancake House on Milwaukee Ave. within the Gladstone Corner.  I visited an Elly's location on Cumberland in the O'Hare neighborhood last year.  I remember there was a plenty of vegetarian options for my husband who refrains from consuming meat and meat by-products.  Perfect!  Let's head over there!  There wasn't too much going on on a snowy Monday morning in late March.  The server, Giovanni, quickly introduced himself and commented on the Mother Nature, "What a beautiful weather we are having today!"  Now that Chicagoans have "sampled" the spring season in the early March this year.  Unfortunately, that sample hasn't yet turned into an "entree" format.  I guess we can't have a full-bite of Spring...at least not at this moment.  Anyways, having a hearty breakfast has nothing to do with the condition outside.  We were offered coffee immediately (one of the checklists initialed).  Hence, it was time for us to decided what we wanted.  I had the stuffed French Toast with blueberries, and hubby went with the Southwestern Fritata with pancakes on the side.  I usually an omelet or skillet kind of person, but I changed it up for something new, like how I dress on my days off!  Omelets and skillets are typically rendered in generous portions at Elly's.  Thus, if you're hungry, I recommend you make your selections from one of these categories so that you're content with what you have in your stomaches.  My French stuffed toasts were rather savory than sweet, which was what I preferred.  They did douse an ample amount of blueberries on top.  Overall, we were satisfied with the tastes of the food and the service we received from Mr. Giovanni.  This location has one of the cleanest restrooms I've seen in any restaurant recently (yes, you need gamble on using public facilities in the city of Chicago when you're dining in).  So thank you and keep up the good work.  I know their yelp rating isn't high enough to stand out in the crowd, but based on my experience this morning, I would say it's safe to try it out.

33.description: Great broccoli soup and home made bread! Fast service and friendly workers. Closes a little too early... Should stay open longer.

43.description: Fantastic experience!  Very friendly greeting from the host, outstanding and caring service from the waitress, and a manager that made sure every attention to detail was taken care of for an excellent lunch.  Their Greek chicken wrap is so yummy!  Highly recommended!  Looking forward to a return visit.

2.description: My friend and I ate here today and enjoyed our time! I definitely plan on coming back soon. :)Atmosphere: Very clean diner. There's also a bakery side to the restaurant as well!Service: Everyone here is so incredibly nice. We were greeted by everyone at the restaurant and everyone said bye to us on our way out. There was a little hiccup in that no one regularly came by to refill our water and coffee so minus a star.Price: Definitely reasonable. My specialty burger with fries and a soup was less than $10. Their juices are kind of high at $5 compared to the rest of the menu but that's about how much I would probably pay at another location anyway so not a big deal.Food: Everything I had tasted yummy. No complaints on my part!

18.description: came here with a big group of friends.. we were seated right away.. service was good.. food came out a little slow... i ordered a "create your own omelette" .. added basically every meat option they had and some mushrooms.. i thought the food was quite bland.. had to use a lot of hot sauce haha..we all also shared a few orders of biscuit with gravy.. i never had it before and i thought it was pretty good.. i dont know... elly's feels and seem to be like a Dennys or a normal diner except it closes earlier to me ...

41.description: Disappointed. This place has not met expectations. Too bad. I was hoping for a positive change but other Yelper's concerns are happening with frequency. Now this place is not open 24/7. Why not? Your guess is as good as mine. Maybe a complete change in management is in order. Perhaps get some staff from the Cumberland location. I really want this place to succeed.

52.description: This place is regularly packed, though we often come around brunch time so that is to be expected. The customer service is great, they pass out samples of their croissants to the parties waiting (almond croissant is delicious and they have a decent arrangement of other pastries and desserts). The food is excellent and prices are fair. Overall, this is probably one of my favorite restaurants in chicago. They are definitely doing something right & judging by their customer numbers & satisfaction, it shows!

50.description: Cozy booths draw us here once in a while. The waiters are friendly and accommodating to our special requests. It's a family friendly place where the locals from the Jefferson Park area gather. Food is typical of a diner. They have juices, specialty coffees and yummy pastries too!

4.description: Absolutely LOVE this place!   My office is 4 blocks from here and thank GOD it is because it's hard to find good places to eat healthy around this area.  They have a great Cajun chicken salad that I get almost every time.  Their breakfast items are good too.  They even have a little bakery in the back which I love to get cupcakes and surprise my staff with.  I love the fact that they have WiFi and the place is quite enough to have a business meeting too.  A special thanks to Heather who takes care me with TOP NOTCH service every time!  A go-to place when your in Jefferson Park!  :-)

6.description: Let's go straight to the point: if you love good brunches and huge portions, this is where you should go. Everything there is good, omelettes, crepes, waffles, salads, pancakes... pick up whatever you want on the menu and I am sure you will not be disappointed!Service is good but unfortunately, food came slowly.Also, their "fresh squeezed orange juice" is not freshly squeezed, or they mixed it with water... but it didn't tasted at all like a freshly squeezed orange juice.

22.description: Arrived and my party was seated quickly. The service is disastrous; they messed up my order and didn't even offer anything. I've been a long time customer but locations has made me stay away from ellys

15.description: The best brunch place on Milwaukee, so far. The place is clean, spacious and timely. The food is good (a bit salty eggs) but they serve large portions. Burgers look thick and each special has a unique flare to it. It can be a bit pricy for per plate ($10ish) but the portions and quality of the food make up for it. Their regular coffee is not very good but they offer gourmet coffee (recommended). I would def come back again just for the pancakes, best in area; 2nd best on my pancake list.Pros:-large portions (worth the $$)-spacious atmosphere/no crowd (noon, Wednesday)-very friendly staff-good food selection (pineapple omelet, gourmet burgers)-clean, clean, clean :)Cons:-regular coffee is bad (better off with espresso, or juice)- a little pricey-eggs can be a little too salty

57.description: Horrible!! The only positive was that it wasn't overcrowded. The service was sub par. Food took forever and hash browns were raw. Pancakes came out when we were finished with our food. They brought us a second round of hash browns and they weren't cooked either. Manager was kind enough to "take off" my meal. I didn't eat my meal and handed it back to her after biting into raw hash browns. Go to the Elly's on Clark and North. Forget this place!!!!

20.description: Let's go straight to the point: if you love good brunches and huge portions, this is where you should go. Everything there is good, omelettes, crepes, waffles, salads, pancakes... pick up whatever you want on the menu and I am sure you will not be disappointed!Service is good but unfortunately, food came slowly.Also, their "fresh squeezed orange juice" is not freshly squeezed, or they mixed it with water... but it didn't tasted at all like a freshly squeezed orange juice.

36.description: Really good food. Great variety... Lots of options. OJ is orgasmic btw (Must have)The service is pretty good as well.Everything is clean and location is excellent (IMO)Really enjoyed this place in the summer time when I could get a great meal late at night... These "Winter Hours" SUCK tho. It's June and you're only open till 4? SMH3 Stars for the lame hours.Guess I'll go to Golden Nugget! -_-

14.description: This is one awesome pancake house. It has fresh squeezed orange juice, real maple syrup, real coffee cream served in a small pitcher.  The eggs are great, and so are the omelets. The coffee and lattes are a real treat for coffee lovers.

3.description: I read these reviews on yelp and thought l should try that place but I am never going back here. She finished my hair in 3 mins. She said that she has 20 years experience. What kind of experience she has I am not sure.

1.description: I needed a haircut quick and my usual stylist was unavailable.  This place is right by my office and I saw it was under new management so I gave it chance.  I am very happy with my decision.  Lori took me as a walk in and did an excellent job...my style/cut is not that complicated but i was very happy with the result none-the-less.  I would recommend to any guy in need a of a hair cut.

2.description: On a whim I decided to get my haircut but I was nervous. Being new to the city, I didn't know where to go...I turned to my trusty sidekick, yelp.com, and start researching salons. I came across this one and thought I'd give it a shot...I'm glad I did...the staff is so friendly and welcoming...Lori did my hair...I will say...she is amazing...she's so nice and upbeat and really knows how to listen to her clients! I am crazy picky, but she listened to everything I said and then delivered...she gave me the best haircut I've had in 2 years! Lori is my stylist for as long as I'm in Chicago! !  Love love love this place, I recommend it to everyone...

0.description: I was out one day about to visit my girlfriend. I wanted to get a haircut for so long, and I thought I'd surprise here. I found Ninety West on a semi-quiet street, Higgins Ave I believe, and I thought I'd give it a shot. From the outside the salon looks like a tiny hole in the wall. As soon as you step inside though it looks clean, neat, and professional. Normally I don't go to salons... but I was there already so I got my haircut. The staff was OUTSTANDING! My stylist asked me in detail what I wanted done for my hair, she treated me like a king. I received a hot towel treatment kind of what I get at a barber shop, but this felt so much nicer!This salon definitely caters to both women AND MEN! Their prices are reasonable, and for what you get... ITS A BARGAIN! This is definitely my new favorite place to go for a haircut! Sorry Chuck ( my old barber)

4.description: An excellent place to get your hair cut, even for men. I've been impressed every time I've been there and I won't go anyplace else now if I can help it. Lori and the staff do a great job and everyone is so friendly! Don't forget to look into their other services too. Plus they offer a discount for your first visit! Can't go wrong.

3.description: I was disappointed in the food quality at this specific Popeyes. I've had Popeyes at other places in the Chicago area that was worlds better. I was unpleasantly surprised by the inconsistency here.

1.description: Redeemed my survey receipt for a 2 piece white meat. They have a policy where they ask for ID when making a card purchase which is cool. I can respect that but I had a visa gift card and they would not accept it because it doesn't have my name on it. I think that's a joke and taking their policy too strict. I think I will file a complaint through visa. They are legit cards. That was one complaint. The other one is that the chicken breast was horrible. It was small and nearly meatless. The breast had the black veins in it which was very unappealing to look at.

2.description: The food is good and the restaurant isn't filthy.. but the cashier is almost always awful. Some of the worst customer service I have received numerous times in a row. I'll just go to the location on Harlem from now on.

9.description: This place has officially struck out. I visited 3 separate times and all there times I walked out because they didn't have spicy dark meat available and asked me if I would wait 15 min while they prepared some. I have never encountered this at any other popeye's. It sucks that when I have the taste for some popeye's, I can't go to my local franchise for my fix. I'll start going to the one on harlem, south of higgins.

10.description: Always liked Popeyes Chicken.  Service here was good for a new store, has ample parking, and fried chicken delivered as always.  Very happy that this location opened close to home.  In summary, good food, okay service, okay prices.  Tip:  Always check your local mailers for Popeyes coupons!

4.description: BEWARE THIS Popeys sells rotten chicken to its costumers. Then when you take it back and confront them the manager there by the name of MAY "what she said bc they don't even have name tags" Will try to play you for a fool and tell you that the rotten nasty chicken smell is their seasoning acting like I never ate Popeyes before in my life. Be aware people luckily I only had one bite of it and haven't gotten any poisoning yet it's been 2hrs since I ate it.

6.description: For some reason this Popeyes produces just a flavor wave of smells that hits everything within 5 blocks of Jefferson Park. Coming home at 9pm I couldn't help, but stop by this place to see what was going on. I haven't really been to Popeye's in years because I try to stay away from fast food and they've really lost their edge in the food game that they used to have.Will this Popeye's redeem the franchise? Sadly no. Everything at this Popeyes is perfectly cooked, the chicken perfectly crisp, fries done perfectly, etc, but the spices they used to have aren't there. The chicken was just regular chicken. I honestly could've made a more flavorful batch at home. Fries looked like they were seasoned, but when you eat them they're just regular fries, you don't taste the cajun seasoning at all for all that cajun look. The biscuit was the best part, I honestly wish I would've took the honey they offered. With the overwhelming smells they were producing, this place was empty and has average quality food which was extremely disappointing. All of the food I had was made fresh because they had no customers so they were just making things on the fly. Looks like it'll be a couple more years before I try Popeyes again.

11.description: Great Popeyes food!  I showed up at 9:15 excited for their sweet tea, only to be disappointed.  Their barstools were upside down on the table, but they're open until 10!  Don't let that fool ya.  I was worried I would be the only one there and many many more showed up between 9:15/9:30

5.description: I've been going to this Popeyes for years it's a great location. The staff are veery nice and helpful! The food is Popeyes quality and the management has deals every once in a while! The location could be slightly cleaner however!

7.description: No Star you know why? Because this place Sells Spoiled Chicken I got sick off Of it and am Looking forward to sewing  them, on top of that i am 3 months Pregnant.

8.description: Sure it's fast food, but there's just something about this Popeye's that makes it stand out from the crowd.It could be the service. Every time I come here the girls behind the counter are smiling and enthusiastic. They make sure they have my order right. I've watched that way this team works. Unlike another restaurant I've reviewed, at this one you have the front of the house making sure everything is going smoothly while the back is cranking out the chickens.The best thing is that every time I ask for a honey packet, I get 4...with a smile. Like it's their pleasure and not an inconvenience to give me a honey packet.Finally, this Popeye's must make their biscuits from magic! I can never get enough of them. They're usually my favorite part of the meal!

0.description: This review will as usual be very subjective.I love this location with the windows looking out to Jefferson Park CTA transit center as I can watch buses passing by, people hurrying around to get places and jets flying in and out of O'Hare, while enjoying my favorite meal of fried chicken legs, rice with red beans and Hawaiian punch. The interior is very nice. Light music playing makes me wonder how things are going over there in Louisiana.It was never crowded in there. Staff's attitude is okay, way better than at McDonalds.My favorite fast food spot so far. If they were open 24 hours I would rate them 5 stars.

The Outlet Store has been around for maybe 20 years so i wonder why it doesn't have a place on Yelp until now.Located in Jefferson Park / Forest Glen neighborhood right across Elston Ave from the Secretary Of State DMV facilities there.  A good part of their business was parasitic to crowds of people renewing their vehicle licenses and so forth but with a evolution to online methods that's gone down.An outlet store in an older and broad sense as they're definitely not tied to any chain, discount merchandise at it's most random = oddments.The type of stuff you'll find here's a 50/50 mixture of typical outlet store cheap ware plus what maybe termed 'distressed merchandise'?  Also surplus supplies from hotels & hospitals i'd guess.  Towels & bedsheets at rock-bottom prices their main attraction.  Plus a lot of things that don't fall into any usual category.  I'm certainly not criticizing much less looking down my nose because i uncover a thing or two each visit that i know i can put to good use at major savings and am happy I do.Unfortunately my shopping visits aren't as numerous as they used to be since they're only open 9-5 weekdays though they had saturday hours not long ago.  Now a new Mariano's grocery store just opened across Elston there so activity should return.

12.description: Best place to have a drink and play some darts.Bartenders so nice and friendly mostly the Polish ones ;)

7.description: When it's raining and you want to keep conversing and have another drink and you're denied your original destination because turning left on California would involve turning into a building (meaning your car would ram into a building, not that you yourself would transmogrify into a building), inevitably you end up at the Jefferson Inn. Perhaps not inevitably, but today I feel like believing in destiny, so let's just go with it. As a physical space, this bar has what it takes-- a bar, some stools, booths, booze. It looked like old patterned wall paper had been painted over with black paint, or else they'd managed to get mold underneath the walls to grown in an intricate fleur de lis pattern. The walls are also adorned with mirrors (to help you surreptitiously check people out, I guess?) and kitschy art including a classy Rita Hayworth print and a less classy "Beauty is in the eye of the beerholder" sign with an anthropomorphic beer mug with a face and legs (and maybe genitals, but I couldn't tell and really wasn't in the mood to ponder it). Populating this space was a nice mix of patrons, including quiet drinkers in deep contemplation and a group of people who were getting their crunk on in a most civilized manner. My favorites were the couple engaged in an elaborate juke-box based flirtation in the back room, including a pseudo lap dance and a lip sync rendition of "You're the one that I want" from Grease. There was also some girl on girl grinding dance action, which, for a bulk of the population, is a guaranteed aphrodisiac. The bartender was sweet and attentive, able to rattle off the fairly significant beer list off the top of her head, and checked in with us at our booth a couple of times, which I appreciated. Conveniently located across from the Jefferson Park transit hub, this is a place worth stopping at if you've time to kill or just like a no frills drinking atmosphere that still has character. Maybe next time I'll plan my trip in advance and have dinner at Gale Street Inn first. Ribs & Rita Hayworth seem like an unbeatable combination.

20.description: Aw, hell, yeah. Some of the creepier people in one of the creepier neighborhoods north of Vittum Park; great jukebox; foxy, brassy waitresses; location right off the Jefferson Park Blue Line stop; and cheap-ass beer add up to a lovely night out.This, friends, is a true dive: the regular barflies give you the stinkeye as you walk in the door, and ladies, rest assured that they'll have some choice words for you if you come in unaccompanied. There's also a harmlessly-freaky crackhead who wanders among the tables yammering about Jimi Hendrix, light spectra, and the universe at large.The Jefferson Inn will never, ever be trendy, overpriced or anything but the sweet little rathole it's been for decades. God bless this place.JUKEBOX: Three plays for $1.

19.description: Never seen a bar this small that still manages to have booths. I was able to park right outside the bar the night I went and it was fairly crowded. It is rare to be able to do this to any bar in the city and that shows how much of a walkable neighborhood bar this is for jefferson Park. I still can't beleive that I was able to walk within twelve steps from my car to the entrance. For that I give this dive an average rating. Nothing too special about this bar and the choice of drinks seems to be very limited.

1.description: I guess if you like listening in to townies arguing with each other and making horrible comments about women, this is the place for you.  No draft beer.  Basically just crap beer in bottles.  I don't know why anyone would ever go here.  Tear it down and put in a bar with real beer and people who aren't jerks.

2.description: Walked by this place so many times since I live in the neighborhood and I only walked in recently. Beer is good, cheap, the waiter really nice... now I'll go there more often. Location is perfect as well, just by the CTA!

9.description: Great bartenders. Cheap and cold beer. Plus, I can grab a beer between the train and the bus? Yes please. Great location across from the Jeff Park transit center. I have to admit, there has been more than one day I tried the door before 3pm, needing them to be open. Great bar!

6.description: I have been coming for years now and I LOVE it. Steve the owner is so nice and definitely grateful to his patrons. On more than one occasion he has provided grub food FREE of charge ---from BBQ to sandwiches. Once he even went to Super Dawg and brought back a ton of dogs/fries for us. The place is exactly what you want from a dive bar -dimly lit, laid back atmosphere, all different personality types, cozy booths and of course, CHEAP drinks!  Irena is the.best.bartender.ever. Ana is sweet too. They pour some pretty stiff drinks and oh yes, the juke box is bangin' all night playing hits from Journey, to Frank Sinatra, to Snoop Dogg. Love this place~ :)

18.description: One of the Best...wait...Scratch that...Thee Best Dive on the far north side.Friendly drunks and regulars and some rather cute bartendresses. yes, i just invented that word. extreme close proximity to public trans, and low low prices mean you have no reason not to get blind drunk. and it is entirely possible to get blind drunk!

10.description: I'm a big fan of this place! Their bartenders are so nice and creative :) and the cocktail are awesome! Recommended ;-)

13.description: Best dive bar in the city!  When I first started coming here a few years ago, I'll admit that I was a little intimidated at first by the distinct  "Star Wars Bar" vibe to it, but now, most of those "characters" are my drinking buddies...Pretty cheap place to drink, juke box is usually blasting some good tunes, and the bartenders are all Smoking Hottt!!!

16.description: I had found this bar in a book and was just curious to see how much of a "dive" it really was.  However, it may be small, but it is very comfortable and welcoming.  The people were pleasant and friendly.I found the bathrooms to actually be usable, which as a female, says a great deal.  I did not feel out of place in the establishment.  The booths in the back served as a great place to drink without having to sit at the bar.  I do not live in Jefferson Park but I would make a point to go back there again.

17.description: Milwaukee Avenue just keeps getting lonelier the further north you go.  Once past Lawrence, the street itself is forsaken even by the blue line train.  But just past Lawrence, across the street from what appears to be a statue of Darth Vader in colonial attire, is this last oasis of hospitality.Dark place, a sociable and semi-rascally mix of silhouettes will greet you with more than just stares; they actually have something to say.  Anything goes, from the looks of your clothes to the relative merits of execution by guillotine, to the way the nearer northwest side used to be back in the day.  If you happen to join the framed posters of Nita Hayworth and Marilyn Monroe as being the only women in the bar, you stand more than a fair chance of outdoing those stars for their attention, whether you like it or not.  But behind the bar, cosy booths offer an opportunity for privacy.

15.description: This place is a good place to kill time when you have nothing to do on the way home using the CTA or Metra.

0.description: The Jefferson in is one of my favorite neighborhood stomps. Its been there for 40 years and then some I believe. Friendly neighborhood place and the bartenders make it even more welcoming. And Steve the owner is an absolute riot.

5.description: Great place to just hide on "Saturday Funday" which is exactly what that dog did!  OLD STYLE On Tap?  Cheap Prices? Great Bartenders?  Divey Booths?  Shady Characters? MUST SEE!! ifp

11.description: I've walked past here a million times... and looked in but never stopped in. During Snowmageden 2011, NOTHING was open. I went to Gale Street Inn (only restaurant open in the area) but I didn't want to end the night after dinner so I peeped a lit Old Style sign and knew it was my night to try Jefferson Inn (the ONLY bar in the area that I was open). Holy shit this place is a dump but sooooo perfect! Agnes the bartender is super friendly and is so on top of her shit it's not even funny. If your beer is half full, she's already checking on you to see if you want another one. They have a popcorn machine behind the bar and sweet, sweet Agnes will make sure you have a full basket at all times. She'll introduce herself when you walk in and make you feel comfortable the whole time you're there. They have a juke box, cheap beer, cheap shots, crazy regulars, and a sweet bartender. What more could you ask for? ~~~CASH ONLY BAR~~~

8.description: If you're into dive bars, then you'll like this place. We've been there several times and really enjoy it. The bartenders are very energetic and attentive. The place is small, dingy and very old school Chicago with some very interesting regulars!!

3.description: Above average dive bar. Friendly bartenders & their regular patrons are chill. Cash only bar with low prices. They have darts & a rear smoking area if you're a smoker.

14.description: I believe her name was Agnus, a great bartender talking up not one but all six of us sitting at the bar. I was waiting for my girlfriends train at Jefferson park blue line stop which is right across the street. I also stopped in the first time on new years eve and it was packed yet cozy.

4.description: Stopped by while killing time before a wake nearby.....Eva was most welcoming and made us feel quite comfortable.  Love the kitschy dive bar feel----would definitely recommend this place for the friendly staff!

3.description: I've been here a few times to get contacts and glasses. Honestly, I also don't understand the negative reviews. The owner was pretty nice and the lady that helped me (I think his daughter) was really knowledgeable and friendly. I got a year supply of contacts about a week ago and was pleasantly surprised to find that the eye exam would be free of charge as a service to me. The eye exam itself was thorough and similar to ones I've gotten at other places, and they gave me a few options with contacts. As for the glasses I have gotten (2 pairs now), I've been very satisfied with my purchases. The frames there are fashionable. They have the bigger fashion frames that are popular nowadays and a lot of designer frames in the display cases which looked really nice. The lenses were way more affordable than other opticals even with all the options I got like the anti reflective and anti scratch coatings, and when I say affordable, I mean that they were easily $100 cheaper. They said they had the lenses, so I got to get my glasses within half an hour. This was awesome as I usually have to wait a week or so at other places. They even made sure they fit and had no problem adjusting them for me. You also get a free case and microfiber cloth with a purchase of a pair of glasses! The exam for the glasses were free as well, and that was also thorough (pressure test, dilation, etc) . I stop by sometimes to get my frames adjusted, and they are more than happy to do that for free. Sometimes, it does take longer when they're really busy, but that makes sense. Also, they seem to be comfortable adjusting their own frames, but they did warn me that they can't be held responsible for damages when I brought in another pair I previously had. I've brought both my parents in for their glasses needs, and they were both happy. My dad did have to wait a week for his progressive lens though because they didn't have it in stock, but that was fine because the lenses were way cheaper than Walmart where my dad got them before ($260 vs $150).  My mom got 2 reading glasses for $100, and she loves them because the prescription they put in the lenses were perfect, and there were a bunch of frames to choose from. This place is just very reasonable with prices and services. I'll definitely be back.

1.description: The man here is EXTREMELY rude. First, he told me he would charge $40 for the prescription. Then he said I needed take an $80 eye exam first, even though I had taken one with him in the past. He said he had no record of it, but his "record" is a piece of computer paper with his handwritten notes. When I asked him how much each box of my contacts would cost, he looked at the boxes I brought in and arbitrarily said "$70 a box." He didn't look it up or refer to anything. When I started ask him more questions, he was curt, and then stood up and walked away from me to the other customer. The customer service here is the WORST. The price for glasses and lens are not that expensive, but the quality is terrible. The lens feel like plastic and they do not even clean well. I would pay much, MUCH more for better customer service. Any owner who walks away from a customer who is willing to pay for the services clearly should not be in a business where he must interact with people on a daily basis.Also, after reading the reviews, I realized how ridiculous this place is. He told me he's been working for "40 years" whereas another review was told "30 years." The other reviewer was offered an eye exam for "$150" and I was for "$80." One reviewer was denied a prescription where as I was told I could obtain it for "$40." Honestly, where is he pulling all these numbers from? Just for extra information, your eye doctor MUST release a copy of your prescription after an exam/fitting, as required by LAW. So clearly, this man has no idea what he is doing.

2.description: Went with my parents after hearing good things about Eye Story. I received a standard eye exam, a pair of contacts, and a pair of generic (but decent quality) glasses for $162. The owner was very informative and helpful. This is probably the best looking pair of glasses I have purchased yet... while being the cheapest. Very happy with the result.

5.description: Stay FAR FAR AWAY from this place. Guy who examed my sight can't speak English. I'm not even sure how he got his license or even has a license to practice. Customer service? Forget about it..Never again

6.description: you honestly get the best deals at this place. I had my lenses replaced here for $75.00 !!!! Lens crafter charged me $350!! I also took my gf here and she got a pair of frames and anti glare, anti starch lenses for $100!! you cannot beat this deal, the customer service is pretty decent depending on how many customers they have but honestly..the cheapest place to buy glasses. I def will be going back here time and time again.

7.description: I bought a pair of glasses in Korea but was having dizzy spells so I went in to this place and they told me my prescription was off. I took their advice and took an eye exam again which cost me $150. I then had my lenses replaced my glasses for another $100. A few days later, one of the lens immediately popped out of my frames, indicating that it was not correctly cut or inserted. When I took it back in, the girl there tried to pop it back in with her bare hands but ended up breaking the lens! She told me to come back in 30 min so they could cut me a new lens. Once I got a new lens, a few days later it AGAIN popped back out! When I took it in, this time she was there with her father and he told me it was my fault and the frames were poorly purchased. I went on to explain that the silicon that previously held my lens inside the frame was missing since they first replaced my lens. I remember this distinctly because I had specifically paid to get silicon in the frames when I first purchased the glasses in Korea. However, the man CLAIMED that in his 30 years of business, he had never heard of such a thing and basically accused me of making it up! They fixed my lens again and said it was the last time they would do it for free. Not too long again, the edge of my lens just cracked! It was so random and the lens was obviously poorly cut and crafted. I can acknowledge that my frames may have been manufactured badly and it's my fault for choosing them but accusations and lack of professionalism towards their customers, that I cannot overlook! This place is all the markings of poor, dissatisfactory customer service as well as overcharging and lack of experience. I won't even get into the eye exam...

8.description: I can't believe the level of customer service this place DOESN'T have. I bought a $200 pair of frames from these guys and within a month, the frames began to peel. The lady was understanding, saying that she can replace them. However, the owner (and I believe her father), comes over and begins telling me that it's my fault. I mean, why bother? They're being replaced and he's got to get into my face accusing me that I was placing them down wrong. I mean, it wasn't the store's fault that the manufacturer's design was poor, so why get in my face? I asked if I could get a different brand since it'll probably just happen again with the replacement pair. They said no way. I walked out dissatisfied and irritated with the lack of customer service. I get home, and there's a voicemail on my phone letting me know that I could only get a different brand if I chose to get my lenses with them. Obviously, they didn't care that I'd lose money from that deal, throwing out brand new lenses that I purchased from somewhere else.  All I can say is, ALL THEY CARE ABOUT IS GETTING YOUR MONEY!

0.description: Huge selection of Asian fit glasses. Walked out with a pair of ray ban glasses + lenses in an hour. Great CS.

4.description: I just returned to get new glasses to replace the one that I got about a year and a half ago.  They were so kind as to offer me a special price of two eyeglass pairs for the price of one, as I found two frames to my liking.  With all my lens options chosen (e.g. ultra thin, anti fog, anti scratch, etc.), it was like $120 including taxes for each pair including the eye exam.  Thus, it was cheaper than any chain eyeglass store like Lenscrafters and Pearl Vision, and it was noticeably cheaper than Walmart.  Eye Story has an incredible selection of fashionable eyeglasses, and the owners and managers keep the eyeglass styles up to date with the latest trends.  All the frames I ever purchased there were sturdy and of excellent quality and looked great.  The customer service was also excellent.  The owner is a Korean middle aged male who is rather quiet but respectful.  His daughters who work there have amazing service skills who will honestly give the best recommendations for you.  They never push any sales on me and they have the glasses ready in like an hour or two.  This is sooo nice because even at Walmart they send the glasses out and you have to wait a week.  If you want great eyeglasses for very good prices, look no further than this location.  The ONLY thing I wish they carried were Circle Lenses but I think the U.S. government does not allow these to be sold within the U.S.   I respect those that want to save as much money as possible and I believe this is the very best eyeglass place in the Chicagoland Area because it has the right combination of price, service, product, and speed of completion for your hard earned money.  And you cannot really go to the Internet for eyeglasses because you really have no idea how they will look on your face with any degree of accuracy (submitting a picture and copy and pasting on eyeglass frames is not very effective).  And over the Internet you won't get an eye exam...

29.description: Home made sausage!!!  The best.  Even better beef n sausage.  I get mine on garlic bread with a side of their great sauce.  My month is dripping just  thinking about it.  These guys are italians!!! They know how to do it right!  Great take out.  Good thin crust to go.

42.description: I was fortunate to discover this place, and I look forward to going back!Mr. V's Pizza looks like a standard, mini strip mall, greasy pizza joint from the outside, situated near some Metra tracks. When I first saw the place, I assumed that it was there because it's only one of two places to eat in the area and therefore, the food just fills you without leaving you wanting more. I was wrong.When you walk in you can tell that the place is run by a family who takes pride in their restaurant and spending time to prepare your food well. The menu also included items that I didn't think a normal grease spoon would have, like breaded scallops!I didn't have the opportunity to try those scallops but I did eat grab a slice of pizza and a soft drink. Initially, I was annoyed that my slice of pizza took 15 minutes to prepare, especially since I was with friends and we were in a rush to get somewhere. However, the long wait time made sense when the slice came out -- it was a slice of freshly prepared (French?) bread pizza! The slice was a nice big rectangle of tasty bread topped with sweet and tangy tomato sauce, and a good amount of sausage. The slice was also larger than I expected so I took some of it home!Despite all of the great pizza I've had in Chicago, I look forward to eating more of the unique pizza that Mr. V's has. Although next visit, I'll make sure to give myself enough time to sit down and enjoy the food.

23.description: I wanted to like the pizza here, I really did. And maybe the other kinds are fine, but the pan pizza I had delivered was a nightmare.It was clearly undercooked, but I was hungry as heck and ate it anyway. At the time I probably would have given it a 2.5, but then ... well. It wrought some havoc on my digestive system. I'm not lactose intolerant or allergic to anything that goes into your standard pizza, and it was the only thing I ate for lunch and my sorrows started soon after, so, yeah.The delivery guy was nice, though. I'd praise them on it coming pretty quick, too, but that was clearly at expense of the pizza just not being cooked all the way.(Also: they deliver pizzas in a paper bag. What? Not a huge negative or anything, just really weird.)I'd recommend, uh ... anywhere else, really.Maybe you'd have better luck ordering in, or maybe I ordered on a bad day.

47.description: Nice little place with tasty pizza, burgers, hot dogs, and some of the best crinkle cut fries ever! Also serving ice cream, which is a nice treat in a Chicago fast food place.

8.description: I moved from Elston Ave. a few years ago .  I deicded to try them again after getting tired of another pizza place.   I LOVED IT.  It was tasty, crispy, and delivered hot !!!  I will be glad to order from them again instead of the other place.  GREAT PIZZA and the delivery driver and phone order taker very pleasant.

31.description: Need at cheap tasty thin crust pizza fix? This is the place. Greasy in a good way.

34.description: I haven't had Mr. V's pizza in a while but I remember it being really, really good. It is greasy, but in a VERY good way. They have a very good crispy crust and the pizza is loaded with cheese and toppings. Pointers for pepperoni under the cheese! Although I never set foot in the actual restaurant, I know that it is practically the size, if not smaller, than the average living room. Although in Chicago, all the best joints are the smallest.

16.description: i thought the pizza was decent, wife thought the cheese was chewey. she said she didn't need to try it again.that's all we ate, no sides no dishes. we might be open to checking out entrees some time

13.description: We love Mr. V's! We have been in the neighboorhood for many years, and have ordered from Mr. V's at least once a week. Everything on their menu is tasty. I usually go for their chicken tenders and bbq sauce, but the pizza is also wonderful. They have plenty of coupons available, just check their menu. The staff are friendly and remember our order. Check it out!

11.description: I became a little nervous when we went inside to pick up our pizza. The place smells. No, it doesn't smell like food. It smelled like mold. Pizza was okay.

39.description: When it comes to thin crust, Mr. V's is the BEST. It's unlike anything else you find in NYC or Chicago for that matter and I love this place. Cripsy thin crust, gleaming flavorful cheese and a savory/sweet sauce will have you licking your fingers after each slice. Their cheeseburgers are awesome--neon green relish, onions, mustard and old school crinkle fries can't be beat. Hot dogs, roast beef--everything is delicious. We usually do takeout, although you can eat inside, it's small and no frills. Chicago is so huge that you'd never find it if you were just traveling through the city but it's definitely a neighborhood gem.

37.description: love this place. homemade pizza, fresh ingredients, and their toppings are tasty! get their sausage, mushroom and pepperoni pizza. it's the best. friendly staff too!

0.description: I came here for lunch with a group of 15 special needs students. They were very patient and very accommodating with us. And the food was great too!

38.description: Everything here is great my only complaint is they are not open early enough on Sundays to order for football which is when I order 90% of my pizza.

27.description: I have to apologize to Mr. V's for NOT ordering food more often!!!! My family and I have been ordering from Mr. V's for over 20 years. However, I moved a little further away and haven't ordered in about 9 months.Needless to say, I was NOT disappointed!!!  The pizza is still some of the best the city has to offer. (Especially the Thin Crust) You can really tell they use fresh ingredients in the pizza, and the Italian Sausage is great! Personally, I like the Mr. V's Special pizza. But I've never had a bad pizza from them...EVER!!  The people behind the counter (who also work in the kitchen) are always warm and friendly.  Plus you can find them on Groupon Now with some deals. It just keeps getting better!

32.description: The Italian sausage here is the best, had just the right amount of jus! The pizza was delicious as well. And the guy that waited on me was right it was worth the wait, which wasn't all that long anyway. I love the fact that you can tell that they care about customer satisfaction and they are passionate and take pride in what they do. I will definitely be back!

44.description: I'm not reviewing what the actual place is like, since I've never stepped foot inside the strip-mall storefront(but have driven by this place every so often, mainly when I've had to do a trip to the nearby Elston DMV for something). Rather, I'm just only reviewing their thin-crust pizza I ate while at a friend's party, which I thought was pretty decent. I'd give Dino's Pizza a very slight edge over Mr V.'s for quality of their thin-crust, but I still liked their pizza. Their veggie pizza(among the 2 types of thin-crust I tried from here) was pretty good, and my favorite of the 2 I had. (also had their pepperoni pizza, but picked off the pepperoni, since I'm not a fan of pepperoni)After trying their pizza, I sorta wish now that the few times I've used the across-the-street Forest Glen Metra stop, that I did run into here at least once. Next time though when I need to again use that Metra stop, I definitely will make a stop here, as it seems like it could be a good place to stop at after returning into Chicago from an out-of-town train trip.I'd be up for possibly trying their thin-crust pizza 'easy cheese' style, or their crinkle cut fries, as other yelpers have noted about.

24.description: do not buy thick crush by the slice at night time! the cheese is worst than 5 dollar hot and ready! thin cheese way too much bread! very small slice and reminds me of high school pizza! the girl tax me twice total $4.66 with small drink. worst of the worst pizza/never again! you will get better pizza if you buy frozen pizza. i rather go to Pete pizza on western or TeDino's pizzeria in uptown. last time i check this place got 3 stars review now it is all five? that is how i found the place! Yelp!

7.description: Best pizza in Chicago.  I have been ordering from them for at least 32 years as they had other locations at one time.

40.description: I still love Mr. V's. You might be interested to know their menu. Here's a link:chicago.menupages.com/me…

30.description: I grew up in the neighborhood, and my parents used to order Mr. V's pizza 25 years ago, and we loved it.  Just moved back in da' hood, and wanted to see if it was still as good as I remembered it to be, and guess what?  It is!  Nice, thin, crispy crust, awesome sausage, a sweet but not too sweet sauce, and juuust enough grease!Sometimes you CAN go back...

46.description: Mr. V's has some of the best thin crust pizza I've had in Chicago.  I order it "easy cheese" (less cheese) and extra sauce.  I have never eaten in the restaurant as the ambiance is lacking, and I only live a couple blocks away.  Also, I've never had their other menu items, just pizza.It's good!

1.description: It's cheap and worth every penny.  Last time I ordered from here I had spaghetti and meatballs, traditional Italian fare.   The spaghetti was overcooked and the sauce was very bland and flavorless, it was "marinara" meaning no meat and certainly no spices.  I would have done better with a bottle of Ragu.  The meatballs were smallish and made predominately with bread crumbs and not meat.  I've ordered pizza from here before and stopped,  pizza was salty and not good.

9.description: Thin crust is the best, and for some reason even plain burgers are tasty! I must get the chicken tenders every time I go.

26.description: Eh, I'm sad to say that I'm not a huge fan of this pizza. After all the rave reviews, we ordered a thin crust with lots of toppings, and it was just ok. it was very cheesy, but the cheese had kind of a fake flavor and the crust was not nearly the crispiness that others here described. The sauce and sausage were not overly flavorful either. Not terrible, totally OK, but Paterno's or Phil's please my palate better.

25.description: Their pizza is average. It's not bad - I would certainly eat it again if placed in front of me. Or if you were getting a bunch of pizzas for a kids party, it would be good. I wouldn't say it was very good and it's certainly not excellent. If given a choice, I'd try to find another option. I have been fortunate to have some VERY excellent pizza. I have also had some not so good pizza. I'd give them 2.5 out of 5. On a positive note, the gentleman answering the phone and the girl working the counter were VERY nice people.
