12.description: Mr. V's, you had me at "right next to the Forest Glen metra station."I mean seriously, people, how much easier do you want it to get?  Here's a straight-up, down-home Chicago pizza (or whatever else sounds good that you don't feel like making yourself) joint.  This is not a place for picky people.  This is a place for people who don't want to cook, who like tomato sauce.  I think that covers all of us at one point or another.  Prices are reasonable and the wait isn't long (most people pick up and do not eat in, though there are a few tables).  Is it fancy?  Ah, no.  But that isn't why you went to Mr. V's....I have to say, though, they do really pride themselves on using fresh ingredients, and they always run coupons, either on their website or in the packs that come to the house.  Be on the lookout!Transit options:Parking - Free and easy in the front lotMetra - Forest GlenCTA - 92 (Foster) bus

21.description: Maybe they have new owners, maybe the dont...but this place has gone to shit, they charge an arm and leg for crap.  Wheres the quality?? wheres the mountains of toppings?? Wheres the owner who gives a shit???

17.description: I have to apologize to Mr. V's for NOT ordering food more often!!!! My family and I have been ordering from Mr. V's for over 20 years. However, I moved a little further away and haven't ordered in about 9 months.Needless to say, I was NOT disappointed!!!  The pizza is still some of the best the city has to offer. (Especially the Thin Crust) You can really tell they use fresh ingredients in the pizza, and the Italian Sausage is great! Personally, I like the Mr. V's Special pizza. But I've never had a bad pizza from them...EVER!!  The people behind the counter (who also work in the kitchen) are always warm and friendly.  Plus you can find them on Groupon Now with some deals. It just keeps getting better!

10.description: The Italian beef I had was bad. The meat was tough, and so was the bread, at one point I had to gnaw on the bread and meat like a wild animal. The beef had the typical peppers on it, but also had jalapeno peppers, which was odd. Delivery was slow.

5.description: Best thin crust pizza in the city. Besides the pizza, the Chicken Parm's the best I ever had.

3.description: I paid too much for my cajun chicken sandwich. There was a small piece of chicken hiding in a very small bun. This came with fries. I paid almost $8 for this. Possibly $8 after taxes. I got iceberg lettuce that barely stayed inside the bun, and they piled it on! It slid out when I took a bite because it was up against the mayo on the bun. The unhealthy iceberg lettuce and the unripened and flavorless tomato made up most of this sandwich. I had to pull 3 out of the 4 very large and stiff leaves of iceberg lettuce out of the sandwich just so I could find the meat hiding under it. otherwise my sandwich resembled one of those bouncy balls from the early 90's that looked like Saturn, and you stood on the ring and jumped up and down on the bottom ball while keeping your ankles firmly gripped around the top part of the ball. That was how far the lettuce was extending out of my sandwich. The chicken was made up primarily of breading and little actual meat. Overall, I was not satisfied with my purchase. There are better places to eat in my neighborhood. I was just desperate and looking for something to wolf down while my laundry dried next door. Again, had the sandwich been an actual sandwich and not a slider, I would have given this place 3 stars. I'm really just irritated because I feel like I got ripped off. If you come here, I'd suggest that you stick to the pizza, but then I really didn't find their pizza all that great either.

35.description: Sometimes you just want one slice of pizza, well this is the place to go!  I liked their thick but prefer their thin.

19.description: Just wanted to say that the food here is great and the staff is pretty awesome too!And please if you have a bad experience or something wasn't right, please call the owners Orazio or Lou and tell them.They care about their joint and I think it would hurt to not know if something slipped by!

28.description: The pizza is Super.  The sausage is so lean(they make themselves) not much these guys can't do well...they make a spicy pizza on request with hot peppers.

45.description: Great little hole in the wall neighborhood pizzeria.  I've ordered literally hundreds of pizzas from this place over the last decade.  It's always fast, great, & friendly.  I've never had the thick or pan pizza, or much of anything else from their menu beside the thin pizza for that matter, so I can't comment on that.  Someday I might just have to try their pan to see how it stacks up against Lou's.

33.description: Been getting their pizza for over 30 years.  Super thin crackery crust and tangy sauce... OMG....

43.description: They have a BBQ Chicken with Bacon Pizza!!Did you hear that? With BACON!!Deeeeeeelicious!!Folks, we have a winner!

2.description: Log story short: horrible delivery customer service.I placed an order with this restaurant at 8 pm, thinking I would try a new restaurant to deliver some pasta for dinner. It was expected to show up at 9:21. When 9:25 rolled around, I called the Mr. V's and a frazzled cashier answered the phone and I explained my situation and wanted a update on a delivery. Her response was that they were really backed up (at 9:30 on a Sunday) and that they just sent a delivery driver out with my food. I waited and stood in front of my window as the night was getting late and at 10:15, with no food delivered yet, I tried calling the restaurant again. Not knowing the hours, the restaurant was closed. I was pissed and now refuse to eat there from their shady customer experience and a no show of the food I ordered (from which I found that it's not worth the hype from the previous reviews)

18.description: I still love Mr. V's. You might be interested to know their menu. Here's a link:chicago.menupages.com/me…

41.description: I love the Italian beef! It's alot bigger than the one I got at Al's on the Westside and they give you LOTS AND LOTS OF MEAT! It's well favored with just the right amount of jus! I got grilled onions and peppers for 38 cents extra. They sell RC Cola, instead of Coke and Pepsi, which I haven't had in years! I was tempted to get a pizza slice too, but I resisted. It was hopping that night; families,business men and high schoolers were picking up their pizza orders. I was doing my laudery next door so I sat down to eat. Very,very clean. I'm going for the pizza next time I go!

4.description: Pizza Time!! Im starving!! Called ahead to make sure they had a slice ready, and they do. Most of the time the food here is great for the price. I wouldn't go getting a chicken sandwich from a grease pit but i do love their cheese fries.  Their Italian beef is good but stress  it loudly if you want extra peppers and sauce on side, they always forget or dont write it down. !! Ok im hungry now so im going to cut this short.. Yummy@!@

6.description: Ugh, the food here is pretty bad, which is unfortunate because it's right down the street from us. The pizza is just blah - so much so I don't really remember it. Worse, though, was the Italian beef that tasted like rubber - gross meat.They also quoted us 10-20 minutes, and so when we arrived after 15 minutes, kept telling us 5 minutes as we sat there for 40 (and never once apologized or offered any kind of make good).

22.description: Mr. V's, you had me at "right next to the Forest Glen metra station."I mean seriously, people, how much easier do you want it to get?  Here's a straight-up, down-home Chicago pizza (or whatever else sounds good that you don't feel like making yourself) joint.  This is not a place for picky people.  This is a place for people who don't want to cook, who like tomato sauce.  I think that covers all of us at one point or another.  Prices are reasonable and the wait isn't long (most people pick up and do not eat in, though there are a few tables).  Is it fancy?  Ah, no.  But that isn't why you went to Mr. V's....I have to say, though, they do really pride themselves on using fresh ingredients, and they always run coupons, either on their website or in the packs that come to the house.  Be on the lookout!Transit options:Parking - Free and easy in the front lotMetra - Forest GlenCTA - 92 (Foster) bus

15.description: Went here for the first time and I thought it was going to be great since all the reviews were pretty good. Honestly, the pizza sucked. Maybe I caught them on a bad day?

20.description: I live nearly a mile or less from this fine establishment. Many storefront pizza places can be hit or miss however Mr V's is amazing good. I often do the special or just get a coupon online for the free 10" pizza with any 16" pizza. Love it! Also collect the coupons with your pizza and get a free one after 10 or 20. I can't remember. Service is always quick and helpful even though always under the gun. Glad to have this establishment in my neighborhood.

36.description: Mr. V's is right off the Forest Glen Metra stop.  Great way to call them on the train for pickup on the way.   The pizza driver once waited on the Metra platform with a fresh pizza for the customer getting off the train.  I saw the transaction taking place, as if it was a drug deal.   Kinda funny.  Their pizza is definitely worth trying.   They have slices, so if you're far north on Elston Ave, it's worth driving by for a slice. They have good beef sandwiches too.  It's a pizza stand with limited seating, but better to carry out.

14.description: I wanted to like the pizza here, I really did. And maybe the other kinds are fine, but the pan pizza I had delivered was a nightmare.It was clearly undercooked, but I was hungry as heck and ate it anyway. At the time I probably would have given it a 2.5, but then ... well. It wrought some havoc on my digestive system. I'm not lactose intolerant or allergic to anything that goes into your standard pizza, and it was the only thing I ate for lunch and my sorrows started soon after, so, yeah.The delivery guy was nice, though. I'd praise them on it coming pretty quick, too, but that was clearly at expense of the pizza just not being cooked all the way.(Also: they deliver pizzas in a paper bag. What? Not a huge negative or anything, just really weird.)I'd recommend, uh ... anywhere else, really.Maybe you'd have better luck ordering in, or maybe I ordered on a bad day.

3.description: This bar has a laid back atmosphere. There is not a sign on the jukebox that disallows any song that you play, as a matter of fact it is online so you can play any genre of music that you want. Somebody doesn't know how to read!!!  Angie is the best bartender fun and funny, Elizabeth is cool as well. Erin works nights and is very friendly. Drinks are very reasonable and you can talk to anybody or no one that's up to you. This bar has been here for many years and with good reason! Sooo if you find the Friendly unfriendly that's because you have no friends hehehe!!!!!!

1.description: this place is very UNFRIENDLY ! came here with 5 or 6 friends and the bartender IDd me and asked me to pronounce my last name instead of asking for a 2nd form (if needed. not sure why it would be since it's very current and looks just like me) there was a reason I didn't want to say my last name out loud . why have old ugly rude bartenders on a Friday night?! never again.

2.description: This place is anything but friendly. The bartender made me feel uncomfortable and did not seem to want me there.  When I mentioned the service to a regular that was sitting next to me, he said he noticed it too. Shortly afterwards I was told to go back to my country by some man sitting in the corner then told to leave by the bartender. They must have been native American. I was shocked. A nice couple I met outside that lived a few houses down told me they too were discriminated against and were told their "kind" was not welcome either. They should really rename that bar.

5.description: This place is pretty much as advertised, if we're talking about the regulars. Friendly's is your typical neighborhood bar on the north side, filled with 9-5ers who've been there since 6. The bar isn't flashy and you won't find any hipsters, but the drinks are cheap and the juke box is ok. There's a lot of country and a little bit of Queen and AC/DC. The bartender can have a little attitude at times, but once you get to know her she'll take good care of you.If you're not into talking to strangers this might not be the place for you. Like I said, all the regulars are friendly. It's the only bar I've been to where it's just assumed that you're there to talk to everyone else, and I mean EVERYONE. I wouldn't really go out of my way to head back here, but I certainly wouldn't complain.

0.description: So is this place friendly or not? I'm so confused... reading the other reviews, it seems two in favor of friendly, two say unfriendly, and the other one is diplomatically and equivocally neutral.So I put it to the test, to decide once and for all. I ordered a Hacker Pschorr (solid, cheap beer at $3.50) and when I got my change I made a point of dropping one of my quarters on the ground.Suddenly the conversation in the bar turned entirely to my quarter ("Ohp, he dropped one," said some dude all the way across the bar. "There it goes," said another.) Within ten seconds I felt a tap on my right shoulder. It was some woman handing me my quarter.Verdict is in. Friendly it is!

4.description: Thought this place would be a cool place to stop, being the name seemed enticing.... DO NOT BE FOOLED!!! My boyfriend and I walked into the bar sat down and it took 15 minutes before we got served and it wasn't cause it was crowded there was a total of 5 people in the bar including us. She had a hostile attitude and the regulars wasn't to outgoing with us. The jukebox also has a sign which basically says if we don't like your music we can kill the song your playing. Then just don't carry that music. If I put in money for music I'd like to hear it. After seeing that sign I decided that playing music and having another round was out of the question. Friendly Tavern, um no it ain't.

3.description: This place IS pretty big for a dollar store.....  But I give a 3 because of it's cleanliness. It looks pretty shabby.  Think of a grocery store with white tile gone gray with dirt and needs a good mopping.  They have a wide variety for a grocery section, although I'd be skeptical for not knowing how long shelf life is for any item there.  Definitely would need to check expiration dates and the presence of gunk on top of canned foods.  But otherwise, I think it's a place that "does the job" when you need some random household appliance or tool that you don't want to spend much for.  Otherwise, I'd avoid it if possible.

1.description: Never been to a Family Dollar before, but this place is located only a block away from the Dollar Tree. Personally, I'm a bigger fan of the Dollar Tree because pretty much EVERYTHING is a dollar there.Family Dollar, not so much. It is pretty much more like Family Dollars, as you have to pay attention to the price tags there. A lazy mofo like me, when I go to dollar stores, I expect to pay no more than a dollar per item. The trade off here though, is that they sell a lot more items than the Dollar Tree, due to the fact they sell items for more than a dollar.The prices here are "meh". I'm getting more savvy with shopping and I can say that most of the items are priced higher than say, WalMart. For example, the Red Baron pizza you can get cheaper at Jewel-Osco. The one thing I saw that did catch my eye were the bedsheets. They went for $16, while WalMart goes for $20, Amazon Basics, for $19.99. Not sure how good the $16 sheets are, but at least that was cheaper than the aforementioned stores.Overall, come in here with caution; You don't necessary save more money going here. I think this place just gives the illusion that you are getting the "best deal", since technically, this falls under the "dollar store" category.

2.description: I don't know what happened with this particular store . I feel that every day goes down, as saying in organization increasingly in poorer , before I loved going to this store for your organization and cleaning , which is now very difficult to see. all disorganized boxes in each corner and the register are detestable. Many Family Dollar stand by for bad organization and this was a flagship store in all organizational standards but now is "one more" in the list  if disorganization talking about..

0.description: Another dollar store popping up in my neighborhood! It's much larger than The Dollar Tree and more of a selection. They even carry cheap clothes...nothing too great but you could salvage the stuff for material if you're into sewing. I typically go here for cheap chips and candy. It really could pass for a mini-Walmart...this place is so big! Every toiletry, cleaner, etc. you'd want!

56.description: This place is pretty good. I came here for two piercings. The first time I came I had my lip done by....dras...who is an awesome piercer...he was really good. The second I got my ear done but by a different guy who was kinda rude  but I'm not expecting them to like have a tea party with me so whateverprices are goodpiercings are less than most placesplace is cleanand it's fairly new

29.description: I normally don't go out and prays people's work on sites like this. But I don't normally win an award for a tattoo either. That is exactly what happened. Angel Cruz and I have gotten to be friends over the 14 months or so that we spent together working on my back and chest piece. I had back surgery a few years ago and I wanted to have a tattoo showing what it looks like on the inside. It turned out great. That inspired me to think a little bigger. I wanted a Japanese dragon coming out of my back , across my shoulder, and across my chest. This mans creativity and skill took over from there. What a talent. Now, about the award. We hadn't quite finished the tat when a tattoo convention came into town. I decided to enter the full back. We came in second with an incomplete tattoo! If you want that really special tattoo, the one you'll love and that will turn heads, see Angel.

42.description: Nice staff, terrible piercer. Some guy  did my tragus piercing and it had the worst time healing. Turns out he pierced it on an angle where the post goes too far in to my ear. Never would have came here but it was open late so I did. Ill never come back here again.

23.description: Best shop in Chicago! Professional staff. Great artists!

47.description: I went there to get my nipples pierced and I got great customer service. The lady that took care of us at first was very friendly and personable and she told us it would be a few min for the gentleman to get ready. It literally took less than a min before the piercer was ready to do the job. I believe his name was Jake I was so nervous about the piercing details of names are vague. He took time getting ready it's a very clean environment in the back. Everything they use is prepackaged and sterile. The gentleman was very good about talking and making sure I was comfortable and ready to do it kept talking to keep my mind at ease. He marked the spots and had the piercing done with ease in less than a min and almost no bleeding at all. He made sure to explain everything about the healing process and cleaning of the tattoo.All in all I would definitely go back there for a piercing in the future and perhaps even a tattoo. I was watching the guy who pierced me drawing out a tattoo when I got there and he does some awesome work. Definitely recommend them they did a great job and the best yet if I have any problems which I doubt will be the case they are only two blocks away.

8.description: My husband and I wanted to get tattoos to celebrate our one year anniversary. Based on the recommendation of two friends we decided to just check it out. We had general ideas of what we wanted . We walked in on a Sunday afternoon and we were immediately greeted by a friendly gentleman. We told him we were interested in a couple of tattoos and he introduced us to Uriel. Uriel patiently listened to us and and it was like he knew better than we did what we wanted. Simple , clean tattoos. He drew up sketches for us and we loved them , no tweaking needed.  He was very nice , friendly , professional and patient . We were both at ease instantly. My husband went first and it Uriel took his time and it was perfect. When he was done with my husband, we sat and chatted while cleaned up and prepped for mine. The station was cleaned , new equipment set up for mine . Mine was quick and easy , and we are truly in love with our new tattoos. This used to be a bar and its decorated very cool , funky . The bathrooms were clean , all the stations were clean. When you walk in they have tablets you can look at with all the different artists photo galleries . We are going back for a couple more new ones and a cover up for an old one and Uriel had some really good ideas for us . We are thrilled with Uriel and everyone else . Thank you guys again!

31.description: I was looking for a piercer to change out my trustee navel ring with PTFE pregnancy jewelry. I bought a highly rated piece and found that it is recommended that the shaft be autoclaved and the piercing changed by a pro. ChiTown said they couldn't use my new jewelry, but also didn't carry PTFE (or any) flexible navel jewelry that I could buy, so I'm out of luck. Two stars because the girl who answered the phone seemed nice; I was on hold for several minutes, so I'm assuming she really tried to find something pregnancy friendly.

34.description: The phrase "you get what you pay for" has never been more true to me before especially after visiting this parlor. My naiveté baited me in here especially since the signs on the front stated that piercings were $30, and I was jonesin' for a septum ring.I walked into an empty parlor on a weekday afternoon. There was no one there for about a minute, and finally a man approached me. I initially thought this guy was a plumber because he had zero tattoos or piercings and wore the type of clothing one would wear when fixing toilets. He said he was the piercer to which I said, "Oh, ok." He then had me sign paperwork and all that liability jazz. Now, I knew I was getting a $30 dollar piercing the moment when I felt him slowly twisting the needle inside my nose. I started to cry spontaneously because of the natural nerve irritation and the fact that it hurt so much I felt like the crazy dude from "Saw" booby trapped my face and this man was digging for the key that would prevent him from dying a painful gut-wrenching death. I also started to bleed profusely from my nose which was strange since this has never happened before. Moving onto other horror films, I began to look like one of Michael Meyer's victims from Rob Zombie's "Halloween". I also told this dude that I needed to be able to flip my ring in for work and he assured me I would be able to do that. ANYWHOOO. Next morning before I had to go to work, LO' AND BEHOLD the ring would not flip inside my nose. I tried. My boyfriend tried. It was no use. The barbells were fused too tightly together and this ring was as stubborn as a mule and would not budge whatsoever. My only choice at the time was going back to that parlor and demand that I get this problem fixed. I ended up having to miss work which was fucking ridiculous because my boss said that septum rings are kinda hardcore and may frighten the geriatric clientele at my work. When I returned to the shop the second time, I was greeted by a different piercer. I explained to her what happened and she said she'd be able to fix it. Thankfully she was able to separate the barbells and I was able to flip the ring inside.Lesson learned: stay away from  piercers who don't have piercings or tattoos. ALSO do more research in regards to who will be doing your piercing so you don't end up with a shoddy job I will not be going back here hell noooo.

16.description: Got my piercings done by Christian. He was clean and professional. Also very calming and made the process go by smoothly,  I highly recommend him.

13.description: I seriously think this is the best place in Chicago to go just because it's super sanitary very clean and all the artist are super nice and they talk and work with you without a rush.

11.description: I am very happy with the tattoo I got.  My artist was Brian.  He did a very good job with the placement. The font is exactly what I wanted. He is a funny and charismatic guy.  I can't wait to show off my tattoo! The prices are a little high but the quality is also. It's going to be on your body for the rest of your life.  You might as well pay good money for it.

39.description: Got my nose pierced here, belly too. I swear everything they do is crooked. Belly ring ring seemed crooked so I got a good ring to hide it so you'd never know. But my nose ring, how do you do that wrong. Process went smooth, it wasn't until months later I go to replace the ring and found out it was pierced odd even with the needle on a slant so I wasn't able to put a new ring in bc I couldn't find the exit for the hole. It closed from the inside so now my ring is partially in. They say "there's nun we can really do bout it... Yea" that's it. Wow.

37.description: I went here for my first tattoo since my friend lives right near it. I read the reviews on yelp and decided to give them the benefit of the doubt. I walked in, and the first thing one of the guys had said is, "What do you want?" in a very rude manner. I decided to think nothing of it and explained what I wanted. They tweaked my design because they said the first wouldn't work on my foot, and since I liked the new one, I agreed to it. It was just an outline of a dove holding a small flower, no bigger than the size of a  fist. It took only about 20 minutes, and I really liked the end result. Unfortunately I later found out that I over paid for the tattoo ($120). My tattoo artist was nice enough, so props to her, but everyone else had attitude problems, and I don't appreciate them ripping me off. I'm sure they do have really good service, etc, but I unfortunately didn't see it when I went to see them. But if you do decide to get your tattoo done here, do NOT tell them it's your first tattoo until after they've quoted you a price. I have a feeling that's how they rip people off. I'm still debating whether I want to come here for my next tattoo, or find somewhere else,  but as of this moment, I don't see myself going back anytime soon.

0.description: Just got my left nipple pierced and Christian did a fantastic job. I got my right one done at a different location and wasn't happy with the service at all. I called before and spoke to Christian about it and he assure me he'd do it properly. I was more than satisfied with the service. Right when I walked in the door everyone was so friendly. I highly recommend this location for any and all piercing.

38.description: Great people, great talent, comfortable place, chill atmosphere, professional. You won't be disappointed. I've gotten my last two done here and was so happy.

51.description: I pass by this shop every morning on the way to work, and on the way home... I have never stopped in there (and frankly had no intentions to do so) until last night.  I went in there with a friend to help her purchase new nose rings. We both had some questions about fixing existing tats.  Let me just say this was THE best experience I have ever had at a tattoo shop!Jerry greeted us, and asked us what we needed to have done.  I then showed him the infamous crappy wrist tat I got a year ago.  The lettering was all faded, and looked like it said STELL instead of what it was really supposed to say (STEEL).  Jerry looked at it, and immediately told me what the problem was, and how he could fix the tat.  Funny thing is he was the first artist to NOT tell me it couldn't be fixed. He asked if I wanted it done last night, and I pretty much himmed and hawed... I figured I would come back in a couple weeks for the work.  I perused through his portfolio for a bit, and was immediately impressed with ALL of his work.  Sometimes when you see an artist's portfolio you don't get a sense of what they are best at - but in this case, ALL of Jerry's work was amazing!  He even mentioned that he draws almost every single sketch!!  I was impressed, and knew this was the man for the job (and for my future work too).  He finished up my friend's tat (which by the way looks BEAUTIFUL after the hack job she first got), and started on mine.  Jerry, if you read this, I cannot thank you enough for the gorgeous job!!!!  I am in love with the way you fixed my existing tat!  Not only was my original idea recaptured, but it was recaptured correctly, and at a fair price.  ChiTown Tattoo is a GREAT shop, and a non-pressure environment.  I am so happy I decided to spend the money and get my work done by Jerry.  They definitely have a repeat customer for a long time coming!  Thank you for making my STEEL tat look fantastic!!!

27.description: I'd give 5 stars based SOLELY on my second experience with Marina... but because she had to fix what someone else here messed up, I had to keep it at 4. I work in the spa industry, So I hate to write bad reviews, because I know they can affect your livelihood and your career....BUT If i'm getting something on my face that I'm not happy with, I think that other potential clients should be warned. I went in for a septum piercing on Saturday, I had been wanting it for a year and finally got the balls to get it done. I called, asked if there was someone available, there was, I went in got seen rather quickly and I was in the chair in the back in about 10 minutes. Maybe it's my fault for not researching my piercer better, I just trusted that the work would be superior. Barry was my first piercer, he was professional, knew that I was nervous and tried to keep my mind at ease by talking to me yadayadayada. BUT... as soon as I saw it, my first question was, "Does it look crooked?" One side was lower and closer to the front, and the other side was higher and closer to the back. and it wasn't sitting flat on my face... I had to keep pushing it down to try to train it.  He said that I had more cartilage on one side of my nose and that it was swollen.  I gave him the benefit of the doubt by letting it heal for 2 full days to alleviate the swelling before I asked another person at another shop who clearly said, "Yea it's crooked and people say its swollen when they know they effed up."........................Greaaaaat =/ how embarrassing I have this crooked shit on my face. So I called on Monday and spoke to a manager and he referred me to Marina who was going to be in that day. I went in... she saw it and said that it was pierced too far back, she told me to take it out and gave me a card to come back in a week to get it re-pierced by her. I asked her if she could take it out for me and when she did she said that where it was pierced at before would not interfere with the new piercing and that I could get it re-pierced that same day. AWESOME!! As soon as she finished she smiled and said, "You're gonna love it, it looks great!" I love when people take pride in their work because I do the same!!!I am NOW, COMPLETELY happy with the way it looks. It looks the way it is SUPPOSED to and they handled their business in a manner which makes the client happy over anything. I've already referred 2 of my girlfriends to Marina. Thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!

32.description: I have been to Chi-town 3 times for piercings and have been impressed with their process and results. Full disclosure:  I am the mom of  teen daughters who have gotten a few piercings, so I have accompanied them to give approval.  I'm not the "piercee."    As a non-tattoed and non-pierced parent (except for my ears) I was somewhat intimidated to go into a "tatoo parlor", but I was pleasantly surprised at the atmosphere of Chi-town.  The employees are very pleasant and professional and the shop is clean and organized.Daughter 1- Nose piercing by Marina  who is a piercing Goddess! Marina is very professional and funny at the same time. She keeps it real and the piercing was done perfectly!Daughter 2- bellybutton piercing by Marina (see above)  and  surface tragus piercing by Barry- who is a piercing God!  He is a really  nice & down to earth guy and a perfectionist regarding  his work. He provided very good information about all kinds of  piercings including the proper location of piercings and the proper care and cleaning of pierced areas.Lastly, Chi-town is less than 1/2 the price of  Jade Dragon for exactly the same piercings.

54.description: clean, convenient, reasonably priced, and friendly! my friend wanted to get her foot tattooed (pretty simple design) so we went straight to tattoo factory since we had stuff done there before....i know prices go up due to inflation and everything else, but they wanted over $100 more than what she ended up paying at this place! the only reason i don't give it 5 stars was the agonizing wait...but i was pretty hungry so every minute seemed like an hour. i'm definitely recommending chitown tattoo to all my friends, and will most likely be back soon for a tattoo of my own!

48.description: Called on the phone to get information on a piercing for my 17 years old. They were friendly, and knowledgable. The place is neat and clean. Sean did an excellent job with my daughters belly button piercing. The price is great. He spend a lot of time explaining to my daughter on how to care for it. Love this place, I will be back to get my tattoo.

44.description: im writing this review because im so tired of reading the aweful things others had said about this shop.i got my belly button pierced and my best friend got his tattoo done here last year in August. the piercer was very nice and my best friends tattoo artist was pretty friendly. i mean, we weren't expecting them to treat us like old childhood buddies, but no way were they rude.i went back to the shop last week and wanted a price quote on a piece that i've wanted for a while now. i talked with the artist, Angel Cruz, and said he was able to do this piece for me. before i decided to get the piece done, i went to other shops and asked for their prices on the tattoo i wanted. yes, there was another place that was charging me $50 cheaper, but from Angel's pictures/portfolio of his past work, i knew that i was going to be very happy with my tattoo. (if you really think about it, you pay for what you get). After speaking to him about my idea for the tattoo and a similar tattoo design, he was able to draw out my design. He made me feel as comfortable as i could. i love my tattoo and i would recommend going to this place for piercings and tattoos :D

24.description: I cant say much good about the other staff.. Angel is rude and over expensive... His work is very nice but if your not looking to spend too much on just letters he is not your guy.But Rafal is a great artist !!! He is very friendly and helpful. He did my skulls and my boyfriends puerto rican flag and we both get tons of compliments on them. He is a highly recommended artist. He is very well priced. The overall place is clean, but like I said not to friendly at all.I give rafal 5 stars but the attitude in this place is a 3.

7.description: Got my tattoo done here 3 years ago! Excellent quality! Paid 70 for a hand sized tattoo :) No bleeding or peeling. I also just got a rook (piercing) yesterday, and they were pretty good...but not as excellent :)

49.description: First, I came here with a simple 1.5 inch tattoo in mind.  Well, the sketch that Bill Bumps drew was fine.  I ok"d it.  I also picked out the colors.  All seemed okay.  I have found out since, in talking to other experienced people,  that the $120 I was charged was too much.  But my biggest and saddest problem is that the color is no where near what I picked out.  I picked out more of a lavendar purple and my tattoo looks black instead, honestly.  I had mentioned to Mr. Bumps as he was doing it that it looked dark.  He lied and said that it would lighten up to 3 shades lighter than the ink bottle I had picked out.   Well, 3 weeks later it looks black.  On top of that there are faded spots in between.  I am having it removed by laser now and I am gonna probably be out hundreds and hundreds, maybe even a $1000.  My other issue is that he was running around doing errands around the shop.  And when he did sit down to do my tattoo, he ends up in a conversation with some other client across from me.  Uhhh, could you pay a little more attention to something that is supposed to be engraved into my body permanently?  Also, why are the artists on top of each other...anybody heard of elbow room?  Save yourself alot of heartache and despair as well as money...please go to Insight Studios on Milwaukee Ave.  That is where I got my first tattoo, but then a coworker recommended this place and since it was closer I decided to try out.  Bad mistake.

40.description: Open until 2 am? Yes! Takes walk ins in a timely manner? Yes! Provides parking behind the building? Yes! So it was a no brainer when I came here for my first tattoo. The paperwork is also pretty painless and only three pages where they ask you the basic information. My artist Joey was great, I was super nervous but he showed me why there was no reason to get excited. I thought it was reasonably priced as well. I got a wrist tattoo that was two lines across and it was only $50. I had been other places that had quoted me more but I had chickened out. I was comfortable the whole time and everything was clean and well organized. On a Friday night, even though they were really busy, I only had to wait about half an hour without an appointment. Joey also told me to come back for free touchups in the future if I needed them but right now my tattoo looks great. It's the morning after and it isn't even swollen or painful anymore. I'll be back for sure since I've now been bitten by the tattoo bug!

53.description: I have been recommened by an acquaintance to go in and get the tattoo I wanted there as Bill Bumps has estimated it (from her description and the picture she showed him. They're friends) and told her it should not be anywhere more than $50. Or so she said. "Perfect," I thought. I go in with a picture of what I want (a word, Pamietaj. It was already in the font I wanted and everything. Perfect size. I just wanted it to get transferred to the back of my neck.) Bill Bumps says it will cost me $130. WTF? Hadn't he told my friend that he will do it for much cheaper? The sign also says "Tattoos starting from $40, especially names" Isnt a word pretty much similar to a name? There was no way I'm paying 130 for a small tattoo of a word!!! I negotiated the price down to $100, which was still expensive but I felt bad so I just went for it.The tattoo process was good, not very painful and Bill made me feel comfortable and he bummed a cigarette before so that was good since I've just ran out. But another thing I really did not like was that he forgot to tattoo in the dot over the letter "i". Like.. wow. Really? Of course I didn't know until way later when I got to take off the bandage and it was already too late to say anything. I don't recommend that place. Sorry.

30.description: GO TO CHITOWN.I'm not sure why other people have been giving such low reviews, but I can guarantee that you will NOT be disappointed here. No, you will leave happy and confident that you were well taken care of.I started coming to Chitown right after I turned 18, a few years ago. The first thing I got done was my tongue piercing by Sean. He's one of the best. I've seen his tattoo work, he's funny, and he's not only talented, but extremely professional. I've never felt more comfortable in my life.Fast forward to a few months later. I went back to get my belly button pierced. Kelly did that and, again, I had no issues with the piercing. Another super outgoing personality and a piercer who knows what the hell she's doing.Continue on to when I got my eyebrow and lip pierced, both by Chuck. I, unfortunately, had to take these out for the new job I got, but Chuck is the best. When I got my piercings done, he suggested a placement, and me, being the know-it-all I think I am, ended up changing the placement. He complied and I ended up realizing I should've taken his advice at the beginning. You'll notice how a smidge of a centimeter can make all the difference, and Chuck knows his placement. He's always there when I go back now and I wouldn't want to go to anyone else again. He is older and wiser than 99% of any piercer I know.I have gone to other shops (won't name names) in the area, and none compare. I had my industrial and other piercings done at another place, and ended up coming back to Chitown for issues I had with those. I was in yesterday with an industrial problem. The bar was so short that it didn't heal properly. Chuck immediately looked at it, and even though it was done at another shop, offered to clean me up and change it to the proper healing jewelry. He had their apprentice, Dani, do the piercing change. I was a little nervous having her do it instead of Chuck, but he was there the entire time, and she made the entire process painless even though my piercing had been giving me pain the past few months.I finally went in for a tattoo tonight. I got it done by David who was fantastic. Excuse me for being a puss, but it was my first tattoo and I almost passed out, despite the fact that it's about 1inx3in in size. He immediately calmed me down, grabbed water, and made sure I was good to go before he started again. He took his time with the line work and made sure I loved it. I'll admit, I was picky as hell about it, having him adjust things before we finished. And he was such a good guy about it. I probably drove him nuts with all my nit-picking, but he never once rushed me even though I was there past closing time.Another great thing is the pricing. It's affordable and you get quality. Normally the saying is "you get what you pay for", but I've never been able to get a $30 piercing and have it come out flawless. The other piercings I've paid top dollar for at the other shop were the ones I ended up coming back to have looked at/fixed. I had gone in for a tattoo quote and, contrary to what another Yelper said, David held his word. Dani even gave me a business card with the quote, date, and David's name on it to confirm when I came back if needed. I trust these people so much. They remember you, they treat you well, they let you hang out for a conversation when you're there, and they make you feel like you belong. My biggest love for this place is that they care. Before and after anything you get done, they take the time to explain everything to you. They make sure you know how to care for your tattoo/piercing before you walk out that door. And if you come back with an issue, they take care of you right away. Every single person in there knows what they are doing and can assist you just as good as the last person you saw. It's a place that truly cares about their clients and has a full fledged team of skilled and professional employees, all the way from the owner to the apprentice, and that's as good as it gets for me. I will never go anywhere else.

46.description: I always pass this shop and I was also recommended by a couple friends to go here. One person got her industrial pierced and another got her tongue pierced. After looking around for a great price, clean shop, good reviews, I just ended up here at ChiTown Ink. I was greeted by a couple of guys goofing around,and not much conversation was made by my piercer. he seemed pretty rude, he gave me a couple of attitudes here and there but I finally got my lip pierced. It was painless and fairly quick. My overall experience was decent. I wish they were a bit more friendlier but other than that, the place is very clean.I'm considering my tongue piercing/ belly button here too. Still browsing around for a friendlier place.

1.description: Started on a sleeve and Brian was the man with the plan. He is a very talented artist. I have 11 tatts and have had 11 different artists from around the world and Brian is, by far the best. It is so detailed and the peeling and scabbing was minimal. He is now my TatMan. I definitely recommend him if you're looking for ink.

55.description: To be honest, I didn't actually get any ink there - and never will based on the first impression of the staff.   They can barely talk to people and have a severe LACK of basic customer service skills.  If you can't talk to me what makes you think I will let you draw on me for something that lasts for life?Did NOT ask any questions - most artists like to know where you want a tattoo, what you want, size, color, textures, shading, etc.....this guy didn't ask ONE question and in fact had to be prodded to even answer the most basic questions in normal customer service conversation - like a response to Hello?  Don't waste your time or your money (they quote outrageous prices).  You will have better luck elsewhere - and a better customer service experience.

9.description: I've gotten two tattoos here. One about a year and a half ago and another 2 and a half years ago. The first time it was a decent experience. Good quality, nice work, nice artist (don't remember his name. Roman maybe?). Fast forward to the second and last time I went there. Not only was the guy at the front counter rude. When I told him the quote I wanted, he had this look on his face that was off putting. I'm putting those words on my body. Not you, bud. The actual artist, whose name I think was David, was really nice and he put me at ease. I'd recommend him if he still works there. Don't get me wrong, the tattoos are good quality but if the people that are working there have a bad attitude, it reflects poorly on the place. I found a place where I am definitely much more comfortable at.

26.description: On a crazy day in April a couple of friends and myself decided to get piercings.  Barry was our guy and was awesome!  My friend gotten her nose and I gotten a dermal on my chest. He was professional and a sweetheart.  Thanks for the awesome piercing! :)

25.description: Barry is amazing for piercing I was so scared getting my tragus pierced but he did it so quickly and I didn't feel a thing. I would definitely recommend going to Barry he does an amazing job. The place was cool too and everyone was so nice.

12.description: Reasonable prices, nice artists/piercers. I've gotten several tattoos and piercings here. Always satisfied

21.description: Came from out of town... Really looking to do a tattoo before I left BUT $80 for a couple of letters??? RIP OFF I got it actually for half that price!!! Way too expensive here

17.description: I normally don't go out and prays people's work on sites like this. But I don't normally win an award for a tattoo either. That is exactly what happened. Angel Cruz and I have gotten to be friends over the 14 months or so that we spent together working on my back and chest piece. I had back surgery a few years ago and I wanted to have a tattoo showing what it looks like on the inside. It turned out great. That inspired me to think a little bigger. I wanted a Japanese dragon coming out of my back , across my shoulder, and across my chest. This mans creativity and skill took over from there. What a talent. Now, about the award. We hadn't quite finished the tat when a tattoo convention came into town. I decided to enter the full back. We came in second with an incomplete tattoo! If you want that really special tattoo, the one you'll love and that will turn heads, see Angel.

10.description: Everyone was super helpful and I was able to get a new ring for my septum piercing. Definitely going back for a tattoo! They were all very professional and have some great artwork!

5.description: Went into this place Thursday, very clean was welcomed and helped quickly. After I decided on my piece is where is went down hill.... Was show two different sizes and was told to hold on for pricing... Waiting what seemed like forever for them to get back to me. Also I had my child w me thinking they would want to get me in and out. Not the case. I was having a quarter sized piece done; waited about two hours for them to FINALLY get to me to start. Was quite disappointed on their attentiveness to their customers needs; I was very ready to walk out n leave. I wanted to get in n out n they made the experience long and drawn out.

3.description: Excellent service. Both Angel and Barry were excellent. Barry assisted in the tattoo set up and Angel did my large, beautiful side piece. He was kind enough to ask if I'd like to be in a private room in the back for my privacy and stuck stickers on my skin and shirt to keep my modesty. Excellent quality, line work, clean lines, clean/hygenic, hilarious and both very friendly and warm personalities. Both made me feel very comfortable for it being my first tattoo. (This review is based on my outline and shading. But I can only bet that the coloring will be as great as an experience)Exceptional artistry work done by Angel. He used a computer program that allowed us to make adjustments to the tattoo (prior to printing out the stencil) to make sure I was happy with all of the flowers, leaves, placement, size, and we decided on colors to help figure out what the colors of the outline should be. I did not feel rushed at all by him as we were brainstorming before our session. He let me watch movies and a couple episodes of grey's anatomy :D (lovveeee!) haha and he dealt with my yips and yelps of pain and was very professional!The only negative thing I've encountered the entire time was when we were wrapping up. Barry was getting me cleaned off and applying ointment/plastic wrap, and a rude co worker barged in. He stood at the opening of the door, and barked orders for Barry to pierce someone right at that second... and to not keep him waiting. I found out this idiot's name was Tyler. Instead of waiting a five minutes to finish up with a client, Tyler demanded that he drop everything to tend to some other customer. That Tyler guy is extremely unprofessional, and I would not recommend going to him for whatever he does, either tattoo or piercing or both,,I don't know. If that's how he deals with someone who he's not working with, how does he act with his clients?Both Barry and Angel were professional and provided me a wonderful experience. Highly recommended.

35.description: Got my neck dermal here,very welcoming,professional,and clean. Will be back for more. They are also very informative if you have questions.

19.description: i've been coming here since 2008,the best artist in chicago are here.joe the owner awsome so is the staff very professional and make you feel at home got got my latest 3tats from steven  very reasonable price i'm in aww!chitown tattoo is the place to go and worth the money steven is awsome ill up date when my arm is done so far never been more greatful for what he has done and cant wait till were done!thanks guys for making me feel like family and perfect tattoo!

28.description: Avoid the big surly piercer guy with no tattoos or piercings!  Me, my cousin, and my niece all had to go back a 2nd time to fix our nose piercings because he cut the studs too short.  They were digging into our noses and not healing properly. Barry was awesome, friendly, polite, and fixed them with no pain.  Barry rocks!

45.description: RIPOFF!!! I left a deposit with an artist and had something drawn up. After about a month I finally got a drawing that somewhat resembled what I wanted. When I asked for a quote now that it is drawn up, he quoted me $800-$950 for color. I just got it done at another shop for $400 and it is better than I imagined. Because it was my first tattoo, maybe he thought he could rip me off. I am not an idiot though. If you want overpriced, go here.

33.description: I got a nose piercing back in November 2011. They were very nice to me when I came in and I came in without an appointment and they took me very quickly. He brought me over to the chair and started cleaning the inside and outside of my nose. I touched it barely to itch and it went back to his supplies and cleaned it again! He was very thorough and kept me at ease. He let me pick a colored stud and I chose red. It was super affordable and the staff was just so nice. I'll be coming back for a possible another piercing or for my first tattoo, can't decide yet!

43.description: Pierced my rook: Take walk ins at odd hours?!? Check.Quick paperwork to fill out (3 pages)Check.Cute little couch setup to fill paperwork on.Check.Clean studio and comfortable piercing chair (for me, reclined since it was a Rook piercing)Check.A little hard to find if you're not sure where it is.Check.$30 flat for rook piercing, $30 flat for helix piercing.Check and Check.Make sure to have your ID on you so they can make a photocopy.Check-a-roo.Quick and relatively painless work, well lit room and comfortable environment all around the studio. Blu-Ray TV next to the room, but more so for the piercer's off time pleasure. Quiet place, even the TV. That was pleasing and soothing.Not that excessive jewelry collection and the prices are not marked for a LOT of the piercings under the counter by the piercing studio, which is a little annoying. However, I got two pairs of nice studs for my lobes for $30 flat. Two different types of studs as well. Little card to tell you about upkeep for your piercing on your way out. Before I got my piercing I was asked what ear, to which I said "Left" and he said to indicate it with my hand, which I think is practical. The piercer guy was a little sassy, not particularly in a good or bad way...but as Olivia K put it, "I'm not expecting to have a tea party with me so whatever." Overall great experience and I'd gladly return for another piercing.

2.description: Came in August to get my first piercing. Got pierced by Danielle, she made me feel super comfortable and informed me from top to bottom how to take care of my piercings. Left super satisfied and comfortable. Couple months later came back to remove a piercing and change the jewelry to another piercing. Wes made everything easy and I didn't even feel a hint of pain. Advised me about tree tea oil and the good it can do for dryness of my piercings/healing. Came back 01/08/16 to repierce my first piercing and get my navel as well, got Danielle again and she's honestly the best. Makes conversations with you, gives you details whether it's your first piercing or your eighth piercing. ChiTown Tattoo employees make you feel super comfortable and make the paperwork/payment easy. Only place I go to.

18.description: Came from out of town... Really looking to do a tattoo before I left BUT $80 for a couple of letters??? RIP OFF I got it actually for half that price!!! Way too expensive here

41.description: I've gotten 2 tattoos from Chitown and i love both of them. yes it was very pricey but i dont mind because they do an excellent job. both tats look amazing and i love the staff. theyre all very talkative and nice. i love going here and wouldnt go anywhere else.

52.description: A couple months ago, I ventured into this tattoo shop to inquire about a touch-up on a current tattoo.  After meeting with Jerry, I had the touch up done and was beyond impressed at my new tattoo.  His ability to blend the colors and  make me feel comfortable thru out the session left me feeling very confident about finally getting the half sleeve I wanted, yet dreaded getting from a sub-par artist.A few weeks later, I came back and had my sleeve started with Jerry.  The customization and detail work is impeccable. The fading is smooth and the design work itself left me speechless. The colors stayed looking vibrant and I'm extremely proud of the work.  Best of all, this shop offers free touch-ups on their tattoos so if you get a little sun, no need to worry, these guys are there for you. As of now, I'm currently getting my other arm done and can't wait till it's finished.

50.description: I went in to get my nose pierced and had a great experience. Quick and neatly done. Not expensive, either. Nice employees and clean atmosphere.

4.description: My friend went there for his birthday and literally had 4 lines added to an existing tattoo... They charged him $200.. My friend isn't really a confrontational person, but texted the artist... Instead of compromising or telling my friend to come back in, the artist nonchalantly said it was so expensive because of the size... But seriously, 4 lines???!!! That is something that is going to be on his body forever! The artist could've at least added some shading or something to blend it in better with the existing tat. It isn't always about money.. Sometimes being nice and being willing to work with people goes a long way.. Horrible customer service, horrible art.

6.description: Don't let Danielle pierce you!! She used the wrong jewelry on my nipples, which led to improper healing. She's careless...She doesn't take her clients' health and the proper/safe way to do piercings seriously. Thankfully, Christian A. helped me out by changing the jewelry and explained how to heal them correctly. If anything, go to him! He's awesome.

22.description: I've lived in this neighborhood all my life and had never paid a visit to this shop until about a year ago. I'd lost my nose stud and I couldn't wear my hoop at my job, so I had to run to the closest place I could to get a little stud. Didn't seem that hard. I drove over with my mom who was also curious what the shop was like. As soon as we walked in, the front lobby reeked of weed. Which was only strange, considering we were, you know, in a professional place. We were guided into the other room to look at the piercings. While we were waiting for the guy who we were supposed to talk to to return, some dude who worked there just started having a really inappropriate conversation with my mom and I, which is the main reason for the two stars. If I'm walking into your shop, don't talk to me like I'm an object. It's not a good way for things to be.Anyway, the dude in charge of the piercings finally came back and when I told him what I needed, he showed me what they carried, which was solely u-shaped nose studs. I was hoping for a little variety, because the u-shaped studs looked way too big for my nostril. I ended up buying one of them and taking a pair of wire cutters to them because it was extremely uncomfortable.Anyway, would not recommend. I'll still be relying on The Tat Cave for my future piercings.

15.description: The people in the front are nice.My piercer failed to mention or bring up the gauge size. When I asked him what size it was he said 17That should tell you enough.

57.description: Brand new Tattoo & Piercing parlor on the Northwest side of the city. I stopped by to check it out ans was pretty impressed. Great staff. Kyle and Richie do good work. I suggest going to see them for a tattoo! I'm heading there soon for some more piercings too.

20.description: They are awesome! Pedro did an amazing job on my artwork! Super friendly and super clean. The piercing guy was annoying to listen to while I was getting my piece done but if you just accept there is one douche everywhere this place is fantastic!

36.description: I absolutely love everything about ChiTown Tattoo.The artists and piercers are super friendly. I've been in here multiple times and I'd recommend it to anyone. I've never gotten any attitude from anyone employed there the many times I've been in. I took my friend to get her first tattoo there and Roman was wonderful about it, was willing to redraw the tattoo. I got a tattoo on my ankle from Dave and he was really awesome as well. Everyone does fantastic work, and they even give free touch-ups, by appointment, for a year. Though they do charge a little high, I trust the work that everyone does there and I would rather pay a little more and be positive that what I'm getting is good quality.I'll definitely be back for the rest of my tattoos.

14.description: I've lived in this neighborhood all my life and had never paid a visit to this shop until about a year ago. I'd lost my nose stud and I couldn't wear my hoop at my job, so I had to run to the closest place I could to get a little stud. Didn't seem that hard. I drove over with my mom who was also curious what the shop was like. As soon as we walked in, the front lobby reeked of weed. Which was only strange, considering we were, you know, in a professional place. We were guided into the other room to look at the piercings. While we were waiting for the guy who we were supposed to talk to to return, some dude who worked there just started having a really inappropriate conversation with my mom and I, which is the main reason for the two stars. If I'm walking into your shop, don't talk to me like I'm an object. It's not a good way for things to be.Anyway, the dude in charge of the piercings finally came back and when I told him what I needed, he showed me what they carried, which was solely u-shaped nose studs. I was hoping for a little variety, because the u-shaped studs looked way too big for my nostril. I ended up buying one of them and taking a pair of wire cutters to them because it was extremely uncomfortable.Anyway, would not recommend. I'll still be relying on The Tat Cave for my future piercings.

3.description: Krys and Endi are the best.  You have to request them.  Have seen a couple of sketch cuts or less than happy clients from the others- but these two ladies have given me great results time after time.  Take time to listen to wHat you want and will make sure everyone is on the same page before undertaking a cut.Salon is gossip house for locals - fun time if you are from the neighborhood and want to catch up or shoot the shit.

1.description: First off, I called to make an appointment which they wouldn't give me. The lady said just come in, so I did. Told me there were 2 people ahead of me and preceded to take a gentleman. So 1 person in front  of me right? No. They failed to mention that the 2nd person was actually 2 individuals. They never told me and I waited 45 min. Decided to leave and they didn't even care. Save your $$ and go elsewhere.

2.description: The staff here are so sweet! Ivana was especially helpful and patient with me as I expressed my concerns and questions with the length and upkeep of my hair. She was always willing to help me visualize what a certain cut would look like before the scissors did its thing. She was also mindful of whether or not I could see my hair in the mirror given that I am nearsighted and wore glasses. With damaged ends, she also took the time to snip off as many as she could find. I left with lighter, healthier hair that was't cut short, which I was nervous about.

9.description: I have been going here for decades (it was formally known as We Care Hair).  Annette was my hair stylist for years (she recently left).  I went to this salon 2 days ago for a trim (my bangs were long) and to have split ends cut off my length.  While I was getting my hair cut, a gentleman walked in and asked "How much for a haircut?".  A different beautician than the one I had replied "$15.00".  The man said "Ok, i'll wait".  My cut was completed in about 15 minutes.  I was charged $25.00 for my trim.  They have just lost an age old repeat customer.

10.description: Employees here are soooo nice and helpful, and they go out of their way to make sure you're satisfied.  All the hair dressers there are really skilled.  Bozena/Bonnie is really thorough and precise; she makes sure you leave happy with the hair cut/style/color she gave you.  Definitely had a wonderful experience and will come again!  Thanks!!

4.description: I love this place! I never go anywhere else.  It is in right by my house, and there is a big parking too. Sometimes I go there before/after work since it is next to Jefferson Park Bus terminal and Blue Line. Chris usually cuts my hair, but other girls are good too. Place is clean, people are super nice and usually I don't have to wait long time to get a service (for cut and style you don't need an appointment). If you need to cover your grays ask for Eri because she does great job. Hair express is all the girl needs to have great hair.

6.description: I have been coming here for years to get my hair cut by Krys. The shop is right next to the Jeff Park station so I just walk on by on my way home from work.  It is quick and easy and I have no complaints. Ask for Krys!

12.description: It is a pretty typical neighborhood place, and I can't say anything negative about the nice employee's attitudes, but I won't ever go back. I've had free haircuts from military barbers that are better than what I walked out with. A simple fade on a guy shouldn't be a hard style, but she didn't seem to understand how to blend the hair -- and the lining around my head wasn't even close to straight. Additionally, the half inch I requested off the top turned into over an inch off. I would've said something right away, but my back was to the mirror and it was too late by the time i saw. Rather than let her put clippers to my head again I went home and fixed it the best that I could. Thankfully hair grows back. The place gets a second star for, at the very minimum, having nice employees. If you're a guy looking for any cut requiring clippers, I'd avoid this place.

5.description: OPEN SUNDAYS!  To find someone to style your hair for an event on a Sunday is very difficult, as most salons are closed. Have only been there for one updo (done by Kristina), and loved it. Loved the products she used for my curly updo, and it held up all day (in a blizzard!!). Stylist was a great listener, patient, and her own ideas for style made it even better than what I had in mind. My girlfriend used another stylist and was happy as well. Very reasonably priced. Clean salon. Have a pony chair for children's haircuts.

11.description: Having just joined Yelp, I wanted to make sure was the first review I write. I've been going to Hair Express for about two years now and it's like my second home. I see Erie and Chris ususally and they are by far the best stylists I've ever had. When I started going there my hair was so 'blah' and now it's as healthy as it has ever been and I get complements on the color all the time. Hair Express always has a new hair style, product or color to try. The salon itself is fun to go to. The customer-service is very friendly. The one thing I like the best is that the salon strives to be as eco-friendly as possible with their products, tools, cleaning products, etc. I would definitely recommend you book an appointment. You won't regret it and you may just find your new salon close to your home!

8.description: Kate cut my hair and put in fun highlights.  I don't think a haircut has ever gotten so many compliments. Kate was super friendly and attentive when it came to what I wanted. The salon is well kept.  The prices are reasonable.  I've already taken my mom there to get her hair done,  and I will be back soon for a trim and touch up. A+

0.description: Very nice staff, professional. They are attentive and considerate, asking questions about what I expect, providing suggestions and constantly making sure I was satisfied.You can usually walk in and there will be not too many wait.The location is perfect as well, just by the Jefferson Park Blue Line stop.

7.description: We're lucky to have a great local family haircut place as our go-to-place. They are all a talented group. My kids especially love Krys. If you're in the Jefferson Park area and are in search of a new place, you won't be disappointed here!

28.description: I work in this area and when I am feeling lazy I find that this is my go-to place for lunch.Yes the food isn't the greatest, but it's decent and it's cheap. You can usually get a lunch special for about 5 bucks.I like the Egg Foo Young and the Szechwan Chicken.I would generally stay away from any of their beef entrees because they are pretty chewy and funny thing about me is that I don't like beefy jello.Staff is extremely friendly.

1.description: Excelsior Garden is a tiny little store front restaurant in Jefferson Park.  It's located just north of Lawrence Ave.  This is the first time I have been here. They have lunch specials for $4.95 (mainly chicken dishes) & $5.55 (beef & shrimp dishes).  These specials are enormous and enough for 2 meals I ordered the Szechwan chicken lunch special. The chicken fried rice was sort of bland and lacked any real flavor, the egg roll was not very good.  My mom use to make killer egg rolls.  The main dish the Szechuan chicken was decent, but nothing that got me very excited. There was chicken, broccoli, bamboo, water chestnuts, carrots, celery, mushrooms and baby corn.  Isn't Szechuan suppose to be spicy.  Ehhh not at allI would be willing to come back and try some of their other lunch specials and maybe some of their other dishes because they have a pretty extensive list of lunch menu items, besides you can't beat the value and quantity of the food.  I'm thinking it's worth trying especially for the price.

39.description: Love it! Cheep and good! We checked out many other Chinese restaurants in the neighborhood and this one is just the best.

9.description: I ordered through their website on Monday afternoon and received a receipt. It's Thursday evening and I still have not received my order. Monday was Labor Day, maybe they were closed. If that is that case, perhaps *not* accepting orders online would be advisable. Or maybe even a call or email...anything...acknowledging that they received and was unable to fulfill me order for whatever reason. I have a two year old and waiting for 90 minutes before making several unanswered calls is not a way to spend dinnertime. Thanks for that fun experience Excelsior. If there was an indication they were closed, we could have ordered from any number of other restaurants that were open that day.

29.description: General Tso's extra spicy is always yummy.  Love the fried dumplings, but the REAL reason I go here is for the Won Ton Soup.  Get the large for $3.  Tons of big won tons, carrots, cabbage, green onions, and pork strips.  Nom nom nom!  Remember to call ahead though because they can be a little slow.

42.description: Typical Chinese carry-out, all the food we got was fresh, which is always a plus!  I got hunan chicken, which had a nice crisp array of veggies, but just barely spicy sauce.  Everything else was good, nothing to complain about, but nothing really to rave about either.  If you live in the neighborhood, it's worth carrying out if you're in a Chinese mood.

23.description: I've been eating at excelsior garden for years (I work next door) at least twice a week. The food is FRESH and they don't use a lot of crap that other Chinese restaurants do. The place is clean, the owners are so nice and the price is very reasonable for the quality of the food you get. I've eaten almost everything on the menu but I think hands down the have the best hot & sour soup in town. As a matter of fact I'm writing this review because I have an awful hangover and I was looking up the number to order some food because my hubby was willing to pick it up! That's how good it is :-) but they're closed :-/

5.description: Delivery for this place is incredibly terrible it's now been an hour and 43 minutes I've been waiting for my food I mean this is frustrating.

31.description: my favorite chinese restaurant on the northside !! been ordering here for years never once dissapointed all there beef dishes are good the meat is tender,not chewy like some chinese restaurants that make u wonder if your eating DOG !!! the orange chicken is awesome ! the price is reasonable !!! thy have a small space for dine in but thats usually for the hurry up eat and go !! u wont be dissapointed !!

25.description: This food is so affordable and so delicious. The people taking the orders are nice. I just love the place. Broccoli chicken, chicken fried rice, egg roll, and crab rangoon all under $10 because of the lunch special.

12.description: I used to order from this place all the time, and now I will never give them my business again.I ordered via grub hub at 6:20pm and it is now 8:13pm and I still haven't relieved my delivery! The order is for 1 person so there isn't much food to be delivered. And I live pretty close. I called and the lady who answered was so rude and unapologetic. Supposedly someone is on their way. My money has been taken out of my account, and very unhappy with the service. At this rate Im thinking of just refusing the food and requesting a refund.Now that its been 20 minutes since I've called. I called again, now the lady is telling me the driver is outside and hung up on me. BIG SURPRISE no driver. I call again and no one is picking up. Finally got ahold of a "manager", and he was very rude and blamed grub hub. Called grub hub and of course they didn't cancel the order as the "manager" claimed. Absolutely disgusted with the service and will NEVER order from there again.

37.description: I really must say that this is my fav chinese place in chicago.  There food is great, I love the orange chicken with xtra spicy beef fried rice YUM!!!!

21.description: Prices are very reasonable. I got the sweet and sour chicken with brown rice. Might want to call in your order since it does take a good ten min for them to prepare it. Chicken was delicious-brown rice was kinda bland. When eating here, be reminded the food is very hot! Parking sucks here since its right by jp bus station.

16.description: This place is deff not for vagetarians. Just in case your vegetarian check your food cause they give you chicken and when u call and complain they talk you rudely saying I didn't put chicken in it?? Bed service would not go again....

17.description: I am now convinced that anyone who thinks this food is good, is young and/or with a VERY limited experience of what GOOD food is. Another bad chinese restaurant in our area. There are no "good" restaurants  near or in Sauganash. Just another, I'll take your money & give you bad food.First they screwed up my order-badly, As it turns out I wasn't missing anything.The General Tao dish reeked and also tasted of breaded chicken fried in dirty oil, and it was over fried-tuff & chewy. My veg. fried rice had no veg but had beef-WITH more of the pervasive strong odor & taste of old, dirty, over used oil. The white rice was fine. The broccoli garlic was ok. Didn't get the egg foo young-another mistake on their part.Now my entire kitchen smells of old, dirty grease. And I've thrown away $25.(include. delivery).

10.description: Amazing place for takeout or delivery!My favorites are their fried rice, orange chicken, and kung pao beef. Delivery is always very fast, and if you order for pick up it's ready even quicker. The lady is always very nice and friendly. One thing I appreciate is their clean kitchen that can be seen from when you pick up. My favorite Chinese takeout on this side of town.

11.description: This is one of our go to Chinese fast food joints! The barbecue pork appetizer are the best, hands down! The sauce is good and the meat is soft. The combination fried rice is what we usually pair it with! Love this place

26.description: I'm updating the review for this place. The orange chicken is awesome, but the rice tasted a lot better the last time I ordered from here then the first. Egg rolls and the pineapple smoothie is delicious.Orange chicken lunch special+3 vegetable egg rolls+pineapple smoothie= about 12.50 (I forgot the exact amount) lol

27.description: Great food.  I've ordered a variety of things from here and they never seems to disappoint. I also received fortune cookies which I expect from a Chinese restaurant, but it seems to be not common lately.

35.description: I've been meaning to review this place for a while.  We love this place.  My husband is from Ireland and is always on the search for the perfect Chinese curry, so during his search he found Excelsior Garden.  We've been ordering from here for 3-years.  This is the best Chinese in the neighborhood.  Listed below are my reasons for the 5-star rating1. Best in the neighborhood - I've eaten A LOT of things on their menu and I've never been let down, everything is always good.2. Fresh, fresh, fresh - their ingredients are so fresh...never anything iffy or frozen from Excelsior3. Fastest delivery on the Northwest Side - they always say 20-minutes, but it's always here in 10 minutes.4. Consistent - their food is consistent so you know it's always good

8.description: Their fried rice is one of the best fried rice dishes I have ever tried. Get the combo with veggies or chicken. Finger licking good! Also the price difference between small and large rice dish is so small that it's not worth getting the small. You will have leftovers. It is pretty big so it can easily feed 2-3 people. They have lunch specials from 11-3, I believe so take advantage of it for lunch! ;)

0.description: Great food! Great service! Fast delivery! And I strongly recommend the General Tso. Best in town!

38.description: The best chinese food on the north side!

20.description: Their fried rice is one of the best fried rice dishes I have ever tried. Get the combo with veggies or chicken. Finger licking good! Also the price difference between small and large rice dish is so small that it's not worth getting the small. You will have leftovers. It is pretty big so it can easily feed 2-3 people. They have lunch specials from 11-3, I believe so take advantage of it for lunch! ;)

19.description: This is the only place i will order chinese  food from its owned by a husband  and wife  there food is always fresh and made to order and its concistent and there prices cant be beat if you get the lunch or dinner  special it comes with a antree  rice and a eggroll for 6 bucks and its a huge portion and they deliver  just about anywhere good people good food good business  loyal  customer  here

33.description: I expected a better experience based on the reviews, but to me this was a okay place for cheap chinese food.  I'd give it two and a half stars if I could.  I ordered the cashew chicken and egg drop soup.  Having waitressed at a mom and pop Chinese place in college, I have an eye for good Chinese and this wasn't the freshest stir fry I have experienced.  Again - not bad, just cheap, and not a value as you are basically getting what you paid for. I will have to note the Egg Drop Soup not good at all.  My first spoonful tasted like vinegar and I didn't go back for more.  Since it was only $2, I just am not too upset about it, but doubt I will ever make it back to this place.
