So my overall opinion of the food is "meh"- kinda pricey for what you get.If you want "Americanized" Chinese food....its not too bad. But holy crap GO THERE FOR THE EGGROLLS. They have the best eggrolls I've ever had. They make them somewhat traditionally but then batter them before frying. Holy wow, so good. This place was on my way home from work and I'd often think about stopping in to get an eggroll before dinner :)CLOSED MONDAYS.

23.description: We've been meaning to review Golden Wok for the longest time.  Definitely recommend delivery, their dining area is a bit gloomy.  They're super fast (not always the best sign for "fresh food," but moving on).Food is consistanly good!  We always get the Kung pao beef and beef fried rice. The egg rolls are the best ever - not sure if they're made there; but definitely like no other. Hits the spot when at home with friends and need yummy food fast.

5.description: I really wanted to like this place. I used their online ordering. When I got there to pick up my order, it was not ready. The man at the counter told me that something with a split phone line and that I should always call the order in. What's the point in having that service then? The food was just ok, I didn't even finish my beef and broccoli because it just didn't taste right. The egg rolls were the only item I liked.

31.description: Wow.  You guys weren't lying about the egg rolls.  I've been to a LOT of chinese restaurants and I have to say the food is damn good here.  The eggrolls are definitely some of the best I've ever had.  I have yet to try the crab rangoon which I will probably order next time.  The orange chicken was phenomenal.  I can't believe this place was right under my nose the whole time.  Well, better late than never I guess.

25.description: Was in town for the weekend and was taken here by an old friend.  He spoke of it very highly  on the way there, saying the flavor 'jumped off the plate' but after getting there we were both disappointed.  Most of the food was way too sugary for my taste and the egg roll which was anything but crisp (the way an egg roll should be).All said and done its definitively a place that has seen better days, the people inside were helpful, but thats because it was mostly empty when i was there (8pm)If your craving chinese and everything is closed this would not be a bad choice but would probably try something else if i had the choice.

12.description: 5/6/2015   Since I can't delete my review, so I wanted to update, I really like the food for the last year, much healthier than most was a 4.8 star for me. I heard there are new owners again as of beginning of April 2015, so putting 3 star until I can go in and try the food.   Update later. thanks.

37.description: EGG ROLLS. Golden Wok 5731 N. Central Ave in Chicago makes the best egg rolls I've ever had. They are so doughy-crunchy-savory-sweet that I never eat fewer than three of them as a snack/meal! They've only provided me with those little packets of Sweet-Sour sauce each time I've gotten egg rolls here, but I've only gotten carry-out; I don't know if they provide more sauce options for dine-ins. The sauce hasn't mattered  too much anyway, because these incredible egg rolls are actually good without any sauce. I found good egg rolls at Kow Kow in Lincolnwood. They provide a good Sweet-Sour sauce for the egg rolls. And New Star in Elmwood Park has a very good Hunan egg roll. I like New Star's Hunan egg roll because it's a bit hotter/spicier than their regular egg roll; New Star has a good Sweet-Sour sauce too. But Golden Wok has the best egg roll!

21.description: First time eating here.  Food was good. We had moo shu pork, Chicken fried rice. and egg rolls.  Fried Rice was good.  Egg rolls were fluffy?  or puffy. Altho good we have had better egg rolls.  The moo shu pork was really good alot of onions. The "pancake" was flour tortillas. I was supprised to say the least.  Overall I will go to again.  "pancakes" maybe not.

16.description: New owners, and a definite improvement.  Have only ordered once so far, but loved the Shrimp w/ Vegetables and Four Seasons.  Good variety of fresh veggies, and tasty meats in the Four Seasons.  We'll certainly order from here again.

17.description: We want Golden Wok to get better since we live nearby. The menu is overly ambitious. They should cut offerings by 60% and concentrate on doing Chinese food well. In addition to changing the egg rolls, they changed sauce packets. The mustard packet is unspeakably nasty. Buy a bottle of Trader Joe's Sweet Chili Sauce if you need sweet goop on your egg roll. (No matter how many times we request no packets, they load up take out bags with it.) Seriously avoid their "Thai" offerings, worst "curry" ever! Hubby likes Buddhist Delight (order it spicy, otherwise, very bland), Korean Chap Chae Noodle, Kung Pao Chicken (mega celery) and regular or Korean BBQ Short Ribs. Moo Shu Chicken is ok (sauce needs work); Cold Sesame Noodle Salad is BORING and needs greens. Take a pass on the Szechuan Chicken. I regularly see one of the "chefs" squatting out back taking a cigarette break. Wish he spent that time improving the menu instead.

10.description: I'm so disappointed with the food I received tonight. I have been a loyal customer for two years and my husband has been the majority of his life. It's been the ONLY Chinese place we would ever even go to. The food has definitely changed, I'm assuming there is new owners. The amazing egg rolls everyone has raved about are now half the size and no longer dipped in tempura. And the pot stickers are not even remotely as good as they use to be.  Everything tastes different. The food's not terrible, it's just definitely nothing special anymore.  Which just sucks because this place used to be our absolute favorite. We most likely won't be ordering from here again.

11.description: This used to be my wife's favorite place. Shortly after they changed owners, we placed a pretty hefty order. Needless to say after we drove 40 minutes to pick it up, and 40 more minutes to get back home....much to our surprise some of the food was not fully cooked and was still raw. Not to mention they forgot to give us our steak on a stick (probably best they didn't give it to us, it probably would have been raw), as well as our pops. I called on the phone to let them know about the missing pops and the raw food, and I told them I would be coming back to give it back to them. The girl on the phone told me they were closing and she would give me a credit towards my next meal, and she hung up on me. I called back repeatedly and no one answered. They got me good. Please avoid this place if you are reading this. Clearly u can see after my experience, how poorly I would rate them. 1 star is too good for a place like this. They deserve a half a star to no stars. I don't know how businesses like this manage to stay in buisness. Please don't get taken like I did. Find another place with better reviews.

26.description: Had a craving for egg rolls last night so came to yelp for advice and found this place. Based on the reviews my son and decided to give this place a try. Now, just as most everyone said on Yelp, the egg rolls were great, very comparable to KowKow's egg rolls but the rest of the food we ordered was crap. We had sweet and sour chicken, which was the oddest looking sweet and sour chicken I had ever seen. We also ordered the orange chicken special with vegetable fried rice and it was horrible. The orange chicken had this nasty looking color to it, the rice had no flavor and it wasn't even hot! We were the only customers to visit the restaurant at that time so our food should have been pipin hot. But no! Next time I want Chinese, I will head on down to Saigon Grill which is much closer and has way better food.

27.description: So I had a craving for egg rolls today and I went to yelp and it steered me to this fine establishment. I turned off on the no outlet side street next to the restaurant and it was packed. I was like either this is the new spot for illegal transactions or chinese food nirvana. I took the food home and nirvana took over.The egg rolls were very big, crispy, and mmmm delish...I ordered 2 but one was enough of this goodness for one sitting.The real winner was the Sweet and Sour Chicken. When I opened the carton I almost didnt think I got the right order since it looks so different from other places Ive ever gotten it. It was strips of chicken cooked to perfection. It was crispy and flavorful and my new favorite chinese dish EVER...Yelp you did it again...What would I ever do without you???

35.description: This place has the best chinese food! This is where I g for take out/delivery. If you would like to dine in..good quiet place, but not where you would want to go on a date.  This is a good dine in restaurant if you have little kids that are going to run around while you eat or you just don't want to be around people.

8.description: I miss the old recipes. The egg rolls in tempura batter, war won ton soup, fried rice with Japanese rice, Botan rice candy. They were truly unique. They might have changed hands again.  When they first changed, the new owner said he would still make the old dishes. Yesterday they were all young guys and they told me I was out of luck.They packed the package poorly. They ran out string beans.

0.description: They changed ownership and I truly miss the egg rolls and the former recipe. I went there for years and it was our to go place as a family. We called the egg rolls *crunch crunch* silly but fun. Gone but will never be forgotten!The other dishes are also prepared from diffrent recipes and gone are the original tasty homemade dishes that were unique and different  than anyother Chinese food restaurant that we have purchased from the past.With that being said,and not to dwell on the past,we ordered two nights ago from grub hub.We had S&S chicken,egg roll, combo fried rice and  beef egg fu young.I had requested for my SS to be separated from the chicken ,this way it wouldn't be soggy.This wasn't the case. Unfortunately the temprua was saturated, soggy, and literally just falling right off the chicken. It was mushy.I called and the gentlemen that answered,said my order did not state I wanted it separately. I wasn't looking for reimbursement nor a replacement, just to shine a light on the overlooked request. I double checked my order from grub hub just to be sure..and indeed I did.. It ruined my meal for the most part,but I did make the best of it. What I do really appreciate is the fact you have many options for the fried rice for a small up charge of 75 cents you can upgrade your fried rice and I had chicken pineapple  it was supposed to be spicy according to the drop down menu but it wasn't ,however the chicken was clean it was white chicken meat the rice was decent although I do miss the old recipe. The combo fried rice was ok says my husband. Although fresh and a ample amount of meat,it lacked something. After adding soy sauce he seemed to enjoy it a little more. He said he just wasn't used it it. I could tell it seemed fresh and on the healthier side. Guess we do get used to things a certain way. But that doesn't mean we can't change :)The egg fu young was good. We asked for it well done,and they nailed it...however some improvement could be made with the gravy. Its watery. Over all it technically is a New establishment and seeing that they bought it out from the old owners which I believe was their sister they have a different spin on the food and it was fresh and it was quality. I did not like the egg roll @ all ..l even with it being the status quo .I would give it a try again with the knowledge that this is not the old golden wok. Delivery was fast, food was hot and fresh and if we do choose to order again I will follow up with a phone call to assure that my sweet and sour sauce is sent separately from the chicken and I would not want the egg roll. Having an expectation of the food as we once knew it could have  influnced our taste buds somewhat. In all fairness I would give it 3.5 stars with the hopes it rises to the potential that it seemingly has. Less the egg roll for me....

38.description: Hey, just tried Golden Wok.  Their food was OK but i may not be back.  Their oarnge chicken was a little too thickly battered and I really hate dark meat pieces but the sauce was OK.  Had some fried rice but my husband said it had very little taste.  The eggrolls were different from what im used to.  They had a special batter/coating.  They were alright.  I ate, im full. thats all.

20.description: I'm so disappointed with the food I received tonight. I have been a loyal customer for two years and my husband has been the majority of his life. It's been the ONLY Chinese place we would ever even go to. The food has definitely changed, I'm assuming there is new owners. The amazing egg rolls everyone has raved about are now half the size and no longer dipped in tempura. And the pot stickers are not even remotely as good as they use to be.  Everything tastes different. The food's not terrible, it's just definitely nothing special anymore.  Which just sucks because this place used to be our absolute favorite. We most likely won't be ordering from here again.

19.description: New owners, food is totally different.  Gone are the huge awesome egg rolls. Sad.

33.description: I have been going to this restaurant for years and have never had any major complaints,  HOWEVER tonight I ordered mu shu and instead of getting the traditional Chinese pancakes, I received a flour tortilla!  It was carry out and I certainly wasn't going to turn around and drive back.  Totally ghetto and lazy and I will not be back.  I think the quality of this place has gone downhill.

2.description: Golden Wok - Yuk.  My cousin and his wife were visiting from L.A. So my other cousins wife ordered food from here and we ate at my aunts house.  Not to be ungrateful for a meal, but this food was disgusting.  I will never order food or eat anything from this place again.  Too bad it's a neighborhood restaurant.  Honestly I can't believe they are even in business with the quality of food that we ate last night.

34.description: The best egg roll I have ever eaten. Oh. My. God it is good. Also, fried rice is nicely seasoned, not too much of anything, and served moist but not wet and sticky. Tasted great. I went with my 2 year old boy, perfect for families with young kids or just people looking for really, really good chinese (american) food. But don't be stupid - order an egg roll. It just may change your life.

32.description: Their egg rolls are beautiful-looking, but one of them triggered my allergies. The server had told me that everything was made with regular vegetable oil, but she apparently didn't know what she was talking about. I'm betting the rolls are fried in sesame oil. Too bad--the place was otherwise nice.

18.description: I am sooo sad.  Every time I come home to Chicago, I must have Chinese food from golden wok waiting for me.  I get Egg foo young, egg roll, and fried rice.   It is completely different.  The gravy is now watery brown liquid and the egg roll  is small and not tempura battered, the fried rice was different.   New owners, different cook.  It's most likely not bad food, it's just not what I expected. I want to know where the cook went so I can go there.

41.description: Good menu selection, fast delivery, clean...dine-in, carry out, or delivery available.  Their prices are pretty standard...not pricey at all.

13.description: I don't recommend the place anymore.  So sad the egg rolls are gone.My review from last year was some how dated 1/1/2015.  It was suppose to say 1/1/2014.  Sorry for the mix up.

4.description: The quality of the food at Golden Wok could be summed up with one word: SHIT!Bottled sauces, frozen, flavorless meat and greasy, salty...overall SHIT food.The entire nation of China should be insulted at the representation of cuisine the owner serves here.Just to give one clear example: I ordered bbq ribs. The ribs were baked (not bbq), clearly came from the freezer and had bottled, electric, red sauce dumped on top.I was beyond insulted at the nerve they had to serve this...SHIT.The frozen entrees at Mariano's are better and cheaper.Shame on management for allowing this to make its way to paying customers.

24.description: Went here based on the reviews....especially about the Egg Rolls. (Actually the reviews made me crave them even more!)  I wasn't disappointed! The Egg Rolls have a great flavor and good size.  Take Out service was quick, and the food was good. I will be back for more.

6.description: I believe this place has changed hands in the past year or so.  I know everyone was crazy for the egg rolls and now they are gone, but in a lot of ways It has improved.  Chinese food is not cookie cutter, the same dish can be vastly different from one place to another.  I think a lot of the bashing has to do more with people liked the old place and it changed.  And yea, the egg rolls are pretty generic now.But it is much brighter and cleaner than it was and I like the food.  We frequent quite a few Asian restaurants because we like variety.  This is now the place we go the most (good food, close by, value). The Lunch specials are a great value and available on weekends (at least as of this review).Had to downgrade review..  Inconstant and service has fallen.  We still do take out occasionally.

22.description: Best Chinese food in the city!!! Egg rolls are amazing. Highly recommend this place!

15.description: I was craving Chinese on Thursday night so I decided to order from The Golden Wok. I was surprised that the food is different. The rice isn't as good as it once was. My husband wants the old egg rolls.

40.description: Golden Wok has the BEST Mongolian Chicken/Mongolian Beef!!!! It is secluded in a little area near Central/Elston on the far north side of Chicago,so you may not have heard or seen this place unless you live in the area. It is definitely worth it if you are in the area and crave some good chinese food.

7.description: This used to be my FAVORITE Chinese food but since they switched owners forget it. Food is just like every other commercialized location you can go to. The egg rolls were one of a kind and they got rid of them. Now they have Costco microwave egg rolls- good move. Totally killed this spot for me. Over 20 years coming here and I will never come back. Don't waste your money.

36.description: Egg Rolls indeed!!! The City's best Chinese Egg Roll hands down! Their food is absolutely amazing. Everything is sooo fresh, cooked to order, none of that Panda Express frozen Chinese B.S. I have been coming to this restaurant for about 20 years now and their food has never ever failed to make my insides very happy. Try the Orange Chicken/ Beef,  their Happy Family, Crab Rangoon, Beef/Broccoli, Sweet-Sour Chicken. and G**Dammit don't Forget the Egg Rolls... Did I Mention Egg Rolls?

30.description: Stepping into Golden Wok is like stepping back in time 25 years (and that's a complement coming from me).  The egg roll here is good as mentioned by previous reviewers and the other grub is acceptable.  The premises are clean, the service is courteous and the place is retro-tastic.  I'm sure that Golden Wok is a neighborhood favorite.

3.description: Yep, this place is an absolute dump. With the hundreds of items listed on the menu, you would think they would be able to make at least one thing halfway decent. We ordered egg rolls and mapo tofu, both of which are great if you are looking for the most explosive diarrhea you have ever had!  Avoid this sorry excuse of a "Chinese" restaurant at all costs!!! You can thank me later.

14.description: Great meal! Have not picked up food from here in awhile. They must have a new chef or different owners.   Food was very good fresher taste. Good job.

3.description: Four stars for best bar in the neighborhood. Looks clean. Smells clean. There's a pool table and dart boards. Bartender was friendly.  Prices were economically appealing.

1.description: Cool place to shoot pool and drink some beers. Yo they have a bunch of different restaurants menus instead of food, which I guess is a thing people do in neighborhood bars? Good little local spot.

2.description: Oh, man.. this place.  We came here around 7 p.m. on a Tuesday and there were numerous WASTED people in there.  The sign of a good dive bar for sure.  The place looks like a shack from the outside but the inside is actually really nice.  Very clean and the stained glass hanging lamps are incredible.  The drunk people didn't bother me at all... until they started fighting with each other about money.   We also suspect that the woman who was the most drunk was the mother of the bartender... who just kept serving her mother drinks.  Bizarre.  The bartender must be used to people drinking heavily in there because she asked us once every 30 seconds (slight exaggeration) if we needed another drink.  I do like the vibe of this place and will be back... perhaps on a weekend night when I can drink heavily like the rest of the customers there.

5.description: How could you not like a place with $2 domestic bottles? I mean, seriously? They have a pool table, touch screen games, 2 steel tip dart boards, a nice bartender, and I can walk there. Perfect! I'm in. P.S. The bathrooms are crappy. No pun intended.

6.description: This is a great neighborhood bar. Not only are the prices great, but I'm a huge fan of the "come as you are" mood that the patrons and bartenders offer. There's a pool table in the back as well as a dart board. There's always some sort of sporting event on the TV, and music playing overhead.Rachel, the bartender on Monday's is great. She makes a mean long island iced tea (beware), and makes sure that your glass is always full. I agree with the statements made about the bathrooms being downstairs, and less than sanitary. I'll leave it at that.  Overall, I'm a fan of this little local watering hole.

7.description: Stopped in on a quiet Monday night for hubby's darts league. Very nice neighborhood bar with a relaxed, country/sportsbar vibe. Relatively clean, and plenty of HD flat-screens for game day. Rumpus room in back--dart boards, pool table--a nice feature. Bathrooms aren't great, but are also clean.Service was outstanding. Female bartender was friendly, welcoming and generous. Drink prices are a welcome relief from the trendier 'hoods. Only party mix and potato chips served here, but the bar stocks a variety of menus for ordering in. Was told that the Sunday bartender brings home-cooked fixins for famished fans.I'd go back for a comfy cocktail.

8.description: This is an ok neighborhood bar. Good drinks and resonable prices and it has of course the important pool table. I don't like the fact that the bathrooms have to be walked down a flight of staris or that the television sets are small. There really is not much to dislike about this place.

0.description: A classic Irish bar in Chicago, definitely loved the pub trivia games just wish they had something like that here in NYC. Definitely somewhere to visit while in Chicago. The regulars will make you laugh guaranteed!

4.description: Yea this bar is a great dive bar great staff and a young  really good looking bar back lol

0.description: Great place always very nice.this convience store has great selection .The people who work there are really nice and smart because they care everyone no matter how old are you.

29.description: We love this place and have been there at least 6 times since it opened -- take-out and dine-in.  You can't beat the selection for the price.  All the basic rolls and sushi are $2.95 and it's all good.  We've always had great cuts of sushi - thick and good quality.  We have not tried the more expensive rolls here, but honestly there is no reason to spend the extra money in our opinion.  The service is a little less attentive than we would prefer, but it was O.K.  Parking can be a bit of a challenge.  Meters on Milwaukee charge money until 10 p.m., but if you get lucky enough to park around the corner at the CTA terminal, the meter is free after I think 6 p.m.  It's extremely convenient to the Jefferson Park CTA too.  It's a great addition to the neighborhood, especially if you want a quick and cheap sushi fix.

42.description: I love the concept of this place. It's like tapas for sushi rolls. Or... sushi conveyer belt but made to order. Try as many different rolls as you want for $3 each! Not surprisingly, the pieces are usually on the smaller side and some of them are good and some very bland. Lots of rolls are covered in spicy mayo and/or unagi sauce. One major difference this place has over a sushi conveyer belt is that all of the food is made to order. That can be a great thing if you're in the restaurant yourself but VERY slow if it is packed.

23.description: Meh....average at best...couple rolls were inedible.  Giving a three is generous.  Won't likely order from here again

47.description: ABSOLUTELY SATISFIED! My boyfriend and I were originally looking for a place that had AYCE sushi, but we gave this place a try, anyway. They have a HUGE section in their menu (with pictures!) of $2.95 sushi rolls. By the time we ordered more than enough sushi for the both of us, we ended up paying the same price as an AYCE sushi place. The man and woman working there last night (05/31/15) were also so fantastic and welcoming. We tried the Masago, Crunchy Spicy Salmon, French Roll, Spicy Scallop Roll, Unagi Q Roll, Dinosaur Roll, Miami Roll, Mini Godzilla Roll, Red Millinium Roll, Spicy Trio Roll, Volcano Roll, and the Dynamite Roll, and all of them were exceptional. We're totally making this place our new sushi go-to place!

8.description: Very reasonably priced sushi.  BYOB.  Relatively simple menu.

31.description: Cute little place that serves sushi rolls for 2.95 which is amazing. For the price youre paying it is great quality. Bring your own drink tho because they are expensive. A bottle of water is $2. They also dont bring out your food all together & the servers are kinda awkward. But if you want cheap good sushi this is the place to go.

34.description: A friend and I decided to try this place, lured in by the super cheap menu but it's just not worth it. Don't waste your money. Rolls taste like bland mush, I don't mean to be rude but grocery sushi is definitely better than anything this place has on their menu. Never again, you get what you pay for I guess.

16.description: I love this place. The price is right, the sushi is great, and the delivery is consistently good and on time!

13.description: Godzilla Sushi offers some of the most affordable rolls in Chicago without sacrificing quality.  The quality is a little better than Ruk and a lot cheaper.  They aren't quite Lawrence Fish Market cheap, but unlike LFM, they offer delivery and a cozy dine-in environment.  The staff is always friendly and the service is prompt.  I get food from here about once a week and am never disappointed.  What a great addition to the Jeff Park neighborhood!

11.description: I love the concept of this place. It's like tapas for sushi rolls. Or... sushi conveyer belt but made to order. Try as many different rolls as you want for $3 each! Not surprisingly, the pieces are usually on the smaller side and some of them are good and some very bland. Lots of rolls are covered in spicy mayo and/or unagi sauce. One major difference this place has over a sushi conveyer belt is that all of the food is made to order. That can be a great thing if you're in the restaurant yourself but VERY slow if it is packed.

39.description: Great location right off Jefferson Park transit center on Milwaukee. They really only focus on serving sushi, they have a few non-sushi items but you won't find any entrees like other sushi places have. Their menu is pretty awesome! Pretty much everything is $3. Between me and my friend we get about 3 choices each and share, that pretty much fills us up. Each plate has about 4 - 6 pieces of sushi.  The sushi itself is pretty good and I really like the mini Godzilla rolls, my favorite! I could eat 12 pieces!It's a very clean and friendly place. Service is good and I have no complaints. I go here every week for Monday night sushi.

37.description: HORRIBLE  HORRIBLE!!!! Went in with a party of four and waited for almost 2 hours for our food. When we were served, FINALLY, we were served red snapper that we all spit out into out into our napkins at the same time. When I asked the chef about the freshness of our fish he asked, "how do you know YOOOUU know what it's supposed to taste like?" Whaaat?!? At the end we were accused of ordering too many items to be fed at an appropriate amount of time. The friends I was with had a good experience the first time they visited but will not be frequenting  this joint again. Very disappointed.  Zero customer service and zero respect.

0.description: I come here often (as a dine-in or as a pick up) and they have yet to disappoint me. The staff is really sweet and polite and the service is usually very prompt, even on busy nights. Overall, I love this place, and will continue to bring my money here.Also note that there is a $15 minimum on credit card transactions.

38.description: Spotted Godzilla Sushi after visiting the small but mighty Ed Paschke Art Center. As hubby commutes from Jefferson Park, I asked him to pick up some rolls on his way home. We tried the Philly (kinda boring), Salmon Avocado (good), Negi Hamachi (also boring), Spicy Tuna (not a get-again) and California (ok). Hubby loved them all but my taste buds are more refined. A tastier brand of rice and a bit of dried seaweed would give these rolls needed oomph. Then hubby asked me to guess how much they cost. Well, at $2.95 each, I suppose I shouldn't complain. That's far less than the rolls at Umi, our favorite sushi place. We have 20 rolls to still try at Godzilla Sushi (plus appetizers).  Note of caution to bike riders: Jeff Park isn't safe, use a U-lock on your bike. Cables get cut all the time. We found out the hard way.

27.description: This place was decent everything is 2.95 and in tiny portions. While it is a good price for sushi its a rip off for dessert. The tuna roll is 6 pieces for 2.95. Everything else is like two piece or one piece for 2.95 as well. I had a good overall experience here with my boyfriend. The service was decent as well.

32.description: Went in for lunch while waiting for my train and got a spicy salmon roll, a mini godzilla roll, and a spicy scallop roll. All were 2.95 each,  and all were absolutely delicious, the godzilla probably being my favorite. I do understand some of the criticism over the texture of the rice, which is something I noticed from the first bite. But for the price and considering I was the only one in the restaurant on a Sunday afternoon it seems understandable and did will not deter me from coming here again. Considering this is almost cheaper than Walmart sushi and umpteen times better I give it 5 stars. Come eat here you will not be disappointed unless you are a super sushi snob.

48.description: I think this is the sushi place Jefferson Park has been waiting for. Most of their rolls are $2.95 which is a steal compared to most sushi places. These 2.95 rolls are served as a sort of small plate style so you have the opportunity to sample the menu and be adventurous versus just picking one $12 roll and getting stuck with what could be a good or bad choice. Some of the simpler rolls like Unagi Q come in 6 rolls but the fancier rolls are served in 4. The sashimi pieces come in a pair for $2.95.  If you want a signature roll those range to about $12, but I think the $2.95 plates are way more worth it because then you can try a variety. My cousin and I went and split 10 roll plates and the bill was only $30! This place is definitely worth a try and I don't think you'll be disappointed. Our favorite rolls were the mini Godzilla, the spicy trio, volcano roll, unagi Q, and the unagi sashimi but I could name more they were all so fresh and tasty! They also have a stamp card incentive as well where every time you get 10 rolls you get a stamp which is not hard to do! Great place and worth a try!

44.description: What a great addition to the neighborhood! We have been to eat here three times since they've opened and each time we did not leave disappointed. Their $2.95 menu allows you to try many different rolls, which is a huge plus rather than spending $12 for one roll you aren't even sure you are going to like. They also have their signature rolls for more but if you're in the mood to try many things, go for the $2.95 menu. The service has always been prompt and friendly. The rice is the perfect texture and the fish tastes fresh. It's BYOB, so that cuts down on your expenses even more! All in all, we've gotten out of here with full bellies and a bill below $27. We will definitely be back, many times.

24.description: I recently moved on up from my lovely Lincoln Square apartment that was skyrocketing in price (thanks) to a little starter home in the also lovely Sauganash. The main downside of my new majorly residential neighborhood is that it's a black hole of food delivery, especially compared to my old neighborhood where I had prime pickings of any type of delivery I desired. It's been a struggle and after far fewer hits than misses, we decided to give Godzilla a try. I'm definitely happy we did. Both times we've had it delivered, all the sushi was very good especially considering it's all very affordable, though most rolls are a little smaller than what I'm used to. Some of their rolls are pretty different from what I would consider "standard" for the Americanized ones we've grown to love, for example their signature Godzilla roll is unlike any of the Godzilla rolls I've ordered elsewhere, but it's not an issue. I have never gone in here to eat, but so far it wins as my go-to delivery sushi spot

7.description: Due to my never ending crave for sushi, when I found this place I was ecstatic! Its conveniently located, quiet little joint. I haven't seen many people dine in, which is probably because they do take out AND delivery. I enjoy dining in because everyone is very nice and respectful, but most of all I like to enjoy the cozy ambiance this place gives.I've been here more times than I'd like to admit, and I love most of their rolls. For 2.95 each plate, its a bargain lunch or dinner! I recommend the tiger roll, crunchy spicy salmon roll (drool), and spicy scallop roll. Not a huge fan of the volcano roll, but if you're my boyfriend and LOVE spicy mayo, its calling you. If you love sashimi, I strongly suggest getting the chirashi don. Beautiful pieces of assorted fish on a bed of sushi rice. Yum!I've never done carry out or delivery through them but sushi is almost always better eaten right after preparation anyway!

40.description: Pretty good stuff. I ordered through grubhub and had it delivered. It was a very fast delivery and I don't live that close, which is a good thing for me. I tried a variety of the rolls and they were all pretty good. I like that everything is $2.95, they may not be huge rolls, but this allows you to try many things and not get full from the 2 giant rolls. I'm definitely going to order again or go in person. Hope they can make a good go of it, because this area needs good japanese.

30.description: I love this place. Very reasonable & good quality. They are slow, but I think it's worth waiting for. Great to have some local Jeff Park sushi.

46.description: My wife and came here on Friday and had a variety of rolls and Sushi.  Presentation, freshness, and flavor was superb.  The roles were reasonably priced (under $3).  Specialty rolls an sushi were less expensive than other restaurants.   Restaurant does a high volume of take out businesss.  This is a BYOB restaurant.  Total dinner for two without tip was $40.

1.description: Godzilla Sushi Roll (GSR) is a small storefront @ 4945 N Milwaukee Ave.  it's located just north of the Jefferson Park train station so all you sushi enthusiasts can grab sushi on the fly.  Yum something to munch on on the way downtown or out to O'Hare Airport if you're going the other way.  They are open lunch hours, close around 2:30 and reopen for dinner hours around 5 pm.  This way you can grab lunch and if you still have that craving for sushi grab some for dinner on the way home.GSR has decent quality sushi at a very reasonable price.  I mean you can't compare it to somewhere like Katsu on Peterson, but for a fraction of the cost the sushi is pretty good with a large variety of options.I tried 3 rolls each for $2.95/roll with 4 pieces.  So for under $10 you get a pretty good fix of sushi at a reasonable price.  Spicy Trio Roll - This was by far my favorite of the 3 rolls w/a combination of spicy salmon & tempura crunch topped w/tuna, white tuna & a blend of spicy mayo & Unagi sauce and tobiko.  The crunch of the tempura batter along with the sauces created a very good blendMini Godzilla Roll - The restaurants namesake was a bit of a let down, but it was tasty.  Basically a California roll w/seared spicy tuna and the same spicy tuna & Unagi sauceMiami Roll - Had deep fried shrimp tempura (no crunch that I was looking for), imitation crab, cream cheese topped with spicy mayoThey are pretty new and have been at their location for about 5 months.  It's worth checking out and I will be back because I enjoy a good meal at a good value

9.description: I usually like this place when I don't want to spend a lot but today I waited 45 mins and the rice was very dry.

26.description: I've been going to Godzilla sushi since the first week they opened, and I'm hooked! Fresh, innovative sushi with friendly customer service, plus they're now open for lunch EVERY DAY of the week! Yay! The customers spoke, and the business listened (a rare thing this day and age). My favorite rolls are the Miami, Volcano, San Francisco, and the tuna and avocado. The rice to ingredients ratio is always spot on, and the fish is always fresh. I also like the flavor of the rice. I tend to lean toward the maki rolls, but the nigiri is equally as impressive. For $3 you get 2 pieces of nigiri. It's the best deal on sushi that you'll find in Chicago. Seriously. I feel that Jefferson Park was in desperate need of a sushi restaurant, and Godzilla certainly fills that need. The menu is incredibly affordable. As others have stated, most of the items are only $3 each. Even the "specialty" rolls are only $3, but you get 4 pieces rather than the standard 6 with the more basic rolls. There are some rolls that go up to $10+, and I've tried a few and found them to be totally worth the extra money. Just remember that if your order is under $15, you have to pay cash. I totally understand this, as it's a way to keep their costs down, and the savings is DEFINITELY passed on to the customer.I've been to Godzilla at LEAST a dozen times since they opened. They have stolen me from Lawrence Fish Market, and that's no easy feat. I was at LFM at least once a week for 10 years! As long as they keep the prices low, the service friendly, and the sushi fresh, they will have a regular customer for LIFE from me.

25.description: The concept at Godzilla is similar to conveyor belt sushi. There are small plates of sushi rolls (4 piece or 6 piece depending on the complexity of the roll), 2 pieces of nigiri, or a variety of other appetizers all for $3 per plate. Each plate is made to order as opposed to conveyor belt which has sushi that could be sitting out for a while. I highly recommend the spicy trio.  The spicy scallops were too mushy. The rice isn't near the best I've had but at $3 a plate... It'll do. The Thai tea here is also pretty bomb and served in a cute mason jar. For made to order, 1-Yelp-dollar-$ign, tapas style sushi.. This place is fantastic. You can try dozens of different dishes without breaking the bank.

12.description: I've been going to Godzilla sushi since the first week they opened, and I'm hooked! Fresh, innovative sushi with friendly customer service, plus they're now open for lunch EVERY DAY of the week! Yay! The customers spoke, and the business listened (a rare thing this day and age). My favorite rolls are the Miami, Volcano, San Francisco, and the tuna and avocado. The rice to ingredients ratio is always spot on, and the fish is always fresh. I also like the flavor of the rice. I tend to lean toward the maki rolls, but the nigiri is equally as impressive. For $3 you get 2 pieces of nigiri. It's the best deal on sushi that you'll find in Chicago. Seriously. I feel that Jefferson Park was in desperate need of a sushi restaurant, and Godzilla certainly fills that need. The menu is incredibly affordable. As others have stated, most of the items are only $3 each. Even the "specialty" rolls are only $3, but you get 4 pieces rather than the standard 6 with the more basic rolls. There are some rolls that go up to $10+, and I've tried a few and found them to be totally worth the extra money. Just remember that if your order is under $15, you have to pay cash. I totally understand this, as it's a way to keep their costs down, and the savings is DEFINITELY passed on to the customer.I've been to Godzilla at LEAST a dozen times since they opened. They have stolen me from Lawrence Fish Market, and that's no easy feat. I was at LFM at least once a week for 10 years! As long as they keep the prices low, the service friendly, and the sushi fresh, they will have a regular customer for LIFE from me.

21.description: I've been ordering take out from here a few times already and I got to say sometimes it's a hit or a miss. Most times the things I order are amazing - like the mini godzilla role- others not so much. Very tiny, very cute. Wish they gave out more ginger and wasabi.

17.description: This is strictly on their customer service and not their food. Got a restaurant.com coupon. Doesn't say Dine in Only anywhere in the fine prints. They will not allow me to order take out using it even though the lady herself could not justify it. It normally wouldn't be a problem for me to dine in but the whole restaurant smelled extremely greasy. The grease smell was so strong that I was getting a headache and walked out smelling like I was hovering over a deep fryer for an hour.Thank God I can trade in my coupon for another coupon instead.

10.description: Love this place. I am so happy that it is my neighborhood! $2.95 for sushi- love it. and it's really good. I've been here at least 4 times already and always got great food and service.

5.description: The concept at Godzilla is similar to conveyor belt sushi. There are small plates of sushi rolls (4 piece or 6 piece depending on the complexity of the roll), 2 pieces of nigiri, or a variety of other appetizers all for $3 per plate. Each plate is made to order as opposed to conveyor belt which has sushi that could be sitting out for a while. I highly recommend the spicy trio.  The spicy scallops were too mushy. The rice isn't near the best I've had but at $3 a plate... It'll do. The Thai tea here is also pretty bomb and served in a cute mason jar. For made to order, 1-Yelp-dollar-$ign, tapas style sushi.. This place is fantastic. You can try dozens of different dishes without breaking the bank.

3.description: Hubby came home and gave Rosa J. a fair warning that he had a crappy work day.  That was understandable!  Let us just have a lazy, "work-free" evening and order something online for delivery.  I recalled "Godzilla Sushi" on Milwaukee, which is located a few feet away from Jefferson Park Transportation Center.  I placed an order via Eat24 on their Yelp page.  I also utilized something wonderful called the Google search engine and found a $2 off coupon.They do charge $3 delivery fee, with an minimum order of $12.50.  You can order in the "a la carte" style, or you can opt for the pre-set combo options or sushi entrees.  For $29 and some change, we had the following:- chirashi don ($14.50): it tasted better than how it was presented.  I wish there was more fish included with this price.  Once again, it is what it is in Chicago.  Having a sushi feast isn't the most economic option in the Windy City since neither Atlantic nor Pacific Ocean is surrounded by.  - veggie rolls combo ($9.50): it's a vegetarian-friendly entree since there's no fish in any of these rolls.  Both entrees come with the miso soup.  The delivery driver arrived at our house within forty-five (45) minutes, as promised in the confirmation e-mail.  Contents in the brown bag were delivered securely, except the naughty soy sauce was slightly spilled.  Overall, we were satisfied with the food and delivery service.

35.description: Third time eating their food and I am done. 1st was take out: the rice was very overcooked which gave the sushi bad texture. 2nd was eat in: slow service ( the people next to us left in a huff) and mistakes in our order. Also at least one piece had tough ligament which was very off putting. I've never had that even with cheap grocery store sushi. 3rd was pick up: 3 pieces with ligament (barf), scallop was weird texture (I didn't even finish it), the Godzilla roll presentation was disgusting. you'd think signature roll would be beautiful but it looked like scraps of fish on top, weird chunks like I've never seen on a roll. Usually when it's a top it's beautiful slices layered, right?But my biggest reason for my post is my current gastrointestinal distress. I've thankfully eaten a lot of sushi and never been sick. Cheap isn't worth it. I'm sad because I really wanted this place to work for me. So convenient! Nice people work there!

19.description: Good prices- decent Sushi. The place is a little disorganized not your average sushi place.  It's still not bad for the price.

28.description: My husband and I have eaten here several times. We've done take-out and also dined in. We think it's fun to take sushi over to Rex Tavern a few doors down. I've tried just about everything on the $3 menu, no complaints. The Redeye specialty roll is awesome. Our server was prompt and the wait time was reasonable. If you're looking for a fancy experience this is not the place, however I feel the vibe is in tune with the neighborhood.

45.description: Very good! Very fresh and the prices are excellent! Byob! Very friendly, fast! Definitely will be back!

33.description: First time was on a Thursday at 7 pm. Service was good, atmosphere was good. Sushi was fresh and surprisingly tasty. Prices are inexpensive. My favorite was the spicy trio roll, tuna and avocado roll. I would recommend this place to all locals of Jefferson Park.

43.description: By all means this place is beyond amazing ! I couldn't believe their prices, so I had to call and confirm. None the less the prices are real and the rolls are amazing. I will defiantly be coming back ... !!

2.description: $3 for most rolls. 4 pieces for the more complicated rolls and 6 pieces for more common rolls.However, that doesn't mean in any way that the quality is lower. This is go to sushi whether you just need a fix or want to have a good meal.Always ready in less than 30 minutes. These guys are great!

18.description: Third time eating their food and I am done. 1st was take out: the rice was very overcooked which gave the sushi bad texture. 2nd was eat in: slow service ( the people next to us left in a huff) and mistakes in our order. Also at least one piece had tough ligament which was very off putting. I've never had that even with cheap grocery store sushi. 3rd was pick up: 3 pieces with ligament (barf), scallop was weird texture (I didn't even finish it), the Godzilla roll presentation was disgusting. you'd think signature roll would be beautiful but it looked like scraps of fish on top, weird chunks like I've never seen on a roll. Usually when it's a top it's beautiful slices layered, right?But my biggest reason for my post is my current gastrointestinal distress. I've thankfully eaten a lot of sushi and never been sick. Cheap isn't worth it. I'm sad because I really wanted this place to work for me. So convenient! Nice people work there!

41.description: Firstly, is this the best sushi the best in the city? No, but it is very good, especially considering the price. My favourite part of this little sushi place is that the majority of their menu is 1/2 rolls for $3, which means you could do a Tapas style sushi dinner, sampling different things on the menu. Also, small portions are nice for someone looking to grab a quick small lunch, which given its proximity to the Jeff Park CTA is wonderful. For those looking for full rolls and a more traditional menu, they do have that as well, but they seem to focus more on the small and well priced portions.In summary: good sushi and good prices. I'll definitely be returning

4.description: --Lots of variety--Very good value--Well placed by transit and neighborhood--Fast service and reliable qualityI live right near here and it's almost a hazard on my wallet to have such a handy sushi place this close.

6.description: This place owns the Jefferson Park area. Don't think twice about it just go. Prices are great!! Food is delicious. Great customer service. Will be back!!

22.description: Due to my never ending crave for sushi, when I found this place I was ecstatic! Its conveniently located, quiet little joint. I haven't seen many people dine in, which is probably because they do take out AND delivery. I enjoy dining in because everyone is very nice and respectful, but most of all I like to enjoy the cozy ambiance this place gives.I've been here more times than I'd like to admit, and I love most of their rolls. For 2.95 each plate, its a bargain lunch or dinner! I recommend the tiger roll, crunchy spicy salmon roll (drool), and spicy scallop roll. Not a huge fan of the volcano roll, but if you're my boyfriend and LOVE spicy mayo, its calling you. If you love sashimi, I strongly suggest getting the chirashi don. Beautiful pieces of assorted fish on a bed of sushi rice. Yum!I've never done carry out or delivery through them but sushi is almost always better eaten right after preparation anyway!

15.description: I ordered delivery from this place a couple weeks ago and it was great. However, my review will be based on my delivery experience from yesterday which left me never wanting to give business to this place ever again. The experience was absolutely horrible with ZERO customer service on the part of the restaurant.Ordered food around 745pm, called around 910 to see what was up with the food and was told by management that they were just finishing up the order and that it would be another 40 minutes....are you kidding me??? 3 hours for delivery for sushi...which is a raw food. The manager told me that they had a lot of large orders and said they are having a "crazy night, sorry". I was basically encouraged to cancel my order by the manager because she asked me if I wanted to cancel about 3 times during the phone call...probably so that they have less orders to worry about. I ended up canceling my order and won't be ordering from this place again for fear of the same experience.Bottom line...don't open a restaurant if you can't handle the business its going to generate!

20.description: Review is for the new location on Clark Street in Uptown: was excited to try this new restaurant not even a block away from me and finally ordered take out from them tonight. I am very pleased and excited that there is a sushi place close by that's actually good. The rolls are cheap $2.95 for 4 pieces and prices go up for larger rolls. I ordered the bazooka as a starter, Mexican roll, tiny Godzilla roll, and the gyoza. All were tasty! The restaurant is small, only a few tables but to my surprise, very cutely decorated, clean, and best part, the sushi chefs were actually asian oh and also BYOB!!! Would be fun to get a large group together for dinner one night; would appear that we rented the whole restaurant for ourselves! Looking forward to my next craving of sushi!

36.description: I ordered delivery from this place a couple weeks ago and it was great. However, my review will be based on my delivery experience from yesterday which left me never wanting to give business to this place ever again. The experience was absolutely horrible with ZERO customer service on the part of the restaurant.Ordered food around 745pm, called around 910 to see what was up with the food and was told by management that they were just finishing up the order and that it would be another 40 minutes....are you kidding me??? 3 hours for delivery for sushi...which is a raw food. The manager told me that they had a lot of large orders and said they are having a "crazy night, sorry". I was basically encouraged to cancel my order by the manager because she asked me if I wanted to cancel about 3 times during the phone call...probably so that they have less orders to worry about. I ended up canceling my order and won't be ordering from this place again for fear of the same experience.Bottom line...don't open a restaurant if you can't handle the business its going to generate!

14.description: Have ate here twice now, once on grub hub and once in store. I'd say pretty good. Great price. Food came out fast. Will be back again. Store is cute. Only major suggestion if they need business is allow BYOB. That'd be the best. No bar here in case you wanted to know.

3.description: This sure isn't what I imagined when we pulled up in front of this "European" bakery. It was dark and dreary inside. The glass cabinets were not lit and there was very little in there.I bought a loaf of bread. My choices were white or white bread. The bread was fluffy, but it had a dry texture and little flavor. We ended up using it for toast.With so many fun and tasty bakeries in the city, I can pretty much guarantee that we won't be back here any time soon.

1.description: Found another hidden gem. I'm not the type to regularly stumble into random bakeries, this was just fate. While the décor is extremely lacking, the goods are impeccable. This place easily has the best meat Burek in town--it is huge, easily feeds a family of 12, and authentically flawless. My taste buds were instantly transported to another land, delightfully so. Don't be fooled at the small selection of sweets, we grabbed 1 of each and later regretted not getting more. I'm not even Serbian, but this place is just awesome.

2.description: i must admit first off, that i am not honoring the wish of the owner by placing a review on yelp. for when i told her i wanted to spread the word, she was not interested. you see, this is an old world place, run by a serbian couple who are getting up there in years. social media, hip trendiness and more business is not what they seek. this small little place tucked away on underexplored elston avenue is too busy cranking out their wonderful italian breads, sweets and more for heavyweights like fresh farms.but how could i resist? i finally was able to try my first burek, after never making into the infamous detas on north ridge ave. a burek, is a filo dough masterpiece, stuffed with either cheese or meat. i chose the cheese. delectable! its kind of like spanakopita. a full enormous one is 15$. you get basically eight portions for that price.i also tried a spongy cake soaked in syrup whose name escapes me. yum! and the nice owner gifted my a coconut flavored treat that was also very delectable.make no mistake about it, this is not a bakery in the lincoln park sense. there are no pricey capuccinos, limited  choices and little ambiance. but this is the real old world authenticity, including the sullen looks as i enter the door until they realize i am like a delighted little child walking into a bakery that beckons from long ago and far away.

5.description: Very delicious pastries and burek.  The owner is very nice!!! I wish I knew about this place earlier!

6.description: Well I was weary about going in because from past experiences the European bakeries treat non Europeans a little less nice. But the lady was extremely nice and helpful. I could not recognize many items and she explained what they were and recommended a few items that were good. The selection is small, very small and no other normal bakery staple items here but my experience was pleasant. Based on that alone i might go back. Based on taste: Its seemed to be hit or miss. Some of my items were good like "banana ball" sorry for my lack of intelligent terminology. It was very moist and did not have an overpowering banana flavor. Seemed just right. The small cookies with apricot in the middle were ok. the same ones dipped in chocolate were much better, they seemed fresher!So I might give it another try. Its close to work.

7.description: If you're a fan of Balkan bakeries, you'll feel comfortable here.  In addition to delicious breads, they have different varieties of burek available with 20-30 minutes notice (eg, plain, cheese, potato, meat, etc) and they can do other savory baked goods too.  I'd give it 4.5 stars on the above items.  There are a lot of sweet cakes and cookies ready made, but I'm not very into sweets, so I can't comment on them, which is why I'll just give an overall rating a 4.  If you're looking for common American or French pastries, look elsewhere.  This isn't the place for butter cookies with sprinkles, fruit tarts, chocolate this or that, etc, so don't come in expecting that.

8.description: Unfortunately, this will not be my local bakery.  I worked in a bakery for 7 years so I am bias BUT I mean business when it comes to my baked goods.1st- I was greeted at the door with the STRONG smell of cigarette smoke.  Now one of the best things about a bakery is the smell.  We actually left smelling of smoke.2nd- the butter cookies were old.  My husband has a great nose/taste and he said they were musty.  I would assume from the cigarette smoke too.3rd- There is not a lot of stuff to choose from, this is not a hoppin' bakery.  It is "European" but there was a lot of items that were unfamiliar so I had them make up a box of their sweets.  For my taste buds nothing was worth going back.  This is not what I understand as "European", maybe Eastern European?4th- one kind of bread, white.  Got a loaf and it was fresh but noting special.5th- the lady that helped us was really nice and gave us a free "potato bread" but it wasn't potato flour it was stuffed w/ hash browned potatoes.  This was really the only thing I would ever consider going back for.Sorry Classic European Bakery it's a no go.

9.description: i'm a fan of melenia's burek.  it's delicious!  and inexpensive.  i would like to order the cheese next time and probably the bread.  her pastries are okay but the burek is what will keep me coming back.

0.description: First let me say that I am an Albanian woman and because my mom lives so far from me I don't have the opportunity to enjoy some homemade burek as often as I'd like. Well this place smells like home as soon as you walk in you smell the burek baking in the oven.  mmmmmmmm aaaaaahh :)  But once we got it home and opened the package we were in heaven. At first i expected them to skimp on the meat as many places do but i was wrong. Not only were they generous with the meat but it was seasoned perfectly, bringing back memories of the old country. This is by far the number one place to get real deal, homemade Burek if your home sick. ;) They actually supply City Fresh Market, which is another Burek spot. FYI....cash only!

4.description: The burek is the main reason to go here. Also, the fresh white bread is way preferable to eating Wonder Bread. Do yourself a favor and the city of Chicago and support a small business that has quality products.

3.description: I've been coming here since as long as I've been wearing glasses. Back then they were located on foster and Pulaski. I live in LOs Angeles yet I still come here for my glasses and contacts. The selection of frames are pretty good especially if you're looking for high end designers. I just wish they carried Chanel! The service is great! They can usually give me my glasses the same day if I don't get a specialized lens. The owner is really great at molding the frames to make the glasses got comfortably.

1.description: I've been patronizing this business for the past 20 years.  The staff are always nice and accommodating.  They always make sure that I'm comfortable with my contacts and eyeglasses.  They even try to laugh at my corny jokes.  Here's one I'll use on them next time I see them, "What do you call a deer with no eyes?"  No eyed deer...Ha! Anyways, this is a good place to go for reasonable prices and awesome service.  Try it out!

2.description: Save your money and headache. This store does not know how to make rimless glasses.  My rim less glass came out uneven, the left lens is 2mm larger. Most of all, these people will not issue a refund or stand behind their workmanship and product.  Run away from this place as fast as you can. Its NOT worth your time. The quality of lens are very poor and expensive.

5.description: Great service, friendly staff! I got my glasses here yesterday and loved the experience. I usually despise going go the doctor, but they made me feel at home yesterday. Will be going back for contacts soon!

6.description: My mom went there 3 times to get her glasses fixed.  This place charged her $700, which i strongly believe they over charged her.  But my mom was getting a massive headache.  Last Tuesday, she went back to that place and the owner/manager was being so highly rude and refused to fix it for her.  My opinion to this is that it felt like he didn't give a damn if my mom continues to get headache from it, which is really upsetting.  I'm not trying to assume anything, but I'm guessing he was acting like that toward her because she can't speak English and don't know any better how the business industry goes.  But when I called that place like few minutes ago, he denied he never said that to her and told me their office policy is, which I don't care about.  So, I'm assuming he's twisting everything around because I spoke to him in English.  Top of that, he was so unfriendly, has an attitude, and rude.  If he don't like his job, he should find another job that will suit his personality.  I would never recommend this place to anyone because their service was so terrible and disrespectful.  Also, I already reported to the BBB (Better Business Bureau).

7.description: I have been coming here since I was in elementary school when they were still at the old location on Foster/Pulaski.I am an adult now and still coming here for my contacts and eye glass needs at the new location in Niles.  The staff is wonderful and patient.  I'm not the easiest customer.  The store is clean and bright.  The layout is great for frame shopping. I don't think you can better selection ofeye glass frames.  They something for everyone.  I wanted funky red artsy type frames and I found them. I have watched their business grow as they have seen me grow into an adult.       The reason for me writing a review now is because I called to have my contacts ready for pick up today and I was told they didn't have them in stock at this time but can order it.  Well, it's my last pair of contacts and had them in for a while and my eyeball is starting to sting.  The gal said, no worries, she had some trial ones I can use. Awesome service.  As always!

8.description: I just picked up my new glasses and I love them!  They had a wide assortment of frames and great collection of designer frames.  And I love the prices!!! I got a great deal on mu Gucci glasses.The service was great and professional.  It was quick and easy.  I'm going to have to tell my friends about this hidden gem.  Thanks My Optical!

0.description: very kind and always has amazing offers whenever I go. and always seems to have the latest trends and designed glasses

4.description: Over the years I have received great service from these folks at acceptable prices. They have been able to accommodate any special requests I've made and have completed them in a timely manner.In this age of buy everything on the internet cheaper, I cannot stress the importance of being able to try on different frames and have someone "tune" the glasses to your face and shape size. I've been wearing glasses for over twenty years and demand comfort and durability and My Optical has been providing exactly that for over five years now for me. Tip: Don't worry too much about the sticker prices. This is a family owned business so there is room for negotiation. They are also willing to help optimize your insurance dollar by providing you with the best bang for your insurance buck - something a corporate monster will never care to do.Always friendly and professional and they know how to take care of their customers.

3.description: Katrina is an amazing artist! SO happy with my results. Very clean establishment, and friendly staff. Also, affordable. I will be back!

1.description: Going in to doing my eyebrows I was very anxious that I wasn't going to like them or that it would be incredibly painful. But neither of those things happened. After taking over an hour styling and picking out my color, I ended up loving how they looked. I came back for my touch up this weekend! I highly recommend this place. The patience and precision of Kasia and overall natural look of my eyebrows is amazing. I'm very happy with the end result.

2.description: I Currently have got scalp micro-pigmentation on my Hairline and I Love it so far. Katrina is very professional and nice, I would Recommend her any day for Perfect Results. Micro pigmentation has gave me my hairline back and my confidence. Thanks Katrina see u at our next Appointment

5.description: FIVE STARS!!!!!!! I wouldn't go anywhere else for eyebrows and etc Kasia is the BEST!!!! She will give you exactly what you want with a very natural look nothing extreme. My eyebrows look amazing and getting them done by Kasia was the best decision I have ever made I am so happy with my eyebrows I feel amazing!!!!! Wszystkim polecam to miejsce!!

6.description: Katrina is an exceptional esthetician. She has helped me with scarring from an accident that left my face looking rough. My scars have gone down significantly to where people I meet don't even notice that I had skin damage anymore. Katrina has also done wonders to thicken my hairline. I highly recommend that you see if she is able to help you with your permanent makeup needs. She is very impressive!

7.description: Great service. Very attentive and gave fantastic advice and recommendations! Finally a spa that cares about their customers!!

8.description: Katrina is the best in what she does. Best permanent make up ever. She's so talented.

0.description: Catrina's experience is shown in her work.I went in for permanent eyebrows & eyeliner Top & Bottom.Catrina reviewed various eyebrow & eyeliner styles as well as colors. Catrina listened to what I wanted & offered her professional suggestions;  the results are wonderful !(The photo is next day, eyes are still swollen therefore difficult to see eyeliner results). I highly recommend Catrina at O. M. Spa.

4.description: This is a long review, but I think when you are doing permanent makeup you can't really skimp on the important facts and process when it comes to picking a place and the actual work they do.  So here goes (and quick summary at the bottom)...I came to OM Spa for my eyebrows.  I fill my eyebrows in daily and whenever I remove my makeup, I feel like a different person because of the difference.  I wanted to be able to go make-up free and not feel like I am missing something that should naturally be there. My goal was to achieve something that looks 100% natural in color, thickness, shape, and technique.  After doing a lot of research and looking at before and afters online, I determined that the hair stroke technique would be the best method to use to create the look I wanted.  Then I did a lot of searching within the Chicago area to determine which place I should go to.  It was a little tough finding this place and I think I got lucky stumbling across it because it isn't the typical place located in the River North/Gold Coast area.  It was tempting to go to one of these places too because I kind of just assumed they would be good based on other aspects of the business, but not actually the work itself if that makes sense (more reviews, location, better website, etc).  BUT, then I found Katrina- I saw before and after pics on Facebook, read that she won a reward almost 15 years ago for best permanent makeup in Orlando, and saw that she has years of experience practicing this technique.  Her portfolio was way better than those from places located in the downtown area so I ultimately decided to go to OM Spa.So now to the actual work itself.  Katrina used three different techniques to create the hair strokes.  You have two appointments when you do a full-set of eyebrows.  In the first, we spent a lot of time discussing what I wanted to achieve and creating the shape I was happy with (1.5 hrs) before she ever started to do the permanent makeup.   Katrina works with your natural bone structure and brow line to ensure that it complements your face so that in the long-run it will still flatter you. She is a perfectionist and was constantly measuring, adding/removing the tiniest amount here and there until it was just right before she began.  She applied numbing cream and then did microblading and softap.  Everybody's pain tolerance is different, but I would say it was a little uncomfortable but totally bearable.  It's hard to be completely happy right after since your eyebrows will look way too dark (in 5 days they lighten to the appropriate shade) and need to heal, but I could tell they would get there.  Overall, I was happy once they healed and confident in my decision to work with her- but the best comes after the second appointment when she does touch up and adds on.  It's easier to add-on than try to correct a mistake so the first appointment for myself was getting a good base to work with to make it easier to add on in the second appointment.  3 weeks later I had my second appointment (this one lasted two hours instead of three) and I finally got the look I was going for.  Numbing cream again and hair stroke technique using a different method (can't remember the name).  They look even, natural, normal and not like a tacky eyebrow tattoo that you can spot a mile away.  Can't wait to go to swimming and still have a full set of eyebrows.Overall, her prices are very reasonable and the touch-up is included.  Katrina truly is a professional and knows what she is doing.  She gives great advice and takes pride in her work and I am even going back for a facial although I have never done one in my life!  Take aways:- Awesome work- Great prices- Sterile and clean - Professional and personable- Relaxing environment.  You don't feel like one of many clients that they are trying to rush out the door.

58.description: We used to eat here every couple of weeks but we have stopped patronizing the place since shortly after summer. The food is only ok and the service has just gone downhill. One night we were seated and bread was delivered to our table and then no one came back to take our order. I had to go ask the manager for a waitress and finally we just walked out. It seems like the last few times we have been in here the service has been bad, really bad.  The food is decent but not exceptional and there are so many other places like this to choose from its easy to go somewhere else.

56.description: I have been going to Colletti's for a couple of years -both take out and dine in. I would say the service and food has improved over time. But yes the prices have gone up. It's usually pretty quiet- which is nice- the booths are very comfortable and they have seating right behind the hostess- a bit loud- and seating in the back which is nice and quiet. I did see the TVs but could barely hear them- and we were in the bar area. The Good1. Food is tasty- I have had their appetizers, pastas, pizzas and desserts. All good.2. Very friendly server helped us pick out a great appetizer, drinks and entrées 3. Very , very  friendly server : she juggled a phone order and waiting to be seated patrons with friendliness and a smile! KUDOS to you!!Areas of improvement:1. On the day we went their was a registration going on and the lot was FULL but the restaurant was empty...? I wish they had the registers- park in the back lot- we almost turned around for fear we'd have to wait for a table...2. Prices have really increased- $7.00 dollars for a tiny chocolate bunt cake?Good food and service- high prices--look for them on restaurants.com

29.description: Recently grabbed lunch at coletti's with a business partner, per his suggestion.  We both had the Crab and shrimp Louie salad. Which was AMAZING!  We also split the Roasted pepper and sausage flatbread app.  Have heard the buzz for years and finally made it in!  Not to mention, I just won a $50.00 gift certificate for "liking" their facebook page,  and This guys never wins anything! Service and decor was fantastic.  I will be back for sure!

42.description: Nice place . Very bad food and wait staff . Went there for lunch . Onion soup has nothing to do with onion soup .. salads were good  but spicy deep fried shrimps were just horrible .. we ordered 2 portions ,tasted,didn't eat it,  complained , got credit for only one . Asked for caffe latte from menu , waitres didn't know what's that...brought us regular coffee ... manager didn't care..never showed up . Will not return .

23.description: We walked in and asked to sit on the patio since it was a beautiful day outside. The owner just said "we're not open our there". We said there are people outside already. He said "well they are just having drinks". We walked out. If he can't even try to accommodate us not worth out business. How does he even know what we were there for? Bad attitude equals lost customers!

47.description: My aunts hosted a bridal shower for my little sister at Colletti's on Saturday. We were one of (I think) three parties that started at noon. Our party was on the smaller side, so they had us set up in the bar. The space was fine for what we had. I think we had only one server for about 20 of us, so it did take a while to get a drink refill. I think that the best thing on the table was the rolls, which were fresh baked. Yum!! We each received a side salad, which was perfectly cold. I noticed that everyone around me was sprinkling parmesan onto their salads. I suspect it was to soak up some of the dressing. Thats why I did it... and it helped. Our lunch was served family style, and included roast beef, roasted chicken, pasta with marinara, and green beans. I didn't try the chicken, since it was crusted with a LOT of oregano (my least favorite spice after rosemary). The roast beef was cooked well done (whereas I prefer medium rare), but the flavor was alright. Pasta was okay, green beans were okay. The staff was very nice to us and I didn't feel that we were rushed out by any means, but we did know when our party was over when they started letting the general public back into the bar. One of the staffers found a cart to help us transport all of the gifts out to the parking lot. Dang, wedding type gifts are heavy!!

8.description: I had sea bass social last night. With Cajun seasoning.  Bland. Sea bass was not cooked properly. Brown Rice bland. No salt or pepper.  Mushy carrots .  not worth it

31.description: Great food and atmosphere!  You forget where you are and what time it is in this place.

34.description: I was hesitant per some of the reviews here but thank goodness my experience was not the same. The thin crust pizza is awesome. I love a crunchy crust and the sauce is delicious.  Came here with the family and had a fabulous time, all the staff check on us regularly and the place is very nice.Definitely coming back to try more.

16.description: I went to Colletti's for New Years Eve, because we got a great deal on a special, being offered for Black Friday, or so I thought. My family has been visiting this place for years & this visit was quite different. The special was pay $120 for one & get half off ($60) the second. The package was supposed to include the following: fresh seafood bar & passed hors d'oeuvres, a choice of 3 entrees, open bar, a champagne toast at midnight, coffee bar & pizza, after midnight & live entertainment, all night. Sounded like a a great deal. A group of 30 of my friends & family booked it & so did I. At the time of booking, I informed the manager, Rick, that I am in a wheelchair. He said that was not a problem. In addition to that, my cousin went into the restaurant & booked, who also told him I was in a wheelchair & she watched him write down "wheelchair", next to our group name. When we arrived on NYE, we discovered that he set up our group of 3 tables, in the very back corner of the banquet room, next to the band. It was inaccessible to navigate through the other 20 tables, where people were seated. So, instead of being cornered into the room, where I'd be constantly bumped into by other patrons, we were given the option to sit in the bar area. 10 of us sat in there, without the rest of our group. We didn't have access to hear the band or the seafood bar, the passed hors d'oeuvres, the champagne toast, the coffee bar, or pizza. So, basically we ate dinner & had drinks. Nothing worth the $90 per person. My steak was overcooked & barely edible, by my standards. Later in the evening, my cousin & I were having a conversation at the bar, about the fact that we got charged for drinks & we probably shouldn't have due to our inconvenience. The bartender, Rocco (the manager's son) butted in & started a very loud and hostile fight with her. He said, "you don't like it, f%#k off & get the f#%k out of my bar!" All while slamming his fist on the bar top several times. That is beyond disrespectful & unacceptable! I called today to see if the manager would offer any sort of compensation & he refused. He believes he did everything he could do to accommodate me. I'm not too satisfied with that, because had he done anything to make the seating accessible, after knowing I was in a wheelchair, over a month prior to my arrival, there wouldn't have been a problem. Needless to say, we won't be spending another cent in this place, ever again!

13.description: Neighborhood hangout and even better since they remodeled the bar and added outdoor seating. Pizza is great and bartenders have been there forever and know how to pour a drink. Good for family in the restaurant or Friday night after work get together in the bar.

11.description: Colletti's is the party place all the time, but they have outdone themselves for the holidays. Last Saturday night, I danced my buns off! They have ample room for their separate private parties. The week before, one party had a DJ and it was such a good time. The music seems to separate itself from others rooms, which I thought was so appropriate. I keep on love, love, loving Colletti's!   Keep up the great food, service and good times!

39.description: We have been wanting to try this place for a very long time and finally pulled the trigger.We were very disappointed!!
