I went in on a Thursday and I saw results by Monday. My friends and family kept  saying, you look refreshed, you are glowing, and there's something different about you! I am so pleased with my results, I had forehead injections and a few to my chin/lower mouth area. Monica even gave me a tour of the treatment rooms and a microdermabrasion spot sample. I will definitely be going back for more Dysport and other treatments. Thanks Dr. Sypien and the Ageless Med Spa staff!

2.description: Thank you Dr. Sypien! I appreciate the time and patience the doctor took with me.  After my last appointment I look awesome.  I have an "under the eye" problem- I have lost most, if not all of the fat under my eyes.  With a lot of discussion and 2 appointments I am in a place where I no longer look tired and unhappy.  The doctor truly is awesome! She listens, she helps you to relax and she used her best judgement for treatment.  I will see her again soon! Thank you Dr. Sypien!!!

18.description: I got a living social voucher for a choice of 3 different facials. I ended up not getting a choice- when I entered the room she just told me we were doing an oxygen facial. I hadn't looked at the voucher in a while so I had forgotten that there were options. I feel a little bummed about that- but oh well...The facial was OK. Nothing exciting. It was only 30 minutes and for some reason I was under the impression that it was an hour. I may have been wrong. The spa was pretty nice- again, nothing too exciting.It was OK. I probably will not go back- depending on what they charge full-price for this facial. I paid $35 for the living social and that seems to be about what it is worth.Nothing horrible- but nothing special either.The esthetician was really nice.

13.description: As soon as you walk through the door you are greeted by a wonderful staff. The spa provides clients with relaxing music and a variety of services to choose from. I started getting services done here when I suffered from a severe acne outbreak. Monica, one of the estheticians informed me about all of the necessary steps we need to take and what I should and shouldn't do. After a couple sessions my acne was disappearing like magic. After the great results, I continue to come back for different sorts of treatments and recommend Ageless Spa to anyone who is looking for a satisfying experience.

4.description: I have been a customer of Ageless Medspa for several years and have recommended family and friends to Ageless Medspa as well.  I see Monika at least once a month and she is wonderful.   She truly loves what she does and that is evident in each and every interaction. The team stays up to date on new treatments and introduces these treatments to their clients.  You never feel any pressure, in fact it is always a very relaxing experience for me.  You could never ask for a better team of professionals.   Thank you to Monika for all she does!

24.description: So, I purchased a coupon for one of their facials through LivingSocial (who was gracious enough to refund my money after I recounted my horrible experience to them) and feel it my duty to forewarn others of the experience they may have if they go there.  Okay first things first, I work in the beauty industry (hairstylist) and thus have had several friends over the years who were aestheticians, and obviously went to beauty school myself, where I learned firsthand as part of my education how to adminisiter a facial.  I know what a facial is supposed to look and feel like,  I have been getting them since I was 17 years old.I came on Yelp prior to purchasing the facial and because I saw only good reviews I felt assured that this would be a good experience.  But now I am skeptical that these reviews are legit, rather than being from friends or employees of the place.  Or maybe they only give good service to you if you are paying full price, because I Def. felt like my business was not valued since I had paid far less for an online coupon for their services. Ok so now to a retelling of my actual experience... First off, you should always be given a questionaire about your skin (routine, problems, habits) the first time you have a professional facial ANYWHERE.  I was given no such thing nor was I asked about my skin in any way by my aesthetician.  Rather, the first thing I was asked when she approached is "what are we doing today?"  Uh, I said, "you are the professional so I will let you look at my skin and decide what it needs" (first pang of doubt goes through me)I was rushed into the room, which had the overhead lights fully on- the room lights should always be off and there should be some sort of ambient light the entire time you are in a room for a facial. From the moment you enter until you leave.  Because it is not a relaxing experience to start such a service walking into a starkly lit room.  Or having the overhead lights flipped on full blast after lying in darkness for a while.So anyway she ushers me in and says "here it is".  Here what is?  She tells me to change and leaves to let me do so.Anyhow we decide to go with the oxygen infusion facial and it begins with a loud, piercing sound from the O2 machine for about a minute right next to my ear.  No apology or acknowledgement of this from my facialist.She literally spent 15 minutes on me (there is a clock in the room and I made note of when I was done because she spent so little time on me), was slamming and clinking things around as she picked them up and set them down the whole time, and just quickly slapped a few things on my face, rubbed them in with quick, jerky movements, then turned the overhead lights back, handed me a mirror and said that's it and left so I could change back into my clothes.I should also mention that you could clearly hear the tv and talking in the waiting area, and heels on the hardwood floor of on of the employees walking around during the entire time.  Not exactly relaxing.I could not believe that that was it.  Having worked in the service industry all my life (first as a bartender and server, now as a stylist) I tip automatically, but now think that I shouldn't have because thats only rewarding unforgiveable behavior.  She treated me the whole time like she just wanted to get me in and get me out, and probably assumed I would not have any clue that this was a poor service.  Tip of the day people: never assume your client is a clueless dumbass that doesn't know better, because they may just be one of your fellow employees in the industry...

6.description: I have been going to Ageless Medspa for a couple of years.   I have had various treatments.  The most recent was Tripollar.  I am afraid of Botox and other injections.  The Tripollar made a difference.  After six sessions, I could notice my brow lines, lip and frown lines had been reduced significantly.  I am 55 years old and will go back for more sessions. The office is so friendly and welcoming, I just love the staff.  Monica and Kasha are very skilled.  The doctor is very informative and honest with her opinion as to what's best for me.

15.description: So, I purchased a coupon for one of their facials through LivingSocial (who was gracious enough to refund my money after I recounted my horrible experience to them) and feel it my duty to forewarn others of the experience they may have if they go there.  Okay first things first, I work in the beauty industry (hairstylist) and thus have had several friends over the years who were aestheticians, and obviously went to beauty school myself, where I learned firsthand as part of my education how to adminisiter a facial.  I know what a facial is supposed to look and feel like,  I have been getting them since I was 17 years old.I came on Yelp prior to purchasing the facial and because I saw only good reviews I felt assured that this would be a good experience.  But now I am skeptical that these reviews are legit, rather than being from friends or employees of the place.  Or maybe they only give good service to you if you are paying full price, because I Def. felt like my business was not valued since I had paid far less for an online coupon for their services. Ok so now to a retelling of my actual experience... First off, you should always be given a questionaire about your skin (routine, problems, habits) the first time you have a professional facial ANYWHERE.  I was given no such thing nor was I asked about my skin in any way by my aesthetician.  Rather, the first thing I was asked when she approached is "what are we doing today?"  Uh, I said, "you are the professional so I will let you look at my skin and decide what it needs" (first pang of doubt goes through me)I was rushed into the room, which had the overhead lights fully on- the room lights should always be off and there should be some sort of ambient light the entire time you are in a room for a facial. From the moment you enter until you leave.  Because it is not a relaxing experience to start such a service walking into a starkly lit room.  Or having the overhead lights flipped on full blast after lying in darkness for a while.So anyway she ushers me in and says "here it is".  Here what is?  She tells me to change and leaves to let me do so.Anyhow we decide to go with the oxygen infusion facial and it begins with a loud, piercing sound from the O2 machine for about a minute right next to my ear.  No apology or acknowledgement of this from my facialist.She literally spent 15 minutes on me (there is a clock in the room and I made note of when I was done because she spent so little time on me), was slamming and clinking things around as she picked them up and set them down the whole time, and just quickly slapped a few things on my face, rubbed them in with quick, jerky movements, then turned the overhead lights back, handed me a mirror and said that's it and left so I could change back into my clothes.I should also mention that you could clearly hear the tv and talking in the waiting area, and heels on the hardwood floor of on of the employees walking around during the entire time.  Not exactly relaxing.I could not believe that that was it.  Having worked in the service industry all my life (first as a bartender and server, now as a stylist) I tip automatically, but now think that I shouldn't have because thats only rewarding unforgiveable behavior.  She treated me the whole time like she just wanted to get me in and get me out, and probably assumed I would not have any clue that this was a poor service.  Tip of the day people: never assume your client is a clueless dumbass that doesn't know better, because they may just be one of your fellow employees in the industry...

7.description: Great facial with Monika! I didn't get too adventurous- just needed good exfoliation and hydration as winter hits. Great facilities, knowledgeable staff, and a great experience! I'll be back.

8.description: I've been visiting Ageless Medspa since 2011. I like visiting this place because it has tremendously helped me with my acne problems on my face. Ageless Medspa offers amazing procedures & treatments at reasonably fair prices. My skin has definitely improved by coming here for the past couple years. In addition, the aestheticians that work here are professional and extremely welcoming. They are also very educated in their field, so I always listen to any advice or tips that they have for me.The smiles on their faces always put me in a better mood when I come in for a visit. The interior design of Ageless Medspa is also beautifully executed with neutral color palettes, which I personally enjoy! I recommend Ageless Medspa to anybody! 5/5 Stars! :-)

3.description: I loved the place!!!! That was my first time and dr Sypien listen to me and knew what i wanted.  She made me feel comfortable and that I was in excellent hands!!! The ladies working there are very proffecional  and friendly!!! Of course I will visit again!!!!

14.description: Ageless Med Spa is a beautiful friendly place where you can feel like home. The estheticians who work there are so professional,  talented, and dedicated that whenever I am leaving this Spa I feel great. I used almost all their laser treatments and I really like the results.

12.description: I was referred to Affinity Optical by my insurance company, I was not sure if I even wanted to go there, I was just calling around first. But after my initial conversation I was sold, made the appointment and went the next week. They are professional, funny, so helpful and I was able to finally get a prescription that actually worked for my eyes. I feel like it was the best eye exam I ever had, the doctor took his time with me and did an awesome job the best part is he made me laugh and put me at ease.I will make Affinity Optical my go to place WHEN EVER I need to get an exam or some swanky new glasses or contacts.  They also have an amazing selection, even a whole retro section that I could not stop drooling over. Everyone is a ROCK STAR at Affinity Optical . . . and NO they did not pay me to say this . . . in fact I baked them cupcakes and a thank you card when I went to pick up my glasses. Stop by and say hello and let them know cupcake girl sent you!!! :~}

3.description: I have been going to Affinity Optical for years.  Always get great service, and attention.   I am a bit of a 'nudge' when when it comes to fitting and getting used to new glasses so it means a lot to me that they take their time and are very patient with me.  I was just there a couple months ago and got new glasses  and  I always get a spare pair.  Today my 'spares' fell off the top of my head and got smashed to bits by a car in the Jewel lot.   Went in to see the Dr. and he told me to pick out a pair and he is making my 'new spares' for FREE!!   Can't beat that!  I would recommend Affinity to anyone looking for a great eye doctor with a fun personality and generous too boot!!   Thanks Doc!!!

1.description: I have never been disappointed.  My parents were going there for years prior to me going there.  The front desk staff is super nice and the doctors are amazing!  I've called at the last minute because of a scratched cornea and they got me right in...twice.  I've been very happy with Affinity Optical since my family started going there. I highly recommend them!!!

2.description: Our family has been customers of Affinity for both examinations, eye care and glasses for at least a decade.  Each and every visit they outdo themselves; honest, polite, expedient, knowledgeable, competitive prices, quality, quality, quality.  We would never consider going elsewhere.

9.description: The Doc is great. It was the first time I have ever had someone spend so much time trying to get my prescription correct (I have some tricky eyes). And he also took the time to explain why it was difficult. I was blown away by the effort.

10.description: I love Affinity Optical. Dr. Najem is the only optometrist I trust with my eyes. He is extremely thorough and patient. I have gone to several optometrists/ophthalmologists in the past and none gave me such a thorough and professional eye exam. Dr. Najem really cares about his patients. He answers all of my annoying eye questions, which I really appreciate. Dr. Lewis is also great- very personable and professional! The office was recently remodeled and looks very upscale. The customer service is also great. I recommended Affinity Optical to many friends and all had a good experience each time they went, as well. This place is in a large strip mall area, so it is quite easy to miss, but definitely a gem.

13.description: My family has been seen by Dr. Lewis for years. She used to be the doc at the For Eyes on Peterson, in Chicago, that's where we met her. She recently left to go into practice with her brother at Affinity. (He's the other optometrist there - or maybe he owns the place). At any rate, it's a schlep for us and I still haven't made it there, but I will. My wife and son drive out there because of Dr. Lewis, whom they love. She gives a very, very thorough exam, and she is really good and nice, so I recommend it.

16.description: very good service here they do an exelent job

6.description: this place can not be beat ! super professional friendly  medical team for the eye . very  complete eye evaluation . the frames are very cool and i love the old eye glasses on display . dr. najem is very professional . will blow gabriels horn loud to all my friends and family about this eye clinic ! AAAAA +++++ ! ! !

15.description: This shop has been here for years. Exactly how many years I'm not sure. They have a lab and an eye doctor on the premises. Their prices are very reasonable. which is always a good thing. They also specialize in fitting patients for contacts. They are in the Jewel strip mall that has a bunch of stores. The lot is usually pretty full. It looks like all the stores here are doing really well.

0.description: I've been coming here all my life but decided to try LensCrafters one time which turned out to be a less then favorable experience. My experience at Affinity today reminded me of why I've always came here. Their customer service is beyond professional. The girls at the front best are very courteous and Dr William Najem is extremely patient, he worked with me until my prescription was perfect. 5 stars for the best price, professional staff and great inventory !

5.description: I've been coming to this office for a few years now and always have a good experience.  I see Dr. Barabas and he is great with contacts, he was the only one who found me a contact that wasn't tissue paper thin or a hard contact.  The contact I used to wear is no longer made, it was actually made to fit your eye not like most of the one size fits all, thin contacts of today.  I don't think I've ever waited longer than ten minutes to see the doctor.  Everyone is pleasant and professional and there is a good selection and prices of eyeglasses.  I always like to support the local businesses.

11.description: Dr. Lewis was very patient with both of my children.  One demanded more patience than the other.  I'm glad that I found this office so close to home.It was a pleasant, pain-free experience all around.  From the moment we scheduled our appointment to the moment we left the office.  Nelson is great and so is the other young girl.  Super friendly, super patient.Love 'em!

8.description: This is the only place I will go to for myself and my children. It is the perfect example of how shopping small and supporting local businesses is better than big box retailers. Both Dr. Lewis and Dr. Najem are extremely professional  and the front desk staff always make sure to stay within my budget. One word of advice-- for glasses, purchase the anti-glare option  it is definitely worth the money. The only criticism I could think of is that maybe they could have a larger selection of frames, but I always find one or two pairs that I really like. Love this place.

4.description: The doctor is awesome, very nice and gentle. I just love this optical. Some times it take lil long to get glasses but its worthit.

14.description: Great experience with the Dr. but also really wonderful front desk receptionists - best receptionists I have yet to encounter!  Having lived in and experienced Japanese customer service, this is saying something.  Both young ladies were very professional, courteous (which I would expect from receptionists anyway), but they were also kind and very thoughtful - like good southern hospitality. I was thoroughly impressed with the office!  I believe that good and happy staff members also reflect highly on the management - looking forward to the next visit :)

7.description: Last week I had an appointment for Thursday at 6pm for my daughter. I had called in and made that appointment about a week or two before.  Well, around late morning of THAT day, a guy from Affinity Optical called me.  He asked if I could come in earlier than the scheduled appointment, like 5pm.  I explained I really couldn't because I was already leaving a half hour early from work just to make the 6pm appt. I asked if that was a problem.  He told me no and that he would just have to shuffle around some appointments (huh? - mine was the last appt) And he didn't sound very reassuring, so I ask, "Are you sure/"  He replies yes.  Well, some time later, my cell phone rings again.  GUESS WHO?  Another employee from Affinity.  This time, a woman and, yup, she asks me if I can come in earlier than my 6pm  APPOINTMENT (deja vu?) The reason she tells me is because the doc's last appt before mine is 3pm and she would be just waiting until I came in. So here I am at work, ya know, that kind of place I go for 8 hours a day so my family and I can have a roof over our head, food in our tummies...I think alot of people are familiar with that..busy at work and these people keep calling me about changing my appt last minute.  Do they even know the "point" of an appointment???  I freakkkn obviously needed a 6pm appt - that's why I made it... Anyway, by this time, my annoyed meter is at maximum.  I tell her, "Just cancel the appt"  Then she says, "oh the doctor is willing to wait for  you"  I say "Noooo, Just cancel the appt and you guys leave early"...Anyway I already found a couple of places with great reviews and I will make sure those guys understand what an appointment means...

3.description: I recently moved into the neighborhood and have visited a few times for ice cream in the past couple of weeks. It always take at least 5-7 minutes of standing around for the folks working to even acknowledge your presence in the store and then eventually take your order. Recently this happened even when someone was actually restocking and tidying on the Baskin-Robins side in front of me. I totally understand needing to get stuff done around the store, but give me a wave or call someone over so I know you aren't just ignoring me. Other than that - quality of product is about what you'd expect, and the associates are friendly once you get their attention.

1.description: I have stopped by here tonight with my friends and the service was terrible! The employee was staring us down and wasn't very nice at all! Also he made my shake with way too much milk and it wasn't all that! I wish they had better/nicer service.

2.description: Rasila is awesome.  Very patient with me and helpful.Place was busy again around this time...but all was orderly.   Service was very quick as well.

9.description: My first one star review.... THIS PLACE IS TERRIBLESo there you are.. 11:30 pm, you're watching TV and a random ice cream commercial comes on.  You think to yourself... wow i'm a fat ass but I need this.  You go and look up nearly all of your favorite ice cream shops online and learn that they are all closed... all but one... Baskin Robbins.  You think back to your childhood (at least if you're my age.. late 20's) and remember the days when the company was a standalone ice cream parlor.  Good memories, 31 flavors, a couple people working the counter... okay this will do.  You throw on some sweatpants, maybe a hoodie and a hat to hide yourself in shame.  Off you go to your local Baskin Robbins.If your local Baskin Robbins is this one.. which is mine.. you're in trouble.  I have gone here 90% during the late hours and you always get the same old corrosive teeth having, lazy bum.  Now I get it, working at Baskin Robbins when you're an old man during the graveyard shift is hardly winning any pride in job awards, but put in some fucking effort.  "yeah.. i'll take an oreo 31 below"  "machine is broken"  You'll get that one often, yet the machine is on, you can see it. " Let me get a scoop of Reese's Peanut Butter ice cream."    "we're out of it"  So if I show up at 8 am tomorrow, I'm supposed to believe the ice cream will still be empty.  Great.. Baskin Robbins goes the way of magic ice cream refilling now.  This guy must have a contract that says if what he needs to make isn't directly in front of him he doesn't have to make it.  It isn't just this location either,  It took me going to four different locations in the Jefferson Park/Portage Park area to finally get what I wanted... and the worst part is that it wasn't anything to write home about.  What is sad about this is even though these guys are the worst, there are no other options for late night ice cream consumption, unless you go to the grocery store... but who wants that.. I wish to be served.  There is a reason they have strayed away from the 31 flavors branding, because they have maybe 16 now.  Half of which are empty, or at least the ones I want.  If there is any justice in the world the roof will collapse on this place.. but don't worry, nothing will be lost... all the machines are already broke and the ice cream is already empty.  With all that said the Dunkin Donuts part of the store runs more effectively, as I believe way more people patron that side of the business.

10.description: If I could give this place zero stars I would. I went in there asking for 2 extra pumps of pumpkin in my coffee, and they interrupt me while I speak telling my order out loud. Then I get my coffee and I could taste that it wasn't what I asked for. I think in my head, should I say something I don't want to be a pain, but this happens all the time. So I was polite and asked if I could please have extra pumpkin sauce in my coffee like requested. The young man there responds "NO............ gimmie a min." I stayed quiet and got really angry because I was being respectful and that is NOT how I wanted to start my day. A woman who works there put the pumpkin sauce in my coffee. There is another D&D on the other side of Milwaukee maybe I will take my business there from now on. Or HOW ABOUT STARBUCKS. I think I will go there from now on. How rude. DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION. The coffee blows and well as their attitudes.

4.description: I decided to pull off the highway to grab some coffee on my way back from dropping my old lady off at the airport. What a disappointment. I have been going to Dunkin literally my entire life and order the same thing everything just about everyday. I had to repeat my order 3 times. In between my 2nd and 3rd reorder I looked around to see if anyone else was witnessing my transaction. By the time I connected eyes with the customer behind me, the only person in line, he was already shaking his head because it was that ridiculous. We are talking about and extra large coffee black and the number 5 on a wheat bagel- just the sandwich. Anyways, my correct order went through and left without looking. Shame on me for assuming clarification. Oh well, I still love you Dunkin. You'll always be my first love.

6.description: Great place to stop in for Red Velvet coffee, service was quick and adequate. The café was clean while smelling delicious and inviting. The bathrooms were also clean and fully stocked. The employees looked happy and greeted me when I walked in. I would definitely come here again.

12.description: Because of the location of this DD i continue to give them my business, and i really wish i didn't have to. The women that work behind the counter in the mornings are completely rude and ridiculous. I could go on and tell you about the half dozen confrontations i've had with the staff there but it's really just a waste of time. I even had to go as far as contacting corporate because of their behavior towards customers. my advice: get in and get out as fast as you can with your coffee and donuts in hand. i wish they'd open a starbucks in that mini stripmall where this DD is located!

5.description: No stars!!!Any frozen coffee is over sweetened, watered down (not blended right) and they won't put whipped cream on anything unless you ask for it, even if the drink calls for it. The WORST customer service I have ever experienced. The workers here ALWAYS look sloppy like they just rolled out of bed and put shoes on. I wouldn't trust them to handle my food.  RUDE and LAZY is all I have to say about this place.  Gave this spot several chances. If you're in this area, make the extra 3 min drive to Higgins and Austin DD/ gas station. Don't waste your money or patience here. They give DD/BR a bad name.Seriously considering reporting them... That bad!!

11.description: Not good coffee. you come here for " dd coffee and there's is worse than gas station coffee. The guy behind the counter was super sweet and gave me a different coffee. It was a little bit better but most definitely not DD quality. Staff is very nice though!

8.description: Annoyed. I am truly annoyed.Rude staff during the day and at night. They think they are doing me a favor by me patronizing this store. As a matter of fact, this DD and BR might have single handily ruined it from me going to any other DD/BR locations. With all that being said, during the wee hours of the morning there is this guy who works there that chews tobacco and when he speaks to you he spits it out at you. He is like the laziest employee on the planet. He says that the 31 below machine is out of order when it was clearly on. He just said it was broke because he didn't want to clean  it. I get it. Its late. You are too busy chewing tobacco. He is a part of this franchise and he should be adhering to their codes of conduct which i am sure isn't acting like a major DIC-K-tator. We ordered a brownie sundae from there. He goes into the fridge and uses his bare hand to put two tiny little pieces of brownie in there. Seriously? Really??  He ran out of ice cream and we asked him if he had anymore in back. He didn't even check and just immediately said no. I mean i highly doubt you would go without a backup of ice cream.If you can avoid this location. The employees are rude and the Indian dude who works at night should be fired, straight up.

0.description: I'll go out of my way to come here in the morning. Super fast and friendly service. The women who work the morning have been at it for years and train the new guys so well. Don't be afraid of the line in the morning, it moves fast! They'll always hand off your drink in your hand with a smile.

7.description: This place is dirty. The staff are slow and disorganized. They screw up simple coffee orders. I've had to throw my coffee away after realizing they sweetened it when I've asked them not to. Forget this place. Go to butter field kitchen in the station instead.

58.description: A really good and moderately priced restaurant that satisfies my craving for Polish food every time I go there. The food is consistent. Always have the mushroom soup, a plate of Pierogis, breaded pork cutlet, Polish sausage plate, and a few other things. Ambience of a neighborhood place with a TV (set to a Polish language station) and a bar. Easy street parking.

56.description: I was there on Tuesday night around 6ish and it was packed. I was the only person who is polish and every table was full. They have only one cook and one waitress but she was on the top of everything. Thr food was amazing and the prices even better. We had groupon $ 34 for $ 60 which we couldn't use all because the prices are so low. 2 adults, 2 kids and 1 dish to go and it was $53. I loved it. Awesome place.

29.description: It's a 6 STARS establishment !!! I'm lucky to live 5min away and over a year and a half I've been in this place 50+ times ! Incredible Polish cuisine made with a real home made touch served really affordable with outrageous generosity!Always something to take home. Way too many favorites on the menu to mention them one by one but if you are in the area you have to stop by ! Food is by far better than in any other Polish restaurant in the city. ALWAYS prepared fresh just for you when you order and not microwaved from precooked before meals like in some other unfortunate places I visited. Tiny place which is always packed with a lucky few food connoisseurs who know this gem of Polish culinary extravaganza! Highly recommended !!!

42.description: This was a very good polish restaurant.  The food was great and the portions were good.  The issue was that I did not know what I was really ordering:-(  After typing that sentence I realized I needed to raise my rating from 3 to 4 starts. If you like homemade polish food, this is your jam.

23.description: What an awesome place! The food, unique offerings sausage, pork with peach, pieroges, and mushroom soup are amazing! Really a special place!

47.description: Cheese and potato Pierogi's are good. Huge portion. The pork kabob was not so good, the bacon on the kabob is pure fat and uncooked. The service is not great. We came in at around noon and there was no other customers in there. The lady was on the phone for at least 10 minutes before I finally said we are ready to order! So she got off the phone and finally took our order. At least she did apologize. After that she was nice and all just not very attentive.

8.description: Cozy little family run restaurant.  We ate borscht, barley soup, Silesian dumplings stuffed with meat, and stuffed cabbage rolls.  It was more than enough for two for lunch.  Have a few Silesian dumplings left for dinner tonight.  Everything was well prepared and well presented with sliced cucumbers in sour cream and cole slaw.  Service was friendly and efficient.  Everything was good.  Will return.

31.description: I was actually not that hungry when I came here but we had plans for a Mother's Day dinner here and I was very satisfied with service and food. The waitress seemed young but very helpful and pleasant. The food was great, I only tried the pierogi's and potato pancakes but they were fantastic. We had the cheese blintzes for dessert and they were SO good! I will definitely be back!

34.description: We ordered the pierogi with potato and cheese as well as the sour kraut and mushrooms. All were outstanding, the kids ordered the potato dumplings and potato pancakes and they loved them, the cheese blintzes are amazing especially the chocolate sauce that was served with them. The owner was extremely polite and curtious. I can't wait to visit smak tak again.

16.description: Amazing amazing amazing.   Such good food.  I took my dad there who grew up on polish/ Russian food.  He wouldn't stop comparing to his mothers cooking.  What smak tak did better and what smak tak did better.   BYOB, very inexpensive for the quality.  Quaint atmosphere.  Really just great great authentic food.

13.description: It's a 6 STARS establishment !!! I'm lucky to live 5min away and over a year and a half I've been in this place 50+ times ! Incredible Polish cuisine made with a real home made touch served really affordable with outrageous generosity!Always something to take home. Way too many favorites on the menu to mention them one by one but if you are in the area you have to stop by ! Food is by far better than in any other Polish restaurant in the city. ALWAYS prepared fresh just for you when you order and not microwaved from precooked before meals like in some other unfortunate places I visited. Tiny place which is always packed with a lucky few food connoisseurs who know this gem of Polish culinary extravaganza! Highly recommended !!!

11.description: Pierogi heaven - we usually stick with an order of meat and another of potato.  The cutlets are must try.  My only issue with them are the potato pancakes - they insist on serving them little burnt - might be their signature.

39.description: My wife and I had nice meal at Smak-Tak Restaurant in Jefferson Park. It is a little, quaint Polish place serving home cooking like grandma would make. My wife and I shared a plate of the mixed Pierogi. We had the meat, the cheese and potato, and the sauerkraut and mushrooms ones. They also have fruit ones too, but I will save them for next time. They were incredible. I also had the Red Borscht w/Dumplings Soup and the Polish Hunter's Stew. Both were wonderful and the portions were very generous. The stew came with three scoops of homemade European-style mashed potatoes. My wife had the Potato Pancakes which were nothing special when compared to the other dishes we had, but not bad either. All in all it was a great and very filling meal. A quick warning though that the place is small with only five tables and some bar stool seating. I can't wait to go back again, especially on one of our cold Chicago evenings when I am craving stick to the ribs old world comfort food.

37.description: The pierogi were phenomenal. The plum and sweet cheese tasted just like my grandmother used to make. A dozen was well worth $10.

0.description: Found this cozy family restaurant randomly, I was stuck in traffic and decided to get lunch here first.  Best decision ever!  Absolutely delicious and comforting food.  I ordered the cabbage rolls that also came with mashed potatoes and beet salad.  It was so good I stopped by again 5 hours later again for dinner.  Highly recommend!  But have to warn you the wait might be long.  There was only one person working in the front and it took a while for him to get around to give you menus, bring you water and take orders from you.

38.description: Absolutely authentic family-run family-style Polish restaurant. Rustic but cozy wooden interior. Feels exactly like a real Polish place you'd find in a small town. The Bigos was very meaty and flavorful. Mushroom soup a large serving, tho' not creamy enough to be perfect. Chicken schnitzel was a whole breast, crispy but still moist inside. Very good. BYO!

51.description: Had a great lunch here.  Menu in Polish and English was a great sign of the things to come.Had the Hunters Stew with sausage, beef and sauerkraut!  Very good...

27.description: Very tiny place.Cozy and decorated like a log cabin with art for sale.We had a groupon which was good because I never would have tried this place or for that matter ever seen it as I drove by.We won't go back.It was ok polish food but not to go out of the way for. The owner is the waiter which would be ok if he had any people skills. He spent most of the time staring at his computer.I had the pork loin special- it wasn't.The borscht and mushroom soup were ok.The pierogi was good.The sour cream cucumbers were common.Nothing special here.

32.description: I wish I lived closer to Smak Tak, but at the same time I am glad I don't or I would be eating there all the time and I would be fat, very fat.  Everything I've had here has been delicious. I love how home-cooked everything tastes- just like my friends' moms used to make when I was a kid. (I am not Polish, but I do know Polish food.)  Fluffy, scrumptious pierogi, creamy, tangy cucumber salad, lightly breaded fried pork cutlets- all great!  No, the gentleman running the joint is not exactly friendly, but he's not mean. This place is so reasonably priced and it's BYO, so I cannot discount their rating on account of  the staff not kissing my butt. Love this place.

54.description: Though the food was very good--four to five star quality, there is no excuse for an owner who doesn't care enough to respond to several attempts to show we are interested in his country, his language and his culture, and who never returns once to the table to see how the food is or if we need anything else, even though we were one of only two tables being served. His wife also came and went from the room twice without ever acknowledging our presence: food order taken, food delivered (no refill of drinks offered), Bill delivered, money taken. End of service. End of conversation.

48.description: Charming retro ski lodge interior, and great that its a byob...the rest of the operation really needs improvement. Service is surly at best. 'Polish'  rye bread is completely forgettable...great bakeries literally around the corner. And, really, what self-respecting restaurant kitchen serves mashed potatoes from a box of flakes anymore?? Twice my girlfriend and I have been turned away by the same unsmiling and ungracious lady who is always there,   "...we're not seating anymore." is the simple explanation.  That being said, they do have some decent dishes, but if surly, ungracious service isn't a deal killer for me, fake mashed potatoes certainly are.

44.description: This is our favorite Polish restaurant in Chicago, and we've tried a lot of them. Make sure to try the soups (we love the mushroom soup and the borscht with dumplings). We keep forgetting that they are BYOB, but it's also kind of fun being invited to help ourselves to soft drinks in the cooler.Keep this place in mind when it's 20 degrees, snowing, and dark at 4pm--what better place to be on nights like this than in a cozy restaurant with Polish comfort food?

24.description: Best Polish food....EVAH!!!.....schnitzels......pierogis.....dumplings....cannot do it justice.....just go! Total comfort food in a cozy little space...perfection!

7.description: This is a cozy little place with a homey and rustic dining room.  It's also quite small with only 5 tables and a little bar table in the center.  The Polish food offerings are quite good as well as generous.   We tried on this evening:- breaded pork cutlet dinner which came with nice little sides of a potato and cucumber salad, and a sauerkraut-like mix- potato pancakes- plate of a variety of pierogisService was fine and efficient, though we did have to seat ourselves when we entered as the one server was back in the kitchen for a few minutes.  It's well worth a try if you want a quiet and authentic Polish dinner.  It appeared we were the only non-Polish there tonight.  The breaded pork cutlet also came with mushrooms and a fried egg, and was by far the best dish, and possibly their signature dish.  I tried pierogis yet again, and while they are ok for what they are, I'm going to stop trying to make  myself  like them (I can't help comparing them to dim sum dumplings).  We came at an opportune time, but I would recommend making a reservation to avoid a possible wait in this tiny place.  It's also BYOB, and there is easy and free street parking on Elston right outside the door.

49.description: My wife and I agree that this is our favorite polish place in town. The restaurant is small but cozy and the food is amazing. Every time we have been there the food has been good. The portions are big and filling. It is worth finding this place to give it a try. you will not be disappointed.

40.description: I've been here couple of times and I'm satisfied ;)The food is good and the restaurant itself is very nice. Thank you guys!!!I will come back for sure, I think it's the best polish restaurant I ever been.

53.description: The food is very good and the portions are huge BUT... service is horrible. The manager ignores customers, is very rude and disrespectful. He basically doesn't care about his clients- too bad because the food is really good.  We went there at least 5-7 times hoping that maybe something will change over the time.. but unfortunately is getting worse. The manager must have some allergy because he is constantly sneezing and clearing his nose in the way you don't want to see. Also, he is using a nasal aspirator and he does it in front off people who eat - behind his desk watching some polish soap opera. The major problem is that he doesn't wash his hands after clearing his nose... and then he serves food as nothing happened. Yucky...  I agree with Reginald's review: "bill delivered, money taken--end of service, end of conversation" ...

30.description: I went there because I had a Groupon, but I would definitely go back without one. This place is not fancy..it's a comfortable restaurant that gives you food that feels homemade - just better! I ordered three things as take out and I thought they were tasty - and I don't doubt they would have been even better had I eaten at the restaurant. I ordered:1) The pork cutlet with mushroom and potatoes - this was friend well and the mushrooms were delicious!2) Chicken Liver & onions with potatoes - greasy (visibly so) but the flavors were good. If you like liver, you might like this. If not, then obviously avoid.3) Potato pancakes - I didn't expect it to look the way it does..it was dark, but really good! Moist and soft in the center and the sides crispy! It was also greasy but after dabbing it with a napkin and dipping it in the sour cream..it was just yummy!The mashed potato scooped were a little dry and I wish it came with a little gravy - but this was really a minor thing and just a preference for me.I will try this place again, I'm sure!

46.description: Last night I went to Smak Tak to eat and all I have to say is WOW!  I have been looking for a place with good cabbage rolls and I can never seem to find one.  This place has awesome cabbage rolls, and a whole lot more.  It is small but very quaint.  Our group ate everything as a shared plate and we tried the pierogis, potato pancakes, polish sausage, breaded pork with mushrooms, and veal meatballs with a dill sauce.  Everything was so well prepared and well seasoned!!  Super crispy potato pancakes just the way that I like it!!  This place blows Starpolska, Red Apple, and some of the other polish staples out of the water.  We will be back!!  Plus, they usually have a Groupon deal going, which makes it even better.  They are also a BYOB.

1.description: This was my first experience with Polish food and I was not disappointed. Came here for a nice Sunday lunch before leaving Chicago. I loved this little place!I had the Borscht with dumplings to start which was very nice and flavourful. As my main I got the breaded chicken breast and I have to say their sauerkraut is the best I have ever tasted. It went so well with the chicken. My boyfriend got the Hungarian Pancake which looked delicious! I loved the presentation of it too.Overall big portions and good food in a cozy place. I will definitely come back if I am in the area again.

55.description: Best Polish food I've ever had. Very authentic food, good portions and everything I've had here is good. The Pork Tenderloin is super yummy! It feels like you are sitting in someone's kitchen, small and very homey. BYOB can't beat it.

9.description: I had the chicken livers with onion.  It was so good that I rolled on my bed around like a happy monkey while consuming this food from heaven.  God bless Poland!  Thank you fellow Polish for making such delicious, flavorful, and comforting food that I always love! I know some people mentioned about the service.  Can you people just enjoy the food?  They are all nice people, and if you don't want to dine in, do take out!  I never, ever have any problem with their attitude!

26.description: DO NOT GO TO THIS "RESTAURANT"!!! My family and I came here for dinner our waitress came over took our order went to the kitchen, and that's when everything took an insane turn. An hour went by and no one came out, we were only one of two tables in the place so by NO means was it because they were busy. I ended up knocking on the kitchen door to ask where our food was. A intoxicated woman came out and told my mother and I she didn't make us any food because she is busy. When my mother asked her what she was talking about, and where was our dinner she laughed in my moms (whom is 75 years old BTW) Face. After a small argument with this lady, and her male friend that was sitting just hanging out in there. We left. I have never experienced Anything like this is my life!! STAY AWAY!!!

25.description: Have visited several times. Small, family owned Polish restaurant with excellent food and personal service.  The owner, Piotr, is on hand to be sure everything is alright--and it usually is. Have tried five or six different entrée items; each one was tasty and had the home cooked look and feel to it.  The breaded pork was especially tasty; I also would recommend the Polish style dumplings.  I was not too familiar with Polish desserts, but Piotr brought us a plate of blintzes filled with light cheese, and topped with chocolate drips; sort of like "Pollish cannolil"--they were delicious.  Will definitely be going back.

12.description: I would have to agree with another fellow yelper. This restaurant is not one of those corporate run establishments where you can't expect your food to be microwaved.   It is family owned, so with that being said you should have already come up with the conclusion that the food is not going to be prepared to your dissatisfaction. It has that home style taste.   The other amazing thing about the owners of this establishment. Is that both husband and wife have some other talents up their sleeves when it comes to photography and painting. Which they have posted on the walls. So if you do stop by, check them out I'm sure you would agree. So for home style cooking, stop here. I'm sure that I will be again sometime soon when I am in the area : )

59.description: Had a group on and went.  Fried pork cutlet was good.  Pierogies were good.  Service was slow and the order taker smiled and didn't say much.  Foe was good.  Water was kind of gross.  Just tap water with no ice cubes.  Small, quaint decor.  Huge portions and was filling.

21.description: I would have to agree with another fellow yelper. This restaurant is not one of those corporate run establishments where you can't expect your food to be microwaved.   It is family owned, so with that being said you should have already come up with the conclusion that the food is not going to be prepared to your dissatisfaction. It has that home style taste.   The other amazing thing about the owners of this establishment. Is that both husband and wife have some other talents up their sleeves when it comes to photography and painting. Which they have posted on the walls. So if you do stop by, check them out I'm sure you would agree. So for home style cooking, stop here. I'm sure that I will be again sometime soon when I am in the area : )

17.description: Smak-tak lives up to its name, which means something like "it's just delicious." We went with a large group on a Saturday night. Everyone in our group loved it. We had a mix of pierogis - potato, mushroom/sauerkraut, plum. Some folks had borscht, which was outstanding, and others had mushroom soup, which was also very good. For the main course, we shared several different plates. The Hungarian pancake was outstanding - lots of flavors from the potato pancake and goulash all mixed together. We also had the stuffed cabbage and a few orders of the fish. We had a couple orders of potato pancakes, which were yummy, even while we had full stomachs by that point. Highly recommend this restaurant!

10.description: Very good and cozy family-owned Polish restaurant. Classic Polish dishes which were quite delicious and sizeable. We had the loin with peach, veal cutlet with mushrooms, and mushroom soup. All the food was excellent! Service was good.

5.description: Had tried to have dinner with my family here before and it was busy and the waiter didn't really seem interested in seating is so we left. I heard good things about this place so I ordered a take out order. Well the take out order they told me it would take about an hour so I drive around an went to Mariano's. I got there a little over an hour later and they told me another 20 minutes. Well I took a walk around the neighborhood with my wife and came back. Well the food was still not ready. It took another 20 minutes, so an hour and 40 minutes to get my order. We got home and I was going to let the food decide if it was worth it. Not even close. The pierogis were good but not great. We had 3 types, cheese, potato and mushroom. The polish stew was pretty bad. I don't think I will try this place a 3rd time. I can actually laugh about it now after I tried it. I'll be back if I have a few hours of down time waiting to eat some food. Atleast while waiting I can double think about having some mediocre polish food.

3.description: For Smak-Tak being the small establishment it is their food is big and explosive in flavor!  I'm talking raise-the-roof type of explosive flavor.  It's not as if this Polish restaurant puts an excess of spices in their food like other cuisines, but there's no need for spices when you come to get this hardy food.  This authentic Polish food is perfect as is and I wouldn't have it any other way.  The German in me likes some hardy, fulfilling food and you will get nothing less than that here.  In fact, I shared an entree with my fiancé and it was plenty for both of us, primarily because the entree was huge and we both enjoyed a nice bowl of mushroom barley beforehand.  Let's back up a little bit, though, to when we walked into this charming little restaurant which looked like a cozy cabin.  We sat ourselves at one of the few (and I mean few) tables and although no one came out eight away the owner of the restaurant came and greeted us and took our orders shortly afterwards.  The owner was short with his words, but still very kind and generous enough to insist on giving my fiancé and I each a mushroom barley after hearing us say that we'd split one.  The mushroom barley came with an excess of rye bread and butter - I had to actively stop my hand from reaching for the bread and butter, knowing that I'd be getting a filling entree any moment...and then that moment came when the Hungarian Pancake was laid out in front of us, in all of its glory.Although I wanted to savor the Hungarian Pancake, it was so good that I couldn't keep myself from inhaling it all while saying "mmmm, soooooo good".  If you're wondering what I'm raving about its this crispy-like  pancake with goulash stuffed inside of it...it may not sound like much but it will rock your world.  I do believe that this dish is their most popular so you won't go wrong with ordering it.  It's a fair price too, considering the quantity and quality - around $15 I believe. As I mentioned, it is a very small restaurant but that  doesn't detract from anything, in fact it may add to their charm.  It's also cool in there with the paintings and photography hanging on the wall - all of which is done by the owner and is for sale.  Overall, this was a wonderful experience and I'd enjoy coming back again to enjoy  everything all over again!!!

35.description: Loved it. We had:1. Pork cutlet dinner- perfection.2. Polish Sausage dinner- reminded me of Busia's house. 3.BBQ ribs- good but not my fave4. Pierogi combination plate- sauerkraut/mushroom was just like Busia's. 5. Potato Dumplings- Little pillows of heaven. Enjoy.

19.description: I went there because I had a Groupon, but I would definitely go back without one. This place is not fancy..it's a comfortable restaurant that gives you food that feels homemade - just better! I ordered three things as take out and I thought they were tasty - and I don't doubt they would have been even better had I eaten at the restaurant. I ordered:1) The pork cutlet with mushroom and potatoes - this was friend well and the mushrooms were delicious!2) Chicken Liver & onions with potatoes - greasy (visibly so) but the flavors were good. If you like liver, you might like this. If not, then obviously avoid.3) Potato pancakes - I didn't expect it to look the way it does..it was dark, but really good! Moist and soft in the center and the sides crispy! It was also greasy but after dabbing it with a napkin and dipping it in the sour cream..it was just yummy!The mashed potato scooped were a little dry and I wish it came with a little gravy - but this was really a minor thing and just a preference for me.I will try this place again, I'm sure!

28.description: A hidden gem that you can easily pass by twice lol. Once you find it though it's completely worth it! The place is cozy and authetic and very similar to a restaurant you'd see in Poland. Great atmosphere and nice setting with the food being exceptional. Large portions at reasonable prices. They always seem to have a groupon so when you see it grab it! I recommend the hunters stew and Hungarian potato pancakes along with the pierogis of course. Go here immediately! !!

45.description: Great Polish food! Taste like I remember from my childhood. I highly recommend this place!

33.description: The atmosphere is pleasant enough except for the owner/waiter who was rather uninterested (unfriendly?).  The food was good; nothing great.  I went once but there's no reason to go back. .

43.description: This is a cozy little place with a homey and rustic dining room.  It's also quite small with only 5 tables and a little bar table in the center.  The Polish food offerings are quite good as well as generous.   We tried on this evening:- breaded pork cutlet dinner which came with nice little sides of a potato and cucumber salad, and a sauerkraut-like mix- potato pancakes- plate of a variety of pierogisService was fine and efficient, though we did have to seat ourselves when we entered as the one server was back in the kitchen for a few minutes.  It's well worth a try if you want a quiet and authentic Polish dinner.  It appeared we were the only non-Polish there tonight.  The breaded pork cutlet also came with mushrooms and a fried egg, and was by far the best dish, and possibly their signature dish.  I tried pierogis yet again, and while they are ok for what they are, I'm going to stop trying to make  myself  like them (I can't help comparing them to dim sum dumplings).  We came at an opportune time, but I would recommend making a reservation to avoid a possible wait in this tiny place.  It's also BYOB, and there is easy and free street parking on Elston right outside the door.

2.description: If you LOVE sauerkraut, then this is the place for you! I'm not giving this a bad rating because of that, but the place is just really "Meh". The decór was very old-school and dated, and the service was meh -- they only checked on us maybe once, and didn't really offer any insight or suggestions of the food.We ended up ordering a mix of pierogis which were OK. The "meat" ones were good. My friend had the "stew" which is OK. Perhaps Polish food isn't really our thing, so apologies for the low-rating, but the service didn't make up for it. Maybe I will try something else next time.

18.description: Very authentic polish cuisine like at home highly recommend it. Hungarian pancake was amazing and cutlet my friend ordered looked amazing as well

41.description: I keep saying 'next time I'll try something else' but that never seems to happen.  Fortunately, my wife says the same about her favorite... so we share.  The Hungarian Pancake and he Breaded Pork Cutlet should not be missed... though I'd like to try the Pierogi, the shish Kabob, the.....

52.description: I had the chicken livers with onion.  It was so good that I rolled on my bed around like a happy monkey while consuming this food from heaven.  God bless Poland!  Thank you fellow Polish for making such delicious, flavorful, and comforting food that I always love! I know some people mentioned about the service.  Can you people just enjoy the food?  They are all nice people, and if you don't want to dine in, do take out!  I never, ever have any problem with their attitude!

50.description: This is not a place for foodies. Simple, low quality food. Maybe in the era of great depression it could have been considered a decent food. I was not feeling good after the hungarian pancake. Never again in this place.

4.description: Cute small restaurant where the polish menu is on one side with an English translation on the other. Cheese and potato pierogi were quite good, although the mushroom and kraut had much more kraut that mushroom. The Hungarian pancake was a delight - my friend declared it her new favorite food. I've had better pierogi elsewhere, but these are cheap and quite good if you're in the neighborhood.

6.description: Had a variety of food from here, every last bit of it was terrific. Definitely will be back here.

22.description: service was great and food was DELICIOUS, some of the best I've probably had, only small issue is that it was so oily that i definitely was feeling ill after the meal that evening. the taste and the portions and everything about it at the time was delicious and i would probably go back for another meal even if it meant feeling sick after...it was that good....

15.description: I've recently been on a quest to try more cuisines that I've never had before and so my friends and I chose Smak-Tak (I was told this translates to Taste, Yes!) for a Polish night dinner. This is one of those restaurants that you can drive by a million times and not realize it exists even though it says Polish American Restaurant in bold letters on top. The interior of the small restaurant is super cozy with cute pictures hanging along the walls and for the first time, I watched a little bit of Polish television. We started off with the borscht soup with mushroom dumplings (really good, sweeter than expected, never had a soup like this) and an order of pierogis which comes in a plate of 12 that you can mix and match. We decided on the potato & cheese, sauerkraut & mushroom (my favorite!), and a sweet blueberry. All were spectacular though! Then we had a couple of entrees including the hungarian pancake (huge, like a giant taco with a golden crispy crust reminiscent of a calzone crust), the potato pancakes (3 big slices fried to perfection, comes with applesauce!), and the potato dumplings (a plate with at least 30 small pieces overlying warm melted butter and reminded me of gnocchi). Taste-wise everything was delicious and new to me but it was also very authentic according to my Polish buddy. Although it was mentioned that the potato dumplings would taste better if it came with gravy....but alas, we all loved it and were stuffed by the end of the meal!

57.description: Tasty!  The wait staff is sometimes a little slow, but I believe there are only 2-3 people there, so it's understandable.  The food is AMAZING though, so it's worth the wait.  Just be prepared to have a leisurely dinner.  Also the place is not very large, about 6 tables plus a small bar area, but it seems to work.  One time we had to wait a bit to be seated but the other times we got right in.  The bottom line is this is great food at a pretty good price.

20.description: Very good.Being Russian/American I suppose to hate Polish food but this place is 5+ !!Simply love it !P.S. We Russians always lose with Pols....maybe because of their delicious food ;-)

36.description: I thought the food was great. The owner was pleasant. I'd come back again. I really enjoyed the Hungarian pancake, it had a nice little kick to it.

14.description: I showed up on Wednesday 11/11/2015 at 7:00 pm and they were closed.  What happened? There not any signs posted explaining.....  I called and the phone rang and rang.  Are they out of business?

3.description: I had an oil painting that my mother bought in Germany in the 1950's. Took it to Antiques Roadshow and was told it needed to be cleaned and re-framed. There are not a lot of art restorers in northern Wis, so I looked up places in Chicago where my daughter lives. Found lots of places, all were either in a location that was cumbersome or very expensive. Passed by Morgan's on Milwaukee so we stopped in. Mrs. Morgan was helpful and gave us a very reasonable estimate, so we took in the picture. It was beautifully cleaned and framed, in a timely fashion and it was VERY reasonable. I've had posters matted and framed for the same as this whole project was.They even gave me a photo of the picture when it was half-way cleaned so we could see the difference.

1.description: I also found this place on Yelp. For the first time in my life I bought an original piece of art for hundreds of dollars and felt that it deserved more expert attention than a frame with a coupon from Michaels. The owner, Wanda, immediately started pulling out frame and mat samples. She picked a mat color that I would have never considered but it made my silkscreen pop. Her expert eye made the whole process go smoothly and I ended up with something stunning. As for her prices, wow are they reasonable. She quoted me much less than I was expecting. I highly recommend Morgan gallery for getting anything of value, sentimental or price, framed.

2.description: I found Morgan Art Gallery on Yelp.  Mrs. Morgan was so helpful. Her many years of framing expertise is evident! I was so happy with my framed pictures,  and the price was VERY reasonable. I have spent a lot of money framing pictures from other places, and I will always go to Morgan Art Gallery from now on!!! This place is a gem and was a  Wonderful Experience!

0.description: Mrs. Morgan is very helpful and knowledgeable regarding what mattes and frames work best with the artwork. Pricing is well below similar companies I have used in the past. Turn around time depends on the frame selected but very quick compared to others. Highly recommend.

4.description: This place has some gorgeous paintings!! I've never bought one so I'm not too sure about the prices but the work is amazing. The prices must be up there because you have to be buzzed in by an employee. Their stock always changes so it's a great shop just walk around in and look at the artwork. Park on the street or in the little mini-mall next door.

0.description: I loved this place so much, does anyone know where they all went? Does anyone know where the owner went, i forgot her name already! but i miss her so much and the salon. Please if you know contact me

3.description: What a great surprise this place is!  I happened in on a Thursday night and there was a session going on.  Amazing musicians!  Sessions on Thurs and Sun and The Craic plays Sat night.   The quality of the music is fabulous!  Great sound, great tunes.  Very fun, real Irish, neighborhood bar.

1.description: Looking at the previous reviews, this looks like a cool neighborhood place. I was in there once under new owners and the previous reviews seem to be right on. As far as clientele, most appear to be courteous and "over serving" overall is minimal. This comes from a resident in the area during The Fourth of July 2015 celebration. A patron(?) of the bar decided it would fun to explode "bombs" not in his/her own neighborhood, but in the backyard/alley beer garden starting at noon and ending, well, it is 7:30PM now and the "bombs" are still going off every 5 to 20 minutes. This activity pretty much wiped out backyard activities for the kids for about half a block. I am a vet and very pro 4th celebrations, but if I feel the concussion at a reasonable distance from the activity, it becomes unnerving. Did I say the "bombs" started on the evening of the 3rd? I understand it is difficult to keep or control some inconsiderate a****** especially when that a****** is fueled with alcohol. Just one more thing. After interviewing some of the homeowners of the  immediate area, I found they are unhappy that some patrons ignore the "residential parking only" signs. Please don't do that. So have a safe and happy, rest of the 4th.Slawn-cha!

2.description: Solid Irish "tavern"...very Chicago. Not clique-ey like some other Irish bars in the area, the lads here will actually chat with you. Great seisun on Thursday nights. NW side prices, and beer garden. What else ya need?

0.description: This is a real Irish bar, not one of the prefabricated pseudo-Irish places that seem to be everywhere. It has basically a neighborhood bar atmosphere, but with certain touches that tell you that the patrons/owners truly identify with Ireland. Definitely a neighborhood feeling, there were older people and what looked to be family groups.  Later in the evening night a couple of men who looked like they were in their 60's came in with their wives, all dressed up, seemingly finishing out a night that had begun somewhere more formal.Apparently this bar is presenting live music on a regular basis, particularly Irish music, which I otherwise would not expect with a small place like this.   The night I went there was a really good trio playing a mix of U2 covers and suchlike as well as Irish traditional tunes.  Some people got up and danced even though there was no dance floor, sort of like you might at a house party.   Anyway, nice place, friendly, good music, laid back atmosphere, and inexpensive drinks.  A good place to relax.

12.description: Foremost has an exceptional selection of beer, liquor and wine. The staff there is almost friendly and helpful to a fault, and their prices are absolutely reasonable. They are willing to order something that they don't have, and will often make recommendations on what might go well with a liquor, etc. I can't stress how excellent their selection of foreign liquors is, and only with they carried a slightly wider selection of imported beer.Quality.

3.description: Foremost is true to name. It has a HUGE selection of wines and spirits from around the world. They have everything under the sky from Two Buck Chuck to $300+ bottles of bubbly. They also carry a wide range of beer. There's something for everyone!I'm a huge fan of the Eastern European wines. They have 'em! Greek, Bosnian, Montenegrin, Romanian, Russian. Everything is priced to sell. You'd be hard-pressed to find anything over $14 in that section. I highly recommend the Bulgarian Bear's Blood.Not sure what to get or on a budget? Take a gamble! I suggest checking out the "Adult Ball Pit of Beverages" as Maria F. and I have dubbed it. It's their giant clearance bin of wines found at the end of the farthest aisle.The parking lot is a clusterf*ck. You're probably better off finding a street spot.

1.description: Now this place was phenomenal as a liquor store. you walking to get greeted friendly by both the cashier in the person sitting up front that the manager. They are a huge selection of a lot of different things the bar paraphernalia and drinks from juices I just heard because I have a lot of good stuff in there for a liquor store and after talking with the manager for about 30 minutes it was a great feeling like going ask her what I needed I need to get something and I'll just pick whatever. They're also pretty stringent on verifying age... while I was there there appeared to be an underage person trying to buy some drinks where the manager quickly, efficiently and very professional shut that out of the sky.  Thank you Mr Vasilopoulos I will be back very soon.

2.description: Very good selection of liquors but not so much on beers..prices are ok and compare to other liquor stores in the area..staff and owner are very friendly

9.description: For the longest time I only bought beer at Binny's. Then my friend steered my towards neighborhood liquor stores. This one is the first one she told me about and I was hooked. While you won't have the Binny's selection, you'd be surprised what you can find here. The prices aren't too bad either, although watch out because some weeks it is worth buying your beer someplace else. On the bright side, the staff will leave you alone unless you ask for help. Sometimes it takes time picking the next selection for beer night and although advice and opinions are nice, I like contemplating in silence. Pros: Decent selection and prices.Cons: The parking lot can be hell trying to get in/out of.To sum it up: One of these days I will try the pizza place attached to it.

10.description: nice place pricewise...you can't beat $3:99 for a 4 pack of becks 16 ouncers.the girls at the checkout counter are always friendly too.only complaint is the tiny parking lot.

4.description: I just walked out with 2 cases of Miller Lite.  When I took them up to the counter I noticed that the cashier didn't ring me up right away so I looked to se what the problem was.  I noticed that one case had a price tag of $15.99 while the other one had a price tag of $14.99.  So I told the lady, oh there are 2 different prices on them to which she remarked "yea but they're $15.99".  I then said pointed out the fact that it wasn't my fault they were labeled as such and that by right I should be charged the price that's labeled on the item.  The girl just looked at me and rang me up $15.99 for both.  It's just a dollar but it's the principle of the matte.  This place clearly doesn't care about their customers and whether they will be back or not.  Grimey business practices will def keep me from coming back again!

6.description: This liquor store used to be RIGHT on my way home from work. Dangerous combo. They have a pretty good selection. I have to admit, I mostly buy (craft) beer, but they have Goose Island, Half Acre, Two Brothers, Lagunitas, Flying Dog, New Belgium, and more. Smaller amount in the cold case, but still a decent selection. Friendly staff. Reasonable prices. Good liquor and wine selection too.The only downside is that their parking lot is a PITA. Oddly shaped and small, blah. At least they have one though!

15.description: Foremost has a nice big selection. Its not as big as sams or binnys but bigger than jewel. Have all alcohol related products even limes. Good selection of imports.

0.description: Very friendly, knowledgeable staff.  Very accommodating.  They have everything!  And if they don't have it, they will get it for you.  All this and great prices, too.  And parking!

5.description: Whatever you want, they got.  If they ain't got, they will get.  This place is awesome.  Seriously amazing selection of beer and wine.  The owners Nick and Phil are super accommodating and very cool.The only con is the parking lot can be, let us say, challenging.  Look for a spot on the street...

13.description: Awesome liquor store. Very impressive craft beer selection. What really makes this place stand out is the customer service. During my first visit, Nick--the manager / owner?--was extremely helpful and went above and beyond. Great communication and in depth beer knowledge. I'll be back for sure.

11.description: This liquor store makes up in content for what it lacks in looks.  A nice variety of wines, liquors and beers.  Many beers sold individually which is great if you want to try a variety of microbrews.  A wide selection of Eastern European beers and liquors (esp. Polish).  Friendly, knowledgeable staff.Russophiles: they have Baltika!  Albeit, Baltika No. 7, the export brew, but still -- Baltika!Nice touch: Lindt, Ritter Sport and Raffaello chocolates at the counter.Parking: available out front in lotBus: Central 85/85A, Pace 225/226, Milwaukee 56

8.description: We were recommended to come here by the owners of Saravale Romanian Market for some Timisoreana and Ursus.  I ended up walking out the door with those, but also some Romanian wines and palinca.  Such a great place to go to when I'm looking for some flavors from my time in the Peace Corps in Romania.  Thanks!

14.description: Great selection, knowledgeable staff.  They'll order anything you ask.

7.description: I have done many liquor tastings at this store. The store manager as well as the employees are knowledgeable and friendly. I like the fact that I am in these places for extended periods of time, so I can get a real idea of what the staff is like. This is a small store, but I like it lots. They seem to have what I'm looking for most of the time.Many Friday evenings and Saturdays they have liquor tastings, which is fun.

3.description: Last time I walked in there, I felt duped. They had one price for a shampoo + blow dry on the wall and instead of honoring that price, while they are washing my hair, they give me a completely different price, because of how thick my hair is and how much time it takes. If that's the case, the customer is entitled to know that in advance. Very shady way of doing business, that it's just left up to the discretion of the stylist. That's BS. You need to honor what's posted otherwise post next to that *exception thick or longer hair.* I won't be coming back, go screw someone else!

1.description: The last time I went here the girl who cut my hair told me this location is closing.  That's probably a good thing considering the total SHIT haircut I got.  The thing that sucks is you don't realize how bad the haircut is until the next day after you shower and do your hair.  It looked like a dog had chewed off my bangs.  I'm done with this place.

2.description: As with all chains, the results are dependent on the stylist. Use Tory, she does a great job, listens well and is easy to work with. 5 Stars for Tory. I have been using her for about 2 years.

0.description: There's a lady with a razor in here, her name is Marcy.She was totally knowledgable about what kind of cut I WANTED my son to have and knew exactly how to take the butched botch that Blades(on Lawerence) provided us and turn it into an actual style for my cool 11year old.While Marcy explained this to her coworker and let her get started fixing my son's mullett, she got started with mine.Marcy is one of few stylists that actually hold and use their razor like its a finger off their own hand, and I trusted her judgement.I feel I was rewarded with a custom cut at the Haircuttery price, I'm totally satisfied with Mine and My son's!

4.description: I have been going to this Hair Cuttery for over 3 years now and have always gotten a great cut...but right now Im very sad.  Jesse the most amazing hair dresser there (for my last two cuts) has moved on.  Where did he go?  Does anyone know?  I would be willing to follow him, he always did such an amazing  job!

58.description: Stopped in for a bite first time. New to the Chi. I gotta say the burger was pretty AWESOME!!! Staff rocks! Beers and burgers who could ask for more???

56.description: This place is not in the most assuming of locations...a strip mall, but this place has enough seating space, ample parking and a great interior.They have a great selection of craft beers and a gourmet menu of delicious burgers.  From the looks of the menu, it seems like most of the burgers are polish inspired.   Their burgers are a mixture of ground beef and pork belly so for those of you who cannot eat pork, BEWARE of this!Their fry selection is to die for.  From garlic parm, to blue cheese, to polish sausage fries, to chipotle and pork belly fries, you have a good selection to choose from.Lastly, they have a variety of spiked shakes for those of you who are craving a milk shake but with a little zing of alcohol!Love love love this place...would def recommend it to anyone looking for a unique burger and a variety of fries selection!

29.description: Probably the best hamburger I've had in my life. I had the one with roasted pork belly and bbq mustard sauce. Good lord.

42.description: Good burger, amazing bun, great fries, pleasant atmosphere, and not overpriced.  Really couldn't ask for more.  I went at time where it wasn't busy so didn't have a wait, I'd happily go back for more!
