23.description: So this is the second check in at this location.  The last time I was here this was LEADBELLY.  They have since changed their name to Brgrbelly due to some legal mumbo jumbo with the trademarked name "Leadbelly" by the House of Leadbelly Estate in Tennessee.  I mean come on ARE YOU KIDDING ME?  Brgrbelly is open for lunch at this location and has a lunch special for the Brgrbelly burger, fries and a drink.  On Tuesday that have $2 craft beers.  The other location on Irving Park isn't open for lunch so it would stand to reason that there is no lunch special.Anyway the first time I had the "Easy Rider Burger" which was absolutely decadent, delicious & amazing.  Well I decided to try something different this time so after perusing the menu of the 12 different choices of burgers I selected the "Amazing Grace" burger which made me go "hallelujah".  Holy Moly this burger is about 4 1/2" - 5" tall.  I ate my garlic Parmesan fries while I looked at this humongous burger trying to figure how I could wrap my mouth around it literally. (& I have a big mouth, but this burger was huge). The "Amazing Grace Burger had the beef (of coarse), smoked pork belly atop the juicy meat, crispy onion straws, homemade spicy sriracha pickles, carolina mustard BBQ.  It made me want to scream out.  Andrew our server saw that I was having issues with tacking this humongous burger quickly brought me a handful of napkins realizing the carnage that was about to happen as I was preparing to attack this burger.  Once again Brgrbelly didn't disappoint and it was another fabulous burger.  Andrew our server kept coming back, clearing little table and making sure everyone was getting what they needed.Burger lovers you have to check out Brgrbelly so far they are 2 for 2 with the great burgers (only 10 more to go)

47.description: Awesome Burger and Fries!!  They even have Green River soda.  Cooked to perfection meat.  The atmosphere is so cool.  Love the music and the pics on the wall.  Sitting under a pic of Janis Joplin was nirvana.

8.description: So this is the second check in at this location.  The last time I was here this was LEADBELLY.  They have since changed their name to Brgrbelly due to some legal mumbo jumbo with the trademarked name "Leadbelly" by the House of Leadbelly Estate in Tennessee.  I mean come on ARE YOU KIDDING ME?  Brgrbelly is open for lunch at this location and has a lunch special for the Brgrbelly burger, fries and a drink.  On Tuesday that have $2 craft beers.  The other location on Irving Park isn't open for lunch so it would stand to reason that there is no lunch special.Anyway the first time I had the "Easy Rider Burger" which was absolutely decadent, delicious & amazing.  Well I decided to try something different this time so after perusing the menu of the 12 different choices of burgers I selected the "Amazing Grace" burger which made me go "hallelujah".  Holy Moly this burger is about 4 1/2" - 5" tall.  I ate my garlic Parmesan fries while I looked at this humongous burger trying to figure how I could wrap my mouth around it literally. (& I have a big mouth, but this burger was huge). The "Amazing Grace Burger had the beef (of coarse), smoked pork belly atop the juicy meat, crispy onion straws, homemade spicy sriracha pickles, carolina mustard BBQ.  It made me want to scream out.  Andrew our server saw that I was having issues with tacking this humongous burger quickly brought me a handful of napkins realizing the carnage that was about to happen as I was preparing to attack this burger.  Once again Brgrbelly didn't disappoint and it was another fabulous burger.  Andrew our server kept coming back, clearing little table and making sure everyone was getting what they needed.Burger lovers you have to check out Brgrbelly so far they are 2 for 2 with the great burgers (only 10 more to go)

31.description: You will wonder... Is this the best burger I ever had? Hmmm could be.  Takes it to another level.  By the way the crazy Fries, in all their wacky combinations, are just awesome. You gotta go!

34.description: This place is nuts....if you like an extremely great burger come here, it's amazing!!!!

16.description: Love, love, love this place! All of them are great but the Best burger (fro me) is the Blue Betty. They carry craft beers and I found one here that has become one of favorites, Bell's Double Cream Stout. Fast and friendly service.Nice to have a place like this in this area, not a lot options.

13.description: Too big for their britches? I used to enjoy lunch here about once a week, but I think since BeefBelly opened BRGRBelly isn't open for lunch anymore? Food is great. Burgers, fries, shakes all good. Service is decent. Too bad there's one less lunch option these days. Not to mention one less place with great music. Oh well. Still a decent place for dinner. Or lunch on the weekends. I will continue to come here, just not for lunch . Maybe even try the boozy shake one day.

11.description: I prefer this location over the original on Irving Park Road because this location is open for lunch and is bigger with more seating.  There might still be a bit of a wait depending on how crowded it is, but the burgers and brews are still on point and worth the wait.When you enter, you need to take an immediate right and that gets you in line.  The placing of the menu board is a bit awkward, can't really see it if you're in the back of the line and I didn't see any paper menus out so one can check out the menu while you wait. So if you're new and/or you're one to take a while to make a decision, I'd suggest looking at their online menu.  Of course all you kids have smart phones, you can always look at the menu online while you wait. But really, you can't go wrong with any of the burgers on the menu.  My go-to is the Old Time Religion, because well,  truffle aioli.  I've also tried the Midnight Special (it's like a taco on a burger--very fresh and tasty), House of the Rising Sun (fried egg topped? yes please!).  The patties are made of a ground beef and smoked pork belly blend so the patty itself is very flavorful and juicy.  The fries are also very good--The Belly Fry is my favorite because well, pork belly, onion straws and carolina mustard!  The Polish Fry is also very good, the horseradish mustard sauce is really good--I'd ask for more on the side.  Their Garlic Parm is really garlicky, but I'd prefer the parm to be grated instead of the powdery topping we got. It kind of made the fries "dry". If that makes any sense. Anyway, great craft beer selection, tons of hot sauces to add some kick to your meal.  Music videos playing continuously on the flat screen.  Friendly service.  An easy fave.

39.description: Best burger I've had in a long time! This cool burger place puts you in the middle of a rock concert with great food- all made fresh and an awesome craft beer and cider selection! It's a little expensive but for the quality and quantity it's worth it! I had the parm/ garlic fries- so jealous!!! I also had the BBQ cheddar burger! Both I'd recommend! If you're looking for one of the best burgers in Chicago, try out Lead Belly. Only reason for 4 stars, the price but you could easily spilt the fries amongst 2 or 3 people.

37.description: Finally made it here on the 4th try! First 2 times they were closed when I had a day off and stopped by. The next time it was dinner time and it was packed and the BF said NO! to waiting. This time on a day off they were open and no lines! I ordered an Easy Rider medium rare and garlic/parm fries = $13. The cashier warned me that the meat has pork belly in it and some people "go up a notch" when they order how they want their burger cooked. I left it med rare and it was just right. I forgot about the sriracha pickles until I bit into one but it was not volcano hot as I feared - maybe the BBQ sauce covered it?  Just enough BBQ sauce to not drown out the taste of the burger. I should have eaten there but I really needed to get home. The fries suffered and got soggy. They were good but they would have probably been amazing right out of the kitchen.  I should have at least tried them before I pulled out of the parking lot! Good burger at a good price, not like some other "gourmet" burger chains around. A nice THICK burger - not some pressed like a flat tire burger - this burger has substance. Looking forward to going back to try a different burger and shake - and some HOT fries!

0.description: I have been wanting to come here for the longest time and finally did! I ordered the brgrbelly burger and garlic parm fries.Let me just say. .... OMG. SO GOOD! burgers were huge, my boyfriend and I split the one order of fries and still couldn't finish. They also have the most delicious butter cookies which they gave my boyfriend and I one for each burger.

38.description: I ate here for the first time today and I have to say I'm pretty impressed! I'm not a burger person in general but with this location being so close to my house and after hearing great things about the burgers from friends, I couldn't help but give it a try. Thanks to good old yelp and Instagram I easily  picked out what  I wanted beforehand. I decided to go with the Black Betty and a order of the blue cheese fires. Holy burger balls was the Black Betty out of this world!!! I never tasted a burger so juicy,crunchy, and salty at the same time. I fell in love after the first bite. The blue cheese fries were out of this world as well. Customer service was lacking at the register end, guy looked bored out of his mind and didn't seem very knowledgeable about the beer selection. I went with good old root beer.  With that being said I will definitely return soon.

51.description: Love BRGR belly! I've been to both locations but live closer to this location. The place is pretty small and wait times can be pretty brutal during peak hours. We did walk out one time because the line was insane and we were too hungry and crabby to deal. Just come knowing, you're probably going to have to wait. Maybe bring a snack and a camelbak. You wait in line, order at the desk and they give you a number that you put on your table and they bring you your food. The burgers are amazing! My husband's favorite is the Black Betty with bacon, bleu cheese, onion and BBQ sauce. My favorite is House of the Rising Sun, with fried egg, cheddar, bacon, and friggin' bloody mary sauce. The Parmesan garlic fries are so good and the last time I was there, I opted for the adult milkshake which was delicious. They had 3 different flavors. The best part is, even after stuffing our faces, we didn't feel gross. Lockdown turned us off after eating their burgers because we felt bloated and sluggish after. It was just overkill.  We don't get that feeling after eating here. I don't know why, but we'll take it. Recently I've been trying to eat less red meat, so the last time I was here I got The Rising Sun but with portobello instead. They have the option to make any burger a vegetarian burger by subbing the meat with portobello. YES! So glad this place is in our neighborhood and we'll continue to support it.

27.description: The best burgers I have tasted. The ingredients are all fresh and the burgers are huge. The service was excellent, the owners went around the restaurant asking how the food was and asked if there was anything else they can do. Oh, don't forget to try the Almost Famous Butter Cookies!

32.description: AMAZING food and butter cookies, highly recommend. only complaint it music is very loud in restaurant.

54.description: The burgers were over cooked and the meat had no flavor. There're a ton of better places out there.

48.description: This could be the best burger in Chicago. The trouble with writing a review is that I cant say what isn't already said. The beef burger mixed  with pork is wonderful. The bun is made in house and is half the battle of a good burger. And its wonderful. I'm not much of a toppings guy as I like to taste the beef of the burger along with condiments. So lets just says this one more time so it hits home. This could be the best burger in Chicago. The fries. Get them with garlic and Parmesan. Your mouth wont believe it. Lots of craft beer to choose from. Nice atmosphere. Go there on an off hour because of the long wait times. Everything here has lots of flavor. You wont eat here and be bored. BUT. Make sure you have lots to drink because with flavor comes thirst.

44.description: Burger was ok and it's way over rated the lady gave us 2 free burger cards since we had to move our table to acomodate for another table in the middle of our meal, I probably won't use the cards. The place was full but if it wasn't for the liquor license I doubt they would have much foot traffic.

24.description: I prefer this location over the original on Irving Park Road because this location is open for lunch and is bigger with more seating.  There might still be a bit of a wait depending on how crowded it is, but the burgers and brews are still on point and worth the wait.When you enter, you need to take an immediate right and that gets you in line.  The placing of the menu board is a bit awkward, can't really see it if you're in the back of the line and I didn't see any paper menus out so one can check out the menu while you wait. But really, you can't go wrong with any of the burgers on the menu.  My go-to is the Old Time Religion, because well,  truffle aioli.  I've also tried the Midnight Special (it's like a taco on a burger--very fresh and tasty), House of the Rising Sun (fried egg topped? yes please!).  The patties are made of a ground beef and smoked pork belly blend so the patty itself is very flavorful and juicy.  The fries are also very good--The Belly Fry is my favorite because well, pork belly, onion straws and carolina mustard!  The Polish Fry is also very good, the horseradish mustard sauce is really good--I'd ask for more on the side.  Their Garlic Parm is really garlicky, but I'd prefer the parm to be grated instead of the powdery topping we got. It kind of made the fries "dry". If that makes any sense. Anyway, great craft beer selection, tons of hot sauces to add some kick to your meal.  Music videos playing continuously on the flat screen.  Friendly service.  An easy fave.

7.description: This place is not in the most assuming of locations...a strip mall, but this place has enough seating space, ample parking and a great interior.They have a great selection of craft beers and a gourmet menu of delicious burgers.  From the looks of the menu, it seems like most of the burgers are polish inspired.   Their burgers are a mixture of ground beef and pork belly so for those of you who cannot eat pork, BEWARE of this!Their fry selection is to die for.  From garlic parm, to blue cheese, to polish sausage fries, to chipotle and pork belly fries, you have a good selection to choose from.Lastly, they have a variety of spiked shakes for those of you who are craving a milk shake but with a little zing of alcohol!Love love love this place...would def recommend it to anyone looking for a unique burger and a variety of fries selection!

49.description: Best strip mall burger I've ever had. In fact, better than a lot of popular burger places in Chicago. Fun vibe with lots of rock posters and many beers to drink. Highly recommend.

40.description: My burger was great and cooked like I requested, which was medium.  I ate the Black Betty burger and some fries. I can't remember which fries my husband and I ordered, but they were both really good. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I was asking them about the different beers they sell (which they have an amazing selection btw), and they were very patient with every question I had. I think the prices are reasonable, especially for the amount of food you get.

53.description: My husband and I have stopped going here regularly even though I can see it from my house because every time we go they under cook our burger. I know it's hard to get a burger just right but it gets annoying when we have to send it back EVERY time. On top of that, the wait times are long when they do everything right. When you have to send your burger back, it takes TWICE as long. I'm hoping if we give them some time they will figure out what's wrong and stop under cooking burgers. Until then, we're going to lay off the Leadbelly.

30.description: We went on a Saturday and the place opens at noon.  We knew we were in for a treat when we noticed people already waiting in line and in their cars for the doors to open.  Once they opened the doors, all of the tables were full within 15minutes.A few of the reviews below mention that the burgers are small and the pictures can be deceiving, so we ordered three burgers (Easy Rider, Black Betty, Good Night Irene), two fries (garlic and blue), and a shake (chocolate).  These burgers are not small and we ordered way too much.Our favorite burger overall was the Good Night Irene.  A huge burger with a crab cake on top.  The Pico de Gallo was amazing and some of the best we've ever had on a burger.  The burger was so big that we had to take the crab cake off, cut it into bite-size portions, and eat it with bites of the burger to get the whole flavor.Be warned about the blue cheese.  It is really, really strong and goes a long way.  The Black Betty and Blue Fries were amazing, but the cheese is so strong that it was all we could taste.  Plus, add the Spicy Buffalo Blue Sauce (we thought it tasted more like a sriracha mayonnaise) and you're in for a flavor overload.  We suggest only getting either of them if you really love blue cheese and getting both may be overkill.The beef patties themselves are huge.  Ours was perfectly cooked to medium:  brown outside and slightly pink inside (which is how we ordered it).  If you like skinny, flat burgers, this is not the place for you.We almost gave this place three stars because of the price.  Each burger is about $10.  However, you get a cookie (a tasty almond one) with each order.  Plus, for Chicago, the prices are not that expensive and they have free parking right out front.  The final push up to four stars was the fact that they carry Marie Sharps, a Belizean Hot Sauce that we fell in love with when we lived abroad.

46.description: Not the best burger ever.  Totally disappointed.  Went on a weekend and it wasn't super crowded.  Didn't mind waiting for my food because it was made to order.  Shake was good, a standard shake but good.  The garlic fries were great, I would order again. Not greasy, very flavorful.  However, I asked for my burger to be done medium, and those I was with asked for the same or medium rare, and they were all cooked well, like over-priced hockey pucks. I wanted a juicy, flavorful burger and was disappointed.

1.description: We finally came here last night! I dont know why we waited so long!!The place was a little busy but the wait wasn't that long. My wife and I ordered the Garlic Parmesan Fries that were absolutely AMAZING!! The fries are Cut Fresh and Perfect. Our Burgers were So Good. Cooked just the way we asked. We got the Amazing Grace and the Black Betty. Whoever thought of the names should get a huge pat on the back!! The Music was Great!But I had to give 3 stars because of the Employees. If they were more attentive to the customers rather than each other, I wouldve given 5 stars. Coming from someone who's sitting in the dining room, people watching. I noticed a TIP Jar. Someone should inform them that TIPS means...To Insure Proper Service. How can they have a tip jar and do not give proper service? Maybe Im being to picky since I was a server once...I don't know. Maybe those Employees were new and Im just being anal??But we will be back. The Food and Ambience of the place shouldn't be discredited because of just 1 experience.

55.description: The garlic parm fries must be made by Jesus himself in the back, they are that good. The beer selection is insane.  My burger was full of flavor and cooked perfectly. It's pretty sweet that when you order a can of pop, any pop after that is free. The cookie with your meal is a nice touch.

9.description: Went here tonight with friends and girlfriend was great. Very full and great food. The music also brings back memories. Great times. So full! I definitely recommend this place. Servicewas great!

26.description: This place is awesome. The food was delicious & reasonably priced. Like the other burger/ rock music restaurant Kumas  Corner, they also have videos of rock music playing but it's not so loud that you can't have a conversation. In fact we met up with some cousins who showed up after we were done eating so we ordered shakes to have so we could stay and sit with them. The shakes were great. Not too thick not too runny. Great flavor. Will definitely be coming back.

25.description: Great service, great burgers, great beer. Very fun atmosphere, and spiked milkshakes.

12.description: I'm usually not one to eat burgers just because I don't prefer it. However, when I trust a place, I will give the burger the benefit of the doubt. After eating at this place, let's just say that this is one of my favorite burger places ever. I liked the casual style of this restaurant. I walked in, ordered, sat down, and the food was brought to me. I ordered the amazing grace. It is described as smoked pork belly atop juicy meat, crispy onion straws, homemade spicy sriracha pickles, and carolina mustard BBQ! The excitement while eating this burger is incomparable to anything else. The sauce, flavors, and texture intertwine so beautifully. I also ordered the pork belly fries which were amazing. I got to try some of the garlic Parmesan fries as well. Flawless. One thing I love about this place is that they have a section where there's all types of sauces (ketchup to horseradish to a1) so that you can pick and choose at your own discretion. Lead belly also give you extra of their signature sauces for free if you ask.The service was excellent too. They were giving my cousins and I recommendations on what to order. They were smiling and friendly the entire time. We dined their pretty late and they did not give us any cues to leave which was very nice of them. Prices were normal, but you definitely get your money's worth. Definitely definitely recommend!

59.description: This place rocks soooooo hard! First of all, you will be hard pressed to find a better burger. Plain and simple.  Great tasting beef, fresh toppings and fresh buns baked on the premises. The garlic fries made for the perfect combination. Everything was piping hot and freshly made to order. The staff were extremely inviting and attentive. They walked me through the menu enthusiastically and didn't miss a detail. They also had a DVD of Bob Marley going on the screens to make this one enjoyably lunch time.  They also have a better beer selection than most bars. A++++++++++++++

21.description: The burger I got felt like I was eating rubber. The onion strings on top were delicious, the bun was delicious, it just seemed like the meat was extremely low quality, or just exceptionally old. Also got a Vanilla shake, meh. Needless to say, if your burger tastes disgusting I won't be returning.

17.description: Finally made it to the former Leadbelly (lawsuit name change) and wasn't disappointed.  The burgers were perfectly cooked (a medium rare and a medium), the buns were the best I've ever had (buttery crisp on the bottom), toppings were delicious. And they were a manageable size! Not leaning to the ridiculous size like some I have seen. Having said that my 30 year old dining companion was sated with his, and we split an order of fries, which were crisp and served in a cute little fry basket (we decided to stick with the regular fries this time.)Staff was great (friendly and attentive). Parking was easy as it's in a little strip mall.  A 4 out of 5 with the only negative being a wobbly table, a messy floor under the table next to us that a family with kids had just evacuated,  and a slightly nippy air temperature inside. Will definitely be going back!

10.description: For me, a burger place must do 2 things well to be considered successful. That is, create a tasty beef patty and awesome fries. Although not life-altering-experience good, I feel that Leadbelly does succeed in both these areas. In general, the beef patties are tasty with a good level of seasoning and have a nice hearty size to them. The smoked pork belly that is mixed in with the ground beef does add a memorable flavor to the patty although I wish that the patty itself was a bit more juicy. The homemade items really do shine through, from the tasty sauces to the fluffy buns. This gives each item a fresh taste and unique flavors.One thing I really liked about all the burgers I tried was that the beef patty was clearly the theme ingredient. The other elements of the burger like the smoked bacon and bourbon bbq sauce in the Easy Rider or Goat Cheese and Truffle Aoili in Old Time Religion helped to bring out the flavor of the meat rather than overpower it. This can really only happen when you have faith in the quality of your ingredients and do not need to use seasoning and sauces to mask poor quality meat. I really enjoyed the clear difference in presentation, colors, shape, and flavors of each of the burgers I tried. From the other items I saw on the menu, I really appreciate the variety of interesting flavor combinations they offer, without being extremely pricey for a similar burger elsewhere.I enjoyed the fries quite a bit here. Generously sized, slightly soft but with nice crispy edges and a thicker cut with some skin. What I really like about this was also the toppings and seasoning didn't mask the strong potato flavor present in the fries. In particular, the garlic parm fries had a nice subtle garlic and parmesean flavor without feeling greasy or too salty. The chipotle fries weren't too spicy and gave a nice contrast of textures with the chili cheese fritos that were topped with a chipotle cream sauce.The Leadbelly butter cookie is a delicious mix of crushed pecans, white chocolate, milk chocolate with good strong flavor of egg and butter clearly present in the cookie. Perfect way to end the meal.Leadbelly is a great way to get creative burgers that you'll find at some of the better known spots in the city for a cheaper price and without the long wait. I'll definitely be giving this place another visit in the near future.

5.description: First time diner here. Definitely a more hip hamburger joint with a grunge rock theme as evidenced by the music videos playing on mulltiple tv screens and the musician pictures lining the walls.I ordered the "House of the Rising Sun" burger which consists of the hamburger, fried egg, cheddar cheese, smoked bacon, homemade sriracha pickles and Bloody Mary Sauce!  ABSOLUTELY FRIGGIN' DELICIOUS!  Garlic Parmesan Fries and a Sprercher Grape Soda rounded out the meal.They also have draft beer and a large variety of craft beers.I will definitely drive in from Palatine to try their other specialty burgers!sA

3.description: We went on a Saturday and the place opens at noon.  We knew we were in for a treat when we noticed people already waiting in line and in their cars for the doors to open.  Once they opened the doors, all of the tables were full within 15minutes.A few of the reviews below mention that the burgers are small and the pictures can be deceiving, so we ordered three burgers (Easy Rider, Black Betty, Good Night Irene), two fries (garlic and blue), and a shake (chocolate).  These burgers are not small and we ordered way too much.Our favorite burger overall was the Good Night Irene.  A huge burger with a crab cake on top.  The Pico de Gallo was amazing and some of the best we've ever had on a burger.  The burger was so big that we had to take the crab cake off, cut it into bite-size portions, and eat it with bites of the burger to get the whole flavor.Be warned about the blue cheese.  It is really, really strong and goes a long way.  The Black Betty and Blue Fries were amazing, but the cheese is so strong that it was all we could taste.  Plus, add the Spicy Buffalo Blue Sauce (we thought it tasted more like a sriracha mayonnaise) and you're in for a flavor overload.  We suggest only getting either of them if you really love blue cheese and getting both may be overkill.The beef patties themselves are huge.  Ours was perfectly cooked to medium:  brown outside and slightly pink inside (which is how we ordered it).  If you like skinny, flat burgers, this is not the place for you.We almost gave this place three stars because of the price.  Each burger is about $10.  However, you get a cookie (a tasty almond one) with each order.  Plus, for Chicago, the prices are not that expensive and they have free parking right out front.  The final push up to four stars was the fact that they carry Marie Sharps, a Belizean Hot Sauce that we fell in love with when we lived abroad.

35.description: Great burgers, big and definately could share one! Oh and their parm fries are to die for!!!

19.description: Jefferson Park is starting to come alive with artists, younger faces and a lot of cool new dining options and this place is the proof. Great burgers, better milkshakes and the fries are fantastic. I've been several times to this location and the creativity in the burger options as well as the clean and clever presentations make it a special burger place indeed. With all the burger joints opening up all over town, the northwest side can be proud of their representative. Brgrbelly Rocks! Literally.

28.description: Delicious!!!! I cannot rave enough about this place. The entire family actually craves this place. Right now we go there every 2-3 weeks, but if it was up to my boys we would be here every week. The burgers are large, my husband & I split the fries because it is too  much to eat. I like too that you can get a portabella or chicken if you choose not to have beef. I can only speak for the portabella so far, but it was just as good as the burger! This place will not disappoint if you are looking for a tasty burger!

45.description: I have eaten at the Irving park location before and all I remembered was great tasting food in an edgy fun environment. The location in Jefferson park is the same it's a great burger place with a great selection of craft beer, and rocker blast from the past vibe! I came in yesterday w. A.pick up order. They made my.burgers and fries quickly. I ordered a classic Leadbelly for the burger. It was a generous portion and kept me full all day. I ordered fried with a polish flair horse radish sauce, sour kraut and sliced kiebasa. Wow that's a meal in its self. I will be back again to treat myself. Also the staff was very friendly and kind!

33.description: So far, this place has the best burgers I've ever tasted. So much flavor. Fries are good too.My favorite burger is the one with goat cheese, tomato, arugula and truffle aioli. Available as a meat burger or portobella mushroom burger.  Both are phenomenal!

43.description: The food is simply delicious and the staff are kind. As an out-of-towner, I highly recommend putting this on your to-do list. There's something on the menu for everyone! Enjoy!

2.description: I've been wanting to try this place for forever but we just got around to it a few weeks ago. My husband and I went in without the kids but this place seems kid friendly enough that I'd be ok with bringing them in. It's counter service so you walk in and order from the board. I had a Black Betty and my husband had an Amazing Grace. I'm all kindsa pregnant so we passed on the beers although they have a great selection. I really, really liked the Black Betty. It was messy as Hell and I needed piles of napkins to eat it but it was amazing. I tried a bite of the Amazing Grace and it was also excellent. We also shared an order of garlic Parmesan fries and they were perfection. My only complaint is that we asked for our burgers to be medium rare and they came out medium well. There wasn't any pink to it. I'm assuming it was something that doesn't happen regularly so hopefully next time we'll get a burger with some pink.

18.description: I ate here for the first time today and I have to say I'm pretty impressed! I'm not a burger person in general but with this location being so close to my house and after hearing great things about the burgers from friends, I couldn't help but give it a try. Thanks to good old yelp and Instagram I easily  picked out what  I wanted beforehand. I decided to go with the Black Betty and a order of the blue cheese fires. Holy burger balls was the Black Betty out of this world!!! I never tasted a burger so juicy,crunchy, and salty at the same time. I fell in love after the first bite. The blue cheese fries were out of this world as well. Customer service was lacking at the register end, guy looked bored out of his mind and didn't seem very knowledgeable about the beer selection. I went with good old root beer.  With that being said I will definitely return soon.

41.description: I don't think there is a better burger for the money.  Fries are also very good, and if you do a takeout, they do not get soggy on the way home.  They even give a free little cookie, but you might be too full to eat even that after the meal.  Tons of craft beers offered, and they even have a full assortment of Sprecher's sodas.  They do a continuous loop of videos of live concerts, also.  I have noticed that sometimes the video being shown will have some significance with the date it gets played, which is pretty cool, also.

52.description: BEST! BURGER! EVER! WOW...I am still thinking about Leadbelly and I ate here a week ago, but it feels like FOREVER! I don't even know where to begin! I'm getting a little giddy just thinking about this place! :) I'll start by saying their burger patty is not your traditional beef patty! It is WAY better...it has pork in it! The addition of pork adds wonderful flavor to the burger! You don't even need fancy toppings to enjoy it! The bun is unreal too! They bake them fresh everyday! They have a good selection of burgers that offer a variety of toppings...something suitable for various palettes! I decided to go with the original Leadbelly which has cheese, LTO, and homemade sriracha pickles. Sounds boring, I know....but the taste was AMAZING!!!! Like I said, the burger patty is tasty and doesn't need a whole lot to satisfy you. It's also made to order. I ordered mine well done and it was cooked perfectly -not burnt and dry! I can't imagine what would happen to my taste buds if I had one of the specialty burgers! :) A party in my mouth...I think so! My husband ordered the Amazing Grace which had smoked pork belly, crispy onions, sriracha pickles, and this Carolina BBQ mustard! It looks amazing and I know he enjoyed it! For a side, we split the chipotle fries....SO GOOD! It had a chipotle cream sauce, pico de gallo, and chili cheese fritos on top! Your burger also comes w/ a cookie...so exciting and so yummy! :) To wash your meal down, they have a variety of options. They have an amazing craft beer selection. They also have regular and "adult" shakes! Wow! We were conservative and just had water...haha. Definitely want to try a shake next time and the Old Time Religion burger which has goat cheese, arugula, roasted tomato, and truffle aioli! I LOVE that this place is not in the heart of the city or in a congested area where it takes you an hour to find parking. Leadbelly is in a strip mall and there is a parking lot. The ambiance is cool...good music and videos playing. It's not too loud where you can't have a conversation. It's clean and the staff is friendly! A little note: I couldn't finish my burger and wouldn't dare throw it away. The next day, I heated up my 1/4 of a burger that was left and it was STILL super tasty! And I was SO sad that I only had 1/4 left! :) That means...it is GOOD! I HIGHLY recommend Leadbelly. I don't think you will be disappointed! Happy eating!

50.description: I live in the area and don't frequently look around much when I'm on this part of Milwaukee cause there's not much to look at. Glad I found them since I had planned on checking out their other location soon after seeing them on Check Please. Probably never going to make my own burger again and instead will just head here. They have a great craft bottle beer selection and had a little display with seasonally limited selections. I chose to have Old Time Religion and added a fried egg as it was between this and House of the Rising Sun. This was AMAZING- had to eat it with a fork and knife but it was well worth the extra work. I am interested in trying The Midnight Special next! The Parmesan fries were easily shared and were also delicious and very unique- normally can't eat fries without ketchup or cheese but these were great without. I also am looking forward to trying an alcoholic milkshake. The music videos and classic and alternative rock artwork were just icing on the cake. Can't wait to return- thanks for spicing up my neighborhood!

4.description: This is a good place to get delicious burgers for a not so bad price for portion! It kinda gives me a feel of Kuma's Korner minus the crazy prices and loud music! We tried the Amazing grace burger with parmesan fries and Midnight special burger and they were good!

6.description: Come here for big and delicious burgers and fries. Don't come here if you plan to count calories or eat a small meal.

22.description: Jefferson Park is starting to come alive with artists, younger faces and a lot of cool new dining options and this place is the proof. Great burgers, better milkshakes and the fries are fantastic. I've been several times to this location and the creativity in the burger options as well as the clean and clever presentations make it a special burger place indeed. With all the burger joints opening up all over town, the northwest side can be proud of their representative. Brgrbelly Rocks! Literally.

15.description: Fantastic burgers!We love burgers and this place has some amazing burgers.  The ambience is casual and the service is very friendly.  They have rock music/ concert videos playing and it can get a bit loud but not too loud you can't carry a conversation. You order your food at the counter and then you wait for your dinner to come out.  We ordered our meal and then waited 35 minutes ( a long time but we didn't mind because they told us as soon as ordered how long the wait was).We tried the Chipotle fries, the House of the Rising Sun, and the Old Time Religion burgers.  The fries were topped with fritto chips and picco de gallo.  The House of the Rising Sun was delicious with the fried egg and the Old Time Religion was so good.  It has goat cheese and truffle oil (what's not to like?).The food was just amazing; great flavors.  The burgers are larger and I was only able to finish half of mine (great lunch the next day).  If we had to critique them it would be on the doneness of the burgers; we ordered medium and they were medium well.  Not our favorite doneness but with such delicious flavors we quickly got over it.   They offer a great selection of local brews and even a couple of different wines. We'll be back :)

57.description: Top three best burger I ever had, n I'm a burger enthusiast, I search n drive for a good burger as far as I can go....burger is an art and this a very good form of it...very recommended.

20.description: Ordered the Old Time Religion burger with a can of O'Fallon Pumpkin Beer. Dad had the Black Betty burger with a Two Brothers Ebel's Weiss draft served in a plastic cup. Both burgers were cooked to perfection on a pretzel roll bun, very juicy and full of flavor. Portion sizes are perfect and they don't skimp on the toppings. The French Fries were seasoned and cooked perfectly; both crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. They also do chicken substitutes for people who don't eat beef. Our beers were cold, crisp and delicious and the service was great. However if you get a draft beer you should sit by the window so you can put it on the windowsill. The 4 tables we tried wobbled really bad and your draft beer will probably spill. We can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.

36.description: What a great burger spot! I have eaten hear a few times and it never disappoints. The burgers are big and juicy and cooked to the temperature desired every time. I have had the leadbelly, the black betty, and the old time religion so far. It makes me feel like a kid back in my "collect 'em all" toy days, I just can't wait to "try 'em all!". In addition to the delicious burgers the milkshakes are outstanding and the cookies (dipped in the milkshakes) are insane, and again bring me back to childhood. Oh yeah, did I mention the french fries? Fresh cut and fried to crisp perfection. Top to bottom, just an outstanding restaurant. It's a family run restaurant too and the O'Briens are a big part of the fabric of the community. They care about the food that they are putting out and the people that they are feeding, and it shows.

14.description: Since moving into the neighborhood with my husband I noticed that there aren't many good places to eat around. This place is one of the good few. The burgers are really good and so are the fries.

28.description: Just went in again - called in at 9 am, worked in with Lola at 6 pm.  Seriously, the girl that shampooed my hair - whoa.  That was nice!  I tipped her as well as Lola for the cut (which was great, as usual).  I needed that scalp/neck massage though and since it is a part of the total price of $17 - no really, that's what it was.  I'm in sales, I know how it is - you get what you pay for.  In this instance, I flip it and pay for what service I get.  They set the prices low, but they do such a good job that I pay them more than double what they charge.  It is well deserved.  :)  Happy hair once again...

1.description: New to the neighborhood and found Bana's on Yelp. Got an appointment for my kids and I for an hour and a half after I called. They were running slightly behind when we got there, but let me know right away and were super friendly. My son sat with Albana first, then my daughter was seated with Hope. We were apologized to again for them being behind. Both kids were happy with their cuts. I sat with Albana next. She talked me through her ideas for my hair from what I showed her I wanted. My hair was super in need of fixing and she did an excellent job! We have found our new place for hair, thanks to Yelp.Update: After we got home, I asked my daughter why she had changed her mind and gotten something else done. She is painfully shy and non confrontational, so she says it wasn't what she wanted, but she didn't speak up. She's 12. :-). I called and spoke with Bana and we went in today for a correction. Turns out that I may have confused the first stylist with multiple pictures. I showed Bana what she wanted in one picture and she went to cutting. My daughter left beaming ear to ear!

39.description: This place is great.  Been coming here for ten years.  The haircutters are hot.  Worth the trip if you come from far away.  Best place in the neighborhood for hair.

9.description: I was in need of a hair cut, so I wanted to give this place another chance. I came once about 5 years ago, I forgot who did it, but I didn't like it then, but today changed my perspective on them! Even though walk ins are available, I still called and made an appointment with Hope, who is a very nice lady who cut 5 inches off and am gave me nice layers. She was understandable and I'm pretty sure she knew I was nervous about getting a hair cut,because it's been so long since I got a haircut!) so she always made sure the length and if I was comfortable with it before she did anything. That's a true professional! Thanks Hope! Will be coming more, thanks to a friendly staff!

29.description: I have been going here for over 10 years, after another local salon gave me PINK highlights instead of red, so I don't know why I have not done a review before.  I used to live minutes away but now I have moved and still come back here. I am not always able to leave work on time, so I like that I can walk-in and get my hair done and do not have to worry about an appointment and possibly being late. Everyone here is friendly. I can say I only had a bad haircut twice in all the time I have gone here, but I don't do anything fancy with my hair normally.  A few times I have come in to get my hair done "fancy" for a party and they did a nice job. Not many hairdressers like working with long hair.  They have always given me good advice when I have wanted to do something that might not really be best for my hair type - like a perm.  I think I have had my hair done by most of the stylists. I like Jackie best mostly because she is who I started coming to from the start and I am used to her.  I am not fond of Ayman - the gentleman who cuts hair. He is nice, but when he cut my hair it seemed he was more interested in doing what he felt would look best over what I really wanted. To his credit, it did look nice and I did get compliments, but I did not want it as short as he cut it. The prices are very reasonable also. I have also had mani/pedis done here. I really think it is a little gem in the neighborhood.

42.description: Good place for cheap prices. I've been getting my eyebrows done here for quite some time for $5. I was impressed with the fact that they actually spend time on your eyebrows and don't just whizz through the process like some places. Some women are better at eyebrow waxing than others, it's just a matter of finding your favorite waxer. The do haircuts for the whole family and waxing of all kinds, manicures, pedicures, etc!!.  No threading, however. No parking lot here - just try to snag a spot on the street!

23.description: I went here for a touch up I have been here only 2 times before. Once for a touch up and the second time for a touch up and cut. This time the stylist asked me what color I wanted. I said black.  She said my grey hair aren't that bad. Yet she charged me extra $5. I dont mind paying but no one told me this before. Also she left my color on 15 min longer then suppose to. My head was really itchy. But what really made me upset was when I left I had a BIG BLACK mark on my nose and cheek.  She looked at me in the eye and didnt say anything. I noticed this mark on my way to the gym. I was so embarrassed I turned around and went home to try to get these black marks on my face. She really didnt care about me. A true professional would have said let me fix that or at least tell me about the marks on my face. Im not coming back!

5.description: Great prices for waxing or threading! I always come here for my eyebrows and they do an amazing job. Love it!

31.description: Really superb hair salon. Had heard about this place.  Out of the blue, I called and asked if they could take me for a cut.  Told me to come on in.  Met my hair stylist Lola upon arrival and was whisked over to the washing station then on to the styling station.  I was in and out in about 40 minutes with an absolutely wonderful hair cut.  I'd never worked with my stylist before and she came through.  Even better than I had hoped for.  Will definitely be going back.  Again and again.  I feel like I won the lottery finding such a terrific and skilled sylist with Lola.  Ask for Lola if you are a newbie here.  You will not regret giving this neighborhood gem a try.  Clean, bright, contemporary.  Great for the entire family.  Fair prices.  Give it a try.

25.description: Been going here for a long time for haircuts and will continue to do so! Ayman does a great job and offers helpful tips without making you feel pressured like stylists have at other salons I've tried. He's cut my son's ultra-fine baby hair too and it looked adorable. I'm going to have him cut my husband's wavy locks too. Price (which is very reasonable) does not reflect quality!

12.description: I went here for the first time and had a hair cut. This is a good place with good people and very good price. I went their i told her i want a layers kind of hair cut and also want to maintain the length. I wanted more layers but no worries i m satisfied. My hair dressers nname was hope. She is a great lady. I will be back their next week or so to color my hair. Forgot to ask the pricing but will call and make sure. They have good price. I paid $23 total and tips was $8. Haircut was only 15 bucks.

37.description: I went there after my friend had gone there 3 times and liked his haircuts. He has curly, not so short hair, and I know that is not easy to cut. So I went with him the fourth time he went, and I was very disappointed. This wasn't any better than a cheap haircut at Supercuts. I don't remember the name of my stylist, but she did not even completely cut my hair. I gave her permission to cut more than a trim to get rid of split ends and style it, I even suggested cutting off another inch as I saw it didn't look much different. After the haircut, I actually felt it looked worse than when I had gotten there.  She didn't even bother to trim any of the hair that framed my face. I had to go home and trim it myself, even my own grown-out bangs! Usually when I get my hair done, everyone notices, but not this time. I guess I will be heading back to Michael Anthony Salon to get this fixed. On the bright side, my friend loved his haircut once again, and it is growing out well.

21.description: I turned to Yelp to find a place nearby for a bikini wax, and found this salon.  I'm no stranger to waxing, and I usually go way into the city, but figured for something basic like a bikini wax I'd try to stay close to home.  The water was very nice and clearly tried hard to give me a good result, but she broke a few cardinal rules of waxing sensitive areas, namely, don't go over the same area repeatedly, AND, make sure the skin is tight enough before you pull.  As a result of these mistakes, I have severe bruising and raw skin today (the wax was yesterday).  Also, instead of applying wax with a disposable stick or spatula, she used a roller system - as in, a reusable one from what I could tell - which seems unsanitary.  It had been a while since I had waxed, so I know I wasn't the ideal candidate for a rock star waxing job, but I'd prefer for her to give me the option of an incomplete wax vs a totally bruised and raw bikini area... Kind of defeats the purpose of being well-groomed, no?  Anyway, long story short, I wouldn't go back for a wax.  I think they can handle easy waxing jobs, but mine are always a bit complex (if you are puzzled by what I mean, you are probably easy to wax).  Bummer, because the salon itself is a nice place, the waxer was totally peasant, and the price was nice and low.

16.description: Bana's is awesome.  I was looking for a salon where I didn't have to fork over $40-60 for a haircut.  I'd been spoiled by an amazing hairstylist friend, so I had high standards for both quality and price.  I've seen Lola twice now and her work is really, truly great.  She could work at a schmancy place that trades in highway robbery, but instead, she keeps it real.  Excellent layering, great styling.  I've gotten lots of compliments and I always tip at least $8, because my haircut is always $17.  Yes.  $17 for an amazing, quality cut, $25 with a mega tip.  As for atmosphere: no frills, rather quiet, but I really don't need an espresso whilst getting my hair follicles trimmed.  I would highly recommend Lola and Bana's.  Oh and yes, they don't take charge under $20, so cash or check recommended.

17.description: My husband and our 3 kids are clients here.  Not only are there great stylists, the salon is clean and modern.  The owner, Bana, is there every time we go.  She is friendly, kind, and professional.  There is also a stylist named Albana who is great with men's cuts and boy's cuts.  My husband is very particular about how his hair is cut and Albana has taken the time to understand his preferences and he always walks out with exactly what he asked for.  Albana also cuts my 8yr old son's hair and today, she gave my 7 month old his very first haircut!  Her sweet demeanor coupled with her skill made the process enjoyable for everyone and the baby got a great haircut with natural looking results.  Finally, Hope cuts my 5 yr old daughter's hair and has transformed her long, thick hair into a stylish inverted bob.  Complete strangers approach us when we are out simply to compliment my daughter's amazing cut.  Prices are very reasonable, ranging from $10-$20 for the services we receive.  I couldn't be more thrilled and my family loves going there!

10.description: Silly me. I have been coming here for years and years. At least 3. The one reason I come here is because of Albana. She is the only one I will let touch my eyebrows. (As you can see from my profile picture, I have thick jet black hair). I went to a place before I found Albana and specifically said clean up only. I like to maintain my arch. When I was done, I looked like a hooker w penciled in eyebrows! And then, I said I'd give this place a try driving by it. Thank goodness I did! In need of a place to get your eyebrows done? Come here. She is popular, so call ahead and see what times she has available.

11.description: Great little neighborhood salon!  They offer a wide range of services, including salt water float tanks! It is clean and well-managed.PARKING: Free street parking, and I haven't had an issue parking thus far.HAIR: I haven't had a bad hair cut yet! I usually go to see Hope. She is always pleasant, easy to talk to, and have never disappointed. VALUE: I usually spend around $15 for the cut! Pretty reasonable for a quality haircut!FYI: If I remember correctly, they don't take plastic if the total is under $15 or $20.  If you are considering paying with a credit or debit card, I would double check about their policy.APPOINTMENTS: Although they do walk-ins, you may be better off calling ahead.RATING: As always, when using the rating scale, I compare apples to apples not apples to oranges. Therefore, at this price point, Bana deserves 5/5 stars.

26.description: I just moved into the Jefferson Park neighborhood a few months ago and have been looking around for a good salon since then. WOW this is the place, I had a wonderful first experience. First off, the salon itself is very clean and modern looking, you'll feel like your getting your hair cut and pedicure at some boutique downtown! The staff and manager were very professional and friendly. I took my son with me so he could get his haircut for school pictures the next week, not only did they do a wonderful job, but as I waited for his cut to finish, I got an amazing chair massage by the masseur. When it was time to pay I was blown away by how cheap it was. I walked out of there feeling great all over :) and it will definitely be my usual salon from now on.

27.description: This place does hair like the trendy salons in trendier neighborhoods but for half the price. I get color, cut, and highlights from Hope, and she is the absolute best!! I always walk out looking like a million bucks.

35.description: Being a mixed chick it is very important to find a great hair stylist that has power & style behind their blow drys. Ayman, a very nice young man from Jordan blow dried my thick/curly hair great! I work up this morning and it was still looking good.  The salon is contemporary with natural colors. There were 3 other ladies working and each appeared very nice. I was offered coffee & water by the manager.  If your looking for someone to blow dry your thick unruly hair give Ayman a try!

8.description: Lola is the best! She is professional and offers suggestions for how to deal with your hair type day to day. She is also great with color and really listens to what you want with the haircut and color. The salon as a whole is really a great value. It's very clean, convenient, and everyone I've dealt with has always been professional. It's so good to find a stylist you trust and know that you will leave looking and feeling great!

0.description: I'll review the 3 services I received here so far: massage, haircut and no-chip manicure. Remember when you go here that you can pay with your card only if your bill is above $30, plus - they accept cash tips only! Fortunately I had cash on me. Anyway, back to the reviews:Massage: my back was killing me - I needed a massage FAST. The therapist (Dominic) knows what he's doing and was very nice. One of the best massages I've ever had! Five stars :-)Haircut: After 9 years of growing out my hair I decided it's time to cut it short. Albana did an awesome job! AND - for 20 bucks! I love my new hairstyle and I really recommend this place! Twenty-five stars!! Thank you so much!!! Manicure: meh. I'm not really fussy about my nails. I didn't particularly like the no-chip polish I got, but mainly because my nails were short to begin with. 3 stars.

38.description: Very nice place. Had a wonderful mani, pedi, and eyebrow wax. A bit more expensive than a cheap nail salon but I like that " salon/ spa look and feeling. You won't be disappointed !

20.description: Great little neighborhood salon!  They offer a wide range of services, including salt water float tanks! It is clean and well-managed.PARKING: Free street parking, and I haven't had an issue parking thus far.HAIR: I haven't had a bad hair cut yet! I usually go to see Hope. She is always pleasant, easy to talk to, and have never disappointed. VALUE: I usually spend around $15 for the cut! Pretty reasonable for a quality haircut!FYI: If I remember correctly, they don't take plastic if the total is under $15 or $20.  If you are considering paying with a credit or debit card, I would double check about their policy.APPOINTMENTS: Although they do walk-ins, you may be better off calling ahead.RATING: As always, when using the rating scale, I compare apples to apples not apples to oranges. Therefore, at this price point, Bana deserves 5/5 stars.

19.description: great massage at this spa.   will be back!  would recommend to all.

33.description: Extremely clean!! Friendly and warm staff! Great massage and pedicure! I went there a little apprehensive for the first time to try floatation therapy, which was an amazing experience. (They have a great package if you buy 5). I was put at ease by a warm and friendly environment. My friend got a massage and I got a pedicure with Rezi :).Ayman (a hair stylist) even dried my hair after I got out of the spa. My friend fell asleep in the floatation tank and we wound up staying past close and everybody was kind and did not rush us out. Thank you for a wonderful experience. We will be back!! :D

2.description: This was my first visit to this salon. i am going to a family party tomorrow and needed a hair cut, and searched Yelp. I called at 1:15 and got an appointment for 2:00.Albana was my stylist and she did a wonderful graduated bob cut on my hair. Was pleased with the cut and pleased with the pricing. I will return!

34.description: Great salon for my haircuts, colorings, eyebrows, and if needed even for a floating(awesome) and even a massage. Jackie is the lady that takes care of me everytime!

32.description: No. Do not go here. I'm convinced these people are paying people to post good reviews for them. I went here for an eyebrow waxing, something they claim to be great at. I told the guy--no, I BEGGED the guy not to do them too thin. When I went to look in the mirror, my forehead basically blended into my eyelids... I had nothing left!!!! I cried, paid them and left. The man never apologized and told me they'd grow back even better. Like that's supposed to make it better???? ABSOLUTE DISASTER!! Again.. just no.

18.description: My favorite hair salon and spa in the city...people are so nice and the service is great! I travel from downtown to get my hair cut and nails done....better than a dowtwon salon!

41.description: Hate to make an appointment for a trim or color?  I love the fact you can just walk in for an utter hair emergency and then walk out beautifully coiffed without spending an arm and a leg.  This place has been my mainstay for nearly two years now and was referred to them by a barber friend of mine in the know.  These beautiful Europen ladies know their stuff and are most welcoming.  Whether you need a facial, haircut, color, mani or pedi, I'd go out of my way, take a cab, rent a zip car to keep going here.

13.description: I had THE BEST deep tissue massage from Dominic at the salon. He rents a space there. He is a master  at his craft and technique and I left feeling glowing ,  energized yet TOTALLY relaxed and    de-stressed.  I went home  to start a  project I've been procrastinating about and my boyfriend said "Wow- you look terrific!" !

4.description: Massage Therapy with Dominik was fantastic...He is polite, respectful and most of all delivers a great massage. I am a doctor of chiropractic on vacation and have known a lot of bodyworkers, and can vouch that Dominik is a skilled massage therapist.  Not just fluff.  Give him a try!oh, and the flotation therapy is great too!

24.description: Having just moved the suburbs, I needed a salon in the city and close to home. I am walking distance from here and had passed by several times. I was fortunate to get a gift card to Bana for my birthday from my boss. It was easy to make an appointment and was seated with Ayman. He was very happy and talkative, and listened to what I wanted. I need a cut and color. He is vey knowledgable and I was so excited at the end. The cut was perfect and the color is just what I wanted. I will be back.

6.description: I stumbled upon this place while I was yelping for haircuts nearby. To be honest, I was going to write a bad review until I looked into the mirror when I got home. First off, they only accept cash unless it's $30 or over. I am glad I called beforehand because I almost never have cash on me. Haircuts are $15 for women, plus $2 extra if you want a wash. I haven't had a haircut this cheap in a while (they usually end badly for me) but I am tired of paying $45+ for mediocre haircuts. When I arrived, I didn't request anyone specific since I've never been here before. I was also able to park right in front (street parking) for free, which is always a plus.The woman I met with (who shall remain unnamed) looked pretty disgruntled and didn't say much. After letting my hair loose from a clip to show my hair length (mid-back), she asks if I want a wash. It has hands down, the most aggressive shampooing I've ever had in my life. It was like I had mud in my scalp or something, and she was frantically trying to give it all off within 60 secs. It wasn't painful, just a lot of rapid scratching and LOTS of pressure. I mean, I had shampoo foam all over my forehead creeping into my eyebrows and sopping in both ears. At this point, I was regretting that I came here. Also, a wash is just shampoo, no conditioner.We went back to her chair and she started cutting. She didn't say one word to me the whole time, which is fine because I am not much of a talker, but she just looked like her hated her job. It was super weird. You don't have to talk to me, but please don't look like you're taking out your frustration on my hair. She also had all her fingernails cut except the thumb, which had a french manicure on it but was badly chipped. When I say chipped, I mean the nail itself, not the nail polish. This is important because she was pretty aggressive with the haircut and kept scratching my face with that super sharp nail. When she finished, she waved the blow dryer through my hair to get some of the moisture out of it. She put a mirror in front of me so that I could see the back. Because she didn't comb it or anything, I still had hair all over my face. It's the way you would look after driving down a highway with your windows open. It did not look good.I tipped her $5 (and found out that this woman was capable of somewhat smiling) and paid the $17 at the front desk. I got in my car and immediately starting fussing about why I never go to places like this. I kept fingering through my hair to comb it while I drove, fix my part line, etc. I arrived home to look in the mirror to see what the damage was, and by now my hair is completely dry. Surprisingly, it looked good. So the positives being 1) the haircut actually looked nice, 2) the haircut was cheap, 3) parking is free, and 4) location isn't too far from home. I don't need the "experience" to be pampering, but I think I'll ask for another stylist next time. FYI, the woman who cut my hair is not any of the recommended people on this page, but it goes to show that even the crappy stylists can cut too!

22.description: I have reviewed Bana's before, and am in need of an update! Two years later and I'm still loyal.I first was attracted to Bana's location (five minutes from home) and prices. What keeps me coming back is the service and quality!I've been getting my haircut by Ayman and I can't imagine going to anyone else! I even got my mom hooked on him! Every time I go in there, he tells me how to take care of my damaged hair so that one day it can grow long and healthy. I keep bugging him to let me go back to blonde but he is honest with me about the quality of my hair and tells me only if I take care of it. He's a blast to talk to and will tell you how it is. He always asks me to cut my hair super short (and I CRINGE) but he listens and will only do what you tell him to do. He is great with that! Other stylists may not listen to what you want or chop off too much but he always does a great job and executes exactly what I ask for.I had Lola before also who is great as well :)Another plus: I can get in the day I want to and not have to wait weeks for an appointment! They have enough stylists and try to accommodate you as best they can.The salon is fantastic and for the price it cannot be beat! I don't want to give up Ayman as a secret weapon but he deserves all the good reviews he can get. I'm 2 hours away for school and I still come back to him!

15.description: I have reviewed Bana's before, and am in need of an update! Two years later and I'm still loyal.I first was attracted to Bana's location (five minutes from home) and prices. What keeps me coming back is the service and quality!I've been getting my haircut by Ayman and I can't imagine going to anyone else! I even got my mom hooked on him! Every time I go in there, he tells me how to take care of my damaged hair so that one day it can grow long and healthy. I keep bugging him to let me go back to blonde but he is honest with me about the quality of my hair and tells me only if I take care of it. He's a blast to talk to and will tell you how it is. He always asks me to cut my hair super short (and I CRINGE) but he listens and will only do what you tell him to do. He is great with that! Other stylists may not listen to what you want or chop off too much but he always does a great job and executes exactly what I ask for.I had Lola before also who is great as well :)Another plus: I can get in the day I want to and not have to wait weeks for an appointment! They have enough stylists and try to accommodate you as best they can.The salon is fantastic and for the price it cannot be beat! I don't want to give up Ayman as a secret weapon but he deserves all the good reviews he can get. I'm 2 hours away for school and I still come back to him!

40.description: WOW!!! TEN DOLLARS MEN HAIRCUTS, yes $10I've been coming here since this place first opened, before it was remodeled and it was just chairs and Bana.  The picture says its $6.99 for men but its $10 now, which is still cheap considering most places it's $15 (besides Betty's and Nick's).  Now there are many ladies there, and one guy (he's not that good Do Not go to him, he will FAIL you), I feel that are all the lady's can get the job done to a satisfactory level.  But if you want PERFECTION and have time I think Bana still does thee BEST FADE.  Next in line would be and an asian lady Jackie, would be the quickest and tightest fade, Mohawk, Blow Out, FoHawk, FloHawk, what ever you need or just wanna try out something new she can get it done. All I can say is I am SO SO SO SOOOO lucky I don't live far from this place.  Oh yea, Patrica B. thank you for the compliment. =)

7.description: Albana did a great job on my hair,  she definitely knows what she is doing,  never had a stylist with so much confidence,  and you can't beat the price. Great value.

36.description: I've been going to bana's for probably 10 years now. However, the last time I went really turned me off to this place.  The entire staff is very friendly and for the most part do a good job. It is a good price for a women's hair cut also. I always just have any one of the hair stylists cut my hair. I always get the same easy hair cut. A trim with it angled in front. A basic hair cut if you ask me. So, last time I had, Ayman, the only male cut my hair. It was so awful, unbelievably choppy. It was not angled at all and  looks like he just cut a chunk of hair off the side of my head. One side looks decent, but the other side does not "flow down" at all. In total, I had to get 6 inches of my hair cut off between 2 hair cuts to fix the mess he left. He was a super nice guy, but maybe just cannot ankle the front of long hair properly. So, if you are a female and get your haircut here, pick anyone other the male hairstylist.

30.description: Wow!  I have lived in Chicago for 5 years and have been to multiple salons around the city.  I usually leave feeling  like the haircut is just ok and that the color is not quite what I wanted.  I always feel that I have spent way too much money for the quality of the cut and color...my 5 year streak of feeling that way ended today!  I walked into this place after being referred by a friend.  The woman at the reception desk was very helpful and pulled some books for me to look at cuts and colors.  I picked one of each. We then disussed my choices,but I told the stylist, Rezi to use her discretion, as she is the expert. She gave me an awesome, new cut and a fantastic color! She even talked me into bangs, which I always toy with, but never actually do. She totally changed my look for the better, which is exactly what I wanted!   The salon was clean and quiet, even though it was pretty busy for the time of day I was there.  When I was finished and went to pay, I almost fell over when Rezi told me the total for my visit.  I actually asked her if it was just for the cut. I said "that's it?" I thought I heard her incorrectly.  Hands down the best cut and color I have had in a long, long time for the best price!  I will definitely be going back to Rezi in the future, she is wonderful!

3.description: We've been going here for years. For haircuts and eyebrow waxing. Albana cut my hair yesterday and did a good job. The salon is very nice looking and clean. Most important they are affordable!

14.description: About 2 weeks ago my parents rented out a hall to renew their wedding vows. I'd had an appointment with a hair stylist at 9am in boystown... Needless to say that it didn't work out. I was upset and I nervous because I had no idea where to go to get my hair done and I hate making appointments last minute,  much less in a rush with someone I'm unfamiliar with. I yelped 'hair salons near me' and Banas place was one of the first ones to pop up.. With solid reviews. So I figured I'd try it out. I'm not sure who I spoke with on the phone, but whoever they were.. THANK YOU! This person was so polite and set me up with an appointment at 1030.  I get to my appointment at 1015am and I meet with a really nice stylist by the name of Lola.. SHE'S WAS ABSOLUTELY great!!! She ever re cut my onesided bob the way I wanted it. (I'm not too hard to please,  but I felt like she went the extra mile).. I met Baba at the front when I was ready to pay and she gave me a little more info on the Solon as well.. I'm so very satisfied that I might have found my new spot. Sidenote: in comparison to my sisters, and God knows I have a bunch, I paid the least. Not sure where they all went but my hair was definitely the best that night.. they all agreed! Check Banas out!! You won't regret it.. I know I didnt!! =)

3.description: I would really like to write a review but as they had me on hold forever.. Another young lady comes back and laughs as she says I'm sorry my friend put you on hold.. I said thank you and good bye.. If there's no respect for the customer I don't plan on ever going there..

1.description: Hhhhhhhhhh

2.description: Continuously impressed by the staff at this office! In 2013 you have the choice to get an eye exam at so many locations. I prefer to keep my eye health in the hands of experts and choose Ideal Family Eye Care over any big box chain or grocery store. I have been coming back to Dr. Szewczyk's office for over three years and appreciate the thorough examination paralleled with a comfortable environment. The staff breaks down ALL of my options and doesn't rush me to make any decisions. If you're looking for a positive eye experience that's actually quite relaxing and affordable, this is the spot for you.Update: my contact lens order was processed and ready in no time! Love it. Thanks guys for the quick turnaround on my order!!!

0.description: I saw the one star reviews... and feel I need to do what I can to wipe out what that  unfortunate feedback is doing to the IFEC's rating. First of all, I have been a patient of doctor Szewczyk for many years and have to admit that the quality of care is just outstanding. Doctor Szewczyk is never rushed and takes a holistic care of her patients. Few times, thank to her detailed tests (and advanced technology she is using), doctor identified several health issues that were outside of her area of expertise and I will always be thankful for that. I feel good that every time I have my annual check-up I see some new & best in class technology that is being used to examine my eyes condition and health - this means to me that I am at the right place since the care is evolving and I want my doctors to follow new technologies/research/innovations. Lastly, I only purchased two pairs of frames (in 8 years) and they last forever! I am still using both to work and continue to receive many compliments (the person that works at IFEC spent hours to help me find perfect frames, was patient and never rushed me, even recommended I come back in few weeks to get the perfect style and I got it!... so I don't have a need to change frames for a "better model"). Doctor is a genuine, kind, experienced professional and has a great reputation. Frankly, I never pay attention to the receptionist since my focus is always on the doctor expertise, but they always been very patient-focused, nice, friendly and I never experienced what others in reviews listed below. I work downtown so on many occasions I had to see other doctors for immediate care and when it happens I am always checking if IFEC didn't expand their location to downtown area (I wish, since i never get the same level of quality and care from other doctors/places around my office).Doctor's focus has been always on quality of care and best outcome for her patients. I never felt pushed to spend money at the clinic - actually I am saving my money (by being doctor Szewczyk patient I am getting a significant discount for LASIK procedure at Kraff institute - I was so positively surprised, thank you doctor for recommending this procedure/place to me!!) So happy and already counting days to my surgery!

1.description: The flowers died within 3 hours and I got other bouquets from other florists the same day and the day before , they were all alive at least for a weak, these died within hours, the petals started falling off the minute I took of the foil, and kept falling off while I was placing them in water. The worst florist in the entire tristate. I really am so very disappointed, I read a review on a couple of other sites... they were unhappy with their flowers life span, and the look of the  arrangement as well.The only thing I have left is the lovely note that came with it... I didn't even get to take pictures with them :(  which I like to do to remember them for ever...And look at their prices... they are so pricey...Pls save your loved one the disappointment...GO SOMEWHERE ELSE...You can't even call them or email them, the phone number on their website  is not a functioning number.They also do not have a e-mail link to contact them on any of their pages... I guess they got sick oflisteningand readingabout their dis-satisfied customers problems. (shrug)I truly am not a malicious person, but I will not tolerate bad business practices and neglect. They are serving human beings with emotions, especially in the flower business... those are very important moments, moments we women cherish for ever...moments we look back on years later... it needs to be  accommodated if this happens, they don't even care! DO NOT BUY FLOWERS FROM THEM. If you see ANY POSITIVE FEEDBACK ABOUT THEM it must be someone who works there or who is a friend. I have not seen one good experience on other review sites. So sad.

2.description: I have gotten flowers from a very dear, very loved , a person so very close to my heart, I got them on the 13th at late night when I came home... I am nuts about flowers, and I cherish and take very good care of any gift that I ever get no matter how small or big I value the thought and the heart put into it  very very much... those were gorgeous red roses when I got them, I am also known to have a green thumb, I am good with plants and flowers, I am one of those crazy girls who talks to them...lol, after I followed the directions on the little slip to the dot, after 3-4 hours they started dying on me, today morning  the 15th not even a day after Valentines!...they are  dead. ( I have flowers from exactly 10 days ago from a different florist... guess what ...they are still alive and looking pretty) I was hoping I could enjoy these very special ones  for at least a week as I do all my flowers that I ever get... I am so heart broken :( I just want to cry :(I really am so very disapointed, I read a review on a couple of other sites... they were unhappy with their flowers life span and the look of the  arrangement as well. The only thing I have left is the lovely note that came with it... I didn't even get to take pictures with them :(  which I like to do to remember them for ever... And look at their prices... they are so pricey...Pls save your loved one the disapointment... GO SOMEWHERE ELSE... You can't even call them or email them, the phone number on their website  is not a functioning number. They also do not have a e-mail link to contact them on any of their pages... I guess they got sick of listening and reading about their dis-satisfied customers problems. (shrug) I truly am not a malicious person, but I will not tollerate bad business practices and neglect. They are serving human beings with emotions, especially in the flower business... those are very important moments, moments we women cherish for ever...moments we look back on years later... it needs to be  accommodated if this happens, they don't even care! DO NOT BUY FLOWERS FROM THEM.

0.description: I was kind of disappointed with this place.
