I came here to get a boutonierre for a formal and it was about $10+ I don't understand how that can be done when other places will give you the same thing for only $4.  It's a pretty shop, but if my experience reflects the rest of their prices - then I think I'd pass.

3.description: For our wedding, the previous florist backed out at the last minute. K House of Flowers saved us and the arrangements looked great. Definitely worth a look

1.description: GO here to get your flowers. They have a cool old black cat that lives here and the gentleman that helps pick your flowers is super friendly. I come here to get flowers for my broad all the time. I love that chick.

2.description: The owner said that I was not a good florist and he was not going to give me some hours for Valentine's Day as I had planned on since I called the owner in January. He talked with me on the phone and said that he would call me for working on the holiday. I have cleared my calender to work with him and I traveled to his business the weekend in before he told me to come in on Valentine's day. I called him for my hours the day before the holiday and a young woman answered the phone and told me to call him at 5pm. So I did. He said that he did not like my work, so I didn't have the hours on Valentine's day. I had other work for the weekend. He should have told me that in January when I phoned him. Not I have lost work and I have no hours at my present business I work at.

5.description: All through high school I would come here before dances or "x month anniversaries" with girlfriends, etc, and get flowers or corsages or whatever. The gentleman who runs the place was always helpful, asking what color dress she was wearing, what she was like, anything that could help him put together a picture of the occasion and the appropriate flower, and you know what, he was never wrong.

6.description: Cute little mom and pop flower shop. Fair prices and a HUGE selection. Plants or fresh flowers - whatever you want! Crisp and cool right out of the fridges - this is the place to go for that special occasian! They even have little cards and ballons to add on to your order. Small parking lot - good luck!!

0.description: The owner, James, has always been friendly and has always done a wonderful job with any arrangements we have sent or received from him. This is a "mom and pop" business, with a very talented florist at the helm.

4.description: Any flower shop that has a resident cat is okay by me.  I have gone here twice; once to pick up impromptu thank you bouquets for friends and another time with a friend who needed some small plants to give as gifts.  Both were easily available.Having said that, the place could use a pick me up.  This is not a Lincoln Park trixie flower shop, so don't go looking for that.  If you want something other than a red pre-made bow on your arrangement, you may need to explain what you are looking for.  The owner is a gem and puts together lovely arrangements, but it by no means caters to a "hip" crowd.  In short, it's my favorite kind of local place.  Give it a go!Bus: Foster, Central 85/85A, Pace 225/226, Milwaukee 56Parking: Street available and small lot in alley

3.description: Zachary's is a dive seemingly in the middle of nowhere. We approached this place for some karaoke and it was the only place in the immediate area with a light on. Inside is big enough just for the bar, a dart machine, the karaoke area, and a couple tiny single bathrooms. It's pretty dark inside but there really isn't a whole lot to see. Full carpeting seemed just a bit strange...Prices are pretty standard for a bar. Heard the mixed drinks were a bit weak (obviously didn't have any b/c I didn't want to spend $ there). Snacking on a small cup of peanuts is a nice little thing to have. Karaoke was pretty fun. Despite being fairly empty, the wait for your next song was a bit unsettling. People were really nice and friendly though. For me, Zachary's was ok for one night... not the best place for a bunch of 20 something year olds though.

1.description: Nice neighborhood bar, Visited on a Sunday night and it was a nice quiet place. Able to sit down, have a drink, talk with a few friends and toss a couple games of darts. Drinks and beer average prices. Seemed to be plenty of parking on Milwaukee Ave.

2.description: I've never had a bad time here. It can get pretty crowded some nights, but people are always friendly and the drinks are decent. Small place, but gets the job done.

5.description: A nice looking dive bar. came here to watch some football. It is small and quiet and prices are decent. There are alot of other bars in the neighborhood and none of them really stand out. I would say this is a place where older neighborhoods get drunk and smoke their cigaretts outside with the old, bad color ballpark seating.

6.description: Why has no one mentioned the live radio broadcasts on Fridays at 7pm?!?!  The Dave & Chris Show sets up in the back and goes live, takes calls, gets drunk, and puts drunks on the air. They argue politics and tell dirty jokes, cuss like sailors, and are entertaining as all hell. Check it out: chicagotalkradio.net.I had Basil Hayden last time I was there and the owner was hanging out at the bar. Truly a Chicago local gem.Also, they have high speed wifi.

7.description: Affectionately called the carpet bar. Go there and you will see why. Tiny, tiny little bar off of Milwaukee that is hilarious. When we showed up at 1 or so totally dead. By closing time, totally packed. To tell the truth, I can't even remember how much the drinks were. Probably not too bad though. The reason we came here that night- they are open until 5! Then, if you want breakfast Blue Angel is just a short walk down the street.

8.description: This place is the worst! Avoid it at all costs!

9.description: This is a 4 o'clock bar that doesn't hop until after midnight! The bartender Debbie is interesting and cool!  If your out late and been drinkin for a while and don't want to quit- this is your place!  The plae has karaoke on some nights and after midnight is hoping most days of the week. so all you second shifters & late nighters this place is for you.

0.description: If you are a fan of carpet (lesbians, don't get too excited) then this is the one.Don't believe the one star review below from Bill C.   Cosby is just bitter as Zachary's (along with any respectful establishment) would not allow him in for being a shamed paedo.

4.description: It's kind of a dive bar, but Friday nights is Karaoke with Jonny Fah and it's a great time!  Be prepared, some of the bar stools are a bit wobbly!  There always seems to be some kind of munchies in the bar, but they don't serve food.  The prices are definitely affordable.It's well worth the trip out on a Friday night to enjoy the interesting collection of aspiring singers doing their karaoke... and the host, Jonny Fah is a blast!

3.description: They have authentic Paczki's!!! The best ones ever!!

1.description: I found this gem on a Saturday afternoon driving down Milwaukee, and stopped in just minutes before closing time.  As I looked around and approached the counter, a very friendly young lady started speaking to me in what I am guessing was Polish.  I'm a dark-haired, blue-eyed pasty girl, so I get it, but I replied with "Oh, no ma'am... I'm sorry but I didn't get any of that".  She smiled and told me that they were closing but she'd be happy to put something together for me. I chose a few mixed pastries. It's a good thing they were so pretty that I decided to photograph them when I got back to my hotel room before I started eating them because they did not last long after the first bite.  The brownie and dipped cookies were really, really good.  The other pastry, an oatmeal flavoured meringue topped with a light chocolate cream and dipped in ganache, was simply amazing.  I love sweets and this was definitely the best sweet I've ever eaten in this country and probably in my top 5 all-time.  If you're in the area, stop in and see them at Sweet World Pastry.  If you're not in Chicago, go to Chicago and seek them out.

2.description: What a gem. I was referred here by Ideal Bakery for a 1st Communion cake. Beautifully decorated and tasty plus the customer service was great. Will be my go to for party cakes. Costco cakes just cannot do an event justice like a true bakery confection.

5.description: They also have really, really good cocoa cake brownies.  Do not try unless you are able to come back frequently for more!!

0.description: Found this hidden treasure because I was in the need for a birthday cake on the fly. What a delicious surprise. Had the tiramisu cake and it was delicious. Very pleased. Will be back again.

4.description: A true hidden gem in Gladstone...

12.description: Love this place the guys are very informative to new vapors and have tons of flavors in stock I'm hooked on the night shift at the moment

7.description: Stew ruined the business he only thinks of himself and how to ripp  people off and he still owes me money where's my money! cheapskate!

3.description: I came here back when Stu owned the place some would argue on his ways of handling business. His gorgeous Pitt Seven was always there, he gave me fair prices and some freebies for the most part. New owners I have nothing bad to say, I can openly admit the place looks a lot cleaner and they still sell MEDTAINERS if you're 420 friendly I suggest you pick one up. I bought two and received a free lighter of my choice and another one once again on the house. Definitely checking back in

1.description: I walked in off the street to replace a broken product of mine (not related to this shop). The clerk was SUPER friendly and didn't try to hard sell me anything; he just let me look around. This place has a giant selection.Answered all my questions and I walked out with a new product at a great price. The clerk also tossed in this cool little lighter on the house. Great place. Would shop again.

2.description: I love this store!  The employees are so very helpful and always friendly.  The prices are fair and I highly recommend Whole Leaf for tobacco, vape pens, vape juice or anything else you may need.  There is a very wide selection. The owner and employees of the store will go far beyond your expectations.  I am always treated with such courtesy.  I will always shop at this store!  Many thanks to J.J. for the professional way you run your store!!!!

9.description: This place is beyond amazing! They have the best selections of liquids. If you're unsure of what you want, the staff knows every flavor of liquids and can help you choose and the prices are unbeatable!  Always a fun , friendly environment. They treat you like a VIP !

18.description: Went here to inquire about e-cigarettes to try to quit smoking cigarettes. Been smoking for 16 years, tried to quit countless times with no success. Spent $70 on a complete kit with e-juice, stopped smoking cigs immediately. No problem. E-juice comes in different nicotine concentrations from 24mg/g down to zero. I was smoking 1/2 to 1 pack/day, got one 18mg jar and one 12mg jar. The 12 is sufficient to completely satisfy my cravings most of the time. I have been smoking the 18mg in the morning though. Hopefully be down to zero in a few weeks. Oh yeah, after initial purchase of e-cig, $60 for the one I bought which is actually two, it only costs $1/pack equivalent. Super easy too.  If you're thinking about getting off cigs, stop in here, extremely helpful staff, great products, great prices.

10.description: Really friendly and helpful staff that hooked me up with an e-cig and some liquid that tastes just like a Marlboro.  Huge selection and great prices too!FYI - Cash Only.   I would give them 5 stars if they accepted credit cards!

13.description: Hands down this is the best place to fufill your vaping needs. Such an honest, helpful and informative staff. You can sense that they want you to leave a happy customer and to keep wanting to come back.  I love this place and frequent it almost on a weekly basis. Its comforting to know that they are fellow vapor heads themselves.

16.description: This place is awesome. The prices are good and the people are so friendly. I'm very picky on what e cigarette flavored octet. They strive for satisfying my 'needs' and don't mind helping me. I love going here.

17.description: Great place, fantastic staff. Good prices. Came here for e-cig. I had been researching the e-cig and was overwhelmed by what's out there. Stu was fantastic, knew exactly what I needed. Couldn't be happier. I parked on Gale st, plenty of parking there.  My new go to place.

15.description: Called to inquire about products sold. Not helpful at all and extremely rude. Brush up on your customer service skills, for real.

0.description: I love this place and have been relying on them for all my e-cig needs for about 2 years. They have a good choice of liquids and batteries, are always ready to answer questions and really take their time to help out (like if a tank gets stuck and won't open or a battery stops working...). I can't imagine a nicer and more friendly place to do my e-cig shopping. Thanks, guys! Keep up the great work! :-)

5.description: This place has excellent selection and very helpful, friendly staff. Glass here is amazing!!! My #1 favorite smoke shop in Chicago area & I'd definitely recommend checking it out !

11.description: The staff doesnt know ANYTHING when it comes to vaping. The coils they build are complete crap, they over price shitty clones and say they're top of the line or authentic. Nothing here is authentic besides SOME of the tanks. Besides that. Horrible place! The only thing that's worry it here for vaping is the juices.

8.description: I have purchased a total of 4 different e-cig devices from this place.  The first one looked like a cigarette, and its works great, but holds a very small amount of liquid.The next three were all the same variety.... KangerTech EVOD.  Turns out, that part of the tool "burns out" and when I brought the old one it, the guy working there said "those break a lot" - so then he gave me a great deal on another one.  I said fine.  When my wife thought she broke another one, we replaced it again from this shop.  So when we brought it home it wasn't working... brand new, just 5 minutes old. So I went to youtube to learn a bit about them.Guess what?  While this shop sells them for $35 a piece, you see you can get them online half that... well you get two tools, and 3 back up coils... which do burn out.  Other parts that come with it don't come with the tools they sell.So end of the day, you may not know it but you are being charged more than 50% above what it costs... and he knows you burned just the coil, but he sells you a whole new device anyway.Bad ethics, bad business. I will never be back here, and I won't be surprised when they are jailed for selling *things* they shouldn't.

4.description: This place is awesome .. I felt like a kid in a candy store .. amazing vines and the best selections I've seen in Chicago and even Florida where I'm from. Customer service is amazing and really know what you need and has awesome pricing. Really enjoyed my time there and really can't wait till my next visit

14.description: i have been in there on 3 separate occasions and it seems that the employees care more about talking to thier friends and being on thier phones then actually selling stuff. i jave went in for very specific items that they carry, only to wait 20 minutes each time while the employee had conversations about everything Except. ....smoke and vape things.   i guess i was on the pay no mind list and that sucks cause i live 2 blocks away. oh well....some people are in business to make money, some just to hang out.

6.description: Ultimate must stop smoke shop in Jefferson Park/ Chicagoland area. Great selection and prices! You can even test out different vape boxes and liquids/juices! The owner does a great job of explaining products and shows you how it's used. Has plenty to choose from to suit any kind of smokers needs! I'll definitely be back to upgrade on a vape box amongst many other fabulous items available!

3.description: Ever since a car crashed through the front window, it hasn't been the same. Ownership is a bit douchey, that's fine though. It's the regulars that drive you crazy. They're very territorial. If they don't recognize you, they will let you know and make you super uncomfortable. Yech. Avoid avoid avoid. Try the Ham Tree or Nil Tap for a better time.

1.description: A lovely neighborhood bar with reasonable prices. This is one of the few bars left in Chicago that doesn't charge an arm and a leg for a drink. It is also one of the few bars that isn't completely packed with obnoxious people and the bartenders are efficient and friendly. I have to assume this is because it's so "far" from everything. The NW area gets looked over, and I'm OK with that if it means I can find nice little spots like this.My friends and I stopped here after dinner at Smak-Tak, which is another place I highly recommend. It was pretty late and dark and we didn't feel like traveling too far. We looked for something close and Harry's was just down the street. There didn't appear to be too many other options and with a bar as nice as this one, that's all you really need.

2.description: This is a real Chicago bar. And yes they do accept credit cards now. I have spent many of nights here and it is like drinking in your buddy's basement.

5.description: This is another small bar in the Northwest side of Chicago. there was nobody the night I went. It is a nice average looking bar with a really small patio and a nice view on Elston. The older bartender was frindly and drunk..which you have to love. This is such a refreshing change from the yuppie bars of Wicker Park and Wrigleytown.

6.description: "Come to Harry's its Sexy" is the slogan my friend Casey made up last summer.  And it totally is "sexy" .... I mean who can resist a neighborhood crowd of regulars, awesome bartenders, great music, harryokee seven days a week on demand and a super cheap prices that are nowhere to be found.  On top of all that awesome stuff there is more: Barney, the manager who sings on request ) note: you must be a little buzzed to appreciate this and it is funny and one on a lifetime experience) the crowd range (from "I just turned 21 crowd to the retired creepy overly awesome old men) The Great Bartenders ( here is the kicker: I work here on the weekends and so do two of my awesome friends along with the oldtimer amazing and sweet bartenders, who are like family).So, what are you waiting for? We have pool, darts (if we can find them ever), harryokee, we sponsor teams of any kind, juke box, and cheap drinks with Guinness on tap (one of the best in the city).PS: Im not saying this just because I work here but because it was my Cheers and that is how I got the job.  Its a fun neighborhood place with inviting people and its so much fun with surprises every night.

7.description: Harrys is a great bar.  I've taken a bunch of friends here and they all can't wait to go back.  We decided to host our christmas party here this year.  They are more than accomodating, VERY inexpensive, and has the best karaoke library on the NW side.  You haven't seen anything until you've seen Barney and Karrie sing I Kissed a Girl... Free cherry chapstick for all.

0.description: Nice neighborhood bar with friendly regulars and patrons. This place is no-frills but the prices can't be beat. We all got 6 beers and the tab was less than a Jackson, seven after tip.

4.description: A buddy of mine had his birthday shindig here.  When we arrived, we found out that Julie the bartender was celebrating her birthday as well.  Double the pleasure, double the fun!I ordered a Jack and Coke and a pint of Guinness and Julie clocked me for $8.  I just stared at her dumbly.  I almost asked her if she realized I had ordered 2 drinks.  It was then I made a quick mental note to start visiting this area more often.The bar is a very friendly and lively space.  The patrons and bartenders alike make it a very fun, relaxed place to be.  I guess it helped that our party bought Julie a shot every 5 seconds to celebrate her birthday as well.  Yeah, it was one of those nights.The details become hazy after this point.  There is a pool table in the back which was set to freeplay possibly for the birthday patrons as there was yet another birthday gathering there.  There is no food served here but the owners are welcome to people ordering in food and eating at the bar which I thought was fair.The jukebox plays Metallica and Ratt.  That's all you need to know about that.  Bring your dollars to feed the music machine.  It demands you rock and rock hard.Cash only.

3.description: Gonna up my rating to 3 stars. Cuz the bartender rembered my beer after I hadnt been there in months. Nice job N.

1.description: Cute little neighborhood bar! I came in last Friday evening with a couple of friends and we had a really nice time. The patrons there bought us drinks and the bartender Nicole was so friendly and sweet. They have cool IPAs on tap and a pretty nice selection of bottle beers too. I will definently be back to this place soon!

0.description: Great bar... All brand new inside. Clean and a lot of beer choices.

2.description: Well when this place first opened, I have visited this place often and was good to know who's whos there.Though there was replacement bartenders and had to teach the new bartender what i like and service and then it went down in service.  So if you frequent often then bartender is caring you more than others.  Even though I'm from the industry and i tip well for 7-10 beers and a Shot of Chilled Stoli O - I always tip $20 bucks and still do that every place i go, but still i dont get the service i use to get.The Owners are nice and now and then I seen their daughter work there she is a nice person.As i don't live in the area any more 1 day I'll stop by to check it out again, hope i see a familiar face or I'll just leave after 1 drink, because bartenders need to stay to keep the crowd keep coming back.Also I after they started I purchase the domain as well, bar57west.com & bar57west.net belongs to m when when ever they plan to buy it to promote their business.Later all

5.description: They fired the best worker they had!  No more 57 for me and my crew.  Ever.

6.description: I wanted to go to another bar on Higgens I haven't hit yet, but it seems closed always on sundays. So I kept heading East on Higgens until I found this place. The only thing about this place that was memorable was they have a security cam to the outside up at the bar. You can watch and make fun of people in the bar going out for a cancer smoke. I never seen any other bar with this feature. Aside from that this is just another small neighborhood bar with little on tap and mostly bottle stuff.

7.description: Love it! For a small neighborhood hole in the wall type place it was really nice. Very updated. I got a top shelf drink for only $5...how can you not love it. Very sweet bartenders. Everyone knows each other which is always a fun vibe.

8.description: Jefferson Park Cheers.. everyone knows everyone.. Bartenders are allllll Great.. Games are always on and the drinks are cheap.. stop in

9.description: Went here on a Saturday night to catch the Blackhawks game. The bartender was friendly, and I had a good time. I will go back again.

10.description: After a lengthy close, the former *old man* bar is reborn as a clean modern local joint that's a nice place to grab a drink. Don't expect to get the warm and fuzzies but they do try.

4.description: I wouldnt call this place a hole in a wall because it looks really nice inside.  Its small but its cool.  They show the games, easy to talk to folks including the bartendars, and a huge thing....cheap drinks!  How can you not like this place.

29.description: I have to disagree with all the other yelpers that gave it 1 or 2 stars. They make the best fried rice in town. I have never been disappointed with it. It's flavorful and the proportions are right! Every time my boyfriend and I go there, we order General Tso's Chicken and sometimes their beef with broccoli or pea pods. Their Shrimp Egg Foo Young is delicious too!Now... if I were to give it 1 less star, it's because there isn't enough seating. Food is prepared fast. They are very neat and clean, and they deliver in a timely manner. Thumbs up from me!!!

42.description: Terrible. After reading the reviews I was excited that I might finally find a solid Chinese delivery on the NW side but it was no good. The egg rolls were cold and tough; they must of been left over from lunch. The Moo Shu pork lacked flavor and had little pork. The "pancakes" and the sauce (hoisen?) was clearly not a house specialty. This was very disappointing as I am desperate to find a place that will delivery quality Chinese food to my house.

23.description: Terrible food. Worst experience of my life.

8.description: Fave Chinese place in Chicago. Their lunch portions are huge and less than $6! And you get an egg roll too! Amazing food. Except the orange chicken. I wouldnt go for that. But everything else is sooo good.

31.description: So....fast service,really good food,no MSG.i'll recomand 100%.

34.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!   $5 for a huge lunch portion, a couple bucks more for dinner and you have food for two days!!!! I live on their broccoli and chicken.... Steamed rice sometimes or pork/chicken fried rice when I'm in the mood... YUM.   My hubby loves the sweet n sour chicken and friends of ours love the sesame chicken. I've also tried the trio of beef/chicken/shrimp (it's called Happy family or something like that) and it's OH SO GOOD!!!!! Plus, I need to have sweet/sour sauce / soy sauce in my rice, on my meal and in my egg roll at all times, so I go through those little packettes.... they have them out for you to take as many as your little heart desires unlike some places I've been to where they literally give you TWO and frown on you when you ask for more..... LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!

16.description: LOVE the Peking fried rice. It's spicy! Yummy egg rolls and crab ragoon. I don't like their orange chicken, though.

13.description: This is our local go-to Chinese place and with good reason, we really like their food. Sesame chicken, beef with bok choy, beef egg foo young and their beef fried rice are a few of our favorites, egg rolls have vastly improved and their Won Ton soup is really good too. If you think you need something sweet for dessert, try their sweet donuts, which are like small, round fry cakes sprinkled with sugar. We usually call and pick up and when they tell you "10 minutes" they mean it. (We waited one time, but only because it was a Saturday night, which was very busy and we had ordered one of their large dinner meals with 4 entrees) The food is consistently good, we'll go back - we always go back!

11.description: Not bad and not exceptionally great, idk I don't deviate to much from what I always get and they haven't messed it up. I wish there was a place to get great pad Thai in Jefferson Park...

39.description: I just moved to this neighborhood, and I'd love to say I've found that "go to" restaurant...you know, the place you "go to" for a quick meal.  Unfortunately, this ain't it!    The Kung Pao shrimp was spicy...but there were only about four (4) shrimp in the entire dish...and it was obvious the shrimp had been cooked before it was added to the veggies/sauce.  The Orange chicken had absolutely no orange flavor....NONE!?   Lastly, I don't know that I have ever had a bad egg roll...even at the ghetto places, but this restuarant had the worst egg roll I have ever, ever tasted!?  By pass Chinese Kitchen and gind something else...

37.description: Not the best Chinese I've ever had... Not the worst Chinese I've ever had. But, for sure the best Chinese in Jefferson Park. The egg rolls are pretty darn good, and so is the Mongolian Beef :)

0.description: My family stumbled upon this place today when I asked my husband to stop at the dollar store next door. He and my daughter ordered egg rolls from here while I went in. When I get back to the car, they were enjoying!So we decided to go in and have lunch before we continued our errands. While my husband said the chicken wings weren't as good as our favorite Chinese place, the lunch special I had was wonderful. Mongolian beef with chicken fried rice and an egg roll, for $6. All of the lunch specials come with those and the menu is quite extensive. Our daughter had the combination lo mein and she loved it. The noodles were fresh and full of beef, pork, and very large shrimp!They don't have much in the way of a dining room but there are a few tables, and the lady was nice enough to bring our food out with plastic plates and utensils on a tray. We did notice that the phone rang constantly so they must do a lot of carry out and delivery. We enjoyed our impromptu lunch and said we would come here again whenever we're in the area.

38.description: I feel a certain amount of shame about going to and/or reviewing bad Chinese restaurants because I'm sure a Certain Someone might have something to say about it.  SO hey...you...STOP READING THIS REVIEW.Seriously.Really.OK - fine - but don't say that it's probably to be expected that the food would be, well, bad.  And that's what it was.  Since the other place down the street was closed, we stopped here.  The soup was good...heavy on the hot, light on the sour.  The orange chicken wasn't orange-y at all.  The Kung Pao shrimp was celery,onion, and peanuts.  Good sauce - but no shrimp.  The egg roll was soggy and the wrapper was too thick.I am shamed...I think I need real Chinese food when I get home to undo this damage.

27.description: Pretty good place to pick up some Chinese food.This place gets your order done FAST. I ordered from here on a Saturday night for pick up. I was told it would be about 10 minutes. When I got there 10 minutes later, our food was freshly made and already put into a bag that was there and waiting for us.My favorites are the sweet and sour chicken and the orange chicken. The sweet and sour chicken comes with what you'd expect, fried chicken, tons of rice, but the extra for me is the sweet and sour sauce where they don't skimp on the green pepper and pineapple. I alays order the orange chicken spicy, and it's the perfect amount of spice for me. That said, the portions are huge. There were tons of leftovers, and I'm sure it will make another 2 meals.The food is still always steaming hot when I get it home and open the bag.The eggrolls are a bit soggy and usually the wrapper is too thick. Oh, and don't forget to grab your own sauces! They don't put sauces in the bag for you. Instead, there's an area to the side of the main counter that has all the sauces you would need in individual packets. Take as many as you need.One final note, some other yelpers might have mentioned this (I didn't read all the reviews), but this restaurant is delivery or take out. There are a few tables to sit at while you wait for your order, but do not expect to dine in here.A quick, easy, cheap, and pretty tasty dinner.

32.description: RUDE!!! Every time I go in there I get the worst customer service and have yet to meet a friendly employee. Love there food but the uncomfortable feeling I get when I go there is enough for me to never go back.

44.description: Food here is fast food Chinese, very fresh, very tasty and very quick.  Food is made without MSG and with 100% Vegetable Oil per their menu.  Egg rolls are average, other appetizers aren't great either, but BBQ Pork was good.  Lunch portions are a good quantity and for prices of  $4.95 or lower, it's a great deal!  You can get a dinner portion, greater quantity for only $1.00 more.  I like my food spicy, and they accommodated, the rice and the main dish, spicy but not overpowering.  The specials are served with Chicken fried rice.They have a few tables inside and a TV, but no public restroom. Located right next to a 7-11, get your beverages from next door.  No fountain drinks, only can pop. They also have specials of the month in case you are low on cash and need something for your tummy.Good, fast food, at great prices.  Portions are sold in sizes.  Also, I agree with another reviewer, the Mongolian dish and Pepper Steak, both great, but served with TOO many green peppers.

24.description: I give this place a solid 4 stars. I'd normally give a place like this 3 stars but the service is fast and pleasant and the place is immaculate.I was shopping at the Radio Shack next door and found myself craving Chinese so I decided to give them a try. I was not disappointed. The Mongolian Beef was tasty, a nice sauce and the veggies were crisp so it clearly wasn't just ladled out of a vat. The veggie egg roll was good, too. They forgot to put hot mustard in with my order so the egg roll was blander than I would have liked but all in all I will definitely go back.

7.description: After a sudden sweet and sour pork craving, I ventured out to find a Chinese place that could satisfy me. Unfortunately, a ton of places around Portage Park are closed Mondays... WHY? Chinese Kitchen was open so we gave it a shot despite the meh reviews. I can see why their food comes out so fast... Their popular items must be sitting in the back just ready to heat up and go. The orange chicken was super soggy and had a strange flavor to it. I thought the chicken fried rice was ok (very Americanized Chinese with a lot of soy sauce flavor) but my bf didn't enjoy it. The sweet and sour pork was the kind I didn't like... lot of breading and not much meat. The sauce comes on the side so that was kind of nice since you can't just reheat this. I'm a bit upset that nothing came with sauces. Nothing for my bf's egg roll and nothing for our crab rangoons. Maybe it's just me but I assumed that things that normally come with sauce would come with sauce...

40.description: I tried this place a couple weeks after it opened and the food was pretty bad. The beef and brocolli was really watery, the chop suey was so bland, and my egg rolls were not burnt but they were definitely under a heat lamp for a long time. I just recommend that you walk a couple extra feet and go to Moy Lee's.

30.description: I decided to pickup some Chinese food for a movie night and decided to try out Chinese Kitchen since I had to stop by the Dollar Tree next door. I was excited to see on the menu that they do not use MSG in the food. The food was ready in less than 10 minutes which was great. I was not very impressed with the food though. The crab rangoon was yummy, but they forgot to include any sweet and sour sauce which was disappointing. The Orange Beef was mediocre. I was disappointed in both the egg drop soup and hot and sour soup. They were pretty tasteless and I got a piece on an egg shell in my soup.I would go back if I need something quick an convinient but not somewhere I got for amazing taste or quality,

46.description: Best place for Chinese food in the neighborhood! Just opened last year. There are 2 competing chinese restaurants in the area but this place is by far my favorite. The other two places have alot more seating and more of a sit-down retaurant.  Chinese Kitchen has a few tables but it's more of a to-go place. They make NONE of their food with MSG....so no need to worry about whether or not they followed your no MSG request! The orange chicken is spicy but very good, and they're crab rangoon is decently stuffed. Great place for a quick chinese food fix!

1.description: I never give low reviews. But this place has the most bland Chinese food I've ever had. We ordered the Mongolian beef, crab Rangoon, and potstickers. The Mongolian beef had no flavor. The crab Rangoon, while in the shape I prefer (triangular not puckered), was weirdly dry. I actually think I would have enjoyed the potstickers, but they were undercooked. They'd probably be ok if I reheated them, but they were pink on the inside and I had to stop eating them. Won't return

9.description: They have good lunch specials  and good prices i only go here when im around  the area somtimes they use gross bad meat in there fried rice dark black yucky meat gross

26.description: The delivery guy is the only reason I wouldn't give them 5 stars.  The food is amazing.  I order from them almost every week.  The price always ends up just shy of 8 dollars, and I always just give him the 8, and last time he delivered, he just kind of shook his head, said "no tip?" and stood in my office like it was my moral obligation to give him a bigger tip.  Listen, I'm in high school.  If I had an extra $10 to throw your way, I would.  But I have college to pay for.Besides him, the foods great, they deliver right away, and for the price you get a ridiculous amount of food.  For about 8 dollars I get an egg roll (which i typically don't like, but i love theirs), a GIANT serving of Mongolian beef with lots of veggies and beef.  They put green peppers in their Mongolian Beef which I'd never had before but it works great.  And you also get the same sized portion of chicken fried rice.  I am always completely full by the end.

25.description: Used to live 2 mins away. Love this place. Fresh, Hot, Fast! Wonton soup great. Egg rolls just ok. Rangoon good.General Tso chicken-the best we have ever had. Moo Shu great. ALways fresh. We now look forward to going into Jefferson Park just to pick up a litlle sumtin sumtin. We miss you! Wish you had a location west of O'Hare.

12.description: I've been coming here for years! Its right around the corner from my work. Whenever I get carry out I always run into familiar faces. all of my friends know this is place for Chinese. They have great quality food, great portion sizes and a ton of variety. I get the  typical orange chicken, veg egg rolls and great for sharing the portions are so large.

21.description: My second visit and it's delicious!!! Another good point is it's clean!! You also don't leave there smelling like a deep fryer. The Chinese place down the street in Lincolnwood reeks of grease and so do you when you leave there!! I ordered the Chef's Special, beef fried rice and beef and broccoli. AWESOME!!

17.description: This is my all time favorite Chinese restaurant! I like my chow mein with pan fried noodles and they do it the best(: I also love their crab rangoons and sweet donuts. By far the best Chinese food in the jefferson park area. Great food, fast delivery, best prices! So good(:

10.description: Love this place! Delivery is soo fast & the food is delishhh. Even after microwaving the leftovers, the food is still just as good.

5.description: Chinese once a week, every week.  I recommend looking at the dinner specials, that's where the deals are at! My favorites are cashew chicken, Mongolian beef, beef lo-main and crab ragoon. (I'd skip the egg rolls)Really missing this place since leaving the city. Delivery almost every time within 20 mins!

3.description: First time ordering. Food was ready quickly. Pot stickers were tasty. Egg rolls very good; not greasy. Mongolian beef was spicier than anticipated but good. Sweet and sour chicken was good, but would have enjoyed more veggies. Just a couple of peppers and pineapple. Tomatoes would have been good. Sweet donuts were a yummy treat.

35.description: Consistent, reasonable and fast.  It's all good here, and the best Chinese I've found in Jeff Park.  Sometimes they are little heavy on the celery and veggies, but they do spicy well and our young kids love the steamed chicken and vegetable dish which is always ordered without the sauce.My only complaint is about the variety, there are just slight differences between the many dishes on their menu so they all run together making it hard to remember what you ordered last time.

19.description: I decided to pickup some Chinese food for a movie night and decided to try out Chinese Kitchen since I had to stop by the Dollar Tree next door. I was excited to see on the menu that they do not use MSG in the food. The food was ready in less than 10 minutes which was great. I was not very impressed with the food though. The crab rangoon was yummy, but they forgot to include any sweet and sour sauce which was disappointing. The Orange Beef was mediocre. I was disappointed in both the egg drop soup and hot and sour soup. They were pretty tasteless and I got a piece on an egg shell in my soup.I would go back if I need something quick an convinient but not somewhere I got for amazing taste or quality,

28.description: I go here a lot for lunch. Fast service, good food and low prices. What more could you want. Perhaps the people sitting around the kitchen prepping the food in direct sight of the counter could wear gloves? Perhaps someone could teach the staff there that "thank you" is free and in turn should be used freely? When you are calling or the only one in the store "thank you" does make you feel welcomed instead of like an interruption.

45.description: FAST DELIVERY.  I live near lawrence and central and i have yet to wait more than 15 minutes for delivery.  typical chinese food, not bad, fast, only dislike is they put green pepper in the mongolian beef?  odd, but they will make the substitution no questions asked.  fair price, great to have in the neghborhood.

33.description: All in all, disappointing. But, for cheap fast and close to work, Chinese Kitchen you have earned yourself 2 stars. In all honesty my favorite thing to get from here is a large order of steamed rice. Chinese Kitchen, even you can't F*ck that up!

43.description: Finally, a decent Chinese carryout in the Norwood Park area!  Food is fresh & tasty!  Beef& Broccoli, Fried Rice, and Sweet & Sour Pork are a few of my favs!  Service is quick and pleasant.  If you are picking up your order, be on time,. otherwise, they will call you and track you down!!

2.description: Typical Chinese carry out place close by normal prices I get the combo Mongolian beef shrimp and chicken a xl fried rice and chefs special food is warm plenty off it and you can feed a family of eight for 40 bucks... Not the best I have ever had but it is consistently good food for a good price... They have a couple of tables of you want to eat here or take it to go... Will be coming back again.

18.description: Pretty good place to pick up some Chinese food.This place gets your order done FAST. I ordered from here on a Saturday night for pick up. I was told it would be about 10 minutes. When I got there 10 minutes later, our food was freshly made and already put into a bag that was there and waiting for us.My favorites are the sweet and sour chicken and the orange chicken. The sweet and sour chicken comes with what you'd expect, fried chicken, tons of rice, but the extra for me is the sweet and sour sauce where they don't skimp on the green pepper and pineapple. I alays order the orange chicken spicy, and it's the perfect amount of spice for me. That said, the portions are huge. There were tons of leftovers, and I'm sure it will make another 2 meals.The food is still always steaming hot when I get it home and open the bag.The eggrolls are a bit soggy and usually the wrapper is too thick. Oh, and don't forget to grab your own sauces! They don't put sauces in the bag for you. Instead, there's an area to the side of the main counter that has all the sauces you would need in individual packets. Take as many as you need.One final note, some other yelpers might have mentioned this (I didn't read all the reviews), but this restaurant is delivery or take out. There are a few tables to sit at while you wait for your order, but do not expect to dine in here.A quick, easy, cheap, and pretty tasty dinner.

41.description: Dear Chinese Kitchen, I miss you. Even though i've found a new place to call my chinese home, I miss the way you got my orange chicken to me so quickly, always spicy (sometimes very much so), and I miss the smile on the delivery driver's face as he realized he had already visited our happy home 3 other times that week - by Wednesday. And your fried thin cantonese noodles...alas, how will I go on without you?!Don't worry, even though you won't come to me any longer (I suspect due to the language barrier that prevents me from bribing you), I am still willing to drive to you on occasion. I heart you Chinese Kitchen.

4.description: I give it three stars because of how cheap it was and how much rice they give. I definitely won't be eating here again. The rice is decent. The egg rolls are ok. The food is just bland.

6.description: I went there yesterday. The interior could use a paint job and the pictures of their food was bland and the color was really faded. Most people just get carryout when they get Chinese. here I dont really think dine in is a real option (there are tables but ambiance is for carryout). Price is really fair and food is really good though. I would order it again and again. Maybe next time ill ask for no water sprouts or scallions in my fried rice and see if they can do that. Ill be going back. DONT FORGET TO TAKE SWEET AnD SOUR And SOY!!!! they do not put it in the bag for you!

22.description: My husband and I order take out or delivery from here pretty regularly. We think that their crab rangoon and pot stickers are great! The portions are generous and the food isn't too greasy. I like that they don't skimp on the shrimp.

15.description: Haven't had good orange chicken for a while and my mom and her friend ate here before so I decided to order from them. First of all kudos to the speedy delivery. The Orange chicken is outstanding. Very fresh and not too spicy. The only downside to my order was the teriyaki steak skewers. Somehow they had a fishy taste to them. So overall a great order.

20.description: Haven't had good orange chicken for a while and my mom and her friend ate here before so I decided to order from them. First of all kudos to the speedy delivery. The Orange chicken is outstanding. Very fresh and not too spicy. The only downside to my order was the teriyaki steak skewers. Somehow they had a fishy taste to them. So overall a great order.

36.description: Ordered the Dinner for Two special- $18 gets you 2 egg rolls, 2 entrees, and soup.  The portions are HUGE, so this lasted us two meals, and I still ended up tossing the leftovers.  Egg Rolls:  we had the veggie; loved emEgg Drop Soup:  yumChicken & Pea Pods:  huge pieces of chicken breats, fresh pea pods, light sauce, excellentShrimp Fried Rice:  I don't eat swimmy stuff, but hubs said it was good. I wasn't overwhelmed, but it was a solid meal.  You can't beat the price on those portions, ther'es no MSG, and they deliver to my house.  So, I'm pretty sure I'll be calling again.

14.description: The best dish that I like from them is the Singapore rice noddles. It is packed with flavor and not too spicy. My second best dish is the sesame chicken. Most of the time it is prepared to perfection but sometimes it just comes out too soggy. The fried rice and egg rolls are just ok.

58.description: Yummy ribs, service was a bit lacking. Good old school vibe!

56.description: A long time family favorite, but I've grown more impressed with The Gale Street Inn since we moved in down the street. The food is delicious, especially the ribs, but I've never tasted anything I didn't like here. On top of that, the staff does a great job of really making you feel at home in the neighborhood.

29.description: Don't ask questions, don't hesitate. Just go eat the best ribs you've ever had!!! They have an amazing BBQ sauce and the ribs are so tender and meaty, you can eat them with a fork. The atmosphere is wonderful and warm. The staff is talented and friendly. This is what all restaurants should be.

42.description: This is a nice place for  a family get together they treat you right the food is great love the ribs the chicken is darn good too and for a side au grutin  potatoes you can't go wrong a member of our party last time had jambalaya and told me he has to go back when he comes over to get it to go .sometimes I go by and get pulled pork sandwiches at halftime good way to top off a good game

23.description: Ribs, baked potatoes, everything was so delicious.  The ribs are one of the best I have ever tasted.

47.description: Went for dinner there last night.  OMG so food.  Attended a shower a few weeks back and had their salmon, food was delish.  Who goes to a shower where everyone loves the food?  Usually with a large crowd, the food is usually okay if anything.  But, here everything was so good.  Came back for the ribs.  They were wonderful!  Stay for anyone of the wonderful desserts.

8.description: You can check "ultimate ribs" off your bucket list after a visit to Gale Street Inn. We went for dinner and drinks before a Kansas concert at the Copernicus Center. Neither the ribs nor the band disappointed. An outstanding evening.

31.description: Wow, ribs were amazing! The meat just fells off before you could pick up the ribs. Hands down the best ribs I have had at any restaurant in Chicago. We also had the tomatillo bowl, enough for 2 people. Spicy and great.

34.description: I was there for lunch and got a burger.   It's one of the best burgers served in the city.   And the fries were perfectly cooked as well.   Very filling.

16.description: Fall off the bones meat, deliciously flavored and well balanced, amazingly cheesy *cubed* potatoes au gratin (first time ive had them cubed and not sliced...and they are on to something!) and strong cocktails that all go together so beautifully and deliciously in an old school almost railcar inspired lounge atmosphere. We truly enjoyed our meal and drinks at Gale Street Inn. Sitting at the bar and chatting with the bar tender and other regulars was an added treat. On my one night in Chicago, this was a great place to happen upon and I will certainly come back for more.

13.description: I'd been curious about Gale St Inn for a while, but don't find myself in Jefferson Park often. I was happy to try it before a recent visit to Gift Theatre. There's a reason they've been in biz over 50 years: the place is well-run, has good dining choices for varied tastes, and delivers decent value.VIBE: Upper-working-class banquet hall, and I don't mean that pejoratively. It's large, warm & welcoming, well-lit and not too noisy.SERVICE: Brisk, but cordial and helpful. Our servers were attentive & knowledgeable. Food delivery was well-paced. We were not rushed. There are plenty of staff and service seems to run very smoothly.GOOD: We liked the ribs, a house specialty. They are not the deep, smoky ribs (a la Smoque), but are well-cooked, well-trimmed and tender. Our half-slab orders each came with a commendably fresh salad and a side.NOT SO GOOD: While my grilled veggie side was OK, my companion's twice-baked potato was dry & dull.I'll probably return when I'm in the neighborhood for a play again. We had a good time -- it was definitely A-OK.

11.description: Comfortable neighborhood restaurant.... staff is friendly and warm... food is standard comfort food, but good... owner stopped by our table and was very nice... solid place... this was our 3rd visit and it has been consistently good every time

39.description: Truly a gem on the Northwest side. Chicken tortilla soup is phenomenal. Ribs are the big seller and are fantastic. Au gratin potatoes are addictive. I have eaten pretty much all the menu, over time, and have to say this is excellent food. Staff are real and do their utmost to ensure you have a great experience. Magician is a great staple! I love this place for its consistency, we have been going for 20+ years and have ALWAYS had a great meal and service. Never once has anyone, we have been with, had a negative word to say. Rehab of the bar area definitely make a huge positive boost to the atmosphere. Keep up the great work.

37.description: Everyone loves Gale Street Inn.  I always run into people I know there.  That's the kind of place it is.  Always good service.  Always good food. Ribs Ribs Ribs.

0.description: I was looking through my old reviews and found this one and had to update it. This is now our place to go when we want to celebrate. We even had our wedding at Gale Street Inn last year! Our family loved the food and we had outstanding service by the whole staff.

38.description: Today we returned to Gale Street Inn after a 10 year pause. What was the holdup? Every single person we encountered was absolutely perfectly schooled in customer service and old-school Chicago style. The bar is utterly gorgeous. The drinks fabulous and reasonably priced and the food totally top notch. Nothing but glowing reviews from us . We are now regulars. This place knows what they are doing

51.description: Amazing ribs. Will always get them every time I come in. Staff is always nice as well. Cannot wait to come back!

27.description: The ribs are some of the best in the world.  Some people prefer a little chew to their rib, some prefer falling off the bone.  Gale Street ribs will literally fall off the bone.  I've visited this restaurant five times and always order ribs.  The quality has been consistent.  Be sure to order the Au Gratin as your side.

32.description: I really wished I could have rated this pub four stars but the bathroom.. No, I didn't find a dead body with the head submerged in the toilet. No freaking warm tap water.. Hello? We're not in the middle of July, it was 30's outside.That aside, it's a very very great looking bar. Like I would've imagined the finest pubs in Ireland and Scotland plus the infamous American size. It's huge! The bartender was pretty cool, my order and my check arrived pretty fast. You may think I got served fast because it wasn't busy. Well.. that hasn't not always been an excuse for the other establishments I've been to. The staff attitude was OK, some customers may think of it as a little rough though.As soon as I see they've fixed the warm/hot water problem, I'm rating that pub four stars. "One simply cannot not to have the hot water in a public bathroom".

54.description: I came here for a bridal shower where we used the private event room, and we had a great time. The staff was really friendly and fast, and the food was amazing. We all got the London broil, but I heard their ribs are awesome too. One really nice perk is that they let the event set up early, and arranged the tables in a way that was helpful to us. I would definitely recommend Gale Street Inn for private events.

48.description: Have been there many times over the years. Recent visit was wonderful like most all the other times I dined there. I like ribs every now and again and this is the only place I seem to get them from because I love their sauce. For me, the sauce is what determines if I like the ribs outside the tenderness of the meat. Nine out of ten times I've dined here they are very moist and such a delicious treat. Every blue moon they come out too fatty, I show them to the server and send them back. They happily bring out a fresh batch to my liking and I appreciate that.The staff are eager, kind and happy to be there. I typically enjoy a baked potato with my ribs and a salad so there isn't too much to review as both are also good. If you are in the mood for some delicious fall off the bone ribs then this is the place to visit. Monday nights are a good night as the rib dinner is a few bucks off. Keep up the good work Gale Street Inn.

44.description: What kind a services!!! especially when you arrived just couples minutes to close... bravo!! me and my friend arrived to this location after a  long day at work and whole staff was excellent starting to server, bartender until manager!! we order to go ribs and burger, food came fast but while we waiting for our food we decided to drink couple martinis.. the martinis was soo good,  for me I order the lemon drop and my friend order a blue line martinis, we really enjoy this place... cant wait until Monday to go and try their special on ribs and hear some  live music.. see you soon.

24.description: We have eaten here numerous times and love everything about it!  The food is great and we have never received poor service.

7.description: Came here randomly on a date. We choose it because it was close to the Metra and the El stop. I was pleasantly surprised how nice the establishment was and how packed it was on a Sunday night. Our waitress was really nice and answered all of our questions. The menu seemed like it was from a food chain restaurant. The food was good...I had a burger and he had a chicken sandwich...both good but I wouldn't say the meal was memorable. This place is kinda out of the way  for me so probably won't be going back anytime soon.

49.description: I'd come here everyday if I could and this review probably won't even do this place justice!! We started with buffalo shrimp and crab cake appetizers and I wanted round 2 of both after 1 bite.  On to the meals for ribbbbbbbs and side double baked potato. They are a must just make sure to have a big appetite bc you'll want to devour every bit. I got the halibut dish - on the lighter side and very delish (i opted out of mango topping tho). Good work to these owners and cooks. And also to the manager Gilberto, made our experience great and he knows how to do his job very well!!! Amen

40.description: The ribs were as good as advertised.  The meat literally falls off the bone. By far the most tender ribs I have EVER had. The sauce was sweet but not too sweet.  Cole slaw needs work and the fries were above average.  Tomatillo soup was awesome. This place rocks.

53.description: I am speechless! Literally speechless. Best ribs I have ever eaten. Grilled shrimp salad..with lemon vinaigrette. .garlic mashed potatoes. .speechless. .

30.description: Fall off the bones meat, deliciously flavored and well balanced, amazingly cheesy *cubed* potatoes au gratin (first time ive had them cubed and not sliced...and they are on to something!) and strong cocktails that all go together so beautifully and deliciously in an old school almost railcar inspired lounge atmosphere. We truly enjoyed our meal and drinks at Gale Street Inn. Sitting at the bar and chatting with the bar tender and other regulars was an added treat. On my one night in Chicago, this was a great place to happen upon and I will certainly come back for more.

46.description: Shanna and Larry were awesome!!! First time in and will definitely be back. Delicious food and great wine list.  great place to relax any day of the week. Can't wait to come back.

1.description: Was there this evening for dinner for my buddies birthday. Haven't been there in many years. The kitchen as always was FANTASTIC!! potato skins, French onion soup and full slab(sorry it was lent but had to)Not crazy about the waitress, the bus boys were there to cover her thank GOD. I was a waiter and bartender in the past and can count on one hand the times I've tipped under 20%. Another small complaint that really probably isn't for the restaurant itself but for the customers that go there. CAN WE PLEASE DRESS UP LIKE ADULTS WHEN YOU GO HERE. The volleyball thirst, sweat pants and baseball hats on while your eating(different groups mind you) kinda ticked me off. Maybe a dress code should be stepped up.

55.description: I've been coming here for 20 years! A classic neighborhood favorite. I love everything on the menu but you have to do ribs when coming here! Staff is great! My husband got a balloon & free sundae on his bday! Lol

9.description: This place has the best ribs!! The meat just falls right off the bone. The bbq sauce has the perfect amount of tangyness, not overpowering the other flavors. The bread and butter is amazing! I can eat that stuff all day! It does get pretty busy around dinner time and on weekends and especially if there's something going on at the Copernicus Center. Bf and I usually call in our order and take it togo. Love how this place has free parking and it's only a 3 min drive from the bf's place! Drooling as I'm signing off..

26.description: Omg shake the meat right off the ribs. Excellent food. Save room for dessert it's just as good. Carrot cake is out of this world. Customer service was excellent too. Need I say more.

25.description: What's a terrific rib place doing in THIS area of town?  Unfortunately, I didn't have their specialty and had the chicken parmigiana instead.  It was bland and forgettable.  More seasoning?  Sure...could've used it.  Changing from the side of risoni to a tortiglioni?  Definitely.  The side salad started things off right, but they only have a limited number of dressings; no blue cheese or thousand island.  Luckily, the atmosphere and delightful service made the evening great.  The wine list is small but perfect for the foods they serve.

12.description: My family and I were here last night for dinner (7 people total). I was the only one having a drink last night, a pomegranate martini. It was very tasty, albeit it was on the smaller side of martini glasses. The service was great, food was great, as always. I didn't see how much our bill was when the check arrived, my husband paid the bill. On our way home he informed me we were charged $20 for my martini, which is outrageously high for 1 drink even if they used top shelf liquor. I wished he would have to told me before we paid because I would've asked the waiter about it.  Too late now, but I'll definitely ask about their price list for theirs drinks next time we go. I'm hoping it was a mistake in that we were over charged for 1 martini and not that we were fleeced for the price of 2 martinis.

59.description: The wait wasn't bad for a Saturday night. The waiter was very efficient. Started off with fried calamari which was veryTasty, some of the best I've had. The ribs were fantastic and the king crab legs were great. Hadn't been here in a long time, but now it will be on my regular list.

21.description: This has to be the best ribs I have ever had. Not only was the service phenomenal, the food was excellent. Gale street is not only a wonderful place to bring a date but also family friendly. The bars selection of cocktails is perfect and the atmosphere is a exciting and bustling. I would recommend Gale Street Inn to anyone looking for good food, good drinks and good time.

17.description: Came here on a Saturday night the wait time was about an hour long the place was packed but once seated it was definitely worth the wait. Appetizers arrived promptly ordered potato skins and the buffalo spicy shrimp amazing to say the least! I had the Rib and jambalaya rice combo And SWEET MOTHER OF GOD these ribs were the most tender and literally fell off the bone in one bite. The jamabalya a rice had shrimp chicken and sausage and it had a great flavor and a bit of a kick!The place seems reasonably priced can't wait to make my way here again!Best ribs EVER!!

10.description: I really wished I could have rated this pub four stars but the bathroom.. No, I didn't find a dead body with the head submerged in the toilet. No freaking warm tap water.. Hello? We're not in the middle of July, it was 30's outside.That aside, it's a very very great looking bar. Like I would've imagined the finest pubs in Ireland and Scotland plus the infamous American size. It's huge! The bartender was pretty cool, my order and my check arrived pretty fast. You may think I got served fast because it wasn't busy. Well.. that hasn't not always been an excuse for the other establishments I've been to. The staff attitude was OK, some customers may think of it as a little rough though.As soon as I see they've fixed the warm/hot water problem, I'm rating that pub four stars. "One simply cannot not to have the hot water in a public bathroom".

5.description: Rib Combo+Jambalaya+Tomatillo Soup+ Spinach with Lemon= Incredible. I haven't had such a satisfying meal in a while. The ribs were just perfect. Not too sweet, not too ketchupy, with a hint of smokiness; andddddd they fell off the bone.  I don't usually suck the bone dry, but the flavor was just too good. The tomatillo soup had great flavor and just enough heat, and a great crunch from the tortilla chips.  I've never had fresh lemon with spinach before; clearly I've been missing out Yum! And the jambalaya was packed with shrimp, sausage, and chicken. From the moment I entered the door I was welcomed by several staff members. They were very friendly and it made me feel they were happy to have my business. The atmosphere was warm, the music was    lively, and the bar had some nice choices. I also liked the Belgian glass my Stella was served in. Those little touches really enhanced the whole experience.

3.description: Came here on Saturday for lunch. Started with the Fried calamari and potato skins with pulled pork. Potato skins were awesome! The sweetness from the pulled pork plus the cheesy awesomeness equals happy eating! The calamari on the other hand, not so good. Didn't taste the freshest. Onto entrees. I had a full slab of ribs with a side of au gratin potatoes. Ribs were fall off the bone, but they could use some work on the sauce. Also, more of a char on the outside to caramelize the sauce would do wonders. The potatoes, again cheesy and awesome. My dish came with salad, which was swimming in dressing. Not a big fan. My hubbies burger looked like it was a frozen patty. Overall: Good service. Waitress was extremely nice and helpful. Food, OK. Room in the back could use a face lift.

35.description: Busy Friday night and really understaffed.   Best part of our wait?  The owner brought us pizza bread as we waited for a table.   My husband asked for a beer and he forgot until we asked again.   We waited forever for our appetizer,  our entrees took over 45 minutes and once we got our food,  our waiter tossed wetnaps on our table and did come back for awhile.   We got here at 615, got a table at 645 and it's 830 and we just finished eating.   Still waiting.  No option of dessert or our check.     We heard the couple behind us say the hostess forgot to put their name in and they waited forever for a table... When thru told their waiter he said,  "sorry  but you're here now..." love the food here and we will be back but worst service ever.   So slow and understaffed. *also forgot to add we were very disappointed the crab she's were no longer on the menu.   Those were our favorite.   We ordered the stuffed mushrooms and although they were good,  they shrunk about 30%... Not sure what's going on with the menu.   The kitchen was slow.... We waited 45 minutes for our entree.   Thinking this goes beyond training.

19.description: Outstanding!!! My wife and I have been a to GSI on several occasions and it has always ben wonderful. The staff, food, and decor are amazing. You will not be disappointed dinning at the Gale Street Inn.

28.description: OK if you like to have to gnaw your ribs off the bone then this place is not for you.  If you like ribs that fall off the bone and are as tender and tasty as any that you have ever had them by all means you need treat here.  I personally never order ribs anywhere else.  On the very rare occasion that I order anything else from here it has always been top notch but I pretty much stick with the ribs and maybe ribs and jambalaya.  Garlic mashed to die for and if you like oysters and they are in season then you will love these.  Atmosphere is great.  Never rushed no matter how busy.  I have been coming here for years and never ben disappointed.  I highly recommend.

45.description: Food was good...I pick up often a to go order.  . ...When my friend ordered her Filet not butterflied... It comes butterflied.  Never had an issue before getting it not butterflied. The waitress then tells us that they always butterfly.  Not true...ordered many times prior.  But... Even when the customer tells you not to butterfly it should have come up at the time of order.  We have our food but she has to wait.  To add insult to injury....small dark haired Asian  woman comes over and tells us they always butterfly their steaks now.  Excuse me...they ALWAYS butterfly their steaks NOW!  When I say to her.. The customer ordered not butterflied...what happen to the customer ordering what they want and we have been here many times when the Filet was ordered not butterflied...and it came out not butterflied!!  This woman then tells me that she cant get anywhere with us and I told her fine...leave our table...she then proceeds to the me I am RUDE!  Yes the customer is RUDE!!   And asked to speak to George...owner who just left...well George...don't worry about this rude customer coming back...and by the way I was not rude.  I have forty years in the service industry...We left and went to Mortons Patio to drink.  We were going there initially but decided on Gale Street.  No issue with food ....Staff issue.  I ate three ribs and packed the rest only to discard in the garbage...not a good evening.

33.description: Finally made it to the Gale Steet Inn. It lived up to it's great reviews! The bread pudding a la mode was the best part.

43.description: Like always, the ribs were on point! 5 of the 6 of us got ribs and the other got the herb chicken. All our sides were delicious, but the au gratin potatoes weren't. It seemed like they used liquid cheddar cheese or something. The shrimp with my ribs were rubbery, which was disappointing since I paid $9 extra dollars for it. Our waiter was okay, but the ladies at the front desk were nice and we had a great family dinner. We'll be back.

2.description: I pass this place all the time when I go pay the cable bill, but I never thought of going in before.When we got to the restaurant there was a half hour wait. The place was jam-packed, some people left when the wait got up to an hour. I won't go on a Saturday evening again. There were a lot of kids and noise. It took about another half hour for the food to arrive, we had to ask for bread because we didn't get offered any and at a certain point we were ready to get the table! Service was very good otherwise.The food was good. I had the classic burger with the sweet potato fries. It was cooked well-done like I asked, but it could have used some seasoning. A lot of places act like they never heard of seasoning. I also had the bread pudding and ice cream, which was tasty.

18.description: What's a terrific rib place doing in THIS area of town?  Unfortunately, I didn't have their specialty and had the chicken parmigiana instead.  It was bland and forgettable.  More seasoning?  Sure...could've used it.  Changing from the side of risoni to a tortiglioni?  Definitely.  The side salad started things off right, but they only have a limited number of dressings; no blue cheese or thousand island.  Luckily, the atmosphere and delightful service made the evening great.  The wine list is small but perfect for the foods they serve.

41.description: This place has the best ribs!! The meat just falls right off the bone. The bbq sauce has the perfect amount of tangyness, not overpowering the other flavors. The bread and butter is amazing! I can eat that stuff all day! It does get pretty busy around dinner time and on weekends and especially if there's something going on at the Copernicus Center. Bf and I usually call in our order and take it togo. Love how this place has free parking and it's only a 3 min drive from the bf's place! Drooling as I'm signing off..

52.description: What a great place to have around the corner.......great food, and friendly staff! Never disappoints..........

50.description: Great place!  Food is great and the staff is super nice.

4.description: Ive been here before but was surprised that i hadnt made my review for my previous visit years ago, so im happy to recently come back here again for their awesome fall-off-the-bone baby back ribs! They give complimentary fresh warm sliced loaf bread with butter which was yummy! i tried the Porkapalooza-which includes pulled pork, jambalaya, some BBQ ribs, creamy coleslaw and choice of side(i tried sweet potato fries),and salad/soup(i tried soup of the day-cream of mushroom,which was really good)! Service was alright and i wish portion were bigger for prices...

6.description: Yep, The Gale Street Inn has an AWESOME neon sign. Making you feel like you might be stepping into the 1960's. And, yes, this same sign indicates that the restaurant has Chicago's finest: Ribs, Steaks and Seafood.At this point, you might be wondering, why would someone, with so much Veggie Love, go into a joint like this??? Well, read on folks, read on...I sat down at the table with some swell, non vegetarian friends. While glancing at the menu, I came across some items that looked splendid.  The Veggie Potato Skins and House Salad, drew me in quickly.Since I wasn't doing any fried foods at the time, The Grilled Vegetable Portabella Sandwich was out.  (Girl can't eat a sandwich without fries...Duh?!)It did look yummy though...With it's roasted peppers, spinach, mozzarella, and chipolte crema on a ciabatta roll. Mhhhmm...Then came the heavy hitters for all you non veg-heads: Da Burgers, Da Surf, Da Turf and Da Ribs.Not quite for me but wait for it...The BEST is en route...Please read on...In super little print, at the bottom of the menu was what I thought, to be my savior for the night:The Sides.  French Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, Au Gratin Potatoes, Twice Baked Potato, Garlic Mashed Potatoes, Grilled Vegetables and Sauteed Spinach. #NomNomNomNomNomI was ALL ready to get a House Salad and Garlic Mashed Potatoes and call it a night and then...THIS happened...#PowPowFirst thing I told the lovely server gal was, "Hey, I know I'm in steak joint but, I am indeed, a Vegetarian."  It was cute because her face got all lit up to tell me about something, not listed on the menu. ...drum roll please...It was one of the BEST pasta dishes, I've ever had!A HUGE bowl of colorful vegetables mixed in with a bit of multi-colored fettuccine noodles.  The vegetables we're fresh and cooked perfectly.  Carrots, Broccoli, Zucchini, Asparagus, and of course, I had to add fresh garlic to it... All in a simple, but tasty, olive oil sauce. Not too heavy, ALL PERFECT!I kinda forgot to mention, one of the BEST House Salads...Since when does a steak joint put Kale anywhere on a menu?!  The Gale Street Inn does!  Spinach and Romaine lettuce, Kale, Cabbage and Carrots...Delish... Add some creamy garlic dressing and voila, perfection.Ps: Don't forget to get the fresh baked bread with some crazy GOOD honey butter-ish stuff.Side Note: Was introduced to the BEST Scotch, I've had. "Highland Park, Dark Origins."#WOW #SMOOTH*Eating Out With A Girl* #EOWAG #EatingOutWithAGirl

22.description: I have been going to Gale Street for over 14 years.  Since my last visit they have remodeled the interior and it looks just lovely....very warm and cozy.   For the most part, their food has always been consistently above average.  The ribs are amazing!  Although I no longer eat pork, I still highly recommend them to my meat loving friends.  The steaks are generally outstanding.  The only time I've ever heard someone complain is when they ordered it "medium", then said that it was "too done".  (I'm sorry...but you should never ever, ever order a steak over medium rare...you will ruin it!  That's on you, not the chef!)  My favorite martini is no longer on the menu, though I'm sure they would probably still make it if I requested it.  The Grecian swordfish is absolutely phenomenal.  I'm not a big fish eater....but this was fantastic!  The calamari was some of the best I've had in a long while.  My friends raved about the gumbo and spicy tomatillo soup.  And what's not to love about that yummy bread and honey butter?My only real complaint is about their stuffed mushrooms.  Since I first started going here, they have changed their stuffed mushrooms at least twice....but nothing compares to how they used to be!  Their new stuffed mushrooms were good (according to my table mates), but I could not eat them because they now have sausage in them.  With drinks and appetizers our dinner worked out to about $50 per person.

15.description: 5 or 6 years ago I would have given this place 5 stars. It has really gone down hill. Sure, they remodeled, but bigger things changed. This was the place to go on the weekends.. Something for everyone. Ribs, Steaks, salads, good sides, good drinks, etc. The removal of the NY strip steak was a game changer. What kind of high end place like this doesn't have a NY strip?? Sure, they add it as a special once in a while, but it really should be a menu staple. They also used to have a south beach mashed cauliflower side. It was excellent. That's gone too. All their creativity is gone. They used to have a really good soup selection, that's gone. They used to have really awesome entree salads, you guessed it, gone. Get there early on the weekend because they run out of food. My group all wanted twice baked potatoes and they only had 1 left.. It was 7pm on a saturday! Yes, they have awesome ribs..but that is really where it ends. But hey, if you are just into ribs, this is the place for you. If not, I'm sorry, but avoid. The service is good, but getting a refill on a glace of wine on the weekend takes a long time. It's just soo hit or miss and the menu is just too limited. So go for the ribs or just don't go at all.

57.description: I was there on a Sunday evening with my friend, it was our first time in the restaurant. We waited ~15 minutes to get a table - glad to be seated so fast!We took a burger and the chicken ribs, they were delicious! The food came fast, it was tasty and very good. We also ordered a baked potato with butter. Good point: they usually bring bread and butter with the main course, I appreciate that.Next time I get there, I want to try the carrot cake, it looked tasty. The people seating next to us had one, but I wasn't hungry enough by the end of the meal to order one.

20.description: Rib Combo+Jambalaya+Tomatillo Soup+ Spinach with Lemon= Incredible. I haven't had such a satisfying meal in a while. The ribs were just perfect. Not too sweet, not too ketchupy, with a hint of smokiness; andddddd they fell off the bone.  I don't usually suck the bone dry, but the flavor was just too good. The tomatillo soup had great flavor and just enough heat, and a great crunch from the tortilla chips.  I've never had fresh lemon with spinach before; clearly I've been missing out Yum! And the jambalaya was packed with shrimp, sausage, and chicken. From the moment I entered the door I was welcomed by several staff members. They were very friendly and it made me feel they were happy to have my business. The atmosphere was warm, the music was    lively, and the bar had some nice choices. I also liked the Belgian glass my Stella was served in. Those little touches really enhanced the whole experience.

36.description: Melt off the one ribs.  Omfg are they good.  True beer selection is really good as well. They have lots of local beers and God craft beers.  The sides are good I love mashed potatoes and they have some tasty ones.  A little bit spends but well worth the money for a neighborhood joint.
