The upside of things... well their service is pretty good and their french fries are pretty spot on. Deep fried, skin on, golden brown strings of potato deliciousness.As like my other reviews, don't take my word for it -- go try it out for yourselves.

11.description: I lived in this area for a very long time and I never tried this place.  I even suggested this place to my cousin when she was visiting from out of town before trying it.  Finally, last week...I did because I was in the area and was craving a gyro!  I don't know where to get a late night gyro out in the burbs and my friend suggested this place...they're open till like 4am.The gyro plate was awesome....and so filling!!! The fries that came with it were great as well!  While we were waiting for our food a guy in there showed us what he ordered...saying the best deal for about 5 bucks - he had fried chicken wings or friend shrimp or something with fries and bread.  If you're craving a gyro at any time of the day or wee morning hours, this is your place!

39.description: Gyro meat was tasty, but the pita was a disaster, strange given that this place has "Kings" and "Gyros" in their business title.  But those french fries were cooked to perfection and the guy behind the counter looked like he built the building 50 years ago and hadn't missed a day of work, ton of character.  I was car shopping in the area but if I roll back through here, I would try again because I have to believe the pitas are normally much better than the one I got with my platter!

37.description: My new obsession here is the polish sausage. Same good service and food.

0.description: Been coming here since I was little and now I go with my own family wife and son. My son loves the fries and the soups and my wife and I are hooked on #4 Chicken sandwich. We usually go here after church or just whenever we feel like. Food is made to order, fresh and hot! nice! Owners know us when we walk in and they always have the welcoming environment.

38.description: Located in Jefferson park, the establishment of kings 2 is the best place for your dining pleasure. The ambience of 80's pop songs, 50's do-op and the occasional bob Marley marathon perfectly matches The heavy Greek accent of the owner taking your order tantalizing your ear buds. The earth shattering orgasm that takes place in your mouth as you taste  the best chocolate shake in town will only compare to the ketchup. The mixture of tomato paste, seasoning and presumably crack rock mix together to create the perfect medley to dip your fresh cut fries.  Over 40 years ago, in 1972 the proprietor of this delicatessen came to America from a small town in Greece to bring his recipe of mouth watering gyros, savory mozzarella Stix and crack infused catsup to bring to joy to every girl and boy in town. Located just blocks away from the local police station, the average law biting citizen comes to enjoy the finer things in life at kings 2. The owners stringy arms are complimented by his big belly, a clear sign that he is as passionate about eating at Kings 2 as I am. The salmon tables and blue swinging chairs are perfect for facilitating your needs as you refrain from blowing your load all over yourself. Surrounding the delicate tables is a lush forest of beautifully crafted floral arrangements. This creates a perfect atmosphere in which to enjoy a little private time with your combo sandwich.  The food will enlarge your penis, cure cancer and make your girlfriend more attractive.

51.description: Awesome place. Awesome food. Awesome staff. F.Y.I. Chris is the owner not George

27.description: Had a cheeseburger with everything and extra onions - really, really done right. Burger seemed slightly over-sized, which was a nice surprise and they actually did add extra onions. (Some places don't know what that means.) Standard Chicago burger joint, large menu, open late. Will try gyro next time with their famous basil sauce.

32.description: If you want a gyro that you can taste for 3 days straight go kings gyros. The fountain drinks are not name brands although they advertise them

54.description: George runs this place like a champ! I have spent all my late night dinners here the last three years. George also gave me a new favorite "Greek Salad with Gyro meet on top" I love it! My girlfriend also loves the grilled chicken dinner. They dont take credit cards but they do have an ATM.

48.description: Lesson learned: Don't judge a book by its cover. The appearance on the outside had never enticed us to want to eat at this restaurant. We were in a rush to head out of town one weekend and we stop by for something quick. To our surprise, they had great fresh cut fries, hot dogs, tasty gyros, chicken kebabs and rice. Price is reasonable and service was friendly. Cash only folks. (sample combos ... a jumbo hot dog and fries - $3.75 or 2 hot dogs, fries and large drink $5.49)

44.description: Close by but not the best. Kinda pricey for what your getting. It's good for late nite eats but other than that its nothing amazing. The place is very faded and the crew there feels very impatient like they don't have time for you.

24.description: Came here on my way home after a comedy show downtown, mainly because I wanted to change up my usual quick McDonalds drive-thru routine for once and figured since I've passed this place enough - why not?! As a lot of reviews mentioned, I decided to go for the gyros dinner, the hand cut fries and a Pepsi. The people at the counter were friendly and the food came out surprisingly quick! The meat wasn't dry, but it wasn't greasy either which is awesome in my book! Fries weren't super crispy, but that's probably because the moisture in the styrofoam container softened them a bit before I got home. I wish you would get more than one pita bread with the gyros dinner but that's about my only gripe - but the cucumber sauce was great. I would definitely come back if the cravings arise....

7.description: This place is gross!! - but I love it! Gyros are hot, moist, and tasty. Cooked to order. I like 'em well done. Fries are over cooked, and could definately be better. Maybe a change in the oil? Service? - what service? Are you kidding me?? - It's Milwaukee Ave. It's 2am. What do you want? Some bleach blond kid, in black tie, named "Christian", or "Skip", serving you at your table??! You don't expect or deserve "service". You get food. And you like it. You'd better, you ungrateful little bastard! They now take plastic. Ask George how he is. Ask how business is. If you want a favourable answer, then come more often you bloody little twerp!

49.description: I was introduced to King's 3 years ago and I'm glad I went there! They not only are friendly but their food is AMAZING!!!!My personal favorites are the Gyro Plate, Chicken Kabob with rice, the 1/2 Grecian Chicken Meal with Rice and the side salad ( the dressing is amazing) and the Baklava to finish things off!  The pizza slices are super yummy, and the onion rings are homemade and I LOVE the BATTER!!! Their hotdogs are also really good, not sure if they use Vienna or Red Hots but they are good!!!They are reasonably priced and always give you lots of food! I'm moving out of the area but will still come here for a cheat meal every now and then. I give this place 5 stars hands down and would recommend anyone I know to come here to eat either there or take it home the food is amazing!!!!

40.description: Stopped in here for 2 hot dogs and cheese fries. It would of been nice if the owner would of told me the hotdogs came with fries!! Instead he charged me for 2 extra cheese fries instead of just adding cheese to the fries that came with the dogs!!! Talk about an extra way to make money. 2 hotdogs and cheese fries cost me almost $15!!  What a rip off and they weren't all that great either!!  All the owner had to do was communicate with me, the customer....imagine that!! Oh well, too late. I won't be going back.  That was really shady!!  I understand no one was in there but you don't have to rip your customers off , he lost a customer!!

53.description: Because of the previous reviews we thought to give this place (10min walk from the house) a try. Sorry to report that our experience was not as the previous reviews.The guy that was behind the counter was rude and tried to rush me to make my order. The spinach pie was very good and a nice size.Gyro meat was very dry. They only give you 1 pita for an entire plate of meat. They are generous on the meat which would be good if it wasn't so dry.French Fries are nothing special. The shrimp dinner was a good portion but again nothing special. If I come back it would only be for the spinach pie :(

30.description: I lived in this area for a very long time and I never tried this place.  I even suggested this place to my cousin when she was visiting from out of town before trying it.  Finally, last week...I did because I was in the area and was craving a gyro!  I don't know where to get a late night gyro out in the burbs and my friend suggested this place...they're open till like 4am.The gyro plate was awesome....and so filling!!! The fries that came with it were great as well!  While we were waiting for our food a guy in there showed us what he ordered...saying the best deal for about 5 bucks - he had fried chicken wings or friend shrimp or something with fries and bread.  If you're craving a gyro at any time of the day or wee morning hours, this is your place!

46.description: Kings Gyros Nr 2 french fries are made out of from fresh cut potatoes (skins on) and lightly salted. They use tons of styrofoam trays and cups instead of biodegradable or recyclable containers for take outs though which is bad.

1.description: We are new to the area. We decided to give this place a try. Let's first start with the parking lot, be careful with the potholes when you first enter, they will mess up your tires. 2nd, as my boyfriend and I looked over the menu, the guy was kind of rushing us and I had to speak up and say, "WAIT BOSS!" 3rd, their "display case" of 4 plates displaying their food....SUPER unappetizing! Dry-looking day old food, fruit flies all over the tomatoes...this is not a good display that makes people interested. 4th, their menu and signs kept mentioning these 'award winning, in-house' made onions rings....OMG! The worst onion rings ever! They were bland and flavorless and they're onions. The batter that covered them tasted old and looked horrible. I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt but they were HORRIBLE. Waste of money. We threw them all away. Now, going back to when we placed our order, I understand why they tasted so horrible. While waiting for our order, in their little fridge near the front, there was a gray bin hanging half way out of the fridge with the door open and it was a bin FULL of pre-coated and frozen looking onion rings. Where is the freshness that their menu talks about! Not to mention the onion ring on the floor along with the cucumber pieces. 5th, Just do not take a look around while waiting for your food. All the nooks and crannies are filled with dust, grease and are a mess. I'm not one to complain but while reading all the reviews for this place, I just had to let the truth be known. The 1 star is for the good cheeseburger and fries.

55.description: I use to frequent this place all the time, they are letting it go to shit and the guys behind the counter clearly dont give a f***, wont get my business again

9.description: Large selection of food. Very tasty. Great because it's 24/7  and there's something for everyone.The DO take credit/debit cards.

26.description: As far as fast food goes, they nail it every time. Service is friendly, and the food is cooked and topped to perfection. Usually get hot dog (comes with a ton of fries!) or a cheeseburger. Haven't found another place that does it as well as Kings #2! Oh , and great place for late night hunger cravings!

25.description: Prices are good,  food is ok except their pizza.  Pizza is never fresh,  they reheat it in the oven after you order.   Good cheese sticks.  Not the cleanest place.  Need a good remodel.   Staff is always friendly.

12.description: Wasn't too happy the last couple of times I got the kabob dinner, Not much meat. The chicken was way better then the steak. Steak was very hard and not much flavor.

59.description: This place is a classic. Have gone there for over 15 years now. The gyros is the best gyros around hands down. The meat is not greasy, like many other places. The pita bread is always fresh and includes great cucumber sauce. The fries are also different, but very good. The owners are always friendly and service is great. They are opened very late which is nice when you are looking to get some good food late. Will continue to go there for years to come!

21.description: Eh...I've had better. Not to entirely knock their food, but seriously...I've had better fast food in my life (and I'm not talking McDonald's). I once ordered a gyros plate from Kings and it definitely was not up to par with the flavors. Almost felt as if I had to throw up afterwards. Not cool man. The upside of things... well their service is pretty good and their french fries are pretty spot on. Deep fried, skin on, golden brown strings of potato deliciousness.As like my other reviews, don't take my word for it -- go try it out for yourselves.

17.description: The gyros isn't all bad but the customer service really is pretty abysmal which is why I stopped going.The main guy on the register usually there once gave me a nickel instead of the 4 cents change I was due and made a racist comment casually saying "I'm Greek not Jewish". I've had to remind him more than once to give me the milkshake or soft drink I ordered/paid for . Besides him the place isn't all bad if you're out late and hungry.

10.description: Dear King Gyros,Will you marry me?Love, MeGee, I hope he says yes!  This place is a great spot for some deep fried awesomeness.  The quality of the burgers are way above what you'd think they would be judging by the look of the place.  Fries, why fresh cut of course!  Be sure to get a side of cheese for those fries.  My hubby always gets the Chicken Pita and swears by it.  And the shakes!  Oh, the shakes!  If you ask him how they make them, he'll tell you "the right way".  And really, that's all the needs to be said, isn't it?

5.description: This place is getting 1 star due to the customer service. I came into the restaurant very late at night with a friend. The place had a couple hours to go before closing. My friend went to the bathroom before ordering, and nobody behind the counter offered to take my order, they just stared at me.When the order was finally ready to be placed, my friend asked if they had grape soda, and what kind it was. The guy said it's like Kool-Aid. Kool-Aid? Why did he have to say Kool-Aid out of all things? Hmm...we didn't like that, and I didn't like the vibe that seemed to be coming our way from the employees. I'm not going to say what I think was going on, but the vibe was not friendly at all...Kool-Aid indeed!One guy in particular stared the entire time we were in there, even while we were eating. It was very uncomfortable, it felt like they didn't want us in there. The one guy even asked if we wanted our order to go when we were placing it.

3.description: I will admit that one good thing about this place are the prices. We tried the bacon cheese burger, bbq ribs, gyro, italian beef, and onion rings but unfortunately we've had better elsewhere! Service was ok though!

35.description: This place is amazing!!! I get food from here all the time! I even have catering orders sent weekly to my work!!! Everyone loves everything! The Greek chicken is the best! U must try it!

19.description: They are not cash only anymore!!! They are accepting all major credit cards and American Express.   Their food is excellent especially the new dishes like the gyros quesadilla and the breakfast wraps amazing.   The place is unique that it's not remodeled but they keep it clean. Also need to try homemade Onion Rings they are the best I've had,  I like it with the homemade sweet basil sauce. Great place!!!!

28.description: I was pleasantly surprised by the prices and tastiness of the food. The staff was also extremely friendly. I had the half chicken Greek style and it was very tasty. One thing I didn't like was that they serve the food on very flimsy paper plates and supply you with those super flimsy and super cheap forks. I can't stand eating with those and made my meal uncomfortable. Otherwise. I will definitely be returning.

45.description: I've been meaning to review this place forever. I live a couple blocks from here and have given this restaurant MANY tries, but it is absolute garbage. The ONLY thing I have found that is consistently good is the gyros, which is good as it is what this restaurant is named after, but don't even bother with anything else.You can simply tell how completely NOT fresh all of the food is if you wait longer than 20 minutes to eat it. Anything with grease falls apart and everything else gets hard. Do NOT touch the mozzarella sticks, they are some of the worst I've ever had. Hard as rocks with no flavor. Everything from the fries to the chicken sandwiches... it's all disgusting.Jefferson Park desperately needs a high-quality burger joint and this isn't it.

33.description: I went there the other day after forgetting my food for lunch at work so I was crazy hungry and I ate the Gyros w/sweet basil sauce, hit the spot bigtime! This place is open late and if your coming from the bar or late night out with friends or a date this was excellent food on the cheap...just bring cash : )

43.description: Hot dogs and burgers are good and I love their gyros. The fries are obviously freshly cut. I haven't had anything else from here.Cash only!

2.description: Kings No 2 Gyros gets an extra star just for being open in New Years Day & preventing me from starving in this urban jungle known as Chicago.  Their gyros are awesome.  The meat flavor cut off the spit and grilled is served with onions, tomatoes & tzatziki sauce on pita bread.  They use real meat not the BS packaged garbage that some places try to pass off as gyro meat.  They provide a generous amount of meat that is deliciousThey have very good quick service.  I came in ordered and 3 mins later I had my gyro.  That being said their gyros are delicious, but the place is not very clean.  The tables need to be wiped up occasionally so they lose a star.  Dirty tables are kind of a turn off.

18.description: Gyros plate, hand-cut fries, basil sauce. NapStay away from beefs and pizza.

41.description: Great place for lunch.  Delicious food, I have eaten here many times and never have been disappointed. Try the panzeronni, gyros and Italian beef. The owners are great. They know their neighborhood and more importantly their customers. I travel from New York to Chicago every 3-4 months. The owners remember and always show that they appreciate the business.  This place is a gem and surely a dying breed of restaurants in the USA. Visit these types of places before they're  gone.

52.description: I've driven by a thousand times and never tried it.  Tonight we were on our way home and needed dinner fast so we stopped in.  The guy working the counter was plenty friendly and we had a good experience ordering.  I had a gyros and it was kick ass.  I like how the tzatziki comes on the side without even having to ask.  The meat was good, not dry at all.  The pita was fresh and soft. I also got an order of cheese fries which were huge and of the fresh cut variety.  My dude went with a Greek burger and he said it wasn't good at all, very dry.  But, I'm basing my review off of my meal which was awesome.  Don't get the Greek burger, definitely try a gyros.  *Cash only!*

50.description: Love the Gyro Platter and the Italian Beef!  Open very late which makes for epic after bar snacking!  I always buy one of each sandwich...leaves me one for when I wake up in the AM!  I can't comment on any of the other food, but can't go wrong on these two items.

4.description: Jumpin' junipers! Their food has been updated and to my surprise, they make hand cut fries now!  The food however is still, merely, decent.  Although, tastier and far more presentable than in 2006 when I would hit Kings on a more often basis.  It would seem they have adopted some new ways to food preparation.  But looking at the basics like cleanliness of the surrounding area or food display bins, it's not too appetizing.  Regarding the storage bins; specifically the pizza spinners and the baklava whether inside or outside of them, they didn't look all too appealing.  The pizza looked tired and weathered like an old beaten rug and the baklava, well, lets just say they need to be prepared by someone caring.I've been eating around at other char-type, Greek, fast-food-grills wondering when they might update their archaic ways and get with the trend of offering hand-cut fries.  (A quick and easy method to offering a finer, more excellent french fry.  People, we're talking about real potatoes versus frozen tundra, God-only-knows-how-long-this-crap-had-been-in-the-freezer)  I was thrilled to learn that of ALL places, Kings is on top of it.  Good job.It was kind of a late night and I really wanted tacos or burritos but my local go-to was closed.  I was the last customer to enter Kings and based on recent reviews and photos, I decided to just go for it.  Their employees looked like zombies, I think it was the end of their shift and everyone was working on leaving, but they took my order and filled it pretty, damn, quickly.  Gyros, jumbo hot dog and an order of large fries.  The fries were pretty good as they were piping hot.  A couple burps into the gyros and I had already had, a decent fill.  Decent though nothing special but it got my dinner hunger satiated.  For that order I paid somewhere around $12 dollars and some change with tax.  Not a bad haul for the money spent.  Food was served quick but that good ol' greeting they once offered was lacking.  No personality, no smile, just food.

6.description: Very sad day. They got a new cook and he sucks.Double downer when a to go order is wrong and you get home hungry -and then hungry and pissed. I just ordered the same "Greek burger" and fries that I order at least once a week only this time it was wretched. My first indicator was the first fry from the bag. Gone is the crunchy outer coating and soft scalding inside. It was replaced with a floppy fry.  A non crunchy fry that didn't belong.  My suspicions were confirmed when I took my first bite. My normally mouthwatering feta/oregano beefy goodness was not there. I was sent home with a dry charred piece of brown that had been sprinkled with oregano, made soggy by tomatoes that didn't belong and soft wet lettuce. How do you call this Greek? I called back and after a muffled phone receiver covered conversation with the new cook - I was told to come in and pick up a "side of feta" for my burger.  That offer is beyond insulting considering I (embarrassingly) eat here 2-3 times a week. George -  I hope you read this because I shouldn't have to remind you how often I enter your establishment. You were really rude on the phone and I'm mad at you.

22.description: I can only comment on what I buy. And that is the Gyros sandwich! It's very good. This is the only Gyros restaurant that has a choice of sauces. Sweet basil sauce or cucumber garlic. Both complement the sandwich well. While they do have a variety of other selections ranging from pizza to Greek chicken and all in between, I've never felt compelled to have anything else but a Gyros. It does look a bit divey and there may be a dirty table or three when you walk in. But don't let that stop you from trying a Gyros. Try something different. Try it with the cucumber garlic sauce. Friendly fast service.

15.description: AWESOME ITALIAN BEEF!!! I stopped here on a late night detour and picked up an "extra good" Italian beef dipped w/extra hot peppers, some hand cut fries and a side of the super tasty onion rings (i think they're beer battered) and all I can say is I literally wanted to go back for more when I was done....like I already had my shoes on to go back when I realized they would probably think I was crazy so I left it for another day instead lol. The price was very decent considering the size in portions that they serve and the entire staff was very polite and tastefully chatty, like not your typical "how's the weather" kind of chatty. All in all an "extra good" experience with these guys and I WILL COME BACK FOR MORE!! I might just pick up two beefs this time haha thanks guys you really helped hit the spot ;-)

57.description: This place has solid gyros, so I don' t know why it's called King's No 2 Gyros instead of No 1, but whatever. I came in her recently and ordered food to go. I got a gyros plate and split a piece of pepperoni pizza with my husband. The gyros were really good. The cucumber sauce that came with the gyros plate was good. The pepperoni pizza was surprisingly decent. It kind of reminded me of the pizza they used to serve in our gymnasium-converted lunchroom during grade school, but in a good way. I think next time I would order just regular cheese pizza, since it looked like they just added the pepperoni on top of the pizza after it had already been cooked. Anyway, it was good food, and I'd definitely go back there.

20.description: They are not cash only anymore!!! They are accepting all major credit cards and American Express.   Their food is excellent especially the new dishes like the gyros quesadilla and the breakfast wraps amazing.   The place is unique that it's not remodeled but they keep it clean. Also need to try homemade Onion Rings they are the best I've had,  I like it with the homemade sweet basil sauce. Great place!!!!

36.description: Please, please, PLEASE do not go here. If we stop maybe they will actually stay serving edible food... nothing is good. Even staples like burgers and dogs are bad; actually bad.... wings gross. Rib tips disgusting. Why do we support such bad food. Come on people of Jeff Park, we deserve so much better!

14.description: Gyros plate is great, substitute the fries for salad very tasty! Tried a lot of gyro around town this is the best one.

3.description: I will never come here again.. Made an appointment for 630 and waited over an hour!! This is completely ridiculous. They overbook and can't get to their clients in time. People have things to do rather then sit in a doctors office

1.description: Dr Beata was awesome! Great service~ right to the point. Awesome results. If you are looking for Botox or filler at a super price and done expertly, come on in. Very impressed!

2.description: I had a scalp issue for a while now, and 4 months later after about 4 visits or so to Dr. Danek its fully resolved.   I was very happy with her approach and her communication and explanation of what was going on was excellent.  I have seen a few doctors to fix this issue and she nailed it on the first try.  I was also VERY pleased with the fact that she listened to me and let me ask questions about what I have read on the net or what I should or should not be doing.  Really was happy about that.  here have been a few doctors that seem to just brush off what you are asking or talking about but she really listened and was able to put my mind at ease.  Was very happy and will be going to her again and again for future needs.

5.description: A great doctor, she is a great listener and really cares about her patients. I've been looking for a long time to find a doctor like this. The only draw-back is the wait times can be a little long but she's worth it.

6.description: Not just for skin care...Dr. Danek's office is the best around.  I had been searching for a doctor to listen to me about how my body was feeling.  I found it with Dr. Danek's office.  They took the time to hear what I was saying.  This office is a true family practice; from birth to death and everything in-between.  I can get in on a moments notice. Everyone is friendly.  Best medical experience in a very long time.

7.description: I am not gay but I  LUV  This woman!!!  after using my health insurance with another DR that I've written a review on yelp about, I decided that I really needed to find a primary DR who understands me/ my body and my health concerns.. ohh and ACTUALLY CARES! ... I made a visit to an office to  lose a few lbs (I think after 35 your metabolism just begins to run South forever ) ... I was going to get beauty creams from my dermatologist and going to another place for something else. All of these DR's.. ugh!!! I took my prescriptions to Dr. Beata and was I impressed how thorough she is. She really cares  .and also made suggestions .. She gave me a blood test to check my hormones and also wanted to try a few things to help my body on it's way to looking GLAM...  I got 2 shots that I've needed after my 10 yr was just about up. and I will be returning in 5 weeks to a hopefully improved body inside and out.. Although her office isn't in my neighborhood.. she is soo good that I wouldn't mind driving an hour for her care .. she is THAT GOOD.. For all of you ladies.. she does beauty treatments as well (botox etc) .. YES she has a Beauty side and a Health Side.. she's FABULOUS!

8.description: Terrific family doctor. She's very thorough, honest, and friendly. Getting an appointment isn't a problem. You will be pleased with the friendly service you get here

0.description: I came to see Dr. Danek at New You Cosmetic Medicine Chicago as I was interested in a dermal filler for filling in the marionette and laugh lines to my face. I found Dr. Danek through Care Credit's website, although I do not have care credit.  I was able to make an appointment to see the doctor quite soon, which i liked. I had another appointment scheduled with Lakeview Dermatology which I cancelled because Dr. Danek's office offered dermal fillers at a better price. They also had a special going on, buy one facial filler get the 2nd half off. The wait was not very long, as other have complained, as  I do expect a wait when going to see a doctor.  When meeting her I felt comfortable and relived, she informed of all the options I had and we choose the best one for my needs.  She was very warm, kind, and friendly, and addressed all of my concerns.  The procedure itself did not take long  maybe 15 minutes, and I was pleasantly satisfied with the results. Plus I was able to take advantage of the "buy one get one half off" special" for the dermal fillers!  Their office is also on the cutting edge of the latest technology for anti aging treatment, I will be returning in a few weeks for a check up and to possibly go for some new treatments  they are offering. One is called a vampire face lift where they use your own stem cells to produce collagen cells, this is the same type of cells that can be made into anything and is on the cutting edge of science and medicine and works for cancer patients. Now stem cell research can be used for cosmetic medicine. I am thoroughly impressed with the latest technology of dermal fillers. And this is coming from the daughter of Gastroenterologist, and I am studying to get into  pharmacy sales myself.  Definitely go to Dr. Danek for cosmetic treatments, you won't regret it and I give her 5 stars and look forward to seeing her for future treatments as needed. Thank you Dr. Danek!

4.description: N/G. I was hopeful & excited about this doctor after reading good reviews here. I was still hopeful and excited after waiting 25 minutes just to give a medical history to a  ESL staffer who seemed to not understand 90% of what I said.I then sat and waited almost 2 hours in an exam room - still hopeful and excited - listening to multiple patients being taking care of in other rooms. Not just double booked - this place was quadruple booked. Never a good sign.When the doctor finally came in, she was rushed, rude & talked over top of me while supposedly (again) taking my medical history. She was dismissive, patronizing and nasty about anything I said regarding my health history, family history - questioned everything in the most degrading way - my condition, even the way my father died - as if I were lying? It was positively bizarre,When I suggested that maybe we were having a communication problem she decided that I was 'insulting' her - and I honestly was not - she did speak English fairly well, but it seemed like perhaps she couldn't understand what I was saying as she was attacking & misinterpreting every single answer I gave.  Tho honestly - I am not sure how she could really hear anything I was saying as she was typing away, looking at her computer screen - and was very hurried, annoyed, busy, talking over me - steamrolling over everything I was saying - and then scoffing at everything I said. It was exhausting, frustrating & frightening - She had me in tears, shaking and almost in crisis right there in the exam room after her "doctoring".. which frankly wouldn't have passed muster in a prison camp! and the exam? Aside from yelling at me and arguing with me -- she poked at my ears, my mouth, pushed my arms down, and felt my stomach, I've had more of an exam from my hairdresser. Offered me flu shots, a mammogram and anti-depressants?? I mean - hey fine - but I can get ALL of that stuff at those Walgreens clinics.I thought I was visiting an actual doctor?I am sure she felt I 'wasn't a good patient' - because I questioned some of the absolutely bizarre things she was saying regarding my conditions - but I have no desire to have "SHE WAS A GOOD PATIENT" engraved on my headstone after some clued out rushed doctor kills me with incorrect treatment! As a patient and as a paying customer, one that has just wasted many many hours out of my own working day to be there,  losing a days pay - to see a DOCTOR for HELP - I absolutely have the right to ask questions about medical treatment options I am being given. And especially when what I am hearing a) makes no sense b) could endanger my life.In my opinion this is simply =not= a good doctor, maybe at one point she was - but now? It is VERY apparent she is just trying to get you the heck OUT of her office if you have any real problems - especially if you are EEEk an HMO patient - she just wants to refer away (is she getting kickbacks?) and focus on her more profitable cosmetic surgery stuff - and here's the rub - she's doling out Botox?? And doesn't know what Myasthenia Gravis is??? Be afraid. Overbooked, rude, unprofessional, and terrible communicator - listed as a family practice doctor but primarily is selling plastic surgery and botox out of a dingy office -  is obviously only taking in and triple booking HMO family practice patients to try and make a buck from the volume  - is NOT interested in actually 'caring' for someone beyond getting them in & out.Cannot recommend.  life is too precious.There are plenty of great doctors in the Chicago area, this is NOT one of them.

3.description: Ditto on the grumpy older lady.  I don't know her name, but she is short and always seems like everything and everyone is bothering her.  I am bothered by the fact that she does seem to act very cordial to others if they are of the same, let's put it, "cultural background" as her.  The rest of the people here are very kind.  Decent selection although sometimes items aren't re-stocked for weeks or even months.  The parking lot has probably never been full in the entire history of CVS/Osco, and it seems more fitting to host a carnival.  Watch out for crazy drivers taking advantage of its expansiveness.  Better yet, go to the CVS across the intersection, it's better.

1.description: What a shame. The cashier was so nice and helpful.The pharmacy!!!!!!!!  ARGH!I usually go to CVS 6417 on Higgins.  For some reason the car drove into this lot.The pharmacist was so stressed.Perhaps it is too much for 1 pharmacist.  Don't take it out on me.  We had just come from the surgeon's office.  I was tired, worn out and too warm...Even the other employee said that she did not want to go to the office as it would be hotter in the office.  We waited a long time for my prescription. The pharmacist was rude and condescending. I needed more than just a prescription filled.  He asked me for my birthdate at least 5 times.  It seemed he did not want to be bothered with the other things I needed that were locked up.   I had to explain numerous times. In the end I did not end up getting what I wanted.I had to bite my tongue or who knows what might have spewed out.Yes, I will still go to CVS.  It will be the 24H pharmacy a block away at 6417 W. Higgins!

2.description: I've used this pharmacy for daily essentials and supplies needed for church. It's quite convenient being right across the street. We run over here to get anything that we may need for church such as utensils, teaching supplies and so much more. We love this store!

5.description: The pharmacy staff at this location is so helpful that I have to say that they took my horrible day and turned it into a good day. The staff at the pharmacy is awesome! They are beyond helpful. Thank you for going above and beyond to help out someone you have never seen before, more places need people like this staff has.

0.description: Open 24 hours it's a huge advantage price is not too high but what's cheap nowadays I will definitely recommend them

4.description: One of the worst CVS I have ever went to. The employee at the register was a grumpy lady. Ms. Su**** I asked if she would grant a coupon the was expired where most cvs do she refused to grant it I ask or a manager and she told me that she is walking around somewhere  go find her . She told me to go to the other cvs then if they grant them over there really?? If im making a $30+ transaction you can't grant a 1.50 EB?  Worst experience ever.

58.description: I really like this little place.  It's the perfect place to go when you're in the mood for a diner breakfast.  It's soooo gooood.  The ladies that work there are so nice.  It's tiny inside, but I haven't had to wait for a seat yet.  During our last visit, we sat at the counter.  I think the last time I did that I must've been a little girl with my mom at Woolworth.  Heads up:  This place is Cash Only!  So be prepared before feasting on a delectably greasy yummy breakfast.

56.description: We wanted a diner... and THIS is the diner experience! :) I feel like neither the restaurant nor the clientele have changed, and they don't need to. Friendly, quick service, great food, traditional diner menu, easy parking on the street. A few of the regular started chatting with us at the counter where we sat, and my corned beef hash was perfect. Lots of food, good prices. :)

29.description: You always want a go to spot in the neighborhood for that home made food feel. This diner has it. It's a small gem wi y big heart. The staff is friendly and the regulars will joke wo tug you too!I've only been here for breakfast, everythi by is your regulate breakfast food, but the corn beef hash is their specialty! Love the prices on the specials too!Just remember to bring cash! Hence my 4 stars..no credit at this place. Check it out.

42.description: if you live within a mile or two this place is a life saver, cheap average diner food. emphasis on average. super affordable and palatable, which is good enough for me, but if you dont live nearby its probably not worth the bother as you'll manage to pass 5 similar places on the way here and if youre looking for somewhere to take a bunch of people this place is kind of small.

23.description: CASH ONLY. You don't have to eat at a 5-star Michelin awarded restaurant to receive 5-star customer service and high quality, fresh food. The Yellow Rose is known for their made-from-scratch corned beef hash. Crap, that's a mouthful -- isn't it!  If you try nothing else here this is a must try. You would be an idiot to NOT try the CBH. We enjoyed it very much. It was not overly salty which we also appreciated. Melt-in-your mouth tender morsels, seasoned with tiny specks of onions and green peppers. Flavorful perfection! If you order something that doesn't bring this item you can order a "side" dish of the CBH for only $3.25 (plenty for two people to share). We tried their stuffed French Toast with fresh strawberries and cream cheese. The amalgamation of the sweet and savory was awesomeness. We shared this dish and thought it was definitely 4-star worthy. For $8 and change one of my other friends ordered the 3-3-3 (three large eggs cooked any style, your choice of three bacon strips or sausage -- your choice of three pancakes or hash brown. In addition, it came with your choice of toast. They don't charge you extra for the toast.  My other friend ordered the 2-2-2 (2 eggs any style, hashed brown, your choice of toast and CBH). This place has been compared to the show "Cheers" because.....it is very friendly and "everybody knows your name." They provided great philoxenia making you feel at home as soon as you walk in the door. It is polyphloisboisterous with chattering of conversation, clanking coffee mugs and silverware. You hear greetings of  "Good Morning" or "Hi, how are you today" or a simple smile. We perused the menu and noticed that this is a place where the "regulars" come and are known by name. BTW, if you are a Vegetarian you will definitely find something on the menu (my friend is a Vegetarian and she said she was "surprised" how many items they have listed on the menu). We saw this restaurant reviewed on an evening "foodie" show (with Brittany Payton). We've lived in Chicago for decades, but had never heard of this joint before. The restaurant itself is a throw-back to the mid-1970's with tacky decor of a dark burgundy faux plastic brick back splash where the cooking takes place to the Formica counter top at the bar and rusty brownish-red faux leather swivel stools. It is definitely very dated. It's not really a "Dive" diner, but some may refer to it as a "hole in the wall." In fact, I am a preterist, so I absolutely loved this about the restaurant. It is very compact. The service is exceptional and somewhat effusive. The restaurant is on the west side of Elston Ave.  We left fully satisfied, and our check was under $20 (excluding tip).  Take your check and walk up to the register and pay. Remember the theme song from "CHEERS"?? Well, they knew our names by the time we left here....."Sometimes you want to go where everybody knows your nameAnd they're always glad you cameYou wanna be where you can see our troubles are all the sameYou wanna be where everybody knows your nameBe glad, there's one place in the worldWhere everybody knows your name and they're always glad you cameYou want to go where people know, people are all the sameYou want to go where everybody knows your name" Yeah, this song pretty much sums up what the Yellow Rose is all about. My 4-star rating is due to the fact that this joint is CASH ONLY and their parking lot is the size of a postage stamp! We would return again if we are ever in this area. The Owners have warm hearts who truly care for their customers. They use quality ingredients (fresh, not frozen) and serve up delectable food. Request their home-made jam or jelly for your toast. Skip the prepackaged Smucker's jelly. They treat every customer with R-E-S-P-E-C-T which was evident from the moment we entered to the moment we paid and left. Service alone receives 5-stars!

47.description: CASH ONLY! Good eggs...no kids menu :-(

8.description: I dined Saturday at 12pm. This small diner is a genuine local chicago original.  It has 3 tables 5 booths and a long lunch counter full of regulars.As far as ambiance, this is exactly what I am looking for.  The staff seemed as authentic as the decor.  They were fast and polite and somewhat engaging, though they defiantly kept up conversations with the regulars.The coffee was fresh and hot.  The setup was nice with the full suger salt pepper and even a full old school creamer container.  I was disappointed when I drank the creamer, which was non dairy stuff.I order the biscuits and gravy with eggs over easy, which is my bell weather.  The biscuits were good.  The gravy was pleantiful but not verry good. The eggs were cooked right and pretty good.  I also had a side of sausage Pattis which came out as 3 pre made patties.  They were ok.  Overall I will try this place again.  Maybe get a special instead.  It looks awesome and was full of regulars but I would not get the bng.

31.description: Love this place. Was first taken here a few years ago and enjoy going occasionally.  It's a small family run business. The husband is one of the cooks and the wife is greeter.  The waitress has been there forever and they treat you like family after you go a few times.  The food is fresh and good.  It's a small place with a small lot or you can park on Elston.  It's worth stopping in as you feel like you're back in some small town diner.

34.description: Having lived in the area for at least 8 years, and never stopping by Yellow Rose was a mistake. I always order the Corn Beef Hash with Eggs or the Irish Skillet. Both are prepared with real corned beef and are so so delicious. During the summer and autumn they give you little bowls of watermelon and it is great to munch on while waiting for food. The staff is so sweet and kind and basically know everybody there. If you live in the neighborhood and aren't coming here, you are definitely missing out on some quality food for a decent price.

16.description: My only problem with Yellow Rose is that they dont always have a seat ready for me. Keep up the great breakfast.

13.description: One of the great diners of a generation long gone. I love going to places where it's clear that most of the customers are regulars, and yet the waitresses are still kind and friendly!! Even better- the food is great! I wish this diner wasn't so far away...

11.description: Today I tried the YRC and the food and service was great...... the only thing that fell short was the grits. I order an omelette with sausage, cheese, and onion well made. Hash browns were crispy. The only thing that disappointed me was the grits.... I love smooth creamy grits, they were lumpy and chunky. Added butter, salt, pepper and just decided to give up.

39.description: I really hate the expression "hidden gem", but that absolutely applies to the Yellow Rose Cafe. The breakfast here is fantastic.  The daily special- 2 eggs, hash browns, toast, 2 sausage and coffee for less than $6? Shut the front door.  And their hash browns are awesome. Wait staff is so extremely nice and friendly.  My husband also loves their biscuits and gravy and the pancakes are good, too. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because I haven't tried their lunch menu. It's cash only so be prepared,  but you will be stuffed with goodness for less than $10.

37.description: This place is a hidden gem. If you're in the area stop by for excellent breakfast or lunch with good portions. The waitstaff is attentive, nice and I have never been without a refill. I am a huge fan of this place I just wish they were open late!

0.description: This place is a gem.  Top notch service, terrific food, and ridiculously cheap (seriously, charge more!!!).  Don't miss out on the homemade hot sauce and jams.  I would by them by the bottle if it was available!The corned beef hash is solid.

38.description: Bring cash! Nice little cozy breakfast place. Few tables available and parking lot is always full. Food was good, everything was cooked well and fresh.

51.description: There is a reason why this place is always packed!  Everything is fresh and you can tell.  It is a great family owned restaurant.  The staff is super friendly.  My husband and I go at least twice a month.  My 5 year old daughter loves Yellow Rose.  Everything is reasonably priced.  They post their specials on their Facebook Page.  Their Eggs Benedict is by far the best!  They do not have it all the time, so when they do I make sure to go.

27.description: Not fancy at all, but the perfect diner and everything I had was made exactly as I'd hoped. Over medium, no runny white eggs? Check. Biscuits and gravy...good flavor...some crunch to the biscuits. Bacon. Crispy. The homemade hot sauce looks the color of Mustard, has great flavor and will kick your a$$ I think, if not prepared. Highly recommend.

32.description: Four of five on the greasy spoon diner scale. This is where you stop to get your standard Midwest breakfast. I've been to better, but this place ia relatively cheap and its close. Ely's (just down the street) blows this place out of the water as far as quantity and quality, out it's about $5 more per person. This place beats any chain breakfast restaurant and the Golden Apple etc.Wouldn't drive across town to go here but I'm happy it's down the street!

54.description: great breakfast place!  their corned beef hash is well made and home made.  their staff is very friendly and so considerate. i look forward to returning and becoming a regular.

48.description: its like a "cheers" type of ambiance where everybody knows your name. I always order their corned beef hash. bring cash and ask for roulas special homemade jam! They will bring some out if you ask. And if you love hot sauce ask to try their homemade hot sauce too! Its a Jefferson Park secret place for breakfast. Simple mom and pop place making awesome dishes for years!

44.description: What's in a name, that which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet. Not in this case Shakespeare! Yellow Rose Cafe is not your average diner or rose. The Rose here is Yellow. Does your diner make homemade hot sauce, homemade strawberry jam or homemade corned beef? No? Exactly! Yellow Rose is located on a busy stretch of north Elston Avenue tucked between two large buildings. Don't blink, you might miss it! But if you do miss it you'll miss out on awesome corned beef, did I mentioned it was homemade, great and creative skillets, pillowy pancakes, crispy hashbrowns  and piping hot coffee!All the great diner classics and more done right!The waitresses here are great too. Friendly, sweet and they keep your coffee cup full! The cooks here are awesome and will even chat to you while they cook up your food. So many great things that make Yellow Rose a diamond in the rough.If you are hungry for diner food and you want it done right head over to the Yellow Rose! Try their homemade hot sauce, homemade strawberry jam or homemade corned beef. You'll love them. And try the rest of the classics and absorb the classic diner ambiance the Yellow Rose brings.

24.description: I don't normally write too many reviews anymore (there's way too many people doing them for me) but I felt compelled, no obligated to do one for the Yellow Rose. The moment I walked in, I felt like a genuine sense of hospitality rarely seen in restaurants today. It was like going back to some better, nostalgic time when people were kind to one another.It was super refreshing to feel that way. Oh, the corn-beef hash was amazing but it almost played second fiddle to the warmth from the fine people at the café.5 stars.

7.description: Clean, cute little old school diner full of neighborhood regulars.  Service is fast and friendly, and the home made corned beef hash is unbelievably delicious!  Can't wait to go back and try other menu items as well!

49.description: Avoid this Dump!The pancakes were burnt, and the rest of the breakfast was a standard helping of hashbrowns, bacon, and toast.Waitress forgot  my order of orange juice and never bothered to ask me if I needed anything.I understand why they close early in the day,they have spent enough time poisoning people.They have regulars--obviously, these people don't mind lousy food and lousy service.There are better diners in Chicago that offer good food and service--go and patronize these diners not this one.

40.description: Want an absolutely charming place. My first morning in my new apartment was quite chilly. The gas company screwed up and didn't switch the account so I had spent the night buried under blankets. On waking up at 6am and realizing the technician wasn't going to be around until after 8am, I decided on breakfast. I found this place on The Yelps and decided to give it a shot. I am so happy I did. I wandered in to an almost empty cafe. There was a waitress and one other diner (a regular) so I plopped myself down at the counter and got aquainted. What a wonderfully friendly and charming bunch. I hate to admit that I've forgotten the waitresses name, but she was just as sweet as can be. And the other diner was a hoot as well. After ordering the Chicago breakfast (lots of sides of meat) we all settled in for a wonderful chat. Then another woman wanders in and is friends with the waitress. She joins us at the counter and joins us in our banter. Then the food arrived. Holy Jebus in Heaven. Fantastic. Fresh preserves for the toast!?! Homemade turkey sausage - and if they hadn't told me it was turkey I would have no idea!?! All washed down with the finest diner coffee a gal could hope for. I will definitely be stopping back in to try more tasty treats - oh, and some good conversation.

53.description: Updated:This was sent to me by a yellow rose patron. Appears that bad food leads to hostility and poor grammar. "John G. has sent you a message on Yelp:Yellow Rose "If I catch you talking shit about yellow rose again I will shit on your front doorstep. stop on hatin' beotch""Real classy. Just like the crappy restaurant.Original review:Diner food Burnt eggs Cash onlyProbably a decent local spot, but not with making an effort to get there.Nuff said.

30.description: Pretty good food.  Small place with the real diner feel including the counter with stools for solo diners.  Cash only.

46.description: My husband and I came here for breakfast.  We were served a nice cup of coffee which was a very good roast and soothing.  I had the two eggs special with bacon and rye toast - a very simple dish with nicely toasted rye toast with butter; my husband had the corned beef hash with scrambled egg and hash browns.  The corned beef hash was actually chunks of corned beef and onions; I think he was slightly disappointed as it wasn't the typical diner corned beef hash, but it was still okay. We also had a waffle topped with strawberries and whipped cream to share and that was pretty solid as well.  Great friendly service and a very cute old-school type of a cafe.  I'm glad I was able to check them out!+solid coffee+friendly staff & service+plenty of street parking

1.description: I have found my oasis in the middle of urban living. Yellow Rose Cafe is my new home away from home. I grew up on this kind of food for breakfast, and it's not often you find a place that serves it up the way mom used to make it. There's bottomless coffee and large portions of food. The staff is so sweet and I felt like they adopted me from the moment I walked in the door. If you're bored with your smart phone, while you wait for your order there are a couple of newspapers they keep on hand for diners to skim through. It doesn't get any better than that.I had skirt steak and eggs for breakfast. I like my eggs over easy and my meat pink in the center. That's exactly what I got. Just to show my love, I made sure I ate every last morsel of my breakfast when I am usually leaving some hash browns and toast behind. You gotta represent when you're a newbie. Even if they aren't expecting it. You let them know your appetite is for real. In all seriousness, I cannot express enough appreciation for everyone I met while I was here. Hopefully the next time I visit, we will all be on a first-name basis!

55.description: Great experience! Food was excellent, hash browns to die for!! Staff was super friendly and extremely enjoyable to be around!

9.description: I don't normally write too many reviews anymore (there's way too many people doing them for me) but I felt compelled, no obligated to do one for the Yellow Rose. The moment I walked in, I felt like a genuine sense of hospitality rarely seen in restaurants today. It was like going back to some better, nostalgic time when people were kind to one another.It was super refreshing to feel that way. Oh, the corn-beef hash was amazing but it almost played second fiddle to the warmth from the fine people at the café.5 stars.

26.description: Great food and super nice staff. Everything we ordered was tasty and quite filling. It's a no frills menu but what they do, they do well. The staff were quick to take our order and nice as pie. The only drawback is limited seating for large parties. You might be waiting awhile for one of the 4 booths to open up. But that isn't going to stop us from going back again and again.

25.description: Good, fresh food, at a good price! The food came fast, they were willing to make changes based on my taste and specific preferences, recommend this place for a good, hearty, fast, and fresh breakfast-plu the staff are very nice, too!

12.description: I hate to burst anyone's breakfast bubble but this place isn't quite what many of the 4 and 5 star reviews claim it to be. I have been here 5, maybe 6 times, for breakfast only and it is just okay. Portion sizes are average, except for corned beef hash, which is a skimpy serving, at best, for the price. (I won't order it anymore) and they could wipe up the tables more carefully- I hate sitting in anyone else's crumbs - wait "staff" (which consists of 1 waitress) is typically inattentive. I do get the attraction of a small, folksy neighborhood diner, counter seats, the newspaper and that wonderful smell of coffee but I'd gladly trade it for better food and service.

59.description: 4 stars for homemade corned beef hash

21.description: I've eaten corned beef hash in dozens of places around the country and this is, hands-down, the best.  Plus the people are friendly.

17.description: This is definitely an old school dinner everything from the booths to the waitress. It's welcoming and the food is good. When your bill comes that's when this place becomes even better. Price is right and food is great.  Try it you will be glad you did.

10.description: I am visiting family here in Chicago and I was looking for a local establishment to have a good breakfast. Well just like most folk I went searching online. I choose this place because the have corn beef hash and I was not disappointed. Outstanding food to go along with the staff. Must eat place.  Don't be in a rush the conversation is excellent to go along with the amazing food. I got the Chicago breakfast with a side of corn beef hash.

5.description: You need to get the sautéed banana french toast and the corned beef hash with siracha hot sauce. They call it the rooster hot sauce. Everything else is not something I would go out of my way for. But the sautéed bananas are similar bananas foster on french toast. I like that the corned beef is real pieces. Typical diner atmosphere and service is not rushed.

3.description: I just love this place. Ive been here over a dozen times in the past 6 months. Each time it feels like home. The ladies behind the counter make you feel like family. The food is so tasty. Ive been working my way through the menu. The corned beef hash is by far the beat Ive ever had. Love the pancakes and country fried steak. The pork chop and eggs are great as well.

35.description: Charming diner with home made everything.  Honest people with low prices who tie you more for your money. Corned Beef Hash is fantastic.  Friendly waitstaff who will remember your usual after a few times there.  Wish they were opened on Sundays, but the owners have to charge their batteries sometime.

19.description: MUST MUST try corn beef hash BEST I have tasted so far! Small little hole in the wall CASH ONLY. Well priced. Seating is tight you walk in you already bump into someone. But well worth it, decent variety of diner food with breakfast/lunch specials. Will DEFINITELY go back but this time try my Corn Beef Hash a little crispy.

28.description: Great neighborhood place! It's small and busy on weekends, but thats a good sign right?? They do have a parking lot which is a plus. The food was good, solid, breakfast fare- homemade strawberry jelly for your toast (yum!), a big 2 egg breakfast special for under 6 bucks, and a Minnie Mouse pancake for my 3 year old :) We just moved to the Forest Glen neighborhood and I see many more breakfasts here in our future.

45.description: Mywife and I live in the Sauganash area and wanted to try out this cafe.I did not find this place to be very friendly, actually quite average andBasic. You will find it much easier to drop by Starbucks for a great cupOf  coffee, certainly not the watered down Continental coffee is kind ofGross with the unfiltered water. You are better off going to Mariano'sDown the street, spend 20.00 on eggs, bacon, and a fresh bagel andMake it  yourself. Don't waste your time unless  your desperatelyHungry and just do not want to cook at home.I

33.description: My car was running on gas fumes in a huge traffic jam on the highway when I decided to cross three lines of traffic to a random exit.  I gassed up, and decided to get some breakfast, hoping the traffic would thin out while I ate.  My daughter grabbed her iPhone and asked 'Siri' for some good breakfast places, and 'Yellow Rose Cafe' came up.  So, off we went.  We found street parking right in front, and headed inside.  I'm nearing 60, so I can spot the difference between authentic 1960's cafes and stylized 'retro' places.  This was the real deal, including some of the best waitresses ever!  They actually reminded me of 'Lavern and Shirley.'  Our food came super fast, and when we acted pleasantly surprised, our waitress said, 'I told our guy that the ladies were hungry!'  There was a large family next to us, and when stacks of pancakes were delivered to the children, the waitress said, 'Move over.  I'm going to share with you.'  I left the place smiling, and the food was good, cheap and plentiful too.

43.description: You might hear people making obscene sounds when you're there because the hash browns are perfectly crispy and the corned beef out of this world. The cooks and waitresses at this classic diner do it right.  The coffee flows like water and Candy the waitress has worked there for 38 years for a reason. "It's my home!" she says. The waitresses brought me a complimentary treat too.

2.description: When thinking of a "yellow rose," I recalled my second Christmas prom in high school.  Hubby (boyfriend at that time) presented yellow roses and asked me if I would be interested in going with him.  Apparently, a yellow rose symbolizes "friendship" in western culture.  Coincidentally, that will be exactly what you feel dining at the Yellow Rose Cafe, across from the CTA Forest Glen garage, in Jefferson Park.  Everyone who works there knows their regulars!  Although it was our first time coming to YRC, we were immediately invited to the party.  We came at approximately 0900 hour on a Friday, and the entire venue was filling up quickly with working men and women, families with young children, and CTA employees and a police officer.  Rosa J. and Daddy J. went with the "All-American" choices.  I had the "3-3-3," which translated to "three (3) over-easy large eggs, three (3) strips of bacons, hash browns, and two (2) pieces of wheat toast with butter and homemade jelly."  Just FYI, the bacons can be substituted with sausages; three (3) pieces of pancakes can take place with the hash browns.  Daddy J. had the upgraded version of what I had, except all components came with the number "4."  Everything was cooked like how your favorite grandma would have prepared in the morning.  YRC is really a solid breakfast spot, in a close proximity to that annoying Driver Services Facility on Elston.  If you've realized that you will never get your thing done over there, people at YRC will keep you company.  We had two (2) breakfast entrees with two (2) servings of bottomless morning coffee.  Everything came to $21 and some change.  I would rather hand my cash to the lovely people at YRC instead of the tax-heavy Driver Services to get my out-of-state ID changed.

18.description: What's in a name, that which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet. Not in this case Shakespeare! Yellow Rose Cafe is not your average diner or rose. The Rose here is Yellow. Does your diner make homemade hot sauce, homemade strawberry jam or homemade corned beef? No? Exactly! Yellow Rose is located on a busy stretch of north Elston Avenue tucked between two large buildings. Don't blink, you might miss it! But if you do miss it you'll miss out on awesome corned beef, did I mentioned it was homemade, great and creative skillets, pillowy pancakes, crispy hashbrowns  and piping hot coffee!All the great diner classics and more done right!The waitresses here are great too. Friendly, sweet and they keep your coffee cup full! The cooks here are awesome and will even chat to you while they cook up your food. So many great things that make Yellow Rose a diamond in the rough.If you are hungry for diner food and you want it done right head over to the Yellow Rose! Try their homemade hot sauce, homemade strawberry jam or homemade corned beef. You'll love them. And try the rest of the classics and absorb the classic diner ambiance the Yellow Rose brings.

41.description: I walk into The Yellow Rose, and for me it was a little tight with the seating  six booths, a long counter eating and a few tables, but as for me, I was in a  time warp. I felt as if I had just walked into  the set of "Mel's Diner" from the seventies television show "Alice". I found the service  so personal to be warm and friendly (just like the show). And their food was just what I had expected, their was plenty of good food at a great price. I think I may have found a perfect breakfast hide away. It is hidden in plane site. just two blocks east of Centeral on Elston Ave.  I give The Yellow Rose a huge thumbs up.

52.description: Cash only, no frills but quality, decent food with super nice people. The bottom line: Never disappointing.

50.description: I'd been wanting to try this place forever and finally made it there today. We absolutely loved the place. It was very friendly, the food was excellent and we will definitely come back again.  Eggs Benedict  is awesome and so is the corned beef hash.

4.description: It doesn't get much more Chicago N'west side than Yellow Rose Cafe  (How's about dem Bears...huh?) Its a bonafide neighborhood diner where the waitress knows most of the customers by their first name, and how they like their eggs. Yelper comments about the friendly service was spot on. I learned about YRC on WGN Chicago's Best, and then read the Yelp reviews . The highly touted corned beef hash had ample hunks of shredded corned beef, however the potatoes had disintegrated into a mashed potato consistency. My portion literally had one small fleck of sweet red pepper in it, and if there were onions in it, the taste was not discernible. Overall, the hash needed seasoning. The waitress offered me bottled hot sauce ( with no mention of homemade) and my toast came with the ubiquitous Smucker's Grape Jelly (once again, no mention of homemade jam stated by numerous Yelpers). Four stars for the hospitable , friendly service . Three stars for the food.

6.description: Orange counters and brown coffee mugs, what's not to love?  Nothing I say.  Cash only but this place serves up some mighty fine vittles for cheap.  I think everything here is homemade.  I could be wrong but I don't think you'll see any big ass Sysco truck pulling up here.  Fantastic breakfast place.  I love their sausage patties, sunny side eggs and buttered toast I dip into the eggs.  I call them dippen eggs!  Friendly career waitresses.  I see myself coming back on a chilly day for a bowl of their soup.  Comfort food at its finest at the Yellow Rose Cafe!

22.description: Small little no frills dive just reslly good grill food burgers or even breakfast  its all good soups are delicious and the price cant be beat

15.description: After loading up on rye bread at Andy's Deli, we wanted to get a bite to eat on our way back to Wisconsin. I feel so fortunate we came across The Yellow Rose. Super friendly and efficient service, good food, just a great feel to the place. Old school in the best way!

57.description: What a great little place. Plenty of good reviews. I'd like to add mine to the list.The food is very good. I've had both breakfast, and lunch items. Have not been disappointed  in any of my meals here. Good food, good service, and fair prices.What more could you ask for? They even have creamy garlic dressing! You can't find it in stores anymore. They were kind enough to fix me up with a to go portion so I could enjoy it at home.

20.description: Another example of owners working the room. One cooks the other serves and the hospitality is terrific. Packed full of regulars a few weeks back on my first visit but I was made comfortable immediately. Now after 6/7 visits I'm one of them. Coffee - oatmeal and a side of the best corned beef hash ever.

36.description: The reviews don't lie, clean, bright, fresh hot food, great people watching and nice staff. Real corned beef hash, not canned!

14.description: My husband and I came here for breakfast.  We were served a nice cup of coffee which was a very good roast and soothing.  I had the two eggs special with bacon and rye toast - a very simple dish with nicely toasted rye toast with butter; my husband had the corned beef hash with scrambled egg and hash browns.  The corned beef hash was actually chunks of corned beef and onions; I think he was slightly disappointed as it wasn't the typical diner corned beef hash, but it was still okay. We also had a waffle topped with strawberries and whipped cream to share and that was pretty solid as well.  Great friendly service and a very cute old-school type of a cafe.  I'm glad I was able to check them out!+solid coffee+friendly staff & service+plenty of street parking

3.description: Delicious Bagels.  They are fast and friendly.  Its nice that they have a train tracker at their counter.  I like the sea salt bagel with plain cream cheese.  They cut it in 1/4's too, which I prefer.  Their drinks are good and reasonably priced.

1.description: Commuting through Jefferson Park Blue Line station is my daily route to work.  For a long while quality coffee wasn't in the picture at this busy transportation center, and I cannot stand mystery coffee from that "Big M" fast food restaurant diagonally across Milwaukee Ave.  "The Bagelers" came along.  Yes, they do serve Ipsento coffee.  Thanks for not letting "Du*kin Don*t" occupy this little venue.  Coffee is acceptably-priced, considering this is a prime location inside of the Jefferson Park Blue Line station.  A 20 oz. Americano costs $3.16 (as of 12/14/2015).  Well, Rosa J. wanted a high-sugar content caffeinated beverage this morning, so she went with the 16oz. vanilla bean latte.  The barista worked fast.  In less than three (3) minutes, my drink was ready, in time for me to catch the train that was coming in five (5) minutes.  There's a train tracker available to ensure that you make it to the destination on time.  I sincerely hope that this place lasts and does well.

2.description: Usually I get DD in the morning today I wanted some new....thank god for my me finally discovering this today!!!i got a poppy bagel with chive and onion spread OMG Yummy!! It's surely  becoming a regular spot for me to start my morning right :) thanks!! also very good customer service !!!!

5.description: So happy to have a coffee place right inside the station! It makes everything so much easier in the morning. Plus, all the people behind the counter are super friendly and they definitely brighten my morning... not just because they give me coffee. They're small but have a good selection of coffee beverages and bagels. They're super convenient and quick too. What more could I ask for?

6.description: I'm so happy to see a nice coffee shop at the Jefferson Park Blue line station. This is a much needed new business at this CTA stop. The people are friendly, and your order is ready quickly for your morning commute. They have breakfast options and delicious coffee. I'm looking forward to supporting this local business.

7.description: Such a great little spot inside the jefferson park terminal. So far I've had the pumpkin pie latte, iced coffee which has a nice acidity , and everything bagel with salmon spread- it's sooo good! Folks are friendly & speedy. Can't wait to try more.

0.description: Visited The Bagelers for the first time a couple of weeks ago, and let me tell you this, they always keep me coming back! The ladies behind the counter are super nice and super attentive. I was recommended to try the "honey nut spread" on my bagel, OMG that stuff is amazing!Here's the best part THEY SERVE IPSENTO COFFEE!!!!And it tastes just as great as the actual coffee shop!If you want to support a local business, this is the place to go. Keep up the great work guys!

4.description: Coffee is good. I had the everything bagel with chive spread. So good it was a near religious experience.

3.description: Unfortunately had to use this pharmacy for change of insurance reasons. Its awful. The Tech tried to  overcharge me then sent me to an unfriendly pharmacist to figure the insurance out. He acted like it was a big effort to help me. There was a long line and a woman screaming on a cell phone.  I have never encountered a more unprofessional pharmacy. I also asked if they give a gift card for transferred prescriptions and the male pharmacist looked at me like I was insane. Never again. Guess I will try Walgreen's. They also made me sit and wait next to the screaming woman on a cell phone. Ugh

1.description: There is nothing "minute" about the Minuteclinic.  4 hour wait times?  They will allow you to leave and text you when they're ready for you.  With 4 hour wait times, one might be better off going to the ER or morgue first.

2.description: Located at Lawrence and Central, this CVS can be a convenient place to stop by when you're in the Jefferson Park/Portage Park area.  The store itself is a little less comparable to other CVS locations, but they have the Minute Clinic, the photo services, as well as the selections of snacks, medicine, and other essentials.  The only issue is is the exiting of the place, as getting onto Central can be a pain with the traffic; your best bet is to exit on the Lawrence side.  There is a free lot to park your car.+Minute Clinic available+exit on Lawrence

5.description: What type of customer services do  they bring?? come in to the store to avoid stop on Walgreens and honestly I regret to stop by. tried to print some picture for me and computer doesn't work well , I asked to manager  to some help and her  answer was "the computer working  this morning" and continue walking, basically she doesn't care at all,  so I'm done with this store, never but never come back now I preferred to driving more miles and get better service. don't recommended this store to shop, CUSTOMER SERVICES IS WORST!!

6.description: Terrible customer service. Photo determined that my picture order looked like an ID photo, even though I was printing my own image (artwork really) on a 4x6 photo. So they call me to say that they will charge me over $11 for just that one picture. Who are they to determine what my picture is about - there is. Itching special about ID photos in their handling or processing... And neither is my artwork that frames faces in 2x2 boxes. Simply absurd. I'll gladly take my business elsewhere who wants to earn repeat business. This is disappointing because CVS always was the fried my underdog in my mind - they lost my confidence.

7.description: Review is for the CVS Minute ClinicI went here recently and the nurse practitioner on duty was incompetent.  I thought she must be giving the previous patient a lot of attention considering she was in there for an hour, but this assumption was unfortunately very wrong.  I went into the office after this other patient and the nurse had me take a seat near the computer (which she is not savvy with whatsoever).  At this point, she went through all of her standard checklists supplied by CVS... Often seriously mis-marking items (marked that I have HIV, diabetes, etc... None of which I have) and marked the box claiming I'd refused to give my weight (I'm 104 lbs. by the way).  She even put in the wrong diagnosis because she didn't understand the difference between various types of illnesses.  Needless to say, I now have print-outs to treat a problem I don't have.  In addition to this, all the information she gave me was read directly from the screen pertaining to a diagnosis that wasn't correct.  How this nurse is licensed to practice anything is beyond me.  I honestly felt like the guy in Idiocracy when he went to St. God Hospital.

8.description: What happened to the above reviewer (PW B) with the Minute Clinic nurse is inexcusable and possibly malpractice. This upsets me because I have always had excellent service there for me and my child. The nurse I have used is great and doesn't just read the wrong diagnosis from the computer. The nurse I had diagnosed me quickly and accurately and even took me to the medicine aisle and showed me which OTC drugs and generics were best for me. I also went in with a spec in my eye. She looked and confirmed that it was there but she did not bill me because she could not treat me. I had to go to an immediate care center with special eye scanning equipment. I appreciate the above review and will be careful the next time I go there. It was a great convenient and affordable service. I hope it isn't going downhill. I also hope I never meet this horrible nurse and I will report her if I have a similar problem. I will update this review if my 5star experience changes.

0.description: This is for the Minute Clinic portion of CVS.I've read a few posts where people didn't have a good experience. This is unfortunate because I've been here several times since moving to the area. Each time I've had to come here, I was treated well and the diagnosis/treatment I received help me to get better quickly.During my times coming here I've had a couple different RN's and both were extremely friendly and professional.

4.description: Regarding Minute Clinic only:Terrible, do not go. All they know is strep throat and nothing else, they will let you leave sick and in pain, as long as it's not strep. They will not give an antibiotic, they act like you're asking for a narcotic, they are rude and uneducated. You will waste money on your co-pay and that is all. Then when you call their customer service, they are equally as rude and unhelpful. I literally have to file a claim with my bank and my insurance to dispute the cost and the services as I was told I had a cold and to suck on some cough drops, something I could have done myself.

3.description: I'm so disheartened to read the awful reviews of penny pinchers. We had a great experience there today. Jay was so generous and gave us a killer deal on a tv that is meant for a sick friend. I will definitely shop there again.
