Please give this place a chance!  It's a place that really helps the working class, such as ourselves.

1.description: FYI. They are closed for business and no longer there. But when they were..... Yikes. Dirty, unorganized, not fun. Glad it will soon be something else.

2.description: I haven't actually visited Penny Pinchers. Jay came to my estate sale in June and, after an overly lengthy explanation of who he was (while I'm trying to conduct business), offered to buy out the remaining contents. I took his number and said I'd call him later. Which I did on June 30. And then I waited for a return call. Never got one. Why take up my time while I'm busy and then don't even bother to call me back? That's just plain frustrating and pointless. I gave my stuff to Norwood Park Thrift store instead. They were grateful.

5.description: The very worst thrift store. It looks like someone emptied a trash bin and put the contents on shelves with equally ridiculous prices. It's naaasty.

6.description: This place was totally unimpressive the day I was there a couple weeks ago. The inventory of household things made the Village Thrift look like a palace and the store is so painfully utilitarian inside. The whole place is drab industrial grey with fluorescent lights. If they do have some rockstar items, they sure don't like to let you know because the displays were borderline pathetic. Plus the guy never even looked up from his computer when my mom and I came by. Maybe I'm spoiled from living in Andersonville where even the brown elephant charity shop can feel like a boutique, but this place really looked and felt like a drag.I was really hoping for something fun in the neighborhood... my search continues.

7.description: Friendly customer service, fair pricing

8.description: I would take my buisness elsewhere if i were you.  Jay who is the stores "very shady" owner is just a peddler of stolen goods.

9.description: I'm writing about this place from the point of view of someone who wants to sell some unused stuff for what its worth. I do sales online but the fact that this place is physically closer to where I live and seems to take a large variety of items was a draw for me. I came in here with some old(er, not necessary ancient), unused electronics. He took my camera at a fair price but refused the other items, which was understandable. Overall he is willing to bargain with his customers as is any good salesman. He is open about how and what kind of business he does, and this integrity is a good thing among salespeople.

0.description: I ride the 85 Central bus going south on a regular basic, and one day i noticed a new  eye -catching window with the name Penny PinchersI kept telling myself I am going to stop by there and see what"s it is about, but my schedule was always full, then one day my co-worker offerme a ride home (which I was beyond tired) I ask her to instead take me to this new second hand store, it was a gorgeous day, and I told herthat I will wait for the bus,because I had to go inside this store.  I was very pleased on how neat and organized it was, and the prices was so very reasonable, and I saw many things that day I wanted buy, but had no way of getting it up to my third floor apt, but the owner Jay was so very nice, polite and professional, that i told him " i"m  surly coming back this time with handy men, and Something else caught my attentionthere was a little boy in the store with him, and I was amazed on how that kid had a mind of an older business man, really show interest inbeing in charge. Bottom line this store is great, and I can't wait to see what he (Jay)  will bring in Next. It"s worth the trip, and I hope it last.  Sincerely,    Lisa C. (Mayfair)

4.description: Penny pinchers seems to have closed permanently as of September 8, 2014.

3.description: I always come to this location because it is right down the street, the girls working are ALWAYS friendly and remember me, and there's never a long wait! I mainly come here for the $15 dark spray tan deal on Mondays (yes, they have deals almost every day of the week) and I used to have a normal tanning membership. I would definitely recommend this location if you're in the Jefferson Park area! It's cute, clean, and friendly. There are people who come in of all backgrounds (I saw a dude on a motorcycle with a leather jacket in here once!) and the staff is friendly to each person who walks in their door. I don't know why this place is getting such low ratings and mind you all, most of these are from YEARS ago. The place is great now! Great beds. Great Versa Spa spray tan machine. Great employees. Great location. And, of course, great prices!

1.description: I come in for the versa spray tan. On Mondays it's only 10$ !!!! You can't beat that deal. They have mystic as well but I like the versa way better. The workers here are super nice and attentive. My go to spot for my weekly glow!

2.description: I've been going here for many years, previously as a member, then as a pay-as-I-go.  Today I went here for the $4 special that they texted, tan on any bed all weekend for $4.  I decided on the Level 5 for 12 minutes.  As soon as I get undressed and in the bed, I realize that 2 of the 4 face lamps are out.  About 4 minutes in, I realized 6 bulbs on the top portion of the bed were out, and 4 others were flashing as if they were about to go out.  At this point, I was already 1/3 of the way through but figured it was only $4.....no big deal.  I actually had to turn the fan/AC off because I was getting chilly in the bed.  When I was done, I told the girl at the front (who was not behind the desk, but chatting with her friend on the couches) about the bulbs.  Her response was "oh yeah, we'll let the owner know."  Didn't offer an apology. my money back or a free tan or anything.....I know it was only $4, but this bed is usually $2/minute, so $24 for a full session.  I have absolutely NO color on the front of my body(8 hours later), and not much more on my backside.  Ridiculous.  I probably should have gotten up, gotten dressed and asked for a new bed, but since it was only $4, I figured it wasn't worth the hassle.  I was just shocked at how they just didn't care when I told them the bed wasn't working.  This location has just lost a long time client of 11+ years.  Ultimate Exposure has WAY better, more modern beds, and are much more friendly.

5.description: Went in here for Mysitc Tan ($30 a pop!!!!) - the tan spray for the pale skinned people of the world.  I've done it before at other salons and NEVER had an issue like I did here.  Got out and the spray was beading on my skin (it should be a fine mist that you can't even see)and most wiped off.  Next day - totally streaky.  I was so embarassed to go out in public, but since I did this for a wedding (yes - lots of horrible streaky pictures of me) I was forced to show myself.  I wrote the corporate office after this whole incident to have them, at the very least, service the mystic tan machine because there is seriously wrong with it.  Still haven't heard back from them.  I hope to update soon that they have great customer service and are very attentive.  However, I don't have high hopes that that will happen.Not sure what their normal tanning beds are like - but I would say if you are going for Mystic Tan - go somewhere else.

6.description: I guess it's called LA Tan because I'm supposed to walk out with a tan that looks as good as people who got it for real in LA? lol I don't know about that because you come out orange at this place and you stink to high heaven. I've been to better tanning salons...this is just tthe lower end of them!

0.description: This location is one of the best LA tans. They're super clean and have a ton of beds. I've only been here a couple of times but all the girls are really nice and the hours are longer than other LA tans I've been too. The only thing is the level 3 bed (the one I've used)  doesn't seem to have a fan so it gets hot kind of quick other than that I really like this place!

4.description: I only went to this location once for the Mystic Tan...their machine needs some SERIOUS upgrading! I read the directions on the wall & stepped into the machine waiting for the voice prompt (per the instructions I just read). The machine made a strange noise and then began spraying me down. Since I was waiting for the voice prompt I wasn't ready & didnt have a chance to hold my breath! It totally reminded me of my military days in chemical warfare training! I even inhaled some of the mist! It stopped briefly & just as I caught my breath it started to spray me again! I quickly turned myself around to get color on my back, sliding all over the place! It was the longest few minutes of my life! I leapt out of that machine, happy to be alive!!! I should have known something bad was about to happen because as soon as I asked for Mystic Tan the girls at the counter had sympathetic looks on their faces...like, "we probably should warn you but we want your money sooo...". Good lord! Never again!!!!

3.description: I'm such an alky for knowing this..23oz of Fat Tire for $3.  Heineken keg cans $2.60.  Tall cans of some "211 Lager" with an 8.5% alc content, a bum lovin' beer.  $1.79!What great deals!This has to be one of very few 7-Elevens still carrying porn mags.  Who still buys porn?

1.description: I've been here twice and both times it was a good experience. It is what it is. Convenience store food with shelves and freezers stocked full of miscellaneous quick, easy to eat microwavable food. Not to mention a decent selection of booze.Jim Gaffigan should get a cut of the business. After all, his standup routines are constant about the love of junkfood and late-night "Hot Pockets".

2.description: This 7-Eleven is located in the Gladstone Shopping Mall on the north side by Milwaukee Avenue. Typical 7-Eleven with a friendly staff that go out of their way to greet you. Only 2 choices for diet soda from the fountain machine. The biggest downside of this particular location is the parking. Because the mall is on an angle and Milwaukee Avenue is on an angle, parking for this location is at the tip of the angle. Parking your vehicle can be difficult.

0.description: Very good service..the clerks are very friendly and helpful..the prices are typical of a convenient store but not horrible..the place is very clean and is one of my fav's

4.description: Service and store cleanliness are consistently good.  I've avoided deli items from competitors, but the sandwiches here are pretty good (especially the buffalo chicken sandwich).  The drink stations are clean and well-stocked.  My only complains are for some of my fellow shoppers.  If I hold a door open for you, I don't care if you don't accept the offer and head for the other one, but there's no need to give me a dirty look.  Some of the cops around here are jerky (often buying jerky) at the checkout.

1.description: This was the most bland chicken my family and I have ever tasted. I wish it was a different experience. I asked a couple of my friends who live in the area about a place I can grab something quick and tasty and this was the place they all swore by. The chicken had absolutely no flavor, dinner rolls were plain white bread, potatoes were just ok and the Cole slaw needed more flavor also. Very sad. We will not be going back and will not recommend this place to anyone.

9.description: Pretty good. Chicken,  broasted potatoes and cole slaw very good. Will try something else next time. It does take some time because they cook it up when you order it, not sitting there for a few hours when you get there. But very fresh. The people that work there are very nice. Will be back.

12.description: I was looking for Chicken for dinner and I found Broasted Chicken Royal on Yelp.It's pretty small from the outside. The people were very nice and helpful.I ordered the chicken buffet. The Chicken:  I really wanted to chicken to be great. The chicken was juicy and tender, but it didn't have a lot of flavor. I was disappointed. The guys were really nice and I wanted to give the place a great rating.  I know you can order the chicken with BBQ sauce, but I wanted just plain breaded chicken with some seasoning.OWNERS: If you are reading this, please offer a seasoned version of this chicken. It was juicy, but just didn't have enough flavor.The broasted potatoes were pretty good. I didn't fault these for not being salted, since that is how they are normally served. A little salt brought them out of their shell.The coleslaw was good. It was smooth and had a nice fresh flavor.We also had the onion rings. They had a great batter on them. Maybe could have been a little more crispy, but they tasted great.The inside is a cool old school look. It was clean inside and the people were great.Again, I really want to like the chicken, but it needed a little something in the way of seasoning.I may return to give them another chance.

21.description: I give this place two stars for there short window of delivery times, but four stars for the barbecue ribs. That comes to three stars. The delivery is fast, the food is warm, the ribs are pretty delicious for a little hole-in-the-wall takeout place. Only problem is if you're hungry after 8:30 then you're S.O.L.

16.description: This summer while at a photo shoot we stumbled across a menu from Broasted Chicken Royal, so we ordered. Not knowing what to expect we were so happy when we started chowing down . . . the best and juiciest chicken EVER and the Broasted potato's "FORGET about it" they were to die for . . . good old fashioned chicken dinner for a great value. They are a bit out of the way but sooooooooooo worth the trip. It took me a couple of months to find the place again . . . I did remember it was West on Lawrence, but found myself driving up and down Lawrence not knowing an address or name . . . until one day last week when I finally saw a chicken on the window . . . I was happy to find it, and had some tonight, they ROCK and I would order chicken for my next party . . . it's really good chicken!

17.description: I called in, I wanted 2 breast 3 legs, just Chicken. Made to order, 20mins. got it ! Walked in, Big guy at register welcomed me. I reconized his rasp voice, he took my call!  Big dude was Very pleasant, maybe he was the owner, hum...I wonder? My Chicken was hot & steamy when I opened the "box".  Chicken in a box right...u gotta love that. "I do" Kinda like a box lunch at school thing. My first bite was in the car.  The aroma, then my hunger, both ambushed me! I had to pull over. Yum, nothing more is needed. It's, "Broasted Chicken done just right. Wow, did i use Yum...(men don't use yum) yes!, I did. Why they butterfly the breast meat? It cooks faster, and cause it's "Yummier" that way. After that second bite, I called back to the restaurant to Thank Big dude and then told him, "I will be back", "like you will too!." Good stuff my brothas n sistas, Yall wont b disappointed. I don't know about the sides. Just Chicken was my hunger roar of the day. Guys, also I read, that Big dude's been cooking since 1952!!!  Oh! and I found out don't bother reheating it, Next day, Its just as good cold from the frig!

10.description: PROS: Good stuffed pizza and broasted potatoes.  Super friendly service.  I ordered a 7-UP, they told me they were out.  A few seconds into the order they said "it's okay, if we have to we will go across the street to get a 7-up."CONS: My pizza order was wrong. :(   I ordered a cheese stuffed pizza.  I recieved a sausage stuffed pizza.  I didn't call back to let them know because I was sick and didn't feel like dealing with it.I will try again because they were nice.  Even though the order was wrong, this goes to show that a friendly attitude can make up for it.

5.description: Everything was delicious! Loved the mashed potatoes not from a box! And the chicken was perfect! If they had promos through grubhub I would be ordering more often.

11.description: As a "local" of the Jefferson Park neighborhood for over thirty years...this "Broasted Chicken Royal" is the best, EVER!I go there at least twice to three times a month...as a busy high school art teacher, this place gives me huge pieces of chicken, enough potato wedges to feed a small army and great cole slaw, too!If you need a fast -ready-to-eat" meal... then Broasted Chicken Royal on Lawrence Avenue on Chicago's North-Side, is your go-to place!Please send me a cash off coupon for this great review, if you can... and I'll cash it in with my next order, next week!from da C-Mann from cHicAgo(the H & A are large to denote the City of Chicago skyline!)

22.description: Many moons ago, my friend Karen and I frequented this place.  It was run by an elderly German woman who made the best ribs ever.  Go figure.  Then she sold the place, and we just stopped going.  The two events weren't really related, it was just a matter of not really having the opportunity to get over there much, which eventually turned into forgetting about it.So tonight I was poking around Grub Hub looking for a place that would deliver to me, and  not wanting pizza or Chinese, and I discovered that Broasted Chicken Royal not only was still in business but would deliver to my area.  I wasn't in the mood for ribs either, but I remembered that they made excellent BBQ chicken, too, so I ordered a 4-piece dinner and several cans of pop, so I'd have something in the fridge for tomorrow and Monday.I phoned just before 8.  A projected 45 minute wait seemed reasonable.  At ten past nine I phoned the restaurant and was told that the delivery guy had been trying to phone me.  Nuh-uh, I told the guy on the phone, I'd been sitting at my desk the whole time, working on the computer.  So he took my info again, and I told him exactly how to find my place with very specific landmarks and all.At nine twenty, I went downstairs with my phone and the money to see if there was any sign of the delivery.  At nine-thirty I phoned the place again, and there was no answer.  I was just about to give up and go back inside when the car pulled up with two people in the front seat.  How on earth do TWO people manage to get lost and stay lost for more than forty-five minutes with specific directions and confirmation of a phone number which I know for a fact they never used??I was handed a pair of lukewarm, soggy bags, and I honestly thought about telling the delivery guy that it was too late and I didn't want them anymore, but I was so hungry I just paid him and came back upstairs.Now, I don't know about anyone else but when I order a dinner with four pieces of chicken, that's enough for at least two people, so I sort of expect to get enough sides for two.  Instead I got one bun, and a small tub of coleslaw, and a bag of broasted potatoes which had to be reheated in the microwave because, ugh, cold and greasy.  In all fairness I have to say that the menu never actually says how much of each side you'll get, so the assumption was mine, but I think it was a reasonable assumption based on the fact that a standard dinner is two pieces of chicken.I got my four chicken breasts but they weren't the kind of BBQ I'm familiar with.  It was almost like I got plain old broasted chicken with some sauce slapped on.  And not even any extra sauce!   It tasted fine, but not exciting in any way.  The coleslaw was pretty generic, like the sort you get from KFC, and the bun?  It was bread, it was filling and it was fresh.  And there was no butter with it.  Big change from the era when I was  eating there fairly often and we got biscuits, butter and honey with our meals.  There were no utensils or napkins in the  bags either, and while I didn't need them, I think it's just a courtesy to provide them.  Over all I just wasn't impressed by the way the restaurant has changed, and won't be ordering from them again.

0.description: I am in love with this place. The store front looks a little shabby, but don't be deterred. Their food is five star excellent. We always get delivery and the food is always piping hot and crispy. Their chicken is so, so good and the broasted potatoes are like butter. Awesome prices and fast service. Jeff Park gem!

20.description: Ive been eating here since I was a kid.Overall a nice place to eat for a fair price.Check out the daily specials.

the restaurant has changed, and won't be ordering from them again.

2.description: Absolutely disgusting... The interior, the quality / taste of the food. Visited once and will not be back.

18.description: Great food.. When you need a catering order this is the place to go!!

13.description: So looking forward to eating local and fresh - but chicken wasn't seasoned, neither the potato wedges.   Kind of bland.

4.description: This place is awesome, the food is ready in no time and it's always delicious for amazing prices.  The staff are friendly and polite.  Don't forget to get extra coleslaw it's da bomb!

6.description: Unfortunately living nearly 40 miles away, I don't get to visit this gem often enough.  A few times a year, when visiting with family, I stomp my feet until everyone agrees to order from Broasted Chicken Royal.As has been mentioned, the pieces are huge, and the price is excellent.  Just got a 20/pc family meal on Saturday and it was like $30 for the chicken, loads of broasted potatoes, cole slaw, and rolls.The service is quick, you are always greeted with a smile by one of the nicest gentlemen around, and the chicken is fantastic.You won't be sorry.....give this place a try!

15.description: The place felt like a dive and the food was  just ok.

7.description: Amazing food, great prices. People running it are extremely nice. Try their stuffed pizza, you wont regret it for a second!

8.description: Our area lacks good Chinese, seafood fry spot (Sharks) and a fried chicken place. Well, that was until we found Broasted Chicken. Crispy, tender well seasoned chicken.16 pieces for $20. The pieces are gigantic! Bye bye Popeye's, hello Broasted Chicken Royal. The family was pleased with the food, that we will continue to bring this for our potluck portion to future parties. Owned by a family who prides them self on their family business and giving back to their community, come support this Mom and Pop's.

3.description: The menu is pretty simple. Chicken or pizza. We got the chicken, and a couple sides. The chicken was fried up nice and crispy. Sadly, the breading was just boring. It needed some seasoning badly. The broasted fries were fries. Nothing special.The people running it were super nice and would give them another shot.

14.description: Not bad....not great.....

1.description: The good news if we have a neighborhood place that falls solidly between the high-end burger places (Kuma) and the high end chains (Meatheads.. etc).  The great news is that it is priced closer to the Chain Places.Seriously.. for about a buck more than a McMeal deal you get a real good burger, heap of fries and a drink.  They have a bunch of greats apps reasonably priced as well.They have many other non-burger options as well.. Polish, Dogs, Philly Cheese Steaks, Shrimp... etcThe guy running the place is nice, does not ask that you bow to his burger or offer penance of  a half hour wait to get seated..  So in conclusion Nice place.. Nice Guy... Good food... Great Prices

9.description: Nice clean open spot w about 10 tables. Menu w burgers , Phillys,  wings, chicken sandwiches , and ice cream shakes. We ordered the butter burger and crisp chicken sandwich (I added house special sauce and hot sauce in it). Both were good. Fries were crisp and hot and the mushrooms were very flavorful. would come here again. Also let me add , the worker in front and owner was very nice.

23.description: I ordered from this place today for lunch and the delivery driver asked me to let them know what I think, so that's what I'm doing... and I must say, I was very pleased. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich with fries and it was absolutely delicious. Honestly, it exceeded my expectations. A previous reviewer was right -- that house sauce is amazing! On top of that, it came on a hearty, soft, high-quality roll that wasn't even soggy even though the sandwich had sauce, grilled onions and peppers. The chicken itself was spiced great. The fries were also very tasty. If all of their food is as flavorful and high-quality as the chicken sandwich, I think Burger Bull is going to be very successful.

5.description: This place is a local gem! Awesome food and shakes. Definitely always fresh and delicious!

25.description: This place just opened and I LOVE it. The quality of their food is really high, especially for a burger joint. Really friendly and prompt service. And the restaurant itself has nice seating and is always impeccably clean. My favorite item on the menu is their grilled chicken sandwich which is served on ciabatta bread with a house sauce that is mouthwateringly delicious. Another great thing about them is that they have super yummy milkshakes; I usually get Oreo. I can't imagine anyone having anything bad to say about this place.

12.description: Very friendly service and cute decor! The peanut butter and banana milkshake was delicious, with chunks of real banana and pb in it. We tried a chicken sandwich and Texas burger -- both were great. The fries and onion rings were also really good. This place has a genuine small business kind of feel where it seems like the owner/staff really value you as a customer and are invested in you having a good experience there. Also, the ice cream looked good but we ate too much as it was so got to save that for next time. Looking forward to trying the Maple Blondie flavor!

21.description: Ordered again and for the goober burger (has peanut butter on it) it wasn't as scary add I thought it might be. Very peanut buttery. I actually think this burger needed something else. Peanut butter is so rich in flavor I feel like they need a pop of some sort. Like when you eat pb&j the jelly contrasts and pops off the rich pb. This burger needs a little something like that. But it was still good!

16.description: My bf lives in the area and we decided to try something new.  We stopped in on a Sat night and decided to order carry out. The place isn't huge but clean and the decor on the wall was fun. We both ordered the House Bull burger and got reg and sweet potato fries. We were both pretty impressed by the food and it was decently priced. We'll def be back to try more stuff on their menu...plus bonus they have a flat screen to keep you entertained while you wait or dine in!

17.description: My husband and I came here on a weekday afternoon for burgers. I had the Hawaiian, and he had the Texas burger. The sweet potato fries were especially delicious. I also really liked the ambiance of the restaurant. We both really enjoyed our lunch, but the best part was the value. For $6.99, you get a burger, fries, and a drink. You can't beat that for a comparable burger in this area. We will dine again at Burger Bull.

10.description: This place just opened and I LOVE it. The quality of their food is really high, especially for a burger joint. Really friendly and prompt service. And the restaurant itself has nice seating and is always impeccably clean. My favorite item on the menu is their grilled chicken sandwich which is served on ciabatta bread with a house sauce that is mouthwateringly delicious. Another great thing about them is that they have super yummy milkshakes; I usually get Oreo. I can't imagine anyone having anything bad to say about this place.

11.description: Texas burger was my favorite here. It had a very good sauce in it. The prices were pretty good compared to other burger places too. Highly recommended!

26.description: Mouthwatering Texas burger was super juicy loaded with bbq sauce, bacon, cole slaw and topped with a couple of onion rings. Fries are fried to perfection. No frills but delicious burger and beats other chain burger places. My husband enjoyed his Hawaiian burger and side of cheese sticks. Def our new neighborhood burger spot and will be returning. Next time having an ice cream shake.

27.description: The burgers are good but with a lot of burger competition in the neighborhood, they are really going to have to step it up to stand out. I'm surprised they didn't have bacon for the burgers, no curly fries either. As for the fries, they are okay, nothing special just basic fries (as opposed to fresh cut, seasoned, or curly). The shrimp dinner comes with fries, garlic bread and a very small salad. The shrimp is pretty standard breaded popcorn shrimp. This is a small restaurant with fairly limited seating, they do have a TV and we're playing old school rock off of a small radio at the time I was there.

0.description: Simply Devine! As I sat and waited for our order, I was trying to make sense to why the chalk sign would say, "finger linkin'". There're sandwiches---how messy could it get? The answer to that question was in the pictures that we took of each other while trying to eat the massive sandwiches. Our contorted, monstrous faces perfectly capture the quality and deliciousness of the food.

20.description: Unbelievably, friendly, courteous, and all around awesome staff! The food is undoubtably mouthwatering! Really glad he came to the neighborhood.  also it's 100% beef other local burger joints use pork in their burgers. Highly recommend to all you will not be dissatisfied.  I just had a burger with an over easy egg and it was so delicious

19.description: I heard this place has great milk shakes so we used Grubhub to order from here last Saturday. We ordered 2 shakes and a cheese stick at 6:25... Half an hour later we realized the estimated delivery time was 8:03.  Over an hour and a half? We called Grubhub, thinking there has to be something wrong, but they said Burger Bull was just really busy. That's crazy!  But oh well. At 8:25 I got a call saying the delivery driver got into an accident; so it would be another 25min. At 840 I get a call saying the delivery is here. When I answered, the delivery diver was telling me about how he had to bother one of my neighbors to use their phone, since he forgot his and our doorbell wasnt working (we noted this in the order). I understand things happen but  you would think after waiting over 2 hours, you would get an apology, or even a thank you for waiting but nope! We just got two mediocre shakes that are very over priced.We were really looking forward to trying their burgers, but this experience felt like a joke.

2.description: Movie afternoon at sons and we decided to order- options for all. You listed several veggie burgers very nice. BUT THEY ARE NOT. It was a grilled mushroom. That is EVERYONE'S go to for us veggies and not good. I expected well a veggie burger. The sauce was good on the Hawaiian style, but a total mess. Grilled pineapple nice, but had this been an actual veggie burger I would return. Too many other options, and as Angie A said...we vegetarians like to hang out with carnivores and we all want to eat. Kudos for trying, maybe just have description be accurate. A veggie burger is not a grilled mushroom. That is a grilled mushroom or veggie sandwich. FYI.  And we paid for a vanilla shake for my sons fiance that we did not get( we picked up so really not great).

18.description: Went there with my wife not expecting much - but it was great. We both ordered burgers for 6.99 and then found out that they come with fries and a drink, and they substitute regular fries for sweet potato fries at no extra cost. Butter burger was excellent, and Texas burger was pretty good. Sweet potato fries were delicious.

13.description: Texas Burger has an excellent sauce and was cooked to perfection.  Fries were seasoned well and had very good flavor compared to any of the chains.   The guy(possibly the owner) who took my order for take out was very professional and a nice guy.   I will be coming here again.

4.description: Unbelievably, friendly, courteous, and all around awesome staff! The food is undoubtably mouthwatering! Really glad he came to the neighborhood.  also it's 100% beef other local burger joints use pork in their burgers. Highly recommend to all you will not be dissatisfied.  I just had a burger with an over easy egg and it was so delicious

24.description: Excellent.  The burgers were perfect and the caramel shake was delicious.  We'll definitely be back!!

6.description: Those who live in the area know there aren't many restaurants immediately around, so I was very motivated to like Burger Bull.  We picked up food to-go once, and it was tasty.  However, two major complaints.  We have tried several times to have food delivered and it NEVER happens.  Burger Bull -- just be honest and market yourselves as eat-in or take-out only. You never ever deliver food.  Burger Bull -- another thing.  Vegetarians and carnivores hang out.  You lose business when they look for somewhere to go and eat.  Meat eaters can eat anywhere, vegetarians cannot.  Minimally you need to add a veggie burger to your menu.

22.description: The owner was very nice and friendly.  The burgers are huge and very good.  We tried the sweet potato fries which were a bit spicy (good), however they should have been cooked a bit longer.  Price is right and they have a great selection of options. We will be back.

15.description: Good service- friendly and fast.   We took our food home so I think it would have been better if we ate it there (hot, crispy).  Despite that, the food was still very good.  And treat yourself to a shake, you won't regret it.

7.description: I ordered delivery and was completely blown away by how quickly my food arrived, how flavorful and fresh my food was, and how reasonable the prices were. We live in an area where yes, it costs a bit more to eat out than in surrounding areas. That being said, we expect quality food and Burger Bull delivers. My bun was fluffy, my burger was cooked to perfection, nothing was soggy, and my fries were some of the best I've ever had. I recommended Burger Bull on a local virtual garage sale page on Facebook so hopefully they get tons of orders in the next few days as people spread the word of how tasty they are!

8.description: The burgers are good but with a lot of burger competition in the neighborhood, they are really going to have to step it up to stand out. I'm surprised they didn't have bacon for the burgers, no curly fries either. As for the fries, they are okay, nothing special just basic fries (as opposed to fresh cut, seasoned, or curly). The shrimp dinner comes with fries, garlic bread and a very small salad. The shrimp is pretty standard breaded popcorn shrimp. This is a small restaurant with fairly limited seating, they do have a TV and we're playing old school rock off of a small radio at the time I was there.

3.description: This place is not bad. What I really was impressed me was the mozzarella sticks. They were top notch! I wonder who the supplier is?! I look forward to exploring more of the menu.

14.description: Burgers were done to perfection! Had a chocolate shake and was so happy that it was made with chocolate ice cream! Yum! Reasonably priced. Great asset to the neighborhood!!

58.description: Living in and out of the chicago area and being mexican myself i have tried many mexican restaurants. Recently moved to the north side and came across Tuxpan Mexican Grill. I saw the reviews and 4-5 stars gave me the green light to order.Skimming through the menu the American Burger section should have given me the red flag but I wanted to see what the 5 star fuss was about. Everything on the menu seemed to sound delicious So i ordered a torta dinner (milanesa/breaded steak) and 1 gordita de chicharron (pork groin green sauce). Taco dinner , 2 chicken tacos.They told me 30-40 minutes , seeing as how i was half a mile away from them it seemed fine. 1 hour and 20 minutes later my food was here. As i suspected my food was cold/slightly warm.My tortillas were soggy as well as my bread. The food in general is 1 star 2 at best. I wasnt expecting authentic 100% mexican food but with the  items that were on the menu i would have thought they would come somewhat close since alot of the items take time to make and need a little more then basic cooking knowledge.The beans were salty, the rice was actually fine but was dry. The milanesa was breaded but I was more worried about the amount they had given me. I was basically eating more bread then meat. I opened my torta up and it seemed instead of giving me the whole breaded steak they just gave me half of it. The breading seemed to taste like corn dog breading.The 2 chicken tacos had no seasoning what so ever. Taste broiled. The lettuce was already browning. The salsa they give you is basically tomato sauce with salt. The best tasting thing i received from my order was the Sangria. And that came extremely warm as well. I give this a 1 star and would not recommend this to anyone else that is looking for an authentic taste. It may be that since I come from a Mexican background that i know a little bit of what something should taste like, but for a restaurant like this to have 4-5 stars it seems to be kinda untrue on the quality.

56.description: so since my last review I've continue to order from Tuxpan and I have to say that my rating has gone up since then.I'd have to say that they are probably the best tacos in Chicago. They still are little on the small side but for the price you really cannot beat  the quality. I'd say the last 10 times I've ordered from them once the tacos came to me dry but every other time they are so juicy. My mom absolutely loves their taco salad. I will definitely continue to order from Tuxpan my apologies for the mediocre rating previously. Delivery is usually pretty fast so I get my tacos normally hot.

29.description: Is small and cozy ! Great service, food was great really nice waiter, will come back, reasonable prices.

42.description: Horrible!!! Took an hour and a half to deliver and there was food missing and what food was there was freezing cold and not edible!

23.description: Love at first bite. I really enjoyed the take out on my first visit. The staff were friendly and helpful and the look of the place was festive and clean. The food was a complete home run. I had what they call the Chuppacabra burrito. It was so big they had to cut it in half to fit it into the carry out container.......barely. OMG it was sooooo delicious. I recommend to lovers of Mexican food.

47.description: This has to be probably one of the best Mexican restaurants on the north side of Chicago, something I never would of thought of by seeing this place.  It looks like a regular small walk in restaurant but the dine in service is really good. The food was delicious and all I have to say for others to understand is, you have to try it yourself!  This place will become a regular stomping ground for me!

8.description: Nice little spot. The portions are generous for the price, and the servers are friendly and very accommodating. Not the most flavor-ful Mexican food I've had (more seasonings needed maybe?) but definitely a good eat.

31.description: Tuxpan is my new go to for Mexican food. The delivery fees are exceptionally cheap, and the food is BANANAS. I ordered the Super Nachos and got a huge box of chips covered in beany, meaty, cheesy goodness. It came with guacamole on top and jalepenos on the side. The only thing that could make this better would be some pico de gallo, which I'm sure you can add for a nominal fee.My brother got a steak burrito. He bit into it and immediately declared "Damn, that is a tasty burrito!" I'll assume I have his blessing in giving Tuxpan 5 stars.5/5 will definitely order again, many times. Delivery was pretty quick. I can't wait to try other items from their menu.

34.description: I live in the neighborhood.  I eat here pretty much once a week.  The staff is friendly and the food is delicious.  It is easily the best mexican restaurant in Jefferson Park.  It's family owned so i feel good supporting them.  It's a little more $ than some of the other mexican places nearby, but not by much.  And given it is so superior in terms of quality, I don't even think about it.In fact, I round up when i pick up my order.  Tacos al pastor and a steak quesadilla - it never disappoints.SIDENOTE: I see some one-star reviews here...reading through them I feel these people are being overly critical for isolated incidents, but that's my opinion.  One star ratings should be reserved for the places that end up on Kitchen Nightmares IMHO; this is not one of those places by any stretch.  So, yeah.  Disregard the haters.

16.description: We order takeout burrito dinners regularly. Fast service, friendly staff, delicious! Love the al pastor pork and their Mexican rice.

13.description: We have been frequenting this restaurant since it opened, so this review has been a long time coming. Their steak tacos are my absolute favorite! But honestly, I haven't had a meal here that wasn't worth 5 stars. The staff and ownership are super friendly and are always happy to see you!

11.description: We placed our order over 2 hours ago, online. After waiting an hour and a half we called the restaurant, finally a 3rd person, a woman, advised us that Eat24 had cancelled the order after she told them it would take over an hour. No one called/messaged/emailed. We just waited. I called Eat24, they of course, had no idea about an order cancellation, and immediately called the restaurant. Eat24 was told that since Tuxpan is now closed they won't fulfill the order. That's absolutely unacceptable!  You received the order at 6:30pm, we called you prior to your 8 o',clock closing, and you lied.  Honestly, the worst (non) delivery experience.

39.description: While I'm not a fan of strip mall casual dining, we really love the food and service here.  The fresh guacamole is worth the short wait, the variety of salsas are totally yummy, and the accommodating service makes up for the lack of ambiance. Since first trying this place about a year ago, Tuxpan has become my family's Mexican restaurant of choice.

37.description: Unfortunately I'm not able to leave zero stars. Please keep in mind this same situation happened to me twice... My family waited an hour and a half for six tostadas, only for me to call and find out that after the hour and a half they still hadn't prepared them. When you order dinner at five and have to call at 7:30 to find out you won't be having that for dinner with three young kids is very disappointing. Their food is good but it's not worth waiting two hours for. When I called and asked why no one had called me the woman's response was, "well ma'am we are really busy..." Clearly! They said they would add something to my order or gladly cancel it. I think after waiting almost 2 hours your food should be free? Just my thought. We will never order from there again. And if you do order I suggest you ask what the wait time is.

0.description: Really good food. Reasonably priced. They deliver. Burritos are very good, guacamole is very tasty.

38.description: Didn't expect much when I ordered but it ended up being wayyy better than I had thought. Eating there definitely makes a difference.

51.description: gave me diarhea.

27.description: I accidentally left an amazing review for this place on Mom's Old Recipe.I love this place. Their shrimp quesodillas were the best thing ever. The shrimp was cooked to perfection and they didn't over power them with onions, I for one hate onions all together. the fact I could taste them and not hate them is an A plus in my book. The best part is they DONT WATER DOWN THE SALSA VERDA. Is thick and smooth and just enough spice as a salsa should be. No TBK quality here.The only flaw is that when their phone is busy, they have a little girl rambling off the other number you should call to order. I called three times before I got through because I couldnt understand her.

32.description: It was pretty damn good. I had 1 Al Pastor taco and a steak quesadilla. They were both good. I liked the salsa they brought to the table. I liked all 3 which usually doesn't happen. The boy got the taco dinner, it was pretty good too. I will definitely be back.

54.description: Had the chiles rellenos and they were fantastic. Large enough meal for next day's lunch. Freshly made watermelon drink from actual fruit not the powder stuff. Friendly service.

48.description: We've been to many Mexican spots in different states and since we wanted to try something closer to home we put our Yelp app to use. Walking in we were greeted by a very nice young man behind the counter. The place is small with decent decor and about 10 tables. When we said that we were there to dine in he came out from around the counter to attend to us bringing some chips and 3 salsas. I don't know if others came on an off day per the reviews I've read but our chips were fresh. The salsas were good though I prefer it hotter. I had the steak torta with a chile relleno taco on the side and my guy had the super nachos with steak. We both agreed that our food was delicious. The steak was cooked perfectly for both platters. The super nachos were completely covered with plenty of toppings and meat. The chile relleno taco was tasty with a spicy kick. To drink I ordered a  horchata which was refreshing and not too sweet or thick. Overall our experience was pleasant and our bellies content. We will definitely be back to try the Pozole and Caldo de Res.

44.description: I finally found a Mexican place that delivers near my job so i decided to try it out a few months back i have been a fan since i order from here about one or two times a month for lunch i have tried alot of different things off the menu and they have all been good..the gordita is probably my least favorite only because it was falling apart but it was good.the fajitas were delicious and i highly recommend the pico de gallo it is so good.i have tryed tacossuper nachosgorditascaldo de resfajitastortas are huge and goodthey all are really good.guacamole i wasn't much of a fan of i have had better.i would recommend this place to anyone and the employers and owners are extremely nice! very nice people.

24.description: In search of a go-to Mexican restaurant in the area, we decided to try Tuxpan. They do a brisk take-out business (we noticed at dinner time anyway) and their place seats about 12-16 people.  Dining in, you are given a basket of chips and a trio of salsas.  The salsa verde was very good--nice heat, great flavor.  There is also a smokier salsa, spicier than the verde but still a nice flavor.  The red salsa is the weakest--no heat, kind of bland.  The chips seemed like they weren't fried enough as many didn't have that nice crisp factor. I ordered the chicken enchiladas verdes--3 rolled tortillas stuffed with shredded chicken, topped with salsa verde and crema.  Comes with a side of beans and rice. It was just OK for me. The chicken was bland and even though the kitchen is steps away the dish wasn't very hot. My husband ordered the enchiladas rojas with beef.  I tried that dish and it was so much better than mine.  I usually stick with verdes because I love verde sauces, but if we came back to dine here, I'd order this dish instead. I got to try their horchata as my son was in a sharing mood and it was very good. Smooth, creamy, great flavor. Service is super friendly.  Our server (I think also the owner's wife) was super sweet and doted quite a bit on my son. Nice family restaurant.

7.description: Awesome clean family run spot. Best meats of any Mexican place this far outside the city center. Consistent in quality, delivery times, etc. Very friendly staff.

49.description: We were happy with the food and the service.  Tasty guacamole, marvelous red mole sauce.  BUT we received menus with old pricing and a bill for new pricing   To top it off, our total bill was about $11 more than it should have been, even using the new pricing, because only the amount we paid for the Groupon coupon was deducted - not the full value.

40.description: Great mexican food, decent prices, and very friendly staff. Best combination of salsas I've ever had. It's one of my two go-to places in the area for mexican food. Good option for takeout or BYOB dine-in.Regarding delivery - the delivery guy is a very nice man, but it can take a while sometimes because they get so many orders. Can't knock them for being popular though.

53.description: I ordered 1 steak 1 chicharron taco. The chicharron was drenched in the same green salsa you already get a huge trio of bowls of salsa that come w the chips. I took one bite. And no I didn't want soggy chicharron. Showed the waitress. She took it back and I asked for just another steak taco.   Still got charged for it. Chips are stale. Steak dry and overcooked. Bland beans . Nonexistent service.

30.description: I feel as though I have no choice but to give these guys 5 stars given the fact that there's obviously a couple of hater on here giving it one star ordinarily I would have given it four stars. There vegetarian tacos are amazing, I usually get rice beans cilantro onions and avocados on it its super fresh super tasty. If you call later on in the day you can get fresh homemade tamales AMAZING!!!! Not to mention whoever I talk to on the phone or in person are always extremely polite and super nice! Bottom line is I love this place go there all the time food is always fresh food is always good!!!

46.description: I am new to the area and decided to try this place out based on the good reviews. We were disappointed that our burritos & flautas were filled with lettuce and hardly any meat in it. The refried beans were flavorless.

1.description: Bland and expensive. I take that back. I wouldn't have minded the price if it was good.One cup of bland guacamole, two tacos, one cheese quesadilla, one tamale, rice and beans and horchata, $30.Also, their chips taste like old fryer oil.

55.description: Just found this little gem a couple of weeks ago.  It's a small place in a small strip mall, but the food is fresh, fantastic, and priced very conservatively. They seem to do lots of take-out business as there aren't many tables in the restaurant, but in the times that we've gone, there has always been a place to sit without waiting.  Service is friendly and quick.  For a quick Mexican lunch or dinner, Tuxpan is worth the drive.

9.description: I do NOT recommend ordering takeout from here. I ordered for delivery twice and both times my order was completely wrong. But the ingredients are really good and fresh. I dined in last night and everything was awesome. The service was great and the people are super friendly.  The food was perfect and very fresh.

26.description: The staff is friendly and they get your order out quickly but the food just is not good. The quality is poor and everything was dry. This place falls below average and our meals were disappointing.

25.description: Tuxpan is my new favorite Mexican restaurant.  Limited seating so get there early on the weekends.  I had the guacamole which was fantastic and generous and a steak burrito which was delicious.  I can't wait to try some more dishes at Tuxpan.

12.description: Went there for lunch during ACLS class because the instructor said it was good. Got the chicken fajita salad. Very disappointing for $13. Lots of lettuce. A few sweet peppers. Maybe exactly one sixth of an avocado. some tomatoes. I'm not sure about the chicken part. What little meat there was , was extremely dry, very tiny, looked like maybe it was from a mouse sized chicken. I  left very unsatisfied.

59.description: This place is a GEM.... I just wish that after living close by for three years I had known it was here (the only sign is a neon one in the window, it's so easy to miss).The food is top-notch for a small establishment, not the most extensive menu but the things they do, they do well. We started out with the OMG great guacamole. I ordered the tampiquena and my girlfriend had the pepper steak (I forget the spanish name for it). The skirt steak was well-seasoned for both dishes, not dry and tough at all. It was delicious. They serve their tampiquena with the enchilada on top of the steak with a drizzle of sour cream (I'm not a big fan of sour cream, but it was sparing and well-executed). I had limon Jarritos and my girlfriend had a Sidral. The restaurant is BYOB if you want something with alcohol in it.The service is great, very efficient, very friendly. The food is well-timed if you order an appetizer (your entree will pretty much come just after you've decided you're done with the appetizer). I can't wait to go back and try some other things off their menu!

21.description: My go to Mexican restaurant with cheap prices and great food. It's not Americanized Mexican food which I love. The staff is very friendly and polite. The place is small, but there is delivery and take out.

17.description: Love at first bite. I really enjoyed the take out on my first visit. The staff were friendly and helpful and the look of the place was festive and clean. The food was a complete home run. I had what they call the Chuppacabra burrito. It was so big they had to cut it in half to fit it into the carry out container.......barely. OMG it was sooooo delicious. I recommend to lovers of Mexican food.

10.description: In search of a go-to Mexican restaurant in the area, we decided to try Tuxpan. They do a brisk take-out business (we noticed at dinner time anyway) and their place seats about 12-16 people.  Dining in, you are given a basket of chips and a trio of salsas.  The salsa verde was very good--nice heat, great flavor.  There is also a smokier salsa, spicier than the verde but still a nice flavor.  The red salsa is the weakest--no heat, kind of bland.  The chips seemed like they weren't fried enough as many didn't have that nice crisp factor. I ordered the chicken enchiladas verdes--3 rolled tortillas stuffed with shredded chicken, topped with salsa verde and crema.  Comes with a side of beans and rice. It was just OK for me. The chicken was bland and even though the kitchen is steps away the dish wasn't very hot. My husband ordered the enchiladas rojas with beef.  I tried that dish and it was so much better than mine.  I usually stick with verdes because I love verde sauces, but if we came back to dine here, I'd order this dish instead. I got to try their horchata as my son was in a sharing mood and it was very good. Smooth, creamy, great flavor. Service is super friendly.  Our server (I think also the owner's wife) was super sweet and doted quite a bit on my son. Nice family restaurant.

5.description: Ever since amigo chinos burned down I've been trying really hard to find a good authentic Mexican restaurant. Recently I have stumbled upon this place and I love it. I'm obsessed with their chicken tortilla soup. Service is quick and our waitress was very attentive. I suggest eating in, but I haven't had trouble with their delivery service. The taco dinner is very filling and I will definitely be coming back for more!

3.description: Pretty good food overall and the steak is very good.They used to have the best super nachos out there, but sadly they are terrible now. I thought that perhaps it was just a mistake, but a second bad order of the super nachos confirmed it. They now serve the slushy, soggy goop that places call nachos where they just throw everything on and let it soak in and turn the chips soft and goopy. It's horrible now. It's more of a taco slushy than nacho chips. I would have rated it a four or five, but anybody who ruins a perfectly good dish like they did just doesn't deserve a higher rating.

35.description: so disappointed Saturday night.I have been to this place twice before and thought it was O K I was with family and ordered Tampiquena (Skirt Steak with cheese enchilada)I asked for it medium.It was by far the worst piece of meat i have ever gotten from a restaurant It was small and so over cooked parts were crunchy. I cant understand how they can serve that.I am bummed because i live close and thought this could be a good spot for last minute dinners,I will not be back  ever

19.description: I accidentally left an amazing review for this place on Mom's Old Recipe.I love this place. Their shrimp quesodillas were the best thing ever. The shrimp was cooked to perfection and they didn't over power them with onions, I for one hate onions all together. the fact I could taste them and not hate them is an A plus in my book. The best part is they DONT WATER DOWN THE SALSA VERDA. Is thick and smooth and just enough spice as a salsa should be. No TBK quality here.The only flaw is that when their phone is busy, they have a little girl rambling off the other number you should call to order. I called three times before I got through because I couldnt understand her.

28.description: Great for both take out and dine in. The service for dine in is almost always a wonderful young man who is extremely attentive. The food is excellent and so is their prices. I usually always get the steak quesadilla or steak tacos. So happy this place is close to my home.

45.description: Definitely a fan of the fantastic, family-owned, quaint neighborhood Mexican restaurant & BYOB that has everything from breakfast to mole sauce.  Fresh salsa kicks off the experience and everything I have tried so far has been excellent.  Caution the soups are homemade so if you don't like picking chicken off the bone stick to tacos.  :-)Great prices, great people.

33.description: I love this place. Just picked up an order (though they do deliver via GrubHub which I use a lot!) and as I bit into that wonderful steak taco I said, MAN, this is good!  Food is great, people are nice.   It doesn't get much better.  If you don't like this Mexican, move to California.  Guac is good, salsa verde one of my faves.  Very good, please check it out.

43.description: I live right down the street from Tuxpan and get food here 4 times a month at least.  I always get great food until tonight. My mom got a steak burrito and it was horrible. It smelled and tasted burnt, and some of the pieces were so overcooked they were hard like a bone. My dad brought it back and explained it and the older woman, I think she's an owner and she was so rude. She argued and fought with my dad. The chef made a new one, they had a pile of already cooked steak on the side and he was taking that and grilling that. So unsanitary and poor quality. I will never get food there ever again.

2.description: I was really in the mood for Mexican this place had decent reviews and delivered. I called and placed my order the lady on the phone was extremely nice. Food was to arrive 45-50minThen 1 hour and 30 min later I was waiting for the food to arrive. I called and the woman I spoke to said it was on the way. (I ordered 2 tacos and a enchilada.)When the delivery person finally arrives I hand her $20.13 the total was $15.13 she take the $20 says thanks and just starts walking away. I politely say, "excuse me miss my change?" She turned around and was like oh. She didn't even have change she pulled out 3 bucks and obviously my change would be $5. I do always tip but an hour and half come on. She didn't have enough for the change so I told her to just keep it. I wasn't planning on writing a review, but then I open the food and all of it is literally cold not room temperature but actually cold like it was in a fridge. Suffice it to say I will not be ordering from them again.   The meat in the taco was chewy and cold. However, the enchilada had good flavor I warmed it up. It was super soggy though.

18.description: Tuxpan is my new favorite Mexican restaurant.  Limited seating so get there early on the weekends.  I had the guacamole which was fantastic and generous and a steak burrito which was delicious.  I can't wait to try some more dishes at Tuxpan.

41.description: We order from here probably 3x a month because the food is good and the prices are low. We don't really have many great options in our area. The burrito de asada is delicious and the al pastor tacos/burritos are my favorite as well as the asada quesadillas. Their customer service has always been great to us. Our recent order was missing salsa. I called to ask if the salsa was extra and the gentleman that answered was very sweet and apologetic and sent over salsa to enjoy with our food.

52.description: Im a guac fanatic... and i've had alot of guac from alot of different places.Tuxpan has one of the best guacamoles around town. (Most places dont use alittle dash of salt! ick!).Im a fan of their steak tacos cause they have FLAVOR!  Not like TBK where itsborderline ground beef.The service can be hit or miss but the place is worth checking out for a quick bite to eat. Prices arent that bad either and they constantly have Livingsocial deals or Groupon deals for alittle discount!

50.description: Food is pretty good.  Only reason why i gave this place 4 out of 5 is due to how crowded this place gets on weekends. The place is small and sometimes you have to wait 45-60 mins for a seat. Service sucks on weekends.  Go on a weekday when i isn't crowded for fast service.  Also on weekends the delivery is quite slow.  Weekdays they have super fast delivery.

4.description: Food is decent. Kind of upset though. I asked them not to ring the doorbell bc my baby was sleeping. Well, that message must've got lost somewhere bc the delivery guy rang the bell. Dogs went ballistic and baby woke up.

6.description: Yum 2 chorizo & 1 steak taco for lunch.  The chorizo is delicious.  The food is good and affordable $1.99 for a taco.

22.description: I ordered a Denver Omelet Burrito. I expected it to be egg, peppers, onions, cheese, and diced ham.  The first bite told me that it wasn't ham. It was diced HOT DOG. This is not ham and not an acceptable substitute, ever.  Bacon would have been fine, even better than ham all things considered. I thought for a minute it might be some strange breakfast sausage, so I rinsed a piece of it off to get a good look. It was indeed, hot dog.  This makes me afraid to eat the rest of my order, and I won't order from there again.

15.description: Ordered online and got my food after an hour and a half. This is not Mexican food, its grilled chicken in a tortilla and some Uncle Ben's garden vegetable rice. The chicken was dry and not seasoned. Worst "Mexican" food ive ever had. Dont waste your money.

57.description: Blink and you'll miss, and we live across the street! So glad we found it! The service was so friendly and the guacamole was so fresh and tasty!

20.description: Good food,  good service,  seems very clean.   We enjoyed our food and they were very accommodating to my husbands food restrictions.

36.description: This is one of my favorites.  My wife and I are foodies and love all different kinds of food including Latin American.  We've been to places all over Chicago and southern California.  For the price, this place is great.  The three different salsas and chips are a big hit with my family of four, something for each of our palates.  My 10 year old son who doesn't particularly like Mexican food (vegetables, yuck) loves the tostadas.  I really like the horchata and steak tortas.  However, my wife's choice, the chile rellenos, are ridiculous good.  I've never met a chile rellenos dish I liked (too sloppy and gooey), until I came to Tuxpan.  The place. not a hole-in-the-wall, because it's not dirty or cramped.  It's small and cutely decorated.  The food is very affordable with frequent Groupon offerings.  Finally, the staff is incredibly friendly, quick, generous, and accommodating.  It feels like family there, if you like family.

14.description: food is gross! Third time I get from here. The pozole is awful. It tasted like they just put packs of seasoning.

0.description: Mr. Miller is a superior piano teacher.  His depth and breadth of knowledge of music is phenomenal.  Not only do I play pieces but he teaches me theory and guides me to classical pianist to listen to (which I am interested in).  I am an adult student who played for 14 years as a child and teenager and came to him to pick up piano playing again.  He is patient, thorough, disciplined and kind.  I look forward every week to my lesson and am learning quickly with his guidance.  I highly recommend him for any level piano player at any age.  I have felt welcomed and he has held me accountable, both very good things in my book.

1.description: First time visiting this little bar and right off the bat I like the vibe.  Feels like a local spot not some trendy hipster bar.  Good selection on the juke box, decent beer options and friendly staff.  I'd give them 5 stars if they offered better food options. But when you have no kitchen and you're limited to a toaster oven,  I guess the frozen  pizza will do at 1am.   And they have menus from local restaurants that you can order in from.

9.description: One of my favorite places in Jefferson park. My hubs and I are avid dog lovers and have two pit bulls. It's comforting in knowing there is a public place in Chicago that actually welcomes our dogs, regardless of breed. The owner has a pretty great thing going on here, and I think more pubs need to follow his concept. Out on a walk with your dog? Stop in for a beer or a frozen pizza... Which were surprisingly Amazing. We will definitely be back. :)

23.description: Just got started, but really terrific atmosphere and people. Looking forward to having this place in the neighborhood.

12.description: I went to check out this new bar after I got off of the train. Very friendly bar tender was working and told us about the place. They like their rock music in this bar which is not my fav, but I didn't mind it. They have a decent tap selection and have a nice variety of mixers such as ginger beer and Fresca. Hard finds at a neighborhood bar. They would like to see crowds gather there  to watch Bears games. They will open early on game days. I plan to go there for one of the upcoming games. If you live nearby or passing through Jeff Park, give this bar a try.

21.description: I've been to Rex several times over the past month, when I've worked late, and the boyfriend wants to pick me up from the Jeff Park Blue Line stop. Every time, the atmosphere is just what we want, every time the music hits the spot, and this time, our bartender gave us a free (frozen) pizza! Exposed brick walls, Christmas lights, solid wood bar. We love this place, and hope it sticks around a long time!

16.description: I've been to Rex several times over the past month, when I've worked late, and the boyfriend wants to pick me up from the Jeff Park Blue Line stop. Every time, the atmosphere is just what we want, every time the music hits the spot, and this time, our bartender gave us a free (frozen) pizza! Exposed brick walls, Christmas lights, solid wood bar. We love this place, and hope it sticks around a long time!

17.description: Awesome place. Everyone is friendly, customers and staff alike. Everyone ive met there has been great. The remodel was very well done and has a real clean neighborhood bar feel.

10.description: Was on a trip to Chicago from South Carolina visiting a friend. Met him at the Jefferson Park station. First stop was Rex. Great atmosphere, awesome bar tender (she had great tats) and enjoyed petting the visiting pups!! This will definitely be a routine stop every time I'm in Chitown!!

5.description: This place is amazing! Dog friendly! My dog is very clam and if she weren't I would never bring her into a public place. I recommend it for anyone with a well mannered pup!

11.description: We were down the street at Fischman's and were headed to the train and in need of a pit stop. Being adjacent to the Jeff Park blue line, Rex Tavern was the perfect place.Inside the bar was dim, welcoming, and comfortable on a Thursday night. The bar seats were nearly full, but there were plenty of tables available. The vibe was laid back and relaxed, music wasn't blaring, and there was a large flatscreen towards the back for the football fans. The bar itself had some classic arch detailing and mirrors. Bartenders were friendly and quick on their feet. As a craft beer fan, there were a few good options, but nothing too wild. Lagunitas, Half Acre, Revolution on tap.The draft beer tasted fresh, which was all I needed. It was seemingly one of the classier bars in the neighborhood on a weeknight. Nice place to hang out. Also, the irony of a dog avatar guy complaining about dogs in a dog-themed bar is almost too rich to mention, but hey there it is.

22.description: I went to check out this new bar after I got off of the train. Very friendly bar tender was working and told us about the place. They like their rock music in this bar which is not my fav, but I didn't mind it. They have a decent tap selection and have a nice variety of mixers such as ginger beer and Fresca. Hard finds at a neighborhood bar. They would like to see crowds gather there  to watch Bears games. They will open early on game days. I plan to go there for one of the upcoming games. If you live nearby or passing through Jeff Park, give this bar a try.

0.description: Awesome neighborhood spot right off the Blue Line (CTA).  Great place to hang out if you miss your Metra train. The staff are friendly and attentive 7 days a week. Drink specials vary but in general they're affordable and a good selection.  I often order food (GrubHub) and have it delivered there.  Great place to watch your favorite teams all year round.  It's VERY dog friendly.  I've closed this place enough to know it's a solid late night spot.Located on Milwaukee Ave in sight of the NW-Metra (UPNW) and a few steps from the Jefferson Park Transit Center at Gale Street.

20.description: I have been here two times so far. I have to say that this is my new go-to spot! It's super chill, cozy, dog-friendly, great staff, and the drinks are yummy! I also love that you can order in your own food or they will cook a frozen pizza for you on the spot. Awesome! Prices are very reasonable and the location is great- right off the Jefferson Park blue line. The crowd is chill and very friendly. Dog Friendly!!!!The staff is very friendly and quite patient with playful pups. They even gave my dog some puppy treats and had a bowl of water available for her. I probably wouldn't recommend bringing very large breeds simply because the place may not be big enough for them to run around and not disrupt too much. Your dog should be well-behaved and potty trained if you decide to have them accompany you, but that kind of goes without saying. It's great to have a year-round puppy friendly place to hang out with our four legged friends! Definitely give this place a visit!

19.description: My husband and I love hanging out here! Great location and so much more cozy, friendly, and professional compared to when it was Martini Club.

2.description: I used to live in this area, now I'm a suburbanite of the sw burbs.I think this place used to be a polish martini bar?We wanted to kill some time on NYE before heading over to Gale Street Inn across the street to ring in the new year.  It was pretty dead around 9pm...totally chill place to hang out and stuff.  Miller Lites are $3 - they require a card to open a tab, but they put everything on the card without asking if you wanted to use the card to pay for your tab.  Some places give you payment options.  Ok, ,moving on...We scored chocolate covered pretzels in a pint glass in front of us, as the rest of the patrons got regular ol' pretzel rods.  That was a nice plus!I visited again this past weekend around midnight on a Saturday... pretty low key, my kind of place, if I were to live in the area again or looking for a place to hang out in the area.This is your typical Chicago neighborhood bar, but I wouldn't call it a "dive bar".  The place smelled of frozen pizza the entire time we were there, but I didn't notice anyone eating it.  The bathrooms were clean.  This isn't a a fancy place, just your typical ol' neighborhood bar...I have nothing to rave about yet no complaints either.

18.description: I have been here two times so far. I have to say that this is my new go-to spot! It's super chill, cozy, dog-friendly, great staff, and the drinks are yummy! I also love that you can order in your own food or they will cook a frozen pizza for you on the spot. Awesome! Prices are very reasonable and the location is great- right off the Jefferson Park blue line. The crowd is chill and very friendly. Dog Friendly!!!!The staff is very friendly and quite patient with playful pups. They even gave my dog some puppy treats and had a bowl of water available for her. I probably wouldn't recommend bringing very large breeds simply because the place may not be big enough for them to run around and not disrupt too much. Your dog should be well-behaved and potty trained if you decide to have them accompany you, but that kind of goes without saying. It's great to have a year-round puppy friendly place to hang out with our four legged friends! Definitely give this place a visit!

13.description: Nice atmosphere, comfy couches, heat lamp in the back for smokers. Nice selection of beer & specialty cocktails. Good music. They even have a phone charging station and the staff was friendly. Totally digging this joint!!

4.description: I came in to this bar on Tuesday night with my friends and it looked like a good place to drink and spend some time with friends. The bartender wasn't attentive with us and it wasn't even crowded. Also, at the end when they were closing they were telling us to leave and pushing us to finish our drinks and to get out. I thought it was rude since we were mainly the ones who were being kicked out and no one else. I would never come back here.

6.description: I belong to a group that frequents Rex Tavern on Tuesday evenings and have always had a great time. The bar staff is excellent and there are usually some specials that keep our guys happy. Good range of beets and cocktails are solid if that's your preference. Cheers!

15.description: We checked this place out and were quite impressed. The bartender Frankie was very nice and friendly. The bar is dog friendly which we thought was very cool. Its very clean with a modern decor. They have an outside patio which is cool too.

7.description: Great place to hang out if you miss your Metra train. I stopped by on a weekday evening. Good beer selection, good tunes playing, and friendly service. There seemed to be a fair amount of locals hanging out. I'd definitely stop by again.

8.description: A neighborhood go to and perfect place to meet someone half way. On Milwaukee in sight of the NW-Metra and 100 feet from Jefferson Park Transit Center (i.e. Blue line and buses) at Gale Street.My service has always been better than most in Chiraq.  Not a huge selection but far better than average. I think 5 draft beers. Always a sleeper option like last week $2 Jamo-reserve... What?!Friendly regulars. Staff who I genuinely like.  Perfect place for a libation with friends.

3.description: Amazing local spot. Right off blue line. Super friendly staff and great drinks! You can bring your own food or they have frozen pizzas that are actually pretty delicious.

14.description: Not sure why there are so many high rankings. This bar was kind of trashy in the people who hung out here and they let dirty dogs run all over the the bar. The bathroom was atrocious and the place was freezing as they had all windows and doors open with late night cool summer wind. They have a lounge area that is small and too close to the bar which gives it a unusual look and this is the problem with the place. It tries to be all types of bars. The dog thing is filthy and should to be encouraged. They do have some good tap selections though

29.description: Perhaps the best ethnic fest in the city. It has everything.  Five stages, one inside a huge traditional theater (air conditioned if you need to beat the heat). Also inside a bar that takes cash instead of coupons, and a casino. Entertainment includes your usual tribute bands, ethnic Polish bands, Polish dancers, and even Polish videos. A large number of Polish food vendors, beer tents serving strong Polish beer, and a shot tent where you can get a cherry or honey liquor. Potent stuff. People talked about the refill cups this year but we did an ounce by ounce analysis of the cost and the refill cup is not a deal. To put it simpley the plastic cups hold a couple ounces more than the refill mug. You pay extra to get the mug and everytime you get a refill you're paying extra for that souvenir mug because you are getting less beer for the same price as a throw away cup. I guess the mug is greener. If you really want a mug just hang around towards the close of day and you should find some lost by the drunks. And speaking of drunks it can get a bit crazy or maybe its me. I had to deck a jerk who was getting a little out of hand. But after he got up he just laughed, apologized and bought me a shot and a beer. Yeah I was drunk too.

42.description: Be transported to a street festival in Poland but won't leave Cook County.  Don't miss Taste of Polonia.  It's a great respite from the McFestivals that take place all over the north side.  Venture to the northwest side and enjoy a place where English is a second language.  Immerse yourself in great food and beer.

23.description: I'm part Polish by marriage so I've developed a love of pierogi, kapusta and sausage. We even had to have the DJ play a couple of polkas at our wedding reception. Since these types of things aren't every day occurrences, when there's a chance for Polish food/Polish music, we're there. Taste of Polonia is a great fest. It winds around outside the Copernicus center which lets them set up the four different entertainment stages. There is traditional Polish music (even not so traditional as we listened to a Polish rapper at one point), a children's entertainment stage, and cover bands. There are also vendor booths--jewelry, toys, and of course Polish-themed items. Got a little one? I love the Polish themed onesies. And the Food--delicious of course. Pierogi, potato pancakes and hunter's stew were my choices for the day and it was all delicious. There were combo plates for the ravenous or polish sausage for a snack. There are tall tables set up under tents where you can lean in and enjoy your meal. I loved the tall tables because our stroller fit nicely underneath, saving space and not causing a tripping hazard in tent aisle. There were also lots of seating near the stages so if you're not up dancing a polka, you can sit and relax, enjoy a brew. This is definitely a family friendly fest; all age ranges represented.

47.description: Came here last night for the opening night of the polish film festival.  It was my first time at this theater although I've been to this festival many times.  The theater is gorgeous and rather large.  I felt very classy.  Also they serve famous traditional polish beer, okocim at the snack counter as well as other famous polish delicacy nachos with cheese!

8.description: This is a great place to see a show. Why you ask?
